Reviews.Title: “Best trained staff I have ever come across.”
Reviews.Author: Hazel G
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights in the Four Seasons Sydney. I have stayed on other occasions. Its position is excellent for the Harbour and always come back. The facilities are very good. The rooms extremely comfortable if slightly smaller than some comparable hotels. But the thing that is absolutely stand-out about the hotel is the staff. They are the best trained hotel staff I have ever come across - and I stay at a lot of 5* hotels around the world. They are unfailingly friendly, responsive and incredibly helpful. Gym open 24 hours and very good facilities. Also for the record, I went to the Handa Opera on the Harbour performance of La Traviata. It was absoutely fantastic. Unmissable event.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing value”
Reviews.Author: TravellerJanWaalre
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Sydney is an upmarket hotel, however some value aspects turned out disappointing for this price class. Obviously it offers "triple A" downtown location at Circular Quay, next to The Rocks. We had booked a full harbour view room (turned out to be on 20st floor), it offered indeed a stunning view of the harbour, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. However other room types will offer a less attractive view (or none at all), but are still quite expensive. Having arrived at the hotel at 9AM, our room wasn't ready yet. Unfortunate, yet we understand that that may happen with an early morning arrival. But despite us coming in straight from a 9 hours night flight, the desk staff disappointingly made no effort to try limit our inconvenience: "please come back in 2 hours". Once ready, our room was very nice, spacious and comfortably providing all necessary amenities. Next day, we found continental breakfast offering limited choice and being poorly restocked once items ran out. Absolute negative experience was internet/wifi access: charging AU$25 for a day basic access is a rip-off. A hotel of this class should offer free service. There may be better value-for-money hotels in downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location : Expensive In An Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: alex19671
Reviews.Content: Just arrived in Thailand having spent 5 nights in the FOUR SEASONs Hotel SYDNEY, Room 1419 an Deluxe Opera and Partial Harbour View room. Room review: A bit on the small size for the price you are paying, but this is an expensive city, so it was difficult to get a hotel offering bed & breakfast, which the Four Seasons did. LOVELY comfortable big bed, had fantastic sleep. Windows did not open. REALLY BAD internet connection. By bad, i mean terrible! It took 2 hours to download 1 song from iTunes. In 2012, i really think Hotels need to get High Speed internet sorted. Cleaning staff were fantastic, really cleaned the room well & tidied up our stuff imaculately. Breakfast review: Was "good" but not excellent. I just felt something was lacking. When i have stayed at other 5 star hotels, you get a much better international selection of foods, which were not represented here so well. Staff Review: No complaints. Really helpful. Well done! Spa Review: Way too expensive. Restaurant tips: We had some of the best food of our international trip in Sydney. You Must try two places: Sake (Japanese + Mexican Influences) around the corner from the hotel. Amazing! but a bit pricey. Great ambience. Make sure you book! Also, North Bondi Italian (in Bondi Beach). WOW: The best Pasta i have had in 10 years. And i am fussy! Perfect al dente Rigatoni with Italian Sausage. Also Crab spaghetti cooked in a paper bag (sounds strange, but was great!).

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeper - Makes a big difference!”
Reviews.Author: northstarManila
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel - close to the Rocks, Starbucks, Shopping area, Circular Quey. Food is excellent, rooms are great! Housekeeping staff were very accomodating. The lady who looked after the room always made sure I had many bottles of LÃ“ccitane conditioner. One afternoon, I asked her why does she always replenishes me with 3 extra bottles of conditioner .... she replied with a big smile on her face "because you have such lovely long hair, it requires 3 bottles !". In my books, She is a star!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: Elise F
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Four Seasons, excellent service, clean room and professional staff. Felt very relaxed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for the rocks and rooms very nice”
Reviews.Author: oznic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four seasons a few times now, great location for business and leisure travellers, spectacular views from room over the harbour make sure you pay for a full harbour view. Arrived early and room was not ready, they escorted me to the day spa where i was allowed to use their facilities including shower and locker rooms at no cost they also went out of their way to make sure I had access to internet and business facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dadd302
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Check-in was easy and they helped find my award club number. Very nice room, good bed and no problems. Free Wi-Fi in Lobby, with a charge if you want to use in room. Breakfast was excellent. No problems getting cabs outside. Just down some steps is Daring Habor and we enjoyed the many place to eat and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Karloz66”
Reviews.Author: Karl T
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Syd was very nice and relaxed . The staff are Friendly and helpful . The room had a good feeling, My veiw was the opera house and Circular Quay wharfs.I didnt mind it , one of those veiws u can watch for hours. The beds are plush pillow custom made by stearns & foster very good sleep . The standard room facilites are all there and allgood. I asked for two buckets of ice for bottles of sparkling for 6 pm , we went out and arrived back around 6.30ish , the only minor let down was the bottles were not in placed in buckets and were still sitting beside the buckets lol , not too worrie i put one in the bar frigde before hand just incase . The hotel location was the main reason we selected the Four Seasons Hotel as we attended an event 100 m away . The amenities were all there and all good and clean . I really can not flaut the hotel as for the ice bucket thats a test i conduct at every hotel i stay at and is very minor . My stay at the Four Seasons hotel was very good it gave me agood and wellcomed experice and will book the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WGRHampshire
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, and we were lucky enough to have a full harbour view room, with the Bridge and the Opera House greeting us every time we drew the curtains back. This hotel is in a brilliant position, with Circular Quay, which is where all the ferries run from, only a five minute walk away - we went to Manly Beach and had a super time there. A superb outside pool where the hotel even provides suntan lotion ( and I spotted John Cleese having a dip!!). There are numerous restaurants all within easy walking distance Top marks to all of the friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel right on Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSydenham
Reviews.Content: Had 5 nights here at the end of February in a room at the front with excellent views of the bridge and opera house. Really central, could walk to all the places we really wanted to go to. The room seemed small considering it was one of the more expensive ones, but wonderful comfy bed and all facilities you could ask for really. The staff were friendly and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The foyer could do with an update and a proper coffee shop would have been good. You could get tea and coffee at the foyer bar, but there were not always any free seats, and if you did not want to get all dressed up and go to the restaurant, there was nowhere for a simple sandwich or snack. There were no views from the lounge/foyer area or the restaurant. You could not do better for a good hotel so close to all the sights in Sydney. Sometimes we just sat at our window and watched all the ferries coming and going and the cruise ships coming in early morning to dock right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: AniD1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney for 4 nights during our first visit to the city. Most other reviewers have put it correctly - this is not as plush as you would expect from a Four Seasons elsewhere in Asia (especially the newer ones) but this is nonetheless a very comfortable and nice one. We had a good room, and found the service attentive. The location is amazing too - a stone's throw away from Circular Quay means we never had any issues getting cabs or public transport and the ferries. And proximity to the Rocks, Opera House and the Botanical Gardens was fantastic too. Concierge and reception were also very helpful, which was a plus! I would stay here again just for the location...

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, a bit tired and not as nice as the photos but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlucey_12
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in ideal location, however getting a bit tired now. Rooms weren't as nice as the photos. Although nicely refurbished, bathrooms are still old. On the other hand, they are very comfortable and have a homely feel. Suprised they didn't have slippers for a 5 star hotel! I love getting around my hotel room in slippers and robe, so this was a disappointment for me. Would highly recommend the executive club - drinks and canapes were amazing and breakfast equally as good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 48h in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Pomp18
Reviews.Content: Excellent view on opera and bridge. Room more then ok. What an experience 48h in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kassie26
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons in a grand premier room. The location is excellent and as promised views of the harbour were unbeatable. The staff at the hotel were also fantastic and I couldn't fault the housekeeping service. The hotel foyer is outdated and not very inviting, and I felt the room in general, whilst spacious and with amazing views was tired and in need of an update and modernisation. It also had quite a musty smell when we first arrived and felt cold. The bed however was really comfortable. The bathroom was excellent. The swimming pool and spa facilities were average at best. We had a really nice stay, that was primarily because of the location and the views, if this is not important for you, I would stay somewhere else with better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: wantbetterservice
Reviews.Content: Great views from the room with good size living area and modern contempory finish

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual great Four Seasons experience”
Reviews.Author: Norcal-Saratoga
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Four Seasons properties around the world and are big fans of their consistently high standards. On our current trip to Sydney, I booked the Four Seasons with the expectation that their Sydney property would be spectacular. I was disappointed. The Sydney property is tired and needs an update to reach the normal Four Seasons level of excellence. The bathrooms are small and crowded, the TV's are not HD, the decor is tired and outdated, and there is just general wear and tear that you would expect more at a Marriott vs. a Four Seasons. On the other hand, the service was great and the breakfast offering was a standout. I would stay at this property again if they did an update, but otherwise will look for alternative high end lodging.

Reviews.Title: “With out a doubt the best Hotel Sydney has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this Hotel to anyone. Location - service - rooms cannot be faulted

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in very convenient setting”
Reviews.Author: Rocmimi
Reviews.Content: Loved the two nights we spent here. Have stayed in many Sydney hotels and this was most definitely the best.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Barton under Needwood, staffordshire, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel cannot fault any of the services located next to circular quay, easy access to all transport 5 star plus”
Reviews.Author: Barry999932
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, we have now stayed at the Four Seasons on 3 occassions Plenty of Restaurants within minutes, although Four Seasons own Restaurant provide excellent meals Well located for all types of transport, Ferry, Rail, Bus One minute walk to the Ferry, and 3/5 minutes to the Sydney Bridge, Opera House and Botanical Gardens Easy access to Darling Harbour, Manley, Bondi, Watson Bay etc via Ferry or Bus

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: RussFilice
Reviews.Content: I have been at The Four Seasons for almost 3 weeks and it feels like home. The staff are all amazing and so accommodating. The experience at The Four Seasons Sydney is a true example of a Five Star Experience. The location is terrific. You can walk to virtually everything. Room Service is so good, you never have to leave the room. And with the views from this hotel, it is often hard to leave the room. I would like to see the hotel "Freshened Up" a bit. It does come across a bit dated. But this is typically an issue involving the property owner more than the hotel brand. I love the place. And the Executive Lounge is a must. I want to bring the entire staff home with me. See you all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and locality”
Reviews.Author: valeriejennifer
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Sydney was enhanced by staying at this excellent hotel. The service was the very best and the room had everything that you could possibly need. Our room was plenty large enough and we could not fault it in any way. The hotel is very conveniently situated for the opera house, the Bridge and the ferries, which seemed to be the best mode of transport. Also for the rail system, which we took to visit the Blue Mountains - very simple and much cheaper then going on a coach tour.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best addresses in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: ECB1974
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at Four Seasons Sydney. For a first time visitor, the hotel is ideally situated in The Rocks, right next to Circular Quay with the ferries, the Opera House and waterfront restaurants. Hotel rooms were pricy and small, but this was countered by Four Seasons' great service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: Chadkane
Reviews.Content: Wonderful weekend staying at The Four Seasons in Sydney. View of The Opera House was spectacular. Service great, location the BEST!! Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Hermitage123
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out this hotel was great. Check in staff were very polite and our room was ready upon arrival - bonus. We were offered showers at the spa to freshen up before our trip home. The room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom products a delight. King size bed, big screen TV and easy walking distance to Circular Quay (across the road) all made our stay enjoyable and I would definately book here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN ALL RESPECT, SUPERB LOCATION IN SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: VAChuck
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Sydney is a very fine hotel! Rooms were spacious and very clean. No spots on the rug. Bathroom was very spacious with tub and shower separately located. We asked for a converter and it was made instantly available with a transformer as well. Friendly and helpful front desk, which probably says as much about the general nature of people in Australia~these are friendly, nice folks! We paid over $400 a night but still a bargain because we piggybacked on our cruise line for a special rate. We had a view from the window of the city but not the harbour. The hotel is in The Rocks section of Sydney, about one minute or less away from the Circular Quay. It is within a few blocks of the main shopping area as well. It is also right across the Quay from the Opera house and a short walk to The Bridge. We did not eat here so we can not comment on this. Complimentary morning coffee was not offered in the lobby,etc. However, the in the room coffee, which is usually terrible, actually was potable. We still went to Starbucks 1/3 a block away for coffee. Internet was not complimentary. Starbucks charged us $3 an hour, a bargain. Concierge service was terrific. Complimentary sunscreen in the lobby which is a must use due to the hole in the ozone layer downunder. This hotel treated us very nicely and we would recommend it! It would be nice though if the amenities of free a.m. coffee, Internet, and a newspaper were offered.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Helen B
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated hotel with gorgeous rooms and views! You will not be disappointed, the staff, room service, executive club and views are fabulous! Our corner room on the 10th floor overlooked the Sydney Opera House, bridge and harbor......incredible! You can walk to everything from this hotel. Can't wait to return !

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMPAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel. I cannot fault it in any way. I love the decor throughout. The lobby whilst not new is still swish with many very comfortable areas to sit. The whole hotel is immaculate. The room was amazing. A full view of the opera house and bridge was spectacular both night & day. My stay included access to the executive club which was very impressive. The choices of wine and hors d'oeurves was vast; the service impeccable along with great views and free internet makes the extra charge well worth it. The executive club also offers complimentary breakfast but I had mine in the restaurant downstairs instead for something different as I'd been in the club the night before. My room was massive with a lovely corner desk with views over the harbour. Bed is like a cloud, I slept well and for a light sleeper that's amazing in itself. The hotel is very quiet. I never hear noise from any other rooms. My full marble bathroom was 2 areas. The first had a dressing area & basins. Then through another door to shower, bath & wc. This is amazing, extra privacy. Lots of towels, bath robes & slippers provided. L'Occitane products supplied which are quite lovely to use. The breakfast downstairs was absolutely the best I've had. The range is vast and constantly being replaced. Whatever the charge it's worth it, the coffee alone was perfect. Service outstanding. I had drinks in the bar with a few friends and whilst it's pricey its what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel with service & ambiance excellent. The whole hotel to me has a very elegant & stylish feel to it. It makes for a very relaxed, comfortable pleasurable stay. The staff are extremely polite and respectful. Apart from Palazzo Versace on the Gold Coast I cannot think of any hotel that comes close to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but underwhelming and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: mobilelisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights at the Four Seasons in Sydney on my most recent trip there, with a colleague. We have both been to Sydney on many occasions and stayed in various different hotels around the city but we found the hotel rather underwhelming! The lobby, reception and communal areas are rather tired and dated. The pool area tiny and overlooked by the flyover. The wireless connection was expensive. This said, the rooms were comfortable enough and relatively spacious, bathroom and products good and the concierge were fantastic, especially Pasquale! Having stayed in other Four Seasons Hotels around the world, this one is not a flagship for the brand I have to be honest! Shame, as it's a good location and has potential. A re-furb is in order and meanwhile a reduction in price as the rooms were expensive for the standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not great value”
Reviews.Author: tripellen
Reviews.Content: This 5 star hotel is well located at Circular Quay with The Rocks, ferries and buses close by. Rooms are small and you pay a premium for harbour views. Certainly adequate but no "wow". Not great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent welcome home”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: This hotel I booked for a few nights as a stopover for my return from Canada to Perth and it was just what I needed. After about 24 hours of travelling on full planes it was so good pulling up in front of the hotel and being pointed to the reception desk as the lobby is very nice. After check-in I had a little while to shower before meeting family for lunch and the shower was amazing, the bathroom was spacious and nicely looked after. The room itself was quite big and I didn't dare lie down on the bed as it looked so comfortable (sure enough when I laid down that night I was out like a light!). It's a little further from the city to where I normally stay but it was still only about 10 minutes walk to get to the main shopping area and less than 5 minutes walk to get to Darling Harbour. The staff were friendly enough, the only thing that I would have to say is they don't tell you they are freezing money on your credit card. I understand this is regular policy but they don't tell you the amount or remind you it's being done. All in all it's a really good hotel and not much more expensive than your Holiday Inns and your Metros.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury - pampered by the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew D
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 4 hours before check in to find that our travel provider had accidently cancelled our booking. Sandy from Reception was brilliant - she found us our rooms, offered us free refreshments after flying in on the red-eye, and took care of everything. She said she would call us once our rooms were ready - which she did. Basically, she just took care of everything for us, and backed up everything she said. We thought the hotel was great, very old style luxury such as: - pianist at breakfast - very relaxing - soaps that smelled nice (my wife loved them) - bed turn down service (not expected, but when we came back late from dinner, the rooms were set ready for us to relax) All the staff were really friendly, and really played to up for the kids. Concierge helped to book us a great dinner. All up, we had a great time. It cost a little bit more, but with the service we received and the time we had, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Down by the Bay”
Reviews.Author: RobinK11
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here in what is a 4/5 star hotel. We arrived rather late in the evening and black tie wedding was taking place so everywhere was busy! The reception were very welcoming and but it seemed that they did not have the double bed room we had booked. They were very apologetic, promised to move us the next day and offered us free breakfast for the following day. We were quite happy with this, however I did have to chase them several times to actually move our luggage (I could have done it more easily myself) and when I came to pay the bill it included the breakfast! This was taken off but it seemed to me that 'tied up communication' was not there! However the room was excellent, we had a great view of the harbour and Sydney Opera house, as well as teh 6 lane freeway. Breakfast and meals were expensive but this was partly due to the poor exchange rate with the Â£. WiFi was ridiculously expensive however a cafe down by the ferries not only did relative cheap breakfast but also had free WiFi. I would come again

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: eves21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for 2 nights, it is a lovely hotel and right next to Circular Quay. We found the staff very professional and helpful, the room was very clean and had plenty of room for the 2 of us. The shower was amazing, water pressure good. And the bath was what you'd expect from an average sized bath. The tolieteries were all L'Occitane which is a special treat. The bed would have to be one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on, it was dreamy, so comfortable I didn't want to get up. We were staying for our anniversary and the staff very kindly left a bottle of champagne for our arrival, it was greatly appreciated. The Hotel also provides a turn down service with ice bucket which was thoughtful. Its a really nice hotel very close to a beautiful harbour, good for a walk - you can walk all the way past Circular Quay to the Opera House and then around to the botanical gardens and up to the art gallery if you want. We saw two penguins playing alongside us in the water as we walked on a beautiful morning, it really made my day.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Dated”
Reviews.Author: SelectiveTravellor
Reviews.Content: I recently overnighted at Four Seasons Sydney. It's unfortunate that International hotels in Australia are not keeping pace with modern times and contemporary expectations. The Four Seasons has a tired lobby harking back to the early 80's. My room on the ninth floor was in desperate need of a facelift and a fresh scent. I was disappointed to find limited amenity, mouldy tiles and basin that wouldn't drain. I won't be visiting again until a refurbisment program is in place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm A
Reviews.Content: Our first stay since it was The Regent in 1997. It's even better and our glorious Harbour view room was an absolute treat complimented by warm and professional service levels. To be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but still a nice place to be...”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Welsh-Boy
Reviews.Content: This is probably the forth or fifth Sydney CBD hotel I've reviewed given a propensity to try new places and keep the travel interesting. I'm a sofitel fan and in manynways, the four seasons feels like a bigger if slightly more dated version of the same thing. To start, the location is arguably amongst the best in the city centre. Rooms appear to either have great city or, in my case, harbor views. And whether short term tourist or business traveller, it's hard to think of a more convenient city centre spot -ferries, harbour, opera house, the rocks, botanic gardens, all within moments. The entrance is big and impressive and service from the doorman to check in to room service staff is pretty slick. My room wasn't massive and the presence of a pretty large (and exceedingly comfortable) bed, together with chunky desk, sideboard and lounge chair didn't leave a massive amount of floor space. That said, better to have less room and quality fittings than a massive space without a great feel to it. Bathroom was nice enough... Separate bath and shower, something I'm a big fan of personally. Little touches like the very nice toiletries help reinforce a feeling of value for the dollars you're paying. And finishing on that note, my room was 220 or so. I'm not sure of the typical rates, by for that price, it's pretty good value for money. Im not sure it's any better than the Hilton (location aside, where this place wins) and I still like the sofitel, but I'd be very happy to be stuck back here for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SKH-11
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel and enjoyed it. The location is the best ever, right next to the bridge, harbor and opera house. We walked to everything which is a huge plus. Our room was very good and the beds are extremely comfortable. We stayed on the 18th floor (room 1810) and had an excellent view of the bridge, harbor and opera house. I do have one complaint. They charge $25 per day for internet access which I think is crazy. With the price of these rooms internet should be free. It's free at McDonald, Starbucks and even the ferries. Our stay included free breakfast which was good. However if it wasn't included we would have never paid $42 per person for this meal. The food was good but no breakfast is worth that much money. The staff is very friendly and professional. We especially enjoyed the young woman that checked us into the hotel. I think her name was Anissa. The rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Freedom3187
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the intercontinental and this was my first time at the Four Seasons, while both hotels are well appointed I found th staff at the Four Seasons helpful and friendly not as aloof as the intercontinental. The beds are wonderful and did like that our bathroom had a seperate shower (I am not fond of having to step into a bath to have a shower)

Reviews.Title: “Managers Need customer service training”
Reviews.Author: Sooner517
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is a lovely hotel in a great city but the management team could use some training in customer service. While on vacation things happen and I realize this but when something as critical as a passport and cell phone go missing I would think a call from a manager should be expected not to mention the offering of asssistance to make the necessary arrangements to correct the situation but after making a report to security and just let me complement Phil's excellent communication and show of concern but that's where the staff help stops us being from Texas and 1st time visitors to Sydney were left to find a police station on our own and a place to get a passport photo on our own and then find the US consulate on our own with not even an apology or offer of asssistance in order to make the process a little easier. to say the least if something goes missing from your room at this so called five star hotel unless your a vip guest don't expect them to go out of their way. Just a final note concierge staff was great at getting opera tickets great seats and Peter Doyle's lobster mornay was excellent just a five minute walk from hotel if you have time take a trip to manly beach and walk down to Shelly beach along the way another great restaurant the le kiosk and everything in Australia is an ugg boot so either buy emu brand or uGg australia capital G in middle is how tell their authentic uggs also Taronga Zoo is amazing if you have a full day and for sushi kenchi at the opera house bar area was great.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Delight”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend after a conference in the CBD. The views were fantastic and we wander around the rocks market. Found a brilliant wine shop across the road. We had a awesome meal in the Four Seasons Restuarant. The late check out was very welcome and on the way out the doorman handed us a bottle of water for our train trip to the airport. Its the little things sometimes

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sally D
Reviews.Content: Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at the Four Seasons. A fantastice experience. I highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and location!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Sydney will certainly not be our last! Our first impression of Sydney was opening the curtains in our Full Harbour View Suite at the Four Seasons...WOW! Spectacular views of Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, Sydney Harbour and the Harbour Bridge! The outstanding location also made it extremely easy to access the ferries, Opera House, Royal Botanical Gardens and The Rocks area. And, the concierge was extremely helpful with restaurant reservations. Looking forward to a return visit to Four Seasons Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: "We booked the Four Seasons" usually means that there'll be nothing to worry about, everything will be perfect and we'll be sad to leave. Unfortunately on this occasion, that was not the case. We left with the impression that the Sydney Four Seasons isn't quite up to scratch and though we experienced true Four Seasons service eventually, for the first 22 of the 24 hours or so we were there, it was more Holiday Inn standard. To begin with, our room wasn't ready. OK, that's hardly unusual in a busy city centre hotel, but even when we returned at 3pm, there was still a delay. Fortunately, we'd not flown in from some far flung destination, but nevertheless, it was irritating to not be able to change or freshen up. Far more importantly, it was impossible to access items such as sunscreen and suchlike from our checked in baggage which we'd left at the hotel when we arrived mid morning. Our "day in Sydney" turned out to be a day feeling a little on the wrong foot but even so, we decided that we'd move on and not allow it to spoil our precious time here. Our room, when we got there was incredibly small. For sure, there was the Opera House outside the window - beautiful - but actually, there was hardly room to move around without tripping over bags or each other. But we were meeting friends for dinner and not going to spend much time there and hey, we're in the Four Seasons, Sydney - what's not to like?! Arriving back from dinner, let's simply say we experienced a problem with our room. Without going into too many details, the unimpressive service was eventually resolved to our satisfaction. But when staying for such a short time, any such incident casts a pall over the whole experience and sadly, we'd be reluctant to recommend the hotel as a result. However, location is everything and when choosing to stay here, I'd suggest you question your priorities. If it's important to stay at The Four Seasons wherever you go, then of course, go ahead. If you'd like to be right there on Circular Quay, mere steps away from the action, then it's a must. Yes, go ahead. But if you're looking to be pampered, to have a spacious room with all the usual trappings, with the service which usually comes at such places, then perhaps it's worth casting the net a little further. So how come I've rated it four stars? Well, it is a Four Seasons after all, the beds are incredibly comfortable and the location lifts it right up there. And, ultimately, our situation was resolved in Four Seasons style, which is worthy of acknowledgement.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with good service but with expensive Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: LukeUk
Reviews.Content: The reception staff here are beautifully trained, and seemingly nothing is too much trouble. The decor is beginning to look very slightly worn, especially in the bedrooms, but the beds are memorably comfortable. Great to have the pool, but this area looks tired, especially the planting which is half dead. The Four Seasons group insist on charging (high prices) for Wi-Fi internet connection, which is unacceptable. Also, it is impossible to read in bed as the lighting is inadequate. Food good, although over-hasty serving staff tend to clear plates away before one has even finished swallowing the last mouthful. All in all, a good hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: dulle_noted
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel on a month-long trip, and we splurged a bit since it was my birthday. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was warm, welcoming and friendly, except the staff at breakfast, who seemed harried and tended to ignore us. But that's minor -- we simply helped ourselves when needed. This hotel is very well-located for the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but great location”
Reviews.Author: 1468VX
Reviews.Content: We were meeting friends from the UK so decided to splash out on a nice hotel. One of the better big hotels, great location right next to the Rocks and Circular Key. Very friendly service but the same issues as always. Breakfast far too expensive at well over $30 each so we eat out at small cafe's each morning. Internet prices ridiculous at over $30 per day. All in all a super place, shame about the additional costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a Four Seasons Hotel sadly”
Reviews.Author: Napper689
Reviews.Content: Room was quite small, no worries in that dept. sadly wi if was extremely expensive for use in the room then they charger you again for wi if in the bar on the same day. This is simply not on

Reviews.Title: “good but not as fine as all four seasons around the world”
Reviews.Author: danieson
Reviews.Content: Why this property doesnt go te extra mile amazes me. the building needs a refurb already, the rooms had cosmetic upgrade but again they need to have the real deal ....for the $850 i paid i really didnt feel much value ..yes service is good and the position is ideal but if the touch up happened and some more care put in i will pay 1000-1200 happily a night....cmon managmnet spend the cash and make it like the 30 other FS i have stayed at aorund the world....and re think the whole food and bev menu and get some good chefs to help you turn it all aorund again ! afternoon high tea woudl be nice as would better room service and kids menus.....pool is old and needs work windows need cleaning to see the views

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and staff and great location. Ideal for business but I suspect even better for a holiday break.

Reviews.Title: “A must if you are in Sydney. Great staff, great food and great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: balisecondhome
Reviews.Content: A must if you are in Sydney. Great staff, great food and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra luxurious stay with fantastic restaurant and well-above average fitness facilities.”
Reviews.Author: DanBornstein
Reviews.Content: Ultra luxurious stay with fantastic restaurant and well-above average fitness facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat; spend the money and forget the bill- you won't care!”
Reviews.Author: JodieS32737
Reviews.Content: We loved it! Perfect location and staff. We upgraded to Executive Level- great decision! Do that if you can and have a cocktail every night looking over the harbor. Can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kesbham
Reviews.Content: Situated about 100 yards from the opera house proves it is the perfect location. Last time I visited was at new years and you have the best seat in the house for fireworks, amazing. The hotel is your typical four seasons. Modern and plenty to do. The pool is nice and the gym is excellent. The rooms were slightly out dated but the views were exceptional. Would return almost instantly if I could.

Reviews.Title: “it could be better for a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: micius
Reviews.Content: This is a Four Seasons hotel, and this should mean that no many words need to be spent to speak about. But during the stay there have been some point of inefficiency that you don't expect by this brand. Of course, on the whole, the experience is positive. The most disturbing thing was that the only day that we came back before 4pm (16.00) we found the room undone. I think that this is not possibile in an hotel of such standard. Moreover the housekeeping took more than 1 hour before cleaning the room since our call. To be true we have been given the access and use of the executive club without any charge in the meantime and we found an hand written apologize letter with some sweets when we went back to the room, but it hasn't been nice to wait such long time after a tiring day. Then the first day we have also found some hairs in the bathroom..another thing that you don't expect in a Four Seasons. The breakfast is excellent and the presence of a piano singer during it is a pleasure. One bonus point for the location, just steps from Sydney bridge, harbour and Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced American focussed hotel with poor staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: AirmileAlex
Reviews.Content: No complaint about location or rooms; but we were regularly passed over for service whilst Americans behind us in the queue were attended to preferentially. Foyer staff seemed bored and inconvenienced (room service staff nice tho). Full of American tour groups / chaotic & stressful environment.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great...Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: azwildcat
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a trip to Australia. I traveled with a friend and we were in Sydney for 4 nights, Cairns for 4 nights and back to Sydney for 1 night. The first 4 nights we stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay and the last night after returning from Cairns we stayed at the Four Seasons in Circular Quay. The Marriott far surpassed the Four Seasons. The room was nicer and bigger and came with two double beds, the concierge staff were extremely helpful with restaurant and bar suggestions and researching and booking various events and the location was great to explore Sydney. The Four Season by comparison had a small room with two twin beds, the room and hallway had a horrible smell and the concierge was not very helpful although the location was just a good as the Marriott. If you are debating about the Marriott or Four Seasons, hands down go with the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: cjaldrin
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is an excellent place to stay. It is real close the Opera House, Bridge (one you can climb), and water. We enjoyed walking in these areas. Had good food in the hotel and very clean room. Janet Aldrin

Reviews.Title: “Really only a Three Seasons.”
Reviews.Author: BostonAdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay. It is certainly not up to the standards I expect form a Four Seasons. Nor is it worth the Four Seasons prices, which they certainly charge. The staff if unhelpful and occasionally rude. The pool area is too small to accommodate the guests and is a bit rundown. The hours to eat at the pool (the only outdoor spot) are minimal and the area always seems closed. The hotel was clean and the bed was comfortable. It wasn't a horrible place by any means: I just expect much more luxury and service from a Four Seasons hotel and that was absent here. It is in a great location right by Circular Quay and the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Views of the world's most iconic harbour...”
Reviews.Author: Lightofhope
Reviews.Content: Opulence, inviting, cosy and comfortable is what the Four Seasons Sydney stands for. Rooms are top class with every amenity imaginable. Views are unbeatable and location is simply perfect. The pool area suffers from no views and occasional traffic noise from the adjoining highway... the only blot on an otherwise perfect canvas. It's not cheap but then again anything this good is worth paying for. Yep this hotel is a must for any traveller coming to Sydney who wants the harbour bridge and the opera house in full view from virtually every room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CraigAnd
Reviews.Content: We walked from our cruise ship port a few blocks to the Four Seasons hotel which could not be in a better location. "The Rocks" walking tour begings right outside their door! Older hotel with smaller rooms but the harbor view was sensational!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: HoffaFin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Seasons Hotel Sydney in November 2011 for a couple of nights. All in all it is a good Hotel in the middle of the center. Nice view over the harbor to Sydney Opera house if you are lucky to get a room into that direction. Rooms were ok and clean even to my taste they could need a face lift (somehow 80's). The restaurant is good, breakfast we had in the Executive Club but compared to other luxury hotels it was average. So end result is a nice and good Hotel but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Puregolg
Reviews.Content: Beautiful appointed rooms with a contemporary touch. Exceptional service...a selection of chocolates on the bed upon arrival was a nice touch. A great buffet breakfast with an abundance of delicious fresh foods catering to every taste. Most impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Late night drinks”
Reviews.Author: Pointyhead_10
Reviews.Content: We can't remotely afford to stay here, but enjoy dropping in for a late night drink before retiring to our more modest hotel, The bar at the back of the foyer is very pleasant in soothing mid browns and the service is beautiful. Of course, it's not cheap, but a liqueur coffee in one of their squishy armchairs is a nice way to end the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and great views of the Opera House”
Reviews.Author: CrookieLondon
Reviews.Content: Staying here for five days in this lovely city. This is our first time at this Four Seasons and it's very impressive. Early morning arrival was no problem and our room was ready on the 26th floor with views of the Opera House. Rooms are big and very comfortable with everything you could possibly want. Breakfasts are excellent. Will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great nibbles in the foyer bar!”
Reviews.Author: bodmor
Reviews.Content: We admit we went for one of the cheaper rooms but were told when we booked we would be able to see the harbour. Our room had a pointed window which we could see the traffic driving onto the Sydney harbour bridge ...but only when we sat at the desk. You get what you pay for! Personally we found the room a little cramped for the 2 of us, not very wide. Though we loved the toiletries ..L'Occitaine, I think! Location is THE best thing about this hotel as The Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera House ..etc are a few minutes walk away! We had drinks in the foyer bar ...Hendricks & tonics which were served correctly with cucumber & with complimentary popcorn which were infused with white truffle oil ....a very nice touch!!

Reviews.Title: “TIRED”
Reviews.Author: chateaudemontagne
Reviews.Content: If you advertise as five star the experience must live up to the promise sadly this is a third rate tired hotel which used to be the Regent has been rebranded as a Four Seasons and has failed in every aspect to meet expectations. We stayed in room 1803 which wasn't a room but a city view cupboard. The room were small an odd shape and poorly serviced. The bathroom was tiny (and I'm a large bloke 100kg 6'1") now thats not the hotels problem but when you can't sit on the toilet because its located in a corner and your knee's knock against the wall then Houston we have a problem. The bath was tiny got in okay needed a crane to get out. The last time I had my knee's that close to my chest I was flying economy with Jetsar!. At least the bath water was boiling hot. As an experience bathrooms in hotel rooms are vital and this just didn't cut it. The range of toiletries was lousy for a $350 a night hotel the bathrobe was so small a Peruvian midget would have had difficulties getting it on. As a five star hotel the best they came up with in the mini bar red wine department was Koonungra Hill from Penfolds REALLY I wouldn't run my tractors on it. Their only redemption was the bed it was fabulous. Over priced and over rated, if this is what we in Australia promote as a five star experience then heaven help us it was a rubbish hotel

Reviews.Title: “Another stay that ends too soon”
Reviews.Author: Ajsorro
Reviews.Content: Had a harbour view room that was a bit smaller than usual so that was a bit of a let down. Overall, great room starndards, great staff, great bar. Always a good stay...

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMcCauley63
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Sydney and I wanted a hotel close to Sydney Harbour, Circular Quay and The Rocks. This hotel is within a block or two of all of those areas. You can't beat the location of this hotel. I stayed in Room 3402, an Executive One Bedroom Suite on the very top floor of the hotel. Unfortunately, the word "Executive" is misleading because it does not give you access to the Executive Club on the 32nd floor (that is an additional $135/pp double per day). Rather than "Executive One Bedroom Suite" they should just call it a "One Bedroom Suite" so as not to confuse their guests. The other negative was that the counter space in the bathroom was very narrow and there wasn't a place to put things out of the way. I like to have my toiletries out where I can easily access them. There simply wasn't room. The positives - the shower was quite large, the bed was very comfortable, the living room area was quite spacious with a generous-sized desk (great for 2 people with laptops), the room came with robes and slippers, and the housekeeping service was wonderful. A couple of nice perks - bottled water by the entrance of the hotel every morning, a self-service latte machine in the bar of the lobby that actually makes great lattes, cappucinos, espresso, etc with to-go cups right there at no charge. Great for when you're on the go (however, there is a Starbucks across the street). I was disappointed that after traveling for over 24 hours and arriving in the morning, we were not afforded early check-in even though we had requested it. We had to wait 2 hours in the lobby for our room to be cleaned. All in all, this was a nice hotel and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBKeeper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney for a foodie trip for my husband's 30th birthday celebration (5 nights). I chose the Four Seasons due to the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor and personal recommendations about how great the hotel is. Unfortunately, this was not our experience, and I very much regret not staying at the Westin or Sheraton on the Park, where we have previously stayed and were very happy. We thought Four Seasons would be even better. The foyer itself needs a complete revamp. It looks tired and if not for the fabulous flower arrangements and back wall of reception desk, would look like a very average hotel. The design reminds me of the very tired Marriott up the road. We stayed in the city-harbourview room and had a nice view of the opera house. (complimentary upgrade from hoteltravel.com). The bed, is amazing, and is as good as the Westin Heavenly bed. The doorman, Pasquale, is amazing. He always remembered our names and cheerfully greeted us and was very helpful. He is a credit to the Four Seasons reputation. The hotel also services your room twice a day, which is lovely. The housekeepers do a seriously great job. The room itself looks rather dated, the bed head had scratches and marks all over it but I try not to complain about little things when we're on holiday. Loved the L'Occitane toiletries and robes, which were just the right thickness. However, two room service incidents ruined our stay. What we noticed about this Four Seasons is that housekeeping literally barge into your room. You will hear someone clicking their card against the door, a doorbell, and then OPEN. This happened to us a couple of times and we found ourselves having to race to the door. As a result, I rang up housekeeping and asked them to service our room at 7pm that night... imagine our dismay when we found them in our room at 4.18pm when we returned from a quick trip to the convenience store... so there we were, waiting in the foyer for a good 15-20 minutes. Even after mentioning this to reception, you would think they would offer something to compensate us for the inconvenience... a drink at the bar? Nah... we were left waiting. Fabulous service, Four Seasons! That night, the receptionist assured me this would not happen again and our room would be cleaned the next day after 12pm as per my specifications. Guess what? They came in at 10am... Strike two! Well, I was angry. When I couldn't reach housekeeping director, I left a message for the hotel manager. To her credit, the housekeeping director did her best to rectify the situation, as we were seriously thinking about leaving to stay at another hotel for the last two nights. She personally looked after us, and did a good job. The hotel manager, however, did not bother returning my call. Now I don't care that the housekeeping director told him what was going on, and they were working on the issue. If a customer leaves a message for you, you ring them back, even to acknowledge that another executive staff member has addressed the issue. You don't blatantly ignore the message. Makes me feel like because we weren't staying in a high end suite on the 34th floor, we weren't important enough to be acknowledged by the hotel manager. I will be writing to the higher powers of Four Seasons about this hotel manager. On our last night at the hotel, another glitch occurs. This was the only night I had time to use the steam rooms. The hotel book says the spa is open until 9.30pm. I headed down at 8.55pm. The spa receptionist told me they were closed. Apparently from the beginning of 2012, the spa now closes at 9.00pm instead of 9.30pm. And steam rooms close at 8.45pm. Wow....after all the troubles we've already had with this hotel, this was the last straw. Duty manager speaks to me.. acknowledges the hotel room information book needs to be changed.. and that was it. Never mind that you've inconvenienced the customer, one who stayed not one or two but 5 nights with you. It was a relief to move on from the Four Seasons Sydney. We will return to the Westin or Sheraton on the Park next time. Maybe try Intercontinental (we like the Rocks area). But there is a twist to this story. What the hotel doesn't know, is that I was testing it out as a possible destination for a work conference for 80-100 people. That's why they should treat every customer with 100% fabulous service, even if they stayed in a "cheap room".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Medic_5
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Four Seasons before our cruise. It was in a great location, one block from Circular Quay and just at the edge of the district called the Rocks. This was our first time to Sydney and the hotel provided a great base for exploring the city. The concierge was great and the umbrellas were nice (and needed) to be available. I had never stayed in a Four Seasons before and while the hotel was very nice it was on par with the higher end Hilton and Marriott Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant business hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: milarooni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly amazing! Situated by the rocks and Circular Quay you can't actually get a better position. The hotel had a business feel to it. Itâ€™s very swanky and posh and definitely a 5*. The breakfast was nice with a good choice. The floors of the hotel are tiered so you can look down onto the main lobby as you eat with the rather lovely pianist played every morning. The rooms were very nice. I had a harbour view room with views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Stunning by day and night! The service was impeccable and the porter brought our cases to our room for us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone & stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: freckles7983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Four Seasons twice - once on our wedding night in April 2011, and again in November 2011 after an event. The level of service we received on our wedding night was exceptional, but you always expect that you will be treated well on your wedding night. However, as normal hotel guests in November we again experienced the same level of excellent customer service, which has convinced me that this is the norm for this fabulous hotel. All staff were accomodating, polite, helpful and friendly - to be honest the best customer service I have experienced anywhere. The location is great if you are looking to explore Sydney, and the room rates are good value for a high end hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the beds are extremely comfortable. I cannot find a fault with our experience on either stay, and my husband and I have agreed that we will always stay at the Four Season when having a night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons, Sydney - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: bchgrl_7
Reviews.Content: From the Parking Attendants and Front Desk staff to the Breakfast and Spa staff, all of the personnel that we dealt with during this two-part eleven night stay were wonderful. Our travel agency is a member of Virtuoso, which provided buffet breakfast daily and a few other amenities. This was our 2nd visit to this hotel and the assistant hotel manager remembered us and provided a room upgrade when we checked back in from visiting Tasmania, AU. Breakfast was made memorable by the restaurant assistant manager and his staff. Service by the Concierge desk staff provided helpful suggestions throughout our stay, despite our having been to Sydney a number of times before. We had great views of Sydney Harbor during both parts of this visit, although I would agree with another reviewer that the rooms that we have occupied were on the small side and booking a larger room was outside of our budget. Both my spouse and I used the spa services and found their staff highly qualified and using excellent products, contrary to a spa we used at the Lake House in Daylesford, AU (to be reviewed next). We had stayed at a five-star hotel in Sydney, before a friend at home recommended the Four Seasons, as a much better value and location. We agree, considering our two stays at this Four Seasons. My best girlfriend lives in the Sydney suburbs and is our main reason for visiting Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, great service but a couple of niggles”
Reviews.Author: SonicDeathMonkey72
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Four Seasons chain and have never been disappointed with any of the ones I have had the pleasure of staying at. This one is definitely up to the level of the other ones I have stayed at except that it is in a city center. It is right next to the rocks which have great restaurants and bars and very close to great shopping. In terms of the room, splurge for the view....my business partner was absolutely regretful that he didn't do the same. The bed was great, the bathroom immaculate, and the TV had enough channels so that I didn't mind hanging out in the room on one of the rainy days we had in Sydney. The service was A-1 from the front desk, to house keeping, to the concierge. My two niggles were minor but I think in need of response: 1. The price charged for wifi bordered on extortion. Not only did they have the nerve to charge more than $20 a day for internet they had to the gaul to give you the option to pay for one internet option that allowed one the ability to watch video or another that offered limited bandwith. Give me a break! The other 3, 4, and 5 star hotels in Sydney don't do this why would the Four Seasons resort to such shenanigans for the sake of a buck. Trust me your clients know when they are being nickel and dimed and this is absolutely shameless. 2. How is there nobody at the pool to service the guests? There was just a sign on a phone that asked guests to call in their food and drink orders. So every time I wanted a drink I had to get out of the pool and run over to the phone like a hobo and beg room service for a drink? It should be the other way around because god knows you are paying for it. Overall I had a wonderful stay but I would suggest improving the two niggles above...especially the internet extortion. I hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “ehhhhh...”
Reviews.Author: dcsae
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was really wonderful, we found all of the staff to be extremely helpful. I was not very impressed with the rooms we had though - they seemed both dated and small. Had it not been a Four Seasons, my expectations might have been less, but I was dissapointed with the rooms when we arrived. Our view of the harbor was nice, and the hotel is in a great location in relation to the harbor and shopping. Overall...it was ehhhh...

Reviews.Title: “The way hotels used to be”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller12
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel we felt welcomed and relaxed. This hotel reminded me of what hotel service used to be. A proper driveway horseshoe you can drive into. A well dressed man snaps into action to guide you to a sensible spot. They casually great you and offer assistance. There is no rushing to grab your key and disappear with your car or opening the boot before the cars even stopped or fighting the taxis for position (they're kept well away until needed). The huge reception area was always stocked with staff meaning we never once waited to be served and were always greeted in a relaxed and friendly manner. It was a almost a shame because it was such a beautiful and spacious foyer I could have admired it for longer. Check in was hassle free and we headed up to the room. The room we stayed in at the Four Seasons was not huge but that was fine. It also had little in the way of a view despite being a harbour view room so if it's your first time in Sydney and that's important then let the staff know. What it did have though was exactly what I want in a hotel; a lovely and clean bathroom, a big comfortable bed, a clear work area off to the side, a couple of â€œchill-out chairsâ€� and a modern TV with decent news channels. The think that really impressed me with the hotel was the little extras that you just don't get in most decent hotels any more like an international power adaptor, shoe shine service and proper wooden coat hangers that you can take off the rail. It's always nice not to be treated like a criminal by your hotel. It also had the biggest safe I've ever seen in a hotel, plenty of cupboard space, a TV you can plug your own devices into, ice brought in daily, a TIME magazine waiting and my choice of complimentary (yes, complimentary) newspaper. Truly wonderful. My new favourite hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rod E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights on our first trip to Sydney. Perfect location, great views, wonderful staff. What more can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: afergy
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves its 5 star rating. The rooms are quite small but very stylish and extremely comfortable. Breakfast was faultless. Best of all was the view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Priceless!

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS PERFECT.”
Reviews.Author: Peter F
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you may pay a little more to get a no risk Hotel. You get the service without the attitude that you get at other 5 Stars. You get the attention to detail, dangerously comfortable beds, really nice folk and rooms in beautiful condition. No, I am not an investor or employee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding night”
Reviews.Author: rabroom
Reviews.Content: Free upgrade to executive suite, what an amazing room with breathtaking views. the wedding night package was certainly worth the money, lavish food on arrival, beautiful boxed hand made chocolates. The room service breakfast was just what we needed. Delicious hot and fresh. Certainly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Four Seasons standard”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 different rooms & they were both small, tired & the bathrooms were dated. We had breakfast in the dining room & the food was good but the service was like a country hotel not a Four Seasons in a capital city & the chairs in the section we were seated were stained - seriously dated & stained. Reception was mixed - some good & helpful staff some too casual & careless. The concierge was good. The spa was excellent. The pool is close by what appears to be a freeway over pass - it was ugly & felt small & hemmed in. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Falkirkgirl
Reviews.Content: What they say about the bedrooms is accurate. They are small and bathrooms dated. They are however furnished to an excellent standard. We had a room with a view of the harbour and the Opera House. It is quite spectacular. We ate in the restaurant once - for breakfast - and found the service to be not what was expected - slow and verging on the disorganised. We found room service to be more efficient and quality better. Location is key to this hotel - well placed for exploring Rocks and ferry services. Bar prices are expensive as were all food costs. All staff were friendly and helpful. Having later stayed at the Marriott on this trip, on balance, I wouldn't stay at the Four Seasons again - it just wasn't the five star quality you would expect from this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location to circular Quay, opera house and 10 min walk to harbour bridge for climb. Clean, good breakfast and pool facilities. Room was a little small (deluxe full harbour view) but how much time do you really spend in the room anyway...Great bed, very comfortable and quiet. Staff very polite and helpful. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “All class”
Reviews.Author: KennedysGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is all class , don't be deceived by the facade which is a little worn , the service from the Valet to the reception to the concierge is impeccable , not to mention the quality of the rooms which are beautifully maintained The beds are magnificent as is the linen comfortable the views are spectacular with their large windows and chaise lounge in which to view them from , The room service prompt and the rooms very clean , the pool area a little worn but considering its one of the only city hotels of this standard to have an outdoor pool which we used everyday there really wasn't anything to complain about , the terrace restaurant was very nice and the food very good , all in all this hotel is great and we will definitely be returning .

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 'Four Seasons' standards”
Reviews.Author: PeterGD
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in a 'Deluxe Full Harbour View room' - I beg to differ. The room is certainly not Deluxe - it is VERY small, the bathroom is tiny and the bath is only suitable for dwarfs. Towels old and thin, bathrobes falling to pieces, no slippers. The bed is huge and takes up most of the room, as is the TV. The decor in the hallways and public areas does not seem to have been updated since the 1970s - v poor. They do give room sizes on the website, but I did not take the time to measure the size of the room before I left home We are in a corner-ish room and 3 doors converge at the same place as ours, making slamming door noise even worse than usual. Feels like a Holiday Inn for 4 times the price. I am paying over $500 a night which is clearly a rip-off. Clearly hotel was something else before it became 4 Sns and they have just updated a few items. Pool area is grim. A few dead potplants have been put out to try to alleviate the misery of a concrete jungle, but sitting by a motorway is never going to be pleasant. The view of the opera house is fine, but to see the harbour bridge you need to stand in the corner by the window - this I do not consider as a 'full harbour view'. I have stayed at 4 Sns hotels around the world and this really does not meet my expectations and is very well below the standards of other 4 sns hotels. All in all I am not impressed - as they have my credit card details we have to lump it and stay another couple of nights, but when we are back in Sydney next month we will try the Shangri-La...

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious must when staying in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TMac101
Reviews.Content: This magnificent hotel with excellent staff, service, food and decor is a must. Book a premier full harbour view room (or any room) and you will not regret one single moment (or cent) of your stay. The staff make me feel like an old returning friend each and every time I arrive.The location is perfect for relaxing or exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: men740
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic weekend.... It was excellent! The staff were extremely helpful and polite. The room was amazing. It was our second stay here and I cannot fault anything.... Cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly child-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pinketer
Reviews.Content: My husband, 1 yr old son and I stayed here this last weekend and were very impressed by Four Seasons. We had to call room service several times overnight for more cot sheets (our little boy was ill unfortunately) and they were brought to us very quickly. Isaac (think he was the Garage Manager) was especially lovely, spending ages finding us a taxi with a car seat to get to the medical centre and then making a point of coming over to us when we returned to find out how our little boy was. Made us feel very looked after. On a practical level, we got the train from the airport to Circular Quay for about $15 each one way. The train is very easy to find from the Domestic Terminal and takes about 18 mins to Circular Quay. The hotel is about 5 mins easy walk from the station, carrying luggage. Wi-fi is $25 a day which we thought was a bit much given the price for the rooms and we didn't eat anywhere at the hotel as that was pricey too and there are plenty of places nearby which are great, especially in the Rocks which is a couple of minutes walk. You are obviously also right next to where the ferries leave for Manly, Taronga Zoo and other attractions and a very short walk to the Botanic Gardens. We were on the 28th floor with a 'city' view but ended up being on a corner so got half city and half harbour which was lovely. It was nice and quiet, apart from our poorly child! Rooms are kitted out as you'd expect for a hotel at that price - mini bar, iron, safe, lovely toiletries and super comfy bed etc. They have a turn down service where they also fill your ice bucket which is a nice touch. Thinking back, the one thing that wasn't as you'd expect was the tv quality - high def tvs with absolutely dreadful reception. I guess people don't tend to watch much tv when they stay there. All in all an excellent, if costly, stay. For a short trip to Sydney this place is a definite one to consider if you have the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: johnj81
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out I can not recommend a better hotel in Sydney. Service was exceptional, Breakfast buffet is probably the best I have had in any hotel in this country. Lunch was great, huge portions well worth the price. Priceless views from our room, thoughtful complimentary wine and card for our anniversary. Great hotel for a romantic escape!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: TeejMcTeej
Reviews.Content: I stayed at here on a work/business trip over-night. The check-in/out process was very efficient, and well organised. My reservation had "Harbor Views" noted. Despite the fairly small room, it was well and truly outweighed by the unbelievable views of the Harbour. My room was on the 26th Floor, and literally looked directly out onto the quay. 180 degree view consisted of undisturbed view of the Opera house (to my right), and the Harbor Bridge (to my left). Fortunately my company paid for the room, which was a little pricey at $315.00 (corporate rate). The buffet breakfast looked fantastic, but I think it was about $40+ per person, and I don't eat that much at 7am to justify spending that kind of money on breakfast. Lovely Hotel, in a great position, with amazing views (if you get the harbor side room).

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Lartom
Reviews.Content: Got off an eleven day cruise to New Zealand and was looking forward to being on land after some rough seas. Located in the Rocks and right on Circular Quay, The Four Seasons was exactly what we needed. We arrived very early (8:30am) and was greeted by warm, friendly staff. Of course, the room wasn't ready since it was so early but they said to come back in two hours and they would have one ready. At 10:20am, we got our wonderful room on the 26th floor with the city view. Bellman brought our bags up immediately and offered recommendations if needed. The room was a nice size with a big window and lots of closet space. Large Flat Screen TV and Bar of course. The marble bathroom was luxurious with it's full tub, stall shower and full compliment of L'Occitane shampoo and toiletries. But the best of all was the comfortable King bed and pillows, as perfect as home. Two happy campers we were (nothing like camping of course). Oh yea, we liked Sydney too! Forgot to mention the excellent breakfast buffet which made it all feel very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Annka78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Sydney in October 2011, The staff were very helpful. The Hotel was modern and clean and the rooms very well equipped. We had booked a Harbour View room, but when we were shown to our 30th floor room (which actually made us feel giddy) we could only see the Opera House if we stood at the corner of the window and craned our necks!!! We asked to be moved and the staff happily moved us with no problem. We were put on the 7th floor (giddiness resolved). Our bed was the fantastically comfortable (and the in Hotel info stated that they could be bought....looking into that!). We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we wanted to get out and experience the Sydney cuisine and culture. We got chatting to the street seller, whom we bought water and orange from each day, and he was extremely helpful and pointed us in the right direction for excellent breakfasts. The Hotel had a great little gym and lovely spa. On the whole the hotel is centrally located and we could walk to most places easily. The concierge was excellent at directing us around the city and also arranging maps and advice on trips out.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Ann80c
Reviews.Content: I booked here using my work's corporate rates, which are very competitive- from the minute we pulled up, looking a little worse for wear, we were treated like gold. We were checked in 2 hours early and given a room on a high floor at no extra charge. The rooms are clean and the light switches are where they're supposed to be. The room we booked was standard room but came equipped with l'occitane products none the less. The bell boys were friendly and we got nice big umbrellas to use when it rained. The bar staff downstairs were attentive and friendly. Very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: charlene1975
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons was everything I had hoped, luxurious, private and clean. I got a great deal on bookings.com and stayed for 2 nights. The staff were friendly and let me check in at 12pm when check in was at 3pm. I had the best sleep I have had in a long time in their luxury king beds and was never disturbed in the 2 day I was there, Coming back to the room in the evening my room had been cleaned and all my things were perfectly placed. The turn down service had been and left ice for drinks and everything was left out that you would need. I did not want to leave and head home. The pool, was perfect, not too many people around using it which was great. The walk is very quick to the ferry so when you are coming back at night you still feel safe and secure. The City View of which I had was exactly that the city view! If you wanted to pay more you could see the harbour, I got to see the harbour on the ferry so the view was not a big deal. Room service menu was very expensive, but the quality of food was good, not worth $37 for a steak sandwich but that is what happens when you stay in a top of the range hotel. Over all WONDERFUL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: rizmyshariff
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel few days before xmas 2011. Nice rooms and friendly staff. Not as good as some of the hotels in Asia but for business its a good hotel. Rates are reasonable. Had a great view from the room. Breakfast was average and was not sure why breakfast was not included in my room rate. Restaurant prices were quite high for the quality of the food. Overall I like the four seasons

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed overall”
Reviews.Author: barneyno43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the Christmas - New Years break. We paid a premium to be in a Club Room, as this was our special treat over Christmas. The room was nice, not spectacular, but nice, the view was great! The club was a huge disappointment, the staff were off-standish, and I felt like we were interrupting their day in just been there. The club closes at 8pm, and the staff start cleaning the tables well before that, they even took the little fake candle of our table while we were still sitting there having a drink. My husband had organised a bottle of Champagne as a treat to be waiting in our room, it was delivered to our room an hour and a half after we had been in the room. Even our luggage took over half an hour to make it to our room after we did. Not what I expected after paying such a high price for the room at all. The breakfast room service was very expensive, but was nice, and well cooked, and delivered on time. However, we are never going back to Four Seasons again, and I would recommend anyone else in Sydney to look at another hotel, they have just as good views, and much better service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel perfect position to see all what Sydney has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: mack1983
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be excellent. Close to Circular Quay and the Rocks area and George Street is great shopping. Our room was small but cosy and comfortable with a king bed and city views. We didnt eat at the hotel because it was a bit expensive ,there is a great cafe across the road for breakfast etc.The staff were very good and friendly. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gianfi58
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Four Seasons on late December. When we arrived the front desk was very kind giving us all the information we needed to visit Sydney and where to have dinner. The room at 19th floor was declared "City view" but we can't see the Opera House as we hoped. The room was comfortable and clean and large enough even if not enormous. The bathroom complete and very clean. The location is the best of the hotel, very close to Opera House (10 min walk), the harbor, the city center and the Circular Quay station. A special thanks to the concierge that solved us a problem in few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “10 nights - no problems; all good”
Reviews.Author: Eam77
Reviews.Content: Very happy to recommend the Four Seasons in Sydney. Location is brilliant, right beside Circular Quay. Recommend a harbour view room, View includes Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Staff very helpful for recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Million Dollar view from floor 32 - worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: roxinparis
Reviews.Content: Select the The Rocks neighbourhood and the Four Season Hotel for your stay and you will not be disappointed. Once I had decided on the Four Seasons I remember being confused about which room to go in for.
