The FULL HARBOUR view rooms are naturally more expensive and the question I had was - is that really worth it????? - Well, the answer is a big YES because if the view of the harbour and in particular the Sydney opera is important then YES. A beautiful GRANDIOSE view of the opera and harbour bridge and the whole area, awaits you and it is totally unobstructed. One of the gentleman in his review insisted on underlining this and I am glad I took up his suggestion so please go in for the FULL harbour view. We were on floor 32 and the higher you are the better. Anything above 20 should be ok I think. Hotel staff were polite and helpful and everything was upto standard. One very pleasant and unexpected surprise was the SHEER SIZE of the room. We were three and the bed was king size - the room was king size and the view certainly was kingsize. The location is very very good and you can't be better placed. - The hotel is also most suitable in its location because the ferry to go to the Sydney zoo in just across the road as is the port if you are boarding a cruise liner. Sydney Opera is just a two minute walk - there is no hotel closer or better placed that the Four Seasons on George Street. It is the first in line so you can't go wrong with this one. Also 12 dollars and a taxi will take you to most sites. iF you have kids go to see the dinosaurs in the Museum of Australia. The point for improvement for the 4 seasons would be the poolside area. There could have been a lot more flowers and colour considering it was summer and the poolside entrance and the pool in general is a bit viellot and seems dated. Could be so much better - more summer vegetation should be present to make you forget the noise of the city - although it remains today reasonable. Sydney is a total delight and our stay at Four Seasons was very equally wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure about the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Noheabill
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to do New Years in Sydney and finally went. Stayed at the Sydney Four Seasons and could quickly tell this was not a Four Seasons property. The room was an Opera house view up fairly high and was the most expensive room of the trip yet it was also the smallest room of the trip. (except for 1 night at the Travellodge) The other part of the hotel that was undesirable was the pool area on the 3rd floor. The place is right next to a fairly busy street, we went down there for lunch one day, and when we got to the deck we could see, smell and hear the busy street so needless to say, we dined elsewhere. This was our third poor experience at Four Seasons over the last 18 months; Jackson Hole, Vegas, and then this place. We really want to enjoy these hotels; we love the two on Lanai, Wailea, and Hualalai. We have had great experiences at the Vegas one as well but I am beginning to think they are not what they market themselves to be. The buffet was OK, too bad for them we had just come from the Langham Melbourne which has an incredible breakfast buffet. Steak at dinner not good, I would have sent it back but we had to get over to the Opera house. The staff was nice; they made it an enjoyable experience. The elevator monitor kept saying there was room upgrades available at some club level, so then why wasnâ€™t this offered upon check in? Concierge set up an enjoyable private tour and the bell desk was especially helpful, a great group that provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, the Four Seasons is great!”
Reviews.Author: DNG6711
Reviews.Content: Though this review is long overdue but it was indeed worth of writing. We stayed one night at the Four Seasons right after the event we attended and just before we fly back to Singapore. Wish we could have stayed longer as Sydney has a lot of things to offer. We got a great rate online which included breakfast since they gave good price for the delegates who attended the IYG. The bathroom was big with a separate tub and shower, and great L'Occitane toiletries. Our rate included breakfast and the breakfast buffet was very nice. Centrally located, the Four Seasons is great, walking distance to most CBD attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff and a spectacular location!”
Reviews.Author: sdpals
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is amazing - that alone is reason enough to go. The staff was very helpful and the hotel was in top condition. I was very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations. Nice hotel, but maybe not what you'd expect from a four seasons”
Reviews.Author: FJ1000
Reviews.Content: It's dated, rooms aren't massive and look like they could do with a refresh. Not what you'd expect from a four seasons! However, if you take it for what it is, i.e. a decent business hotel in a fantastic location, with great views of the opera house, then it looks a lot more attractive. The hotel rates reflect the fact it isn't up to normal four seasons standard. However, it was perfect for my wife and I because it's clean, comfortable and walking distance to the opera house, bridge and botanical garden.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we need from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: EduardoPeixoto
Reviews.Content: Location: it is hard to comment about location in Sydney, you can choose among excellents spots. But close to the harbor and a walking distance from the opera and shopd for sure is one of the best. Service: professional and friendly. Rooms: Pros: pretty new, clean, wifi perfect, goog towels and bathroom, large lcd tv. Cons: a little bit small and there should be more tv channels. Restaurant and breakfast: 5 star. Service, food, everything. In Sydney, You must consider Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: The main draw of the four seasons Sydney is its location... right on circular quay. I had a harbour view room and watching the sun rise over the opera house is a sight that will stay with me forever. The hotel itself was a little disappointing as I have stayed in other four seasons resorts and expected the hotel to be the same, it wasn't. It felt like any other 'business' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bed”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons just a couple of days ago. We had a Harbour View Room, which cost just over $800 for two nights. It was a beautiful hotel, very clean, and the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful(we were offered check in two hours early for free). My first reaction, however, when I opened my room door was "wow! this is small!" That is the only thing that was a little disappointing. For two people, we were still able to spend our time there in comfort, but for the price that I paid, I expected the room to be bigger. We had a wonderful view and everything else about the hotel was really great and very luxurious. I would have loved a few more days there.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced for quality of hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDW85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel after NY for three nights. Am not a frequent guest of five star establishments but comparing it to stays in hotels such as the Shangri La and Hilton this hotel is definately not worth the price, particularly as The Four Seasons markets itself as a 'cut above' the rest. Rooms were small, and to be honest I've had better bathrooms at 3-4 star establishments. It was also lacking little things that you would come to expect as standard at such a high end establishment such as a nespresso machine and a pillow menu. In terms of price, I understand that hotels mark up but this was ridiculous! $14 for a room service coffee, $42 for the buffet breakfast! Suffice it to say we didn't spend any money at the hotel itself wherever possible. We also had a slight hicup at the end of the stay. We arranged a late check out of 1pm, and were constantly called by reception between 12pm - 1pm asking us when we were checking out. I understand mistakes occur but by the 3rd phone call we certainly felt as if we were inconveniencing someone. All in all, the location was good but for the price i would reccommend another hotel or spend the money at somewhere like the Novotel or Holiday Inn on a bigger room and just spend your money on food/coffee/drinks in the multitude of options that Sydney has on your doorstep. Certainly in future when I am looking to splurge on a luxury hotel I will NOT be choosing a Four Seasons branded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2812
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the four seasons sydney and though the service was exceptional ...the hotel itself and rooms were not so grand .....was hoping for more luxury ... in fact the way we had broken up our journey was that we stayed there for 2 nights in 2 different trips ....in the second round we stayed at the Shangri-la which is just 2 blocks away and it was just a world apart ..... Maybe we just got a standard room ...so it was a little small and cramped .....the lobby is just about average and overall its a nice hotel but just dont expect luxury .... the location is just perfect...right next to the rocks area and across the street from the opera house ...but Shangri-la is just around the corner and is a MUCH better bet...

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bettyrose07
Reviews.Content: I booked a King City View room and, I certainly got a king size bed - one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in - but, the room was certainly not 'king'. I've had bigger rooms in 3 star properties in Europe. I think the dark decor makes it feel even smaller. The bathroom was fairly pokey as well. Certainly not what I expected for the money. It was however, clean and well presented. The hotel itself is very tired and certainly not up to 'Four Season's' standard. The staff were lovely though. If you are there on a Sunday, surcharges kick in which REALLY annoy me. 10% on top of anything in the Spa. $10 on top of the meal cost and delivery fee for room service. There is also a surcharge for paying by credit card. They don't have free Wi Fi which I find pretty lousy. It feels like they're trying to grab money any way they can. The location is fantastic though which is obviously what you're paying for. I would recommend the hotel for this reason however, you would have to like confined spaces!

Reviews.Title: “Less than Expected”
Reviews.Author: oliverAustralia
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons is an old 'Regent Hotel' and was not built to Four Seasons Standards. I have stayed here many times over the years and had expected that Four Seasons would have radically improved it but unfortunately this is not the case. The rooms were never big and many of them have only a city view. It would be a good hotel for half the cost. The views with full harbour view are great but expect to pay a lot for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Book Four Season's Directly with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smarternow1211
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the Sydney Four Seasons! At first, recognized it didn't have the same feel as the other Four Season's I've stayed at - more 'business-like,' but that was fine. Travcoa originally booked our room there and it was a small, 'glimpse' of Opera House View, dark and not up to any Four Season's standard I've ever experienced. After studying the hotel's website and realizing what our agent had done, I called the hotel directly and they were delightful to deal with. They actually moved us up a few levels to a Premier Harbor View Room - a huge corner room - #1615, with views of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House, at a lesser rate than advertised. It was reasonable for what we got. Best room, hotel, and breakfast of our entire stay in Australia. Hotel staff was phenomenal; concierge perfect. Just happy I made the change from what Travcoa, so-called "Leader in World Luxury Travel" had booked for us. Sometimes, it just pays to do it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sherri0513
Reviews.Content: The staff is great, rooms and views are fabulous and the location is awesome! We had a wonderful time celebrating New Year's with a fantastic view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge - perfect spot for watching the fireworks without dealing with the crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: kenflys19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of downtown Sydney Australia. All the comforts one could want and a great location. Only drawback is that you have to pay for internet. But you have to do that all over Australia and New Zealand. Only exceptions are McDonalds, Starbucks and Burger king.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Four Seasons standards, but excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: travelji
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on the first stop of our honeymoon in Australia and New Zealand. Sydney is a beautiful city and with the tourist action centered around the harbor, the hotel's location right in The Rocks and by Circular Quay is fantastic. That said, the room and the building were not up to Four Seasons standards. As several reviewers mentioned, the rooms facing the harbor are very small. In our first "harbor view" room, you could see the opera house if you squished yourself against the right side of the glass, but nothing from the chairs or the bed. Since we requested a room where you could actually see the harbor, we asked to switch rooms and this was accommodated within a matter of hours. The staff was also very accommodating to our unusual request to have a toaster in our room for a fun brunch of homemade treats and gave us a bottle of champagne to celebrate with. We scheduled a couple's massage in the spa - technique was great, though one masseuse had a medical condition requiring her to wear gloves. We would have expected to been advised about this in advance, not after disrobing! All in: The Good: * Location is excellent for tourists * Friendly and accommodating staff The Bad: * Small rooms * Property is old, lacks character Gave this an Average rating not because it's an average hotel, but as many other reviewers mention, it is certainly less than what you expect from the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The Harbour View room - a great room with the best view!”
Reviews.Author: Alana D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Harbour View room - a great room with the best view! On check in, we explained that we were celebrating a birthday, and the hotel said that they would send up a surprise to my partner later on in the day - Thanks for sending up the Birthday cake, Four Seasons! Do yourself a favour and splash out on the buffet breakfast - we included it with our stay, and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: Tracy5951
Reviews.Content: Many months ago we booked a room with an Opera House view for 4 nights over the New Year period. Hotel rates are eye wateringly high in Sydney over this period, in our case AUS$800 a night but given it was for a once in a lifetime experience we thought why not.... On checking in we were given the key to what can only be described as a 'pokey' room - so small it didn't even have a normal door to the bathroom, just a noisy sliding one. It did technically have the Opera House view - if you stood directly in front of the window to the far right - hardly a useable view as only one person could stand there at a time. Overall the room felt dated and in need of a refurbishment and most definably was not what we expected for the money. My husband spoke to one of the duty managers who said she would see what she could do to move us the following day. Unfortunately a shocking nightâ€™s sleep was had as there was a fault with the air conditioning and it kept me awake most of the night. On returning to reception the next morning my husband was told there was an upgrade available â€“ for an additional AUS$300 A NIGHT!!! A completely unacceptable situation then occurred when they started to negotiate the room upgrade cost. It was only when we asked to check out early that the matter was referred to someone senior in the management team who arrange to move us free of charge. Iâ€™ve not named the assistant manager my husband spoke to as I do not think it is fair to do so â€“ however she really has a lot to learn in the art of managing disappointed customers. The â€˜newâ€™ room was a much better size and did have the most fabulous full harbour view, the type and size of room expected from the Four Seasons brand, but it was a case of too little too late. Even at the normal rate of AUS$400 the first room was overpriced and disappointing. Iâ€™ve really struggled to rate this hotel as I do not want to be overly harsh and the location is terrific, but in terms of value for money and staff attitude (when we were checking out I overheard the same upgrade negotiation cost for another customer â€“ if there are better rooms empty why not use them to wow customers â€“ theyâ€™ll tell others which in turn will be good for future bookings....!!) it is not the best. This hotel was supposed to be the highlight of our 3 week holiday in Australia â€“ sadly it was not, Iâ€™ve given The Louise in the Barossa Valley, Sebel Playford in Adelaide and Quay West Suites in Melbourne all â€˜excellentâ€™ reviews, Iâ€™d recommend these hotels to family and friends. On the plus side Sydney did not disappoint and we spent a fabulous New Year on the Majestic Dinner Cruise on the harbour â€“ would recommend this strongly to anyone in Sydney for 2012.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more, but it was still good!”
Reviews.Author: JAmerican2
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Four Seasons! It was right in the heart of Sydney in The Rocks district, in walking distance, close to everything! That's basically what you are paying for-the location! In my case, we also paid for the ocean view, which was a nice treat! As for the hotel itself, I've stayed at The Ritz Carlton(once), Marriott, HIlton, Hyatt, etc. and I would put this hotel in the same category as a Marriott. The room and the bathroom were small and we had a room with a king sized bed. The maid service kept it clean and had a turn down service at night, but most nights we were already sleeping by the time they wanted to come in. The room also had a desk/chair, small ottoman, and flat screen TV. There were bathrobes in the room for us to use during our stay, but we had to ask for complimentary slippers(which were plain, not displaying the name of the hotel). The Ritz provides you with slippers(that actually display the hotel's name) and robes! The hotel was pretty quiet, so once we closed the door to our room, we weren't disturbed. The overall look of the hotel gave me the feel of a business type hotel. The decor used used dark woods and earth tone colors. It wasn't bright and inviting. We were told by the front desk that it had been renovated about 4 times since it was built with the last time being a few years ago. The best thing we can say about the hotel is that the breakfast was delicious! They had a wide variety of food that represented diverse cultures. The breakfast staff was warm and friendly and we really enjoyed their attentiveness! The concierge was quite helpful and knowledgeable, so we checked with them every morning, since we were touring independently. The front desk staff were also very pleasant! Make sure to use the complimentary safety deposit boxes! The only other hotel in that area with a better view would be the Shangri-La Hotel. The view of all the others are blocked by tall buildings, so this was the best bet, since Shangri-La was so expensive. My pet peeve was that there wasn't free wi-fi! I think I spent enough for the room, that it should have been included!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: paul1009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in to start our vacation and we were early before check in time, around 1pm. We were told it would take about 30 minutes so we went for a drink in the lounge. The service there was terrible. The bartender did not know how to make a Bloody Mary. An hour later, I went to find out what was going on with the room and was told it was being worked on. 30 minutes after that, we were taken to our room. We had a request for a king room, facing Sydney Harbor. We walked into the room and it had a king size bed and not much else because there was no room for anything else. The room was the size of a 3 star room in Europe, not what we expected in the Four Seasons. The bathroom was the size of a broom closet with a small, stall shower. I called the front desk to complain and was told there was nothing that could be done unless I paid $150.00 a night extra. After 2 days of misery, I called and demanded to speak to the manager. I voiced our displeasure and asked if they had another room, not facing the Harbor on another floor that was bigger that we could switch to. He found us a great room facing the city at no additional charge. Requesting a king room at this hotel does not guarantee that you will get a decent sized room. Make sure you see pictures or request a suite. Sydney is an expensive city but the restaurants in this hotel are really high and there are better restaurants to eat at. The location is great and you can have some wonderful views but I am sure there are other hotels with great views too. I have had much nicer rooms with better service in other Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: BonjourLL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights including nye, the hotel is nice enough but it is lacking character. The breakfast buffet was really good and the service was excellent especially the staff by the pool. The pool is a little bit old fashioned and is way too small for the amount of people in the hotel. For example on new years day most people had the same idea of relaxing by the pool and it ended up people arguing over sunbeds, people lying on towels on the floor and people sitting on normal chairs, they could have easily fitted a few more sunbeds in. The lunch tables by the pool also had to be reserved at a time as it was so busy which really is ridiculous as when you sit by the pool it is meant to be relaxing. However as I said before the pool staff were really great at trying to seat everyone and avoiding arguments. The location of the hotel is great and the views of the harbour and Sydney opera house are spectacular we actually headed back to the room on nye at 11 before the fireworks as the view in our room was better than the restaurant we were in for dinner. The decor of the rooms is quite dingy and I would definitely recommend a suite as we had one suite and one standard room and with 2 people the standard room felt cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RegenMan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed two nights between a long flight from US and a cruise. The hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance of shops and most docks. If traveling on a cruise be sure to find out where ship will dock as not all large cruise ships embark from Circular Quay. Ours did and we easily rolled our suitcases from front door of hotel to cruise ship. As part of our package we requested opera house view and this was provided. Outstanding view of harbor. Only complaint is that rooms are indeed a bit small compared to other Four Season's.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: elainevedette
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Park Hyatt at the Rocks which is a far superior property. This one feels like a cruise ship hotel with little of the Australian charm. The rooms are really lovely but there is not the intimacy of the Park Hyatt. Next time in Sydney I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel to stay in with excellent staff, great location and amenities. I would highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons, Sydney lived up to its reputation.”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: We were treated with utmost professionalism from check-in to check-out. We had e-mailed a couple of special requests prior to our arrival, and were delighted that they had been attended to without complication. All in all, one of the most pleasant hotel stays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Service is outstanding...location just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: globalfun00
Reviews.Content: This Four Seasons location lives up to its name in luxury and service. The staff is attentive, friendly, and professional. The room had an amazing view of Sydney Harbour. And it's just steps from the location of the hotel as well as the Rocks, Opera house, ferries, and other attractions. The bed was extremely comfortable with a large bathroom. I highly recommend it to visitors of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people who go out of their way to make a difference. The best in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons consistently delivers to the highest standard. It is the best location in Sydney with The Rocks, Waterfront, Opera House and CBD shops all within easy walkinfg distance. Staff are great and rooms all have great views.

Reviews.Title: “Fourseasons or Four Point Sheraton?”
Reviews.Author: Pickyfellow
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the title is a little unfair considering the service is good and food at The Bar (lobby lounge) is delicious. Plus the bed is comfy, as expected of any Fourseasons. But the room is tiny ad noisy. I got a Harbour view room on the 9th floor. Limited view to speak of and but the noise from the busy street even late at night is annoying. Add to that noise in the corridor and running tap of your next door neighbor at 7am in the morning! And I have never been in the Fourseasons room that small, which does give one the feeling of a Four Point Sheraton. Ok, if you are on business or a first time tourist to Sydney, the location is great and price is reasonable. But one wonders why the Fourseasons would compromise the brand value with a property like that which is also showing signs of age. Pickyfellow

Reviews.Title: “Made a special occasion even more special.”
Reviews.Author: Fairpammy
Reviews.Content: Well, you expect a lot from a Four Seasons hotel, and here in Sydney the Four Seasons gives you the best service, view, food and attention to detail this city has to offer. As a local, we visited this hotel to celebrate our 21st wedding anniversary. We had a deluxe room with an amazing view of the Opera House and bridge. The view was spectacular both night and day. Presumably not all rooms have views so pay the extra it's worth it. The rooms are elegant, perfectly clean, have L'Occitane soaps in the bathroom and a bed so comfortable we were tempted to take up their offer to buy one! Kables restaurant was immaculate in every way, the sommelier was helpful and didn't direct us to the most expensive wines on the menu, the food was stunning and the chairs were brilliantly comfortable. Certainly this is not a trendy, hip restaurant, and there is no view whatsoever, but it's elegant dining. Breakfast is served in the same space in the morning and the offerings were both plentiful and delicious. There's a chef on site to whip you up a perfectly poached egg or omelet or help yourself to the variety on offer. Again, the service is impeccable, immaculate and yet not annoying! If you want a great location on the edge of the Rocks, and next to Circular Quay, ferries, trains and city shops, love great service and are willing to pay for it, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with some of the best views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: archios
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for my birthday and loved every minute of it. The hotel location is at the top end of George st. next to the harbour & the historic Rocks district. We paid extra for a harbour view room and weren't disappointed. Walking into the room to be greeted with views of the opera house & harbour bridge out the window was truly stunning & worth every penny that I paid. There can't be many hotels in the area with views that good. The staff were all brilliant, whether offering to carry your bags for you or offering advice on places to go. They also gave me a birthday cake on my birthday. The room was not the biggest in the world but it was spotless and the bed one of the softest I've slept in. Good size bathroom as well with a lovely shower. All in all one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Vinny-The-Kid-UK
Reviews.Content: As you would expect from a Four Seasons this is a high quality hotel. Our harbour view room had the most fantastic views of the Opera House and Bridge. Room was not enormous but was big enough. The location for everything you want to do in Sydney is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Easily one of the best in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: FRANK11528
Reviews.Content: I am a regular to this fine five star Sydney hotel which follows the Four Seasons tradition pretty well. I was there this week and stayed at my normal corner grand premier room which is not a suite but a large version of the normal rooms. Check in staff and those I have encountered were well trained and courteous. The room was very clean and well prepared and the bed must be one of the best features of this hotel. Once you are in one of these bed, you don't want to get up. The TV and audio system are not the best but I don't think one should worry too much about this. My general gripe about most hotels in Australia is the bar fridge and faciltities for coffee making. A coffee lover, I don't drink instant coffee and why are bar fridges only 2 degrees colder than ambient air ? Where is the Nespresso machine and where is a decent cold fridge. The Rocks is just a 2 minute walk and the Opera House and Circular Quay about 5 minutes. You won't be disappointed as this 'easily one of the best hotel in Sydney' is strategically located and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jset28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Seasons a couple of times as i have an attachment to anything Four Seasons. I love this hotel, if i could i would have one of the grey chairs in the Opera view rooms in my house. The beds are extremely comfortable and the view is amazing! I wouldn't call it value for money as it and almost every other hotel in Australia is expensive although it doesn't include anything but the room. But the location is great, the room is great and the hotel is still classic and beautiful although maybe in need of a little makeover soon. Counting down until my next visit :)

Reviews.Title: “5/5 for the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: El_Pago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October of this year (2 months ago) and have been meaning to write a review! Went to Sydney on a ''surprise trip'' that my boyfriend had planned and of which took me to the Four Seasons hotel! Well, what a hotel and what a trip! Coming from Melbourne and having high expectations of five-star hotels, i was pleasantly surprised with the elegance of this hotel and the professionalism of the hotel staff. The staff were very helpful and willing to go above and beyond for any of our personal requests! This hotel saw a new chapter begin in my life - and my boyfriend PROPOSED while staying at the Four Seasons !! The bar downstairs was a great setting to have some Champagne and celebrate such a joyous occasion. The room itself was great and had everything you needed for an enjoyable time in the beautiful Sydney. The bed was so unbelievably comfortable and we could not get out of it for most of our stay! The location of the hotel is very central and close to Circular Quay and Sydney City. Do try to have the buffet breakfast at this hotel also - very nice range of food and delicious smoothies! Any negatives? Went up to check out the pool and thought ''meh''. Nothing special for a five star hotel, but hey, a pool's a pool! IF you are looking for a classy, relaxing and convenient stay in Sydney - book this hotel without any hesitations! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Melissa A
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed and advised of all the hotel facilties. It is very central to The Rocks and the surrounding Harbour. As we are locals we attended a function and stayed overnight. Staff were friendly and the room service meal was fabulous. The room was fantastic and it was totally sound proof from the city traffic. The room was very clean and fresh. We totally recommend staying here and have before. In fact we are planning a weekend there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: GES57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so centrally located. The rooms have an awsome view of the Opera House and the Bridge, the Breakfast was the best we had in comparison with any of the other hotels ( and we stayed in many) , the beds were so comfortable it was hard to get up and the rooms had all amenties one might need. Very friendly and helpful staff as well! Do try and stay there, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Four Season's Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Silverbullet1955
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed there almost one year ago. It was centrally located, near the Rocks! It was luxurious! We stayed on the 33rd floor I believe, and I got awesome pictures of the Sydney Opera House & the Sydney Harbor Bridge! The Staff & the service was impeccable!!! We enjoyed an evening in the Spa! I also got an opal pendant from Flame Opals with a discount from the hotel. Although, we only stayed there 2 nights, it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: UtahPowderpuff
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to the Rocks, shopping, ferries, Sydney Opera House and all this beautiful city has to offer. Very nice rooms, impeccable service. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, great staff at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Kevin D
Reviews.Content: Staying in Sydney CBD? Want a warm welcome, luxurious beautiful clean rooms and a unbeatable location? Don't stress out trying to be the one who found that unknown hidden gem in the city. Just stay at The Four Seasons and know you've chosen well. I have no association with the hotel, I just like giving credit where credit is due.

Reviews.Title: “Full harbour view room was exactly that.”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: Even closer than thought to the water therefore views better and access to ferries and restaurants etc. Room very impressive, super clean and the styling was in line with the Hotel. We particularly liked the decor. Everything worked which is all you want, no real short cuts anywhere I could see, service was second to none and that is the best king bed you can find in a Hotel. The room was very quiet as well, minimal water and door noise to be heard. I like my papers to read so perhaps a few more choices and supplied papers for that sort of room rate would be nice. The breakfast was also well worth it, we had it included with the room, too many choices leaves you full nearly all day. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent...treat yourself to some luxury and stay at the Four Seasons Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: NadiaSki64
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Four Seasons before, that's why we came back, and will definitely be staying again. The location is ideal and it is supported by friendly and helpful service and delicious food. We thought the breakfast buffet was fantastic. The sad thing was checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Grammeto9
Reviews.Content: We just spent 7 wonderful days in Sydney and stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel. It is right in the Rocks district and accessible to Sydney proper by public transportation and taxi. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff were very responsive and helpful. We asked one of the Concierge staff for dinner recommendations and he came up with three out of three, each one unique in its own right. We had a beautiful room that overlooked the harbor, the bridge and Opera House. The bathrooms were huge and offered a separate shower with ample water pressure. The towels were plush as was the bathrobes that we were ours to use for our stay. The personal amenities offered were top notch. All in all, the experience was perfect and we are looking forward to returning next year. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a first class experience in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great view Great location”
Reviews.Author: Simon W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while seeing Eminem in concert. Got a room with a view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House which was outstanding. Service was great and the location is fantastic right next to Circular Quay and The Rocks. Lots of restaurants, cafes and night clubs within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “One of those hotels you will remember forever”
Reviews.Author: ErikaLeiden
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the views and the area. Make sure you get the junior suite (like 2715, 2815), not the presidential one. That has city view and is great but doesn't have the view of the harbour bridge/opera house. Great restaurants, shopping, circular quay, the rocks, opera house, all within walking distance. Internet is fast in the room. Great bathrooms and you can make the room completely dark if you have to survive a european jetlag and sleep during the day. Breakfast is amazing on the 2nd level. Love the lobbybar as well. Belldesk downstairs offered great help with restaurant reservations. Not a very modern design, but great if you're not after modern. It's hard to be disappointed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: mangosm
Reviews.Content: Just recently had a weekend stay here. We had been hoping to book into the Hyatt until we realised it was undergoing major Reno but we were not disappointed at all with having to change our plans. The biggest factor for the four seasons is probably it's location, it is right beside circular quay and the rocks, minutes from Pitt St, the main shopping area and basically close to everything you could want in a city and if you are not well you have taxis, ferries and trains at your finger tips. The lobby was nicely laid out and of course the big Christmas tree! Check in went smoothly and as we arrived early, they took our bags and we went to have lunch. The rooms are of a very high cleanliness standard, we had room 1501 which was city view, looking out onto the street obviously, the shower grout could do ith some refreshing as it was a bit mildewy but I am being picky on this as there was nothing else to fault. very Comfy bed, though both I am my husband found the pillows to high/hard. I had some beautiful treatments at the spa, facial, body brush and hot stone massage, it came as a signature package and reasonably priced, spa is lovely and very professional staff, elegant spa lobby and lovely staff. My husband used both gym and pool and thought both were excellent. We did not eat in the hotel as we were meeting friends throughout the weekend so cannot comment on food/service. Though coffee in the lobby was great. Internet connection is $25 per 24hr and car parking is $55 per day. The rooms are not massive, rather average sized really, and I hoped for a bit of a wow factor if not with the room than perhaps with the view, but it was comfortable, very clean and in a fantastic location. I did have to go to the spa on the 3rd floor in the dressing gown provided in the room, but slippers were not provided though I was given them at the spa to use, it would have been better to have these in the room or have them sent to the room with the gentle reminder received from the spa the night before the treatments. I would definitely go back but would look for a better rate or better room or better view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: stina1986
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal. 2 minutes walk to circular quay and 5 minutes walk to main shopping streets, such as George St and Pitt St. The hotel itself is very nice with great service. I enjoyed returning to the hotel after a long day of shopping and sight-seeing every time.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: adam_blem
Reviews.Content: The service and quality cannot be faulted, I expected a bigger and more luxurious room for the rates, but had a fantastic stay nonetheless and the location for exploring Sydney is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, service and room - will return!”
Reviews.Author: wijastro
Reviews.Content: The location is very central and the service exemplary. Rooms and views are excellent. Room service and food could not be faulted. The only niggle is the charge for using a credit card (very petty and was the one spoiler on the experience). Will stay again and pay cash do I'm not annoyed by this sort of petty charge.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: Both the location and the quality of the Hotel amenities are first class. Just a 5 minute walk from Harbour action is a massive plus in traffic-laden Sydney and the quality of the rooms - good beds and pillows, plenty of work space were more than acceptable. The service is high class. A big tick for a business or leisure trip

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Floridangel
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Hotel Sydney was our first stop in our Australian honeymoon, and our experience could not have been more positive. The staff was friendly, helpful, and unpretentious, and they allowed us to check in early which was most appreciated after our exhausting flight over from the states. Our stay included a complementary breakfast which was out of this world. Anything you could want was available from the buffet and the presentation was exquisite. Our room was a little small, but this was expected after traveling to other cities in the states. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever experienced ANYWHERE, and we loved our view (despite the weather being pretty depressing outside for the first two days). The location of the Four Seasons is perfect. Honestly, prior to coming to Australia I read a few mediocre reviews of this hotel and it almost made me want to switch our accommodations. I'm so glad I listened to our travel agent who insisted we would enjoy the hotel. I can't imagine having a better experience staying anywhere else in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “First 3 star, 4 Seasons”
Reviews.Author: JakartaTripper1953
Reviews.Content: First time at the Sydney Four Seasons. It does not look like it has been refurbished or upgraded since opening 20+ years ago. Does not fit into the Four Seasons category what so ever. The fixtures and fittings so old and run down, also look so cheap. Lousy lighting for reading and general ambiance. Women would hate the bathroom for putting on makeup - no space and bad, bad lighting. Bathrobes thread bear, missing the fluffy towels. Many years nor replaced. No room for suitcase to open up to get clothes without major disruption to the suitcase. Wireless internet very expensive. Although charging 5 star prices they cannot even give you a pen to write on. BTW management the pencil needs sharpening. I am stunned at how down market this hotel is. The management should be ashamed to call it a Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: cj_loves_holidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons from 21-23 July and it was perfect. The service was amazing. We were upgraded to a a harbour view room and our room was ready for us alot earlier than expected. Despite the weather being completely miserable while we were there our stay was made very comfortable. The room was perfect! Beautiful views, very comfortable furnishings, clean, neat and quite spacious. All of our requests were attended to very quickly and with no hassel at all, the staff were all brilliant and very helpful. The location was perfect within easy access to everything. Breakfast was lovely, we had the buffet breakfast one morning and then due to an early flight we had room service the last morning, both were fresh and delicious. Well worth the price, I will definitely visit again and I will definitely be recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Average for Sydney standard”
Reviews.Author: randy20060901
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel August 2009. It was neither excellent nor terrible for the price. Average for poor Sydney standard but much better than staying at the Westin. [SERVICE] Average. Don't expect too much this hotel is in Sydney. [CLEANLINESS] Good as we expect for the 5-star. [FOOD] We just used the bar next to the reception. Drink & service were good. [FACILITY] Maintained well no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheLeadLap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a family vacation and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff was overwhelmingly friendly and went above and beyond to ensure we had what we needed. The girl at the concierge desk even called in a personal favor to get us into a restaurant that was fully booked. We celebrated my wife's birthday in Sydney and while the hotel restaurant had already closed by the time we returned, the staff gave us a table and provided us with silverware and drinks so we could enjoy her over-sized cupcake. Each morning when we went to the restaurant for breakfast, the hostess and waitress knew us by name. We occasionally ate across the street at Starbucks in an attempt to save a few bucks. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect! Our room overlooked the Sydney Harbor; bridge and Opera House. While the Four Seasons is a bit pricey, it is certainly not out of line with other hotels in Sydney. Our travel agent got us a great deal, so you may want to go that route. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The bar”
Reviews.Author: lawterboy122
Reviews.Content: Came to the bar with some friends for some desert. I highly recommend the desert tasting platter. The tea and coffees were expensive at 6.5 each and they were very standard. The tea drinkers complained that all they could taste was hot water. Overall not a bad spot for dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in everything”
Reviews.Author: drbrok
Reviews.Content: The water view room was well designed but not particularly large. The corner rooms were much larger but much more expensive. We enjoy a good room and were very satisfied with the smaller room. The service elevated the entire experience to wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Sydney is the best for customer service .”
Reviews.Author: 176JohnB
Reviews.Content: From my experience, the Four Seasons is the best hotel for customer service in Sydney. The staff are attentive right down to the bottled water provided on departure. I would thoroughly recommend if you want to be pampered in luxury surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Lana Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days Nov 2011. The rooms are quite small although comfortable (i had a king) but in desperate need of a refurbishment and overall the hotel is very tired looking. Even the lift had me worried it would break down. The room came with no book that lets you know what is on and where such as room service and after asking for one for 4 days it still did not arrive so do not know if there is even roomservice. The staff whilist friendly in general were not attentive as they should be in a 5 star hotel. The location is great and close to the main tourist attractions. Please dont waste your money here. Its far from 5 star and there are much better options in this area at this price. I was really shocked and will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good, could be better?”
Reviews.Author: XpandMyHorizons
Reviews.Content: Location: excellent, stone's throw from the Rocks, and practically on the water front. Downside was no nearby supermarket. Rooms: not sure why some have said that they were small. Mine was fine for our family of 3. Bed was nice, high, and firm. Bathroom was perfectly adequate. Other stuff: it's so close to Circular Quay that you can just go for a run out by the water, all they way to the Botanic Gardens and back. Internet was fast enough but not particularly cheap. Front desk was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, luxurious 5 star hotel with all the bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: chazwaah
Reviews.Content: 6 of us friends stayed in 3 rooms in the amazing hotel last weekend. The bed is super comfy, and room service is spot on. Great location, just steps to the opera house and amazing restaurants around "the rocks" area Prob one of the best hotels weve ever stayed in Def recommend

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: vik871
Reviews.Content: We stayed at four seasons for one night. The hotel room is small and very confined. We had to pay $60 upgrade for harbor view room. Views were good but I would not stay in this hotel. The front reception staff check in and check out were not friendly. Looks like they did not enjoy there job. The hotel is best a 3.5 star. Very small. Lifts needs upgrading. I was charged $100 for someone's elses laundry. The TV was grainy picture called staff could not fix. Room service dining very pricey. Car valet most expensive. I would stay next door at Shangri La as the rooms are bigger and I did not have to pay upgrade for views. If available they upgraded. Valet much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Nothing Especially "Four Seasonsy"”
Reviews.Author: elizabethw823
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Four SEasons Sydney last week. It was a great hotel, very modern, clean and comfortable. Maybe it's because it was a city hotel, but there wasn't anything about it that seemed to have that extra "Four Seasons" touch. I am use to complete luxury when staying at a Four Seasons and something was lacking a bit. Again, nothing wrong, everything was great, but I missed some of their signature special touches. For examples, often times they will hand out coffee, apples, bottles of water... I know, it sounds crazy to complain about such silly things. But trying to give my honest reaction. Also, the rooms - though stylish - are pretty small. And a reminder to US travelers, they seem to have European style rooms in that we asked for 2 beds and got 2 twins! Otherwise, the staff was GREAT... that certainly lived up to expectations. Everyone was very nice and willing to make any accommodation. All and all, a great spot in The Rocks, SO glad we stayed in that area (I wouldnt' stay in another area!). The Rocks area is so beyond beautiful and the hotel is within walking distance to the Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbor Bridge and ferries to beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, location and accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Jen S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Four Seasons Hotel in the Rocks District in Sydney over a weekend. The hotel was just a few blocks away from the Opera House so a very easy walk. We arrived off a plane early morning from the USA and was sure that we would not be able to check in to the hotel until later that afternoon to freshen up before a day of sight-seeing. We arrived at the hotel and they promptly showed us to our room! We were showered and ready to hit the streets by 10am that morning (check-in was officially 3pm). The concierge gave us strong advice on restaurants and local events and eagerly helped us each time we approached the desk. Even if he/she was on the phone that person was put on hold when we approached with a question. The fitness room was fantastic with good equipment and TVs. The fitness room was with the spa so there were refreshments and cool towels available. The hotel was exceptionally clean, hosted exceptional service, and the beds were very comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: RegTravellers
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Sydney is in a great location (close to The Rocks and The Harbour), but feels in need of an update. Decor is dated, and service is fine. Not all that you might expect from a Four Seasons Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: DavidWilman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel in Sydney for our honeymoon and were so very pleased with the choice. Overall, it was outstanding - from the room to the friendly service - and in particular, a thank you to David Luff, the Concierge Clerk, who helped arrange all our activities and restaurants during our stay, and to Irene Chia for arranging a special warm welcome in our room to celebrate our day. Many thanks...we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with lots of hidden luxury and personal service”
Reviews.Author: kirstiesaunders
Reviews.Content: Great attention from staff! Comfy beds quiet rooms

Reviews.Title: “Where are the Four Seasons Brand Police???”
Reviews.Author: pfpedersen
Reviews.Content: Holy cow, this was such a huge surprise to find my favorite hotel chain had a hotel in its portfolio that looked like a bad Hilton!! Someone from Four Seasons headquarters had better bite the bullet, get on a plane and come down under to have a look a look at this joint -- it is an embarrassment to the brand... That said, this 1980's smoked glass and tired marble monstrosity has an ideal location, which makes it a great choice for tourists and business people alike. My husband worked and I spent every day strolling out to take a ferry or a bus to some of the best beaches in the world. Shopping, The Rocks, The Botantical Gardens all within an easy walk. The lobby is very unprepossessing: a three story atrium that has a constant din from the meetings and parties that take place in the main ballroom right off the atrium. The polar opposite of the contemporary, hushed luxe of a typical Four Seasons lobby. Our first room was tired -- old dirty looking carpeting and worn upholstery. Our second room was larger and had been refreshed, which was better. The pool is on a 3rd floor roof right under the highway to the Sydney bridge -- not exactly a quiet sanctuary. The spa was tatty and unkempt -- even the robes were grey from too many washings. The food from room service was very good and service in general good, if not quite as crisp as the brand's other properties....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and an overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: midiberry
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great few days in downtown Sydney at the Four Seasons Hotel. Most of what we wanted to see in the city was within walking distance or a short taxi ride. The concierge service was excellent and all staff were charming. They did make an administrative error with our bill which resulted in a late charge being added some weeks after we left. We felt this is unacceptable practice for a high class hotel chain and the experience left a bad taste in our mouth - if I had been them, I would have swallowed the relatively small extra charge. We will probably not go back again, so they have lost a customer for the sake of a few dollars

Reviews.Title: “Good service and great views”
Reviews.Author: PCM87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times with my husband. I location is unbeatable being in the heart of Circular Quay and views of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House that make this hotel a very special place. This is about my 4th visit now, all my visits have been good, with the exception of one stay, where a few things went wrong. These things were quickly rectified by hotel manager, Vincent Hoogewijs, who contacted me and did his very best to put matters right. This resulted in my return stay and a very comfortable and relaxing 3 day visit. A room with a view is a must at this hotel. Full harbour is certainly worth the money but the Opera view is certainly lovely. I enjoyed a very pleasant room service meal during my staff with the room service staff extremely attentive and accomodating. Dinner in the room is a very special experience at the Four Seasons Sydney, as the views are to die for. Overall, the hotel has a strong emphasis on service and offers a number of special services to make you feel right at home. Consider taking up the Executive Club during your stay as canapes open bar and breakfast, makes your stay all the more enjoyable. Thanks to the staff and management for their welcoming attitude and special attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great service, great location. We would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: az_one_11
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a Sydney holiday or business stay. Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BJ5
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic room and facilities, good restaurants, excellent breakfast, friendly and efficient staff, couldn't ask for more. Spent one night in a Harbour View Room and one in an Opera House View Room, both of which were stunning, with amazing views. Also had a lovely treatment in the Spa. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Observatory Hotel instead”
Reviews.Author: cassidy24
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Four Seasons Hotels around the world. This one was nothing special. The pool area had dirty towels everywhere and no one in sight to clean up. The gym had no headphones out to use. We told the hotel we were celebrating a special anniversary and it was a non-issue to them. Our turn down service never happened on our first night and we got no newspaper because they said we had a do-not disturb sign on the door (which we did for about an hour before we went to dinner). The room was adequate and clean, though on the small side, and they did upgrade us to a partial harbor view from city view, which was nice. One plus: the location within walking distance to the Rocks and downtown is perfect. The bed had great linens. However, for the price I would stay at the Observatory where our room was twice as large, the service was better and we got a welcome fruit platter.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect one night escape.”
Reviews.Author: Dom1066
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed one night but had a great experiance, we got upgraded to the harbour view room on the 32nd floor which had total uniterupted views. The beds are very comfortable and while the bathrooms are fairly small the are clean and have great power showers. The heated pool was very warm even though it was cold outside you could stay in it for hours and the spa/steamroom/sauna was a nice touch to wind down. Also a great gym if you feeling that way inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Davejr99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Four Seasons for our honeymoon, thinking we would treat ourselves to luxurious accommodations. We were extremely disappointed. The rooms are very small, the service was lackluster, and we had a very difficult time gaining access to all the perks we were supposed to have included in our package (like free breakfast). Be sure to take a close look at the fees that the hotel charges, like $50 per person for breakfast and over $100 for one load of laundry. I've stayed at Four Seasons in many locations and unfortunately, I will have second thoughts about ever choosing this hotel chain again. Needless to say, I do not recommend the Sydney location as it is simply not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: LouMelbourne11
Reviews.Content: Traveling for business and usually just staying one night, I want an easy, hassle free stay. The Four Seasons is in a great location and has a spectacular entry. The staff are pleasant and efficient. But my room 'opera view' was tiny, and needed some maintenance. The toilet would flush for 10 minutes (yes, this is true, I timed it) . And all just a bit old looking. The room service was inedible - undercooked chicken, that I sent back (and to their credit, didn't charge me). But from a so called 5 star hotel, I was pretty disappointed. But it's a king bed made up of 2 singles joined together type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great view, but...”
Reviews.Author: amargosa3000
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming, the room was large, great bed, fantastic bathroom, view of the Opera House. Only downside was that the sound of trains entered my room all night.

Reviews.Title: “Conference at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: fernvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one day to attend a conference. The rooms are very tastefully decorated and the hotel is in perfect location with views of Circular Quay. The staff are very efficient and close at hand if you need anything. Breakfast was a buffet and very substantial. The rooms are large & impressive and the dining area also very clean. the waiters close t hand in case you require anything. Just step out the dor and you have a taxi stand as well as other public transportation like a bus stand and even a tarin station within minutes walking. A short stroll away is the Opera house. By evening, the hustle of the city office goers quiten down & the area in front of the hotel near the Quay become a reaxing place for a stroll.

Reviews.Title: “It was good. Worth the dosh? Depends. Read on...”
Reviews.Author: Cardi9
Reviews.Content: In passing I once heard a saying that you could be seated on milk crates in a restaurant and people would still be happy if the food & service was excellent. Ok, well, with my derriere that may cause a few issues such as diamond cushioning along my skin making my butt resemble the surface of a buttoned leather lounge. The Four Seasons Sydney reminds me of this saying. Not because I was forced to sit and sleep on milk crates or anything substandard; quite the contrary. The furnishings are just lovely with a hint of regality but are obviously well worn. The king size bed felt like it had a 30cm feather pillow top on it which was UH-MAZ-ING to fall into at the end of the day. Heavy cotton curtains in each room if drawn would make you think that 8:30am is actually 2am as I found out and it wasn't a welcomed surprise however I can appreciate the idea if I was nursing a hangover. What I loved about the Four Seasons were the people and the personal service that they provided. They were kind, courteous and generally interested to hear about my stay with them. It felt like coming home where family were asking you how your travels were and if you'd like a night cap. Mind you, a night cap at my mother's house certainly wouldn't be $16 a glass but then again, I wouldn't be served a 2006 Shiraz from the Hunter Valley at mum's house. Maybe just a cup of tea and a kick up the bum. Yes, the Four Seasons is pricey. And why wouldn't it be? It's at The Rock's in Sydney, one of the most affluent areas in Australia. The real estate that this hotel is built on would be worth a mint and possibly even more if a Chinese company could get their hands on it given their buying capability in Australia at present. Buffet breakfast is a lazy $42 per head which includes all of the bells and whistles you'd expect but I honestly thought that the spread would be a touch better given that I've eaten at The Grand Hyatt in Melbourne of which I compare the Seasons to in price and also reputation. Streaky Australian bacon just doesn't cut it for the only meat option on the menu. I can pay $8 for a streaky bacon and egg sandwich at any of the little cafes you'd find in a side street. Am I being fussy for $42? Damn straight I'm being fussy! I would like Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon, the eggs poached hard with none of that vinegar flavour and freshly made Hollandaise. Oh, and toasted panini bread. In the Seasons favour, they served fresh orange juice plus any barista made coffee you'd like. Only problem was, where was the barista? The latte came out cold and weak. Hm, see what I mean? Again, all I can say about the Four Seasons is that the people make this hotel. If it weren't for their courtesy and subservient attitude, I would say that the Seasons needed a serious decorating renovation to bring the standard up to the prices that they ask. Oh, and Matt Preston to get in there and do a serious breakfast review because it is just not good enough! Would I stay here again? Sure! Only if my employer footed the bill. On the coffee scale, I'll rate this hotel a luke warm latte. Love the idea of it, just not quite there.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, but check your bill ...”
Reviews.Author: IslanderOz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at The Rocks/Circular Quay, and a 10 min walk around to Sydney Opera House and the Botanic Gardens. We stayed in the deluxe harbour view room which was wonderful but a bit pricey at $500 per night, the view was spectacular! Breakfast buffet was very good. Our only complaint was that on our wedding night we were brought a lovely tray of food, chocs and bubbly... only to find the next morning an invoice pushed under our door. When we went to reception we told them it was a lovely thought but we hadn't asked for it and therefore didn't expect to pay for it, they agreed to remove the charge. Upon checkout we found a few other charges added to our bill which should have been included in our room rate - again the costs were removed but it left us with a bad feeling about this hotel and as a result we would probably not return or recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Sydney Four Seasons is all class.”
Reviews.Author: homesong
Reviews.Content: Luxury isn't always done well in Australia but the Four Seasons has it covered. Service all the way. Proper service with good communication. Not service to fix problems like in other hotels. No stuff ups hence service for service sake. Lovely ambience, great bed, large rooms, gorgeous bathroom and view over Sydney harbour. Would do again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay and great value for money as well”
Reviews.Author: Adrianmob
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in the heart of Sydney and fantastic rooms and service. Bed is so big and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: whitakersd
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Sydney we stayed at the Four Seasons for nearly two weeks. This hotel is excellent for a number of reasons. First, the room was comfortable and well furnished. Ours had and many of the rooms have a view of the harbour and the Circular Quay. Its nearness to the Quay makes it a fine place to be for ferry trips on the harbour and all other forms of transport, bus and train. It is also near to the Rocks and in a less busy area than in the city itself. The bed in our room was one of the most comfortable i have ever slept in in the many cities we have visited around the world. This is particularly important for a long stay of 13 nights. Long enough to feel at home. The staff are very professional and friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. When one of our sons pyjamas disappeared they searched for a couple of days and then gave us some money to buy another pair. There was no quibble about this. Their attitude was great. Also they were quick to extend a conference rate I had for the first 4 nights to the whole of our stay. A better rate than available in any other nearby hotel. Overall an excellent experience. My only negative point, is that it was a surprise to find, when i got home to the UK, a credit card service charge on the bill for MasterCard which I had not noticed. For AMEX I could have understood it, but maybe this is something that is common in Australia. It certainly would not have put me off using this hotel though

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location!!!”
Reviews.Author: dh24yaya
Reviews.Content: Perfect location at Circular Quay. We happen to have had a large room overlooking the Opera House and Bridge...exceptionally comfortable bed and room!!! The concierge floor had a wonderful breakfast and great snacks. We have stayed at many Four Seasons and I would say the the common areas need a little sprucing up. Also the staff was not as warm and friendly as other properties I the chain...which was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: suntans
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed her for 7 nights, and the location is excellent for the Quay, train, Rocks, restaurants and pubs. The pool and hot tub were very nice, the perfect spot to relax in the sunshine, comfy loungers and fluffy towels in abundance. I peaked into the fitness centre - it looked excellent, and the spa looked very nice, although I did not use their services. Our suite was an Opera View room, and the views were outstanding, of the Quay on one side, and busy George Street on the other side of the suite. Our suite was always spotless, the maids did an outstanding job, and the bathroom always well stocked with fresh towels - loved the pressure in the shower - it was energising and refreshing. The beds are much lauded at this hotel, but to be honest, I found it totally uncomfortable! The whole week I felt like I was sleeping in a valley or on an inclined plane! Time to buy new mattresses I think. The furniture was beginning to look a little tired, and the couch had a definite odour about it, it was also as hard as a rock, so I avoided sitting there. No satelite TV, just a few channels to choose from, a RS menu that had the most outrageous prices I have ever seen - $16 for a glass of wine. No free Internet. We were shocked that they wanted an extra $25 a day for WiFi. A hotel of this calibre should have free internet. Check in was a bit of a strike out, our room wasn't not ready, ( The front Desk gals did however arrange a nice table in the bar with some hot tea for us while we waited. That was a nice gesture) We were informed that breakfast was not included in our rate, and that was an additional $40 per person per day, I enquired about the complimentary morning tea and muffins (as advertised on the web site) and they informed us we could upgrade to include morning muffins and nightly canapes for $185 a day, this is when we were also told of the internet charges, it was just bad news being delivered all round. When you consider that the rack rate for our suite was already about $500 a night - we certainly were not in the mood to hear about all the extra charges the hotel had in store for us, especially after a 15 hour flight. At check out, I realised they even charge for local phone calls. Was I surprised? No........ It really is a beautiful location, and the hotel is clean - but it is nothing like the Four Season properties we have stayed at in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable location”
Reviews.Author: Enjoystour
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this beautiful hotel for 3-nights few months back. The location is fabulous close to harbour & the view of Sydney harbour from the room is breathtaking specially during night time. The lobby is stunning & the service is prompt & immaculate. Just had a tinge of discomfort during breakfast where i thought colored people were not adequately paid attention too. Similar feelings were echoed by my other partners. Otherwise a fantastic, luxury hotel close to the best sights in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: IvoLP
Reviews.Content: The staff was not that friendly when checking in. The location is very nice but the rooms are quite small, it seems like the rooms also could use a bit of renovation, especially the walls and carpet look a bit worn out. Reasonable quality of gym. Breakfast and parking are twice as expensive as competitors so that was a bit of a turn off. Same for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: frenchyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 2 days for a conference. It is a nice hotel with excellent service at the front, I was really impressed with the concierge staff, friendly and attentive. My only discontent was having to wait until mid afternoon to have my room made up even after 2 calls. The hotel is situated right in the Rocks, the train station, direct from the airport, is a 5 minute walk. Room was clean, great shower and L'Occitane products, I can not comment on room service as the prices were outrageous and decided to go out instead, there are plenty of great restaurants and coffe shops around.

Reviews.Title: “best service in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ro_teixeira
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time there. The concierge was perfect, suggesting and making perfect reservations for restaurants and trips, renting a car, looking for special things that we needed like underwater camera cases, special wines, golf gear, and so on. We really used the concierge and all the staff was fantastic, specially Mr. Jorge The room was always clean and perfect. It was near the best atractions, walking distance to Sydney Opera and the ferry-boats.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Four Seasons as a business traveller. The basic rooms, are as reported quite small. However, this was not a disadvantage. I had an Opera View room and there certainly was a great view of the Opera House from the large window, Room service meals are nice, but not overly generous portions and proportionately expensive to what you receive. I found a $15 charge for R/S delivery because it was Sunday outrageous and don't recall being charged that amount at any other hotel. Newspapers were not delivered and I found the doorknob request for a daily paper well hidden in the room as I was leaving. This service should be automatic for the room price. The staff are fabulous, very friendly and helpful. My room was starting to be a little shabby paint wise, but really overall, I have to recommend the hotel for its location (right at Circular Quay), the staff, the comfort and the amenities. The shower was fabulous, you can choose the temperature and it the water pressure is great.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it!”
Reviews.Author: freshfields
Reviews.Content: Currently at this hotel and having one bad experience after another. After a 22 hour flight from the States we really looked forward to our stay here. We frequent 4 Seasons Hotels all over the world but this is the worst! Top of the line room with only one sink, no hooks to hang towels or 2nd bathrobe, no soap in bathroom, tub drain doesn't work properly, lighting so bad in bathroom husband can't even see to shave, no lights by couch so unable to read, TV is HD but they only have analog hookup so very pixilated screen making the 46 inch TV almost impossible to watch. Ordered a burger which turned out to be a MacDonals's complete with pickels and ozzing sauce, for the price of $26.00. Outrageopus! Would not take off check as it was unedible, but would give me drink instead. Oh yes, weather here cold and rainly sowantead to shut off A/C and turn on het. Seems that broken too. Advice - AVOID at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Michelle R
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location and beautifully appointed

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: leetonozzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own in a deluxe room, booked directly at the hotel. I found it great for business travellers. The staff are friendly and helpful, the room was well appointed and immaculately clean and the bed was wonderful...a very big plus if you are wanting to be fresh for a presentation next day! I have back problems, so a good bed is important for me. It wasn't the usual rock hard bed, but not bouncy either. The sheets were luxurious, as were the l'occitaine goodies in the bathroom! The room was completely quiet, so sleep quality was maximised. I didn't avail myself of any of the hotel's leisure amenities, but the bar downstairs looked very good. The location was ideal for my business trip,and is in a very convenient part of town for tourism as well. I asked the waiter for the cheapest option for breakfast, which seemed to shock her, but it was very good value for money.The only disappointment for me was the lack of free wifi, as usual (sigh). I would almost swap a good sleep experience for free wifi! I also think they should promote their budget breakfast option much more openly - you shouldn't have to ask for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great tourist location! And service oriented.”
Reviews.Author: H2where
Reviews.Content: All in all, a very accommodating hotel. They kept my luggage overnight when I went on a random side journey to the bush country, they moved me to a room with a better view, the food is good, and the location better. The only thing keeping me from a higher rating is that the rooms are on the smaller side. Overall, though, I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel- Great for any occassion”
Reviews.Author: Happy0nH0liday
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at the Four Seasons Sydney for business. I have always found every room I have stayed in to be beautifully appointed, clean and comfortable- just what you want for a business trip. The downstairs bar is relaxing for a drink after work- the only downside is the lack of free wifi although this is a common problem in many Australian hotel and should not detract one from staying here. The pool is nice although a bit chilly when the weather is not warm. Room service is great although could be improved by more regular/ seasonal changes for frequent visitors. The location is great- two minutes was to Circular Quay which has numerous options for meals. Overall, I rate this as my favourite hotel for a business stay in Sydney (we have numerous options available to my company and I always return here)!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, great location”
Reviews.Author: tellerto
Reviews.Content: Had the Harbour View room, directly facing the Opera House, with views to the Harbour Bridge and Circular Qua as well, Good, clean room, nice touches, but you pay for it all. Overall a very nice place to stay, Buffet breakfast a bit steep though, at $84 for two!

Reviews.Title: “Service ++++”
Reviews.Author: Louise2329
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Four Seasons for our 1st Wedding Anniversary and we will definitely stay there agian the future. We were blown away by the outstanding and professional service that we received by all staff! We came back from our day out and asked the concierge for recommendations for restaurants and within 2 minutes they had booked us a table and given us all the information. Upon getting back to our room we found a bottle of Champagne on ice, two glasses and a personalised card that said "Congratulations on your 1st Anniversary". When we walked down for dinner, the gentleman outside gave us an umbrella just in case it rained whilst we were walking. We were also given complimentary bottles of water for the trip home the next day. Room was excellent, very luxurious! Great view of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Circular Quay. Couldn't recommend enough!

Reviews.Title: “The staff make any business, and these guys were fantastic in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Tami S
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with my stay at Four Seasons. Great location with beautiful views of Circular Quay, Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the room. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and efficient. I was only there for 1 night and lucky enough to be upgraded to a premium room, which seems to happen reasonably frequently where possible! Definitely worth spending extra to add a little luxury to your stay. Plus, the beds make for an incredible nights sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Corner Room”
