Reviews.Author: CliffKol
Reviews.Content: We booked a corner deluxe king-bed room for the same price as a basic room. A great upgrade, facing the harbor and bridge. Room was luxury, clean and comfortable. Hotel was typical Four Seasons, grand, luxurious, modern and well maintained. Convention type hotel. We stayed here in 2002 and it was just as good in 2010. Centrally located near harbor, Rocks, park, bridge and opera house. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bufind
Reviews.Content: Boy. what a great way to start a trip at the Four Seasons Sydney! It is in an area called "the rocks" which in my opinion cannot be beat. Our room (albeit, it was not the avg room) had a view of the bridge on one side and the opera house on the other. Restaurants all around the hotel were great (Pony and Sake particularly). We were there twice on this trip and had two different rooms and they were both great. Not the average room but angled (in a good way) with all the bells and whistles. My hat is off to you Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: home222
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at Four Seasons Sydney. Not one complaint. Great location, service, people. And the best housekeeping department I have ever seen in any hotel in the world. Every hotel's housekeeping department should take lessons from this group!

Reviews.Title: “Not one weak link in our stay,PERFECT and PROFESSIONAL ! Congratulations”
Reviews.Author: Hoges018
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 26th wedding anniversary at this wonderful hotel.From the time we checked in to the time we left we cannot fault the FRIENDLY and professional staff.We booked through one of the internet services as a quick decision to celebrate our anniversary in Sydney. We live in the Hunter Valley vineyard area and have been involved in all aspects of tourism and wine growing for the last 38 years.We checked in and to our surprise were upgraded to a corner room on the 19th floor with the most amazing views of the harbour bridge and opera house and circular quay.Fantastic breakfast with a room full of friendly attentive staff also made this a great occassion.My wife and I could not fault this hotel in any way,cant wait to return! BJ

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Lugrin
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Sydney is I think the best hotel in Sydney. I was a regular customer of the Regent in the 90's and was happy to see that it has kept its standards and even gone up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff with great amenities. Strongly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony P
Reviews.Content: Service from concierge to check in all extremely professional and friendly. Any staff met during our stay all behaved in the most professional manner. Very good rooms and amenities. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in SydenY”
Reviews.Author: cobraa
Reviews.Content: I really loved Four Seasons Sydney, I stayed in it during my honeymoon trip in 2010 The hotel is very stylish and luxurious It was a good choice for a honeymooner itâ€™s well located in the rocks area We had the Premier Harbour View Room The room was big and We could see both the opera house and the harbour clearly from our room My wife loved their bed very much Our room was on the 20th floor if I am not mistaken. Staff were polite and friendly The concierge guided us on where to go in Sydney Many cafes are around the area Again itâ€™s a really nice hotel and pricy as well but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay at any hotel of all the hotels I've stayed in around the world”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, best stay of any hotel I've ever been at anywhere in the world. Perfect location, many options, beautiful view, very comfortable beds.... Hard to beat, and the staff is super!

Reviews.Title: “Our holiday splurge was great”
Reviews.Author: tonkatome
Reviews.Content: When in Sydney we took a really nice hotel for 2 nights during our australian holiday. The hotel is in the city at the rocks and a very handy spot for the harbour, ferries, restaurants and history. The hotel is first class in all respects and we loved our stay here. It is quite expensive but for the location and the lovely facilities it is worth a little splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tez99
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel with a five star location at the Rocks. Close to everything you need on George St Sydney including the best restuarants and nightlife. Hotel has amazing harbour views, super comfortable bed and nicely furnished rooms. Excellent, friendly service. I will be staying here again on my next business trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in The Rocks?”
Reviews.Author: JLM2009
Reviews.Content: This was one stop of a 30 day honeymoon in June 2009 (the tripadvisor system only lets me go as far back as October 2010, but I just haven't gotten around to writing the reviews), which also included Fiji, New Zealand, Hong Kong, London, Cairo, Madrid, and Portugal. Firstly, it is truly a 5 star hotel. Service was impeccable, the Front Desk cordial and welcoming, the Concierge above-and-beyond helpful. When they say they will call back with an answer to a question (if they don't have it right away) then they do so in a very timely fashion. Beautiful common areas, great room service, attentive staff. Secondly, the rooms were in spectacular condition, and our particular room had the perfect view of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. My wife was feeling ill, and we spent an entire day inside the room, and I can't imagine a better hotel room to be in. The location is superb. We stayed in the hotel for 3 days, and we NEVER ONCE took a cab to go anywhere. There is so much within walking distance from this hotel: the harbor, the opera house, the botanical gardens, the Rocks, pubs, restaurants, convenience stores, the zoo, etc. If you want to stay in Sydney in a place to be able to see the major sights, and feel like even when you're just inside your room that you are deep in the heart of Sydney, then get an Opera House or Harbour view room at the Four Seasons. As far as value, sure it's expensive, but as with many of the Four Season properties, you get what you pay for. We got lucky and caught a pay for 2 nights, stay for 3 promotion, which made staying here a no-brainer. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “this is a 5 star hotel that acts like a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: callipsau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic, I usually stay in 3 star hotels and have done so all around the world. I was travelling to Sydney for business and my work paid for the room. The service is fantastic, from your taxi door being opened to your luggage being taken to your room, to a turn down service, to a friendly smile. the location is fantastic on the Rocks in sydney (the Lindt cafe, as well as the Guylian cafe are around the corner), for those that like Starbucks there is one across the street (might be the only one left in Australia........). My only complaint with this hotel is that they didn't have free wi-fi (something that I found at lesser star hotels in Melbourne and the US). Although I wasn't particularly fussed by that, the room was quite big, the bathroom was beautiful and the complimentary products are L'Occitane. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey001
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic location and very luxurious. We had great views and the food was great. The service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The bar opened quite late on week nights too. Top marks and worth the money for special occassions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: NeilPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Went on business and has everything and more than you require. Great location near the Rocks and many eating places close by. Treat yourself to a wonderful Hotel

Reviews.Title: “relax relax relax”
Reviews.Author: kiwis002
Reviews.Content: Well what a enjoyable stay here, staff were helpful, hotel was very clean, service was excellent, drinks at the bar was wonderful, But food is very expensive there, but u can eat out at lots of lovely food places around the area. BED was comfortable. View was lovely of the Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: TrevSBournemouth
Reviews.Content: The staff and hotel were excellent. For a city centre hotel the room (city view)was spacious and we found the staff to be very helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “They remembered me!”
Reviews.Author: vissi87
Reviews.Content: My third stay at Four Seasons Sydney was just as special as the previous two. I booked an Opera View Room and was ecstatic to receive a complimentary upgrade to a Premier Harbour View room due to my previous stay in this room type. The view of the harbour was simply magical, especially at night. The room was lovely and spacious and the marble bathroom complete with L'Occitane toiletries was very luxurious. Staff are fantastic and always courteous and friendly. We ordered room service and it was absolutely delicious. The chocolate puddings were to die for! Thank you Four Seasons Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: leisure1507
Reviews.Content: very central location, very very helpful and pleasant staff. I really liked the attention to detail , rooms are spacious, clean, superb views. There is ample storage, good eatries nearby and most of the sites are nearby with very good access to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, big room. Slow lifts.”
Reviews.Author: physioT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner harbour view room for our wedding anniversary. The room was quite large and we had a nice view of the harbour bridge and opera house. The bathroom was spacious but it was just a normal bath (ie. not a spa bath). I wished the windows were bigger to make the most out of the view, and I wished we could have seen the view from our bed. We could really only enjoy the view if we sat on the chair outside the bathroom or directly next to the window, which is a shame as we paid over $500 for the room and breakfast package. The king bed was very comfortable and the L'Occitane toiletries were a nice touch. We found the staff to be helpful and unobtrusive. The staff were extremely patient; often letting us take the lift ahead of them because for some reason, the 6 lifts were very slow, with long wait times. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant Kables was nice, and again the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel location is excellent, close to the Rocks and Circular Quay. I would be wary of the rooms on the lower floors as you would definitely hear the train and traffic noise. We were on the 20th floor and could still hear the train sounding the horn at various times during the day. I think I would stay here again but perhaps look for a cheaper room or a better deal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy Hayler
Reviews.Content: I actually moved out fo another 5 star hotel in Sydney (Amora) when I discoeverd that they had no wi-fi, and moved to The Four Seasons. The hotel is superbly located just uards from the harbour, the rooms were to a high standard and the staff were excellent during my four nights there. I would very happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel; convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CarrickGirl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent the final four nights of our month long tour of Australia at the perfectly placed Four Seasons Sydney at the beginning of May. En-route to the hotel we got our first glimpse of the Opera House and the famous Harbour Bridge. The hotel was very comfortable and had a highly convenient location within minutes walk of both Circular Quay and George Street shopping area. Although our room was somewhat compact, we had a partial view of Sydney Opera House. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine with a good shower. We used the concierge service to book a meal in the Sydney Tower on our first night and the girl was friendly and efficient. The hotel is ideal for walking around the Circular Quay and Rocks area; we walked down to the left to get to Sydney Opera House. There we had an excellent and enlightening tour with Alan, full of enthusiasm for this iconic building. We also took a Majestic lunchtime harbour cruise. This afforded some terrific views of one of the most photogenic cities, and the buffet lunch was delicious. We walked back to the Four Seasons from Darling Harbour; the latter area well worth a visit. We enjoyed a couple of drinks in the lobby bar of the Four Seasons and we found the staff friendly and efficient. We also took a ferry from Circular Quay over to Taronga Zoo; which was very enjoyable. The only negative in relation to the Four Seasons was that we were a little disappointed with the buffet breakfast as it didn't have as much variety on offer as other Australian hotels we had stayed in on our trip and did not have a cook station for omelettes etc. Overall however I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here if we are ever "down under" in Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it...”
Reviews.Author: OldAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice in the past 2weeks and on both occasions the staff and service were fantastic. From the front desk to room service, porters and restaurant, everyone was seemless and lovely. Even though it is a large corporate hotel we were made to feel very welcome with our baby. Front desk gave our toddler a little koala which was a nice touch. We will definitely be staying at the four seasons when we travel to sydney. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “The views save the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexCpl
Reviews.Content: Our rating of three for this hotel is based almost solely on the fantastic harbour, opera house and bridge views which are iconic. But the truth is, location is just about the Four Seasons Sydney has going for it. We paid a lot of money for a harbour view executive suite and were looking forward to our stay. The arrival at the hotel was distinctly underwhelming. it's a dated building and so is the lobby. The lobby was full of self-important non-resident business people, and service as half-hearted. Public areas are uninspiring, with little of the luxury expected of the brand. The pool area is nowhere near the standard of others in the group - small and not well appointed. The suite itself was comfortable and the views of the harbour and opera house are awesome. Very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. All look dated though. Had room service a few times in order to make the most of the outlook. This isn't a bad hotel, but not what you'd expect of the Four Seasons Group.

Reviews.Title: “ok, great views, but a bit disappointing for a Four Seasons...”
Reviews.Author: Voyager212
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby etc is dull and uninspiring. I was totally underwhelmed on arrival and did not feel I was in a Four Seasons. Things got better when I went upstairs. I had a harbour view room which had fantastic views of the Bridge and Opera House, which rather made you forget any of the hotel's deficiencies. The room was small, but well decorated. Bathroom was fine. Good TV. No balcony. Location is excellent, close to the harbour, Rocks, business district etc. It was a bit chilly to use the pool, but I had a look around. It is a small pool deck, just about OK for a city centre hotel but nothing special. If I return to Sydney I would have a close look at other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit to this hotel and even better than last time”
Reviews.Author: JanetCoulbeck
Reviews.Content: The location is close to all the main tourist attractions so you can walk everywhere. We had a suite this time, but unfortunatley no view of the bridge, the room was lovely. The front desk were very friendly and the concierge guys were excellent there wasnt anything they didnt know!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful luxurious hotel in an amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: robyn M
Reviews.Content: The service was of a high standard. The Hotel was beautiful and elegant. The location (The Rocks and Circular Quay) was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Olivia010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for three nights on a business trip. All the staff in the lobby were great. Reception were friendly and helpful, the concierge was knowledgeable and the doorman gave me a few bottles of water when I returned from my run. My room was only 15 floors up and didn't have a spectacularly great view but that didn't really matter, I just kept the blinds shut. The room itself was quite small but very comfortable and luxurious. The bed was massive and took up most of the floor space in the room. Very comfortable, too. There was also a desk and chair, an ottoman, and a little round armchair-type thing. The bathroom was nice and the shower worked well. I ordered room service one night and it arrived promptly. The food was pretty good, to be expected! There is a turndown service every night which is a nice touch. When I was there the pool was shut but apparently they had organised for guests to use the pool at the Marriott down the road. I didn't check out any of the gym facilities, preferring instead to make use of the fabulous location and go running around the rocks and the Botanic Gardens. All in all I think the Four Seasons is everything it should be - it doesn't seem to be quite as luxurious or exclusive as I would have thought the brand to be elsewhere in the world but was a really nice place to stay in a beautiful location right on Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Geelong255100
Reviews.Content: After a long day of meetings, driving around from meeeting to meeting there is no better place to have a good nights rest than the Four Seasons Hoel in Sydney. Their beds are so comfortable they would the competion a good run for their money. Rooms are very quiet , well appointed with excelllent amenities in the bathroom.The location of this hotel is also very good, close to public transport should one need to use it as well as shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return”
Reviews.Author: martin p
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Sydney and a night in your beautiful Hotel. He couldn't have made a better choice. The experience was complemented by the excellent service especially our attentive waiter at breakfast, beautiful room and view and amazingly comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views from room 2215”
Reviews.Author: babyboo01nz
Reviews.Content: Lovely room..spacious, huge comfy bed (on the soft side)....so much so I am going to call them tomorrow to find out where to buy their pillows and bed cover. So deliciously snuggly. Extra items we ordered for arrival (wine, chocolate, fruit) were delivered within 5 minutes of our arrival, as anticipated. Gorgeous harbour/city/bridge/opera house views from this room. Nice bathroom - single vanity, fully tiled shower, separate toilet cubicle, massage bath (single person). I particularly liked the magnifying mirror with light! Nice bathroom products as always. Service couldn't be better - nothing was a problem and they were always eager to assist! Valet parking very quick, they also held our bags for a few hours and allowed us to continue parking even after checking out. Room service very quick and really friendly, also 2 free papers delivered to us (without us asking). Turn down service..room spruced up before bed (while we were out)... nice to come back to. No noise within hotel..very quiet. We could hear a little from the street below but nothing unusual for a city location. Also, fantastic location for exploring The Rocks+city area. The only thing we were miffed about was paying a $10 "Sunday" room service surcharge (on top of the standard $5 room service charge). It made my eggs and squeezed juice breakfast a whopping $53..... I wouldn't have ordered had I noticed the fine print before calling. Aside from that.. lovely hotel, and service that cannot be faulted!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Some Issues ...”
Reviews.Author: AussieRoamers
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was wonderful with proximity to the CBD and the Rocks. The room was spacious, modern and clean but there were some issues. I ordered room service only to have two followup calls querying my order. It appears that I had an old menu in the room - I would have expected more from this hotel! Also, the meal when it arrived was very ordinary with an extraordinary price! Breakfast was $AUS42 - it was good but I have had much better at a much, much lower price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds, best staff, best location, and fantastic food!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissBeeHaven-RUBY
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel I have ever been in, the food, rooms, service were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and service. Attentive staff. Excepionally well maintained establishment.”
Reviews.Author: Matikens
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, attentive staff, exceptionally well maintained. Rooms are very comfortable - the best bed, pillows and linen of any hotel I've ever stayed at. Good business location as well as being located on the water and potential for good walks.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't love it and we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: N W
Reviews.Content: I anticipated it would be an extraordinary stay as it's a Four Seasons Hotel but it wasn't. My expectations were far too night. I confirmed a city view king room @ $295 per night inclusive of breakfast. The room was small, the bed was soft, lumpy, uncomfortable and offered no support for your back. The air conditioner blew hot air all night, despite the temperature gauge highlighting it was only 16 degrees. We reported the incident to the maintainance department who visited the room and advised the temperature gauge was never correct and there was nothing wrong with the air conditioning in the bathroom roof. Apparently that was all that could be done, so we didn't sleep at all that night and had to pay for the inconvenience. The breakfast buffet was great, however we were soon let down again by the slow check-out procedure and temporary loss of luggage upon departure causing us to almost miss our plane. Overall it was a very disappointing experience, the food and beverage was very overpriced and the customer service was ordinary. I will not return to this hotel and I would certainly not recommend this hotel in the future. I would try next time the Shangri La only a five minute walk from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: BGosivetti
Reviews.Content: Right at a convenient corner of Circular Quay and by the Rocks, easy access to a lot of great sights in Sydney. Very nice rooms and attentive service from hotel staff. Only complaints would be that we had a couple of plumbing issues which the hotel did their best to address but one of which was not fixable during our stay (they did offer to move us, but that was impractical with a lot of us traveling); and also service at the breakfast buffet was inconsistent - the staff was overwhelmed and sometimes inexperienced. But would definitely stay here again as they were responsive and the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KarenUK_13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 5 nights in 2 rooms along with my parents. We arrived early (around 8am) from our flight from London so our rooms were not ready. We were sent to the restaurant for complimentary drinks whilst we waited and the receptionist took our cell phone number to call us when the rooms were available. We left our luggage with bell services so that we could have a walk outside. At 9:15 we were called to say that both rooms were ready so we went back to check in. Our luggage was in our rooms when we got there. We had booked harbour views and were not dissapointed with what we could see, a perfect view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The room was well appointed and looked clean and well kept. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent (we had this included in our room price, if paying seperately I thought it quite expensive however it was in keeping with breakfast prices in other Australian city hotels.) Service was always quick and the servers very polite. The hot breakfast buffet was good, especially having 2 types of bacon. The cold buffet options were also excellent especially the selection of fruit and variety of smoothies. The pastery and smoothie selections changed daily so there was a variety throughout the stay. A big plus for this hotel is its location. Being on the very edge of Circular Quay was excellent as you did not have a walk up the hill or steep steps after getting off the ferry (something we had to do when we stayed at the Shangri-la a week later, even though on a map and in pictures the hotels look like they are on the same level.) Being in this location also meant that you could get to the station and main bus stops within a few minutes walk. There were only a few negatives about this hotel. The bedroom windows, they allowed a lot of noise into the room from the road and railway which ran close to the hotel. Whilst this did not bother me it did bother others in my family a little. Also for a hotel of this class and the amount charged for the room free internet access would be a plus (this was offered in other 5 star hotels that we stayed in on this trip.) Overall we had a lovely stay in the Four Seasons and if we were to visit Sydney again we would choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely weekend away in the city”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_Panda_79
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a gorgeous location. Upgraded to a premier room city view that was worth the extra $100. I even enjoyed views of the opera house which was a nice surprise. Great service for an australian hotel also. Yes the five star hotels in hong kong, macau and china I have previously enjoyed were newer and the service a bit smoother. However none of those offered a surprise view of the beautiful opera house, not promoted and completely unexpected. Also, the service here was genuine and warm. They even gave free toy and fruit and cookies box with colouring book for my little niece. These little touches made for a wonderful stay. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: treasures514
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to The Rocks, Circular Quay and the CBD. Check out The Rocks weekend market. There were quite a number of great finds!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Comfortable Hotel but Not Like American Four Seasons Properties”
Reviews.Author: MM90402
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in February. The hotel has a great location -- walking distance to the Rocks restaurants and markets, the Opera House and the main ferry dock at Circular Quay. It's a nice property, but its nothing like the Four Seasons hotels I've stayed at in the U.S. The rooms are small and unimpressive. We had a partial Opera View room and it still wasn't exciting. Decor was a bit tired. Room service was dismal. No free WiFi, which always irks me, especially when traveling internationally because I rely on WiFi to connect home. Ended up making a daily stop at Starbucks down the street for the WiFi. Still, the beds were comfortable enough and the room was clean and the location is superb. It's just that it felt more like a Sheraton or Hilton to me. We ate at the restaurant every morning because we had a package that included breakfast. It was busy (I think everyone had that package) and though it was fine for a day or two, there wasn't enough variety to sustain longer than that. If I could have afforded it, I would have definitely chosen the Park Hyatt which is only about a 10 minute walk away and gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Likemonicainfriends
Reviews.Content: Good points: Best bed I have ever slept in. Perfect location. Staff are just lovely. Bad points (which is hard to find!) Basic rooms are small - perfect for one though! Pool a bit small for number of guests. Overall: Felt luxurious - exactly what you want for your hols. Would stay again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location in Sydney's CBD”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights on business, and overall, found the hotel to be comfortable and acceptable for the price. What I liked: - Central Location: The hotel is located along George Street and within easy walking distance to the offices within the CBD area. It is also close to Sydney Harbour and the Rocks, and therefore also a perfect starting off point for taking in some of the sights of Sydney. It is also possible to walk to Darling Harbour from the Four Seasons, although this will be a good 15-20 minute walk. - Service. Staff were courteous and helpful and ever ready to provide recommendations for lunch/dinner. - Rooms: The rooms were smaller and more dated than other Four Seasons I have stayed at, but the beds were comfortable. I also had a view of Sydney Harbour which was spectacular. Things I didn't quite like Decor - Overall, the hotel is rather old, and probably in need of renovation, although I didn't mind this for a short trip Amenities - The amenities were overall fine, although I had to call up for bedroom slippers and complimentary water. The ice buckets were also not cleared before the last guest left, and was full of water. These little things should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: D2heaven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Sydney CBD area and near the Circular Quay. Convenient location to go and visit the Opera house, royal botanic gardens and the old rock. It is a large hotel with more than 400 rooms which is not ordinary for this brand. On arrival, we were greeted by doorman and escorted to front desk area. There was a long queue and we had to wait for a long time to be served. I think they had number of tour groups checking in at that time. They should have arranged seperate check-in area or desk. It is really disappointing that they make independant travellers waiting, who must be paying more than $500 per night. Check-in agents seemed more interesting in upselling or persusading guests to pay more for upgraded room type rather than deeply apologizing and thanking for patience. We stayed in a harbour view room. Absolutely amazing view from the room, different experience from Park Hyatt Sydney. We do recommend you to request higher floor well in advance. This is really worth it. Room size is very small compared to any other Four Seasons hotel or 5 star hotels in Sydney such as Westin, Park Hyatt and InterContinental Sydney. I liked the layout of room furnitures but bathrooms really needs some refresh. Overall, we were happy with the room until we found couple of cochroaches in the bathtub. My partner almost screamed. I called the guest service to report this matter and a guy came to our room after 15 minutes smiling which we think he did not understand how serious this was. We requested an another room to move and front desk agent told us that the only available was opera view room which is downgraded room type. We did not accept it and they offered harbour view suite with upgrade fee of only $100 per night. We wanted to talk to the manager on duty but again we had to wait for a long time. I think it was just nightmare on that day as there was still long queue when we came down to front desk to complain about this whole cochroach issue. Not sure if this is normal day for this hotel. Then, Four Seasons as a brand really should consider not to extend the management contract as this is ruining the whole brand and it seems that as a guest you could never expect consistent Four Seasons branded experience. Anyway, we ended up staying in city view suite for one night without any additional cost but we moved to InterContinental Sydney next day which was far better than Four Seasons Sydney in many ways including check-in and out experience, manner and staff attitude of front desk agents. We had pleasant conversation with front desk agent at the InterContinental Sydney who was more interested in our trip and dinner plan... I am sure there are lots of great staffs working at Four Seasons Sydney but the way it operates, it is going to lose Four Seasons Brand orientated guests.

Reviews.Title: “It is now my favorite Four Seasons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globalknowledge
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect! Will be back in October.

Reviews.Title: “I was in Heaven.. :)”
Reviews.Author: silvia0476
Reviews.Content: I loved the fact that I did not have to park my car. They parked it for me when I arrived. It has been the best place I have stayed on any holidays. Will definitely go again..

Reviews.Title: “So Much to Like”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: Overall, save one issue elaborated upon at the bottom of my review, it was really great -- truly five-star and worthy of the Four Seasons reputation for excellence. Here is what I liked based on my three-night stay. --Service was superb. Check-in was welcoming; the person who checked me in even took time to step away from the desk and give me a brief tour of the hotel's lobby. Although there were lines at check-out, they moved quickly, and the desk was fully staffed. Every staff member I encountered on an elevator, in the lobby, etc. stopped to say hello and engaged me in conversation (but not too much conversation) about my visit to Sydney. Detail-orientation was impressive -- for example, I started a bag of laundry in my room using one of the Four Seasons bags (which are fabric, nice touch) and at turndown service a note had been placed on my bag saying that it was assumed it was personal laundry, but that if it was dry cleaning that should be picked up, I could fill out the form and call them. A city map was in the room materials, as was a map with suggested running routes. At every turn and in every interaction, it was the legendary Four Seasons service that you'd hope for, delivered in an intuitive and under-stated way. --The hotel is elegant. It FEELS like a five-star property, which is in contrast to some other properties that offer five-star amenities but look like IKEA. Wood panels line the guest room hallways. Furniture in the room is sleek but substantial and of very high quality. Bathroom had luxury surfaces. Design is understated and a spot-on mix of classic and contemporary. The bed is fabulously comfortable. --The hotel was QUIET -- while there were a fair number of people in the lobby, it was large enough to never feel crazy; just the right about of buzz. The walls must be very thick, because while other guests were on my floor, once I got in my room I never heard a peep. Very serene. --Gym was great. Spacious, well-lit (including windows to the outside), stocked with a great range of cardiovascular equipment, pulley machines, and free weights. Access is 24-hours, even though it's housed in the spa, which closes. --The hotel's location is wonderful, right off of George St. It gives you great access to the CBD, and you are about a block from Circular Quay. The Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and Rocks neighborhood are all within walking distance; if you want to go elsewhere, Circular Quay is a transportation hub for ferries, trains, and buses. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. A couple of minor complaints: first, the shower drove me a little crazy because every time I took a shower enough water spilled out from under the shower stall door to soak the bathmat and require that I use a bath towel as well to mop up the remaining water (and this was with me conscious of the problem and deliberately aiming the shower head away from the door). Now, the good news is that those towels were replaced at turndown service. However, a plastic piece or something needs to be added to the shower to keep the water in. They have to know about the problem since the housekeeping staff would pick up sopping wet bathmats every day. Second (and VERY minor): while the bath products that were provided smelled great and were of great quality (L'Occitane), I thought it unusual that a five-star place didn't provide mouthwash. I felt the same way about slippers (there were robes, but no slippers) and complimentary bottles of water at turndown. Other five star places provide those; this one didn't. Small in the scheme of things. So why four instead of five on my rating? One issue -- the internet. In-room internet access was $25 PER DAY. I find that criminally expensive -- I mean, what a rip-off, especially considering the already high room-rate. The fact of the matter is it that, for a business traveler such as myself who depends on in-room internet access, that makes this hotel non-competitive. Why? Other five-star properties in Sydney offer internet service that is included in the room rate or granted with compliments thanks to my position in the hotel chain's loyalty program (Four Seasons has no such program). Adding $75 (for 3 days of internet on a 3-night stay) to the cost of your already very expensive stay is hard to justify, particularly for an amenity that so many hotels, from budget through luxury, are offering for free. Furthermore -- and this is what really got me -- after paying that exorbitant amount for access, you get high-speed LITE internet (a fast connection costs even MORE)! This "lite" service was functional for e-mail, but nothing else, including downloading small word-processing documents for business purposes. I'm sorry, but if I'm going to be forced to pay that much for internet access, then have it be a fast, reliable connection. So, sad to say, despite delivering so much excellence, I probably won't return to this property, at least on any visit where internet access will be required.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent experience staying at the Four Seasons Hotel in Sydney and will always stay there in the future.”
Reviews.Author: AJMcN
Reviews.Content: The staff and service at the hotel were outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone we dealt with was friendly, helpful and seemed to be genuinely interested in our welfare. Also, the food at the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and amazing views”
Reviews.Author: EmilyQuintin
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night at the Four Seasons and dinner at nearby Quay in November 2010. It was everything you'd expect from a five-star hotel - huge bed, plush robes, gorgeous toiletries and a view to die for - it just lacked the personality you'd get from a smaller boutique hotel. The wi-fi wasn't free - which surprises me in this day and age - should you not expect it from a hotel when you're paying top dollar? We didn't spend a lot of time in the room - we enjoyed everything the Sydney Harbour foreshore had to offer - drinks, dinner, walks along the promenade. It's a good place to stay in terms of location - if you're close to Circular Quay you can get anywhere you like on buses, trains, ferries and even water taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, middle CBD”
Reviews.Author: laurahoc
Reviews.Content: On arrival the $200 deposit for one night on a pre-paid room was a bit too much. The room was amazing with a great view of the harbour, most comfortable bed and pillows. The bathroom was spacious and a degree knob for the shower was a plus. I would highly recognize this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, efficient staff, fantastic location, good gym”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_flyer_Asia
Reviews.Content: Efficient staff: Overnight flight getting me tho the hotel for 9:30. Meeting at noon. Needed to check in early and they delivered. Great service. Equally accommodating with the late check out. Room: Modern, great ammenities, nice view. Only downside the expensive internet - unacceptable these days. Gym: Free weights, machines and treadmills. Enough in their for a heavy workout or a good cardio session. I'll definitely be back at the Four Seasons Sydney. Perfect for business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn67
Reviews.Content: Good family room packages. Beds very comfy and service exceptional. Special treats for the kids. Excellent location, just across the road from Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a fabulous setting”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireAdventurer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and loved every minute of it.The views of the harbour were terrific and the Opera House view was truly memorable.The facilities of the hotel were first class and the situation couldn't be bettered in our opinion.We could walk to the restaurants and shops easily and catch a ferry without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “honest review of our stay”
Reviews.Author: mkw35
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the only disappointment.... $25 per day for internet access is extortionate, when even the smallest country guest houses and hotels can offer this service for free. The good side was that the bed was the most comfortable we've ever slept in, the bed linen was luxurious, and the room itself was immaculately clean. View of the Opera House was superb and the hotel is situated close to all amenities in the Rocks, the city and circular quay. Car parking expensive at the hotel, but cheap at the car park behind the hotel on Harrington St, at $15 per day at the weekend, a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A tired property, but functional”
Reviews.Author: voyageur Ã  paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel have a very odd buzz about it, wanting to convey a hip city buzz but failing to hit the mark. The lobby is ordinary, although it looks like it was recently redone, with a bar off the back. Staff are generally friendly, but really don't go the extra step to personalize the service. The room was functional - the bed comfortable, the bathroom adequate. In room entertainment is average - mostly Australian channels on the television, and of those, the dominant theme was sport. The most shocking aspect of this place are the prices charged for food and drink. Admittedly, one does not stay at a Four Seasons property to save money, but the prices here were eye popping. Chicken Caesar Salad, chips, and a beer: A$ 55 ! Coffee only in the breakfast room A$ 6 - The irksome aspect of this coffee experience is that I sat with a colleague who was finishing his b'fast and the server asked me if I wanted a coffee, which was served from the jug that was already on the table. Being charged was annoying, but in line with the overall mediocrity of the hotel. Location-wise the hotel is well situated between the Rocks and the CBD - the Opera House is a 5 minute walk, and a stroll to the shopping areas and Darling Harbour takes 20 minutes. All in all I wasn't too bothered by the whole experience, but were I travelling on my own for pleasure, I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “we did love it and would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: jeana53
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we have ever been to. We went here for our honeymoon, and we got upgraded free. I loved the toiletries in the room, and when we asked the duty manager if we could buy some, she said that they did not sell them, but arranged for 2 bags of them to be delivered to our room for taking away. The breakfast was cooked specially to order, and we have no complaints at all about the hotel. Must surely be a 5* plus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ZoomJet
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Circular Quay. Hotel was close to shops and A++ restaurants. You could walk to the Ferries and basically go anywhere. Hotel itself was excellent! Staff was friendly and what I expect from any Four Seasons in the world. Breakfast buffet had everything you can imagine I was full all day because I could not stop eating the smoked salmon, biscuits , fresh desserts and fruits etc. The rooms are a bit smaller than what I'm useto staying but the bed was fantastic! Only downfall was WIFI was not free...expensive hotels should not charge for WIFI anymore!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: ruby255068
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel is very luxurious. The staff make you feel very welcome, the rooms are of very high standards and the bed is extremely comfortable. We had a room with a veiw of the Opera House and it was magnificent. Because its a 5 star hotel you pay 5 star price on food and drink at the hotel so we ate out all the time and we had a wide range of places to choose from which was great. The hotel is very central to everything. You can take a 10 min stroll along the harbour at Circular Quay and go to the Opera House or take a ferry to Manley. There is transport eg. buses, taxi & trains right across the road from the hotel to take you to Bondi Beach and other great sites. We walked a lot of the time as everything was in walking distance eg. shops, restaurants & bars. The mono rail was great, we got a day pass that lets you get on and off all day and it takes you to all the great sites in the city. If you have a car it will coast $55 per day to park at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would choose to stay here again without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: kylie087
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be welcomed with a room upgrade with a beautiful view of the harbour and the opera house. The room was clean and the staff at the desk just lovely. The best part however, was the bed. It is the most comfortable we have stayed in and we are now looking to buy one!! Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. 5 star experience all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JayB37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our tour of Australia. It is 5 min walk from Central Quay and the rail station, where you can view both Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Hotel staff are friendly and rooms are very large with the biggest bed I have ever seen, it must have been 7ft. There are tea/coffe making facilities. The bathroom is very luxurious. We booked an Opera View room, it was amazing - I could not get over the view - seeing the ferries coming in and out, watching both sunrise over the harbour and the lights at night on the Opera House. This was what I'd always wanted to see and I was NOT disappointed!!! We had booked room only, but were told at reception that breakfast was included. I double-checked this but they were adament. Breakfast was a grand affair with so many choices and very attantive staff. However, when we checked out we were charged for our breakfasts BUT when the receptionist who booked us in was called, the charge was waivered due to a mistake on the Hotel's part. I am very glad we atayed here instead of at Darling Harbour, it is much quieter. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby and it is fantastic just to soak up the atmosphere on an evening, walking to the Opera House, eating outside and gazing at the perfect view over the Harbour. This Hotel is all you expect from a 5*. I would recommend the Hop-on Hop-off Bus, which can be got fron Circular Quay. This takes in all the main sights of Sydney and if time is a limited, is a good way of getting an overview. The only (slight) downside was the conferences/meetings in the Hotel lobby each day, which meant a lot of people milling around. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ozgypsy
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest of this hotel as it is on the company prefered list. I like it because: - it's only a few minutes walk from Circular Quay: the service is excellent: the rooms are small but very comfortable and they have nice doormen who swing the big glass doors open every time you enter or exit. A couple of negatives: - the last two times I've stayed, the King bed had started sagging in the middle; they have a nice cafe/restaurant that doesn't seem to open of an evening during the week - only the upmarket Kable's is open; once I wanted to use their Business Centre to run off a few pages of printing and they wanted to charge 55c per sheet. Despite the negatives it is still my first choice for business accommodation in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “location sucks !”
Reviews.Author: rajeshtrips
Reviews.Content: nice hotel but location was sad very far from the Harbour in terms of walking ( cabs are way to expensive in sydney)

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: happygolucky090
Reviews.Content: This was the first 5 star hotel I have every visited. It was everything I expected in terms of service. The rooms were rather small, but I did have a nice view of the opera house. The staff was friendly and almost overly accomadating. The room was modern with all expected amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Metro Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: molenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons, Sydney for a leg of our Honeymoon because we wanted to spend some time between beaches in one of the world's great cities. Our experience was first class and was exactly what we were hoping for. Our Opera House View room was cozy and magnificent with luxury finishes throughout. There was a bottle of chilled champagne waiting for us in front of the corner window when we arrived. The staff were friendly and eager to assist with anything we required. The hotel's location - a block away from Circular Quay - couldn't have been more perfect for a couple of people looking to explore the city. It's the public transportation hub of Sydney will get you wherever you need to go via land or sea. It was easy to walk through the Rocks district and take advantage of the shops and restaurants therein. We did the Harbour Bridge Climb, surfed Bondi beach, visited Taronga zoo, went jogging through the Royal Botanic Garden, and dined nightly at the fabulous restaurants around the Opera House without ever having to hire a cab. In all that activity, we didn't have time to take advantage of the spa and it was too cold to use the pool (though several Aussies were down there pulling laps in the afternoon.) Americans/coffee addicts may be relieved to see the Starbucks across the street. The area around the hotel explodes on weeknight evenings as the happy-hour crowd celebrates. The Guylian chocolatier/pastry shops around the corner and near the Opera House may ruin someone's diet, but you won't regret the event. The only drawback was the fee for high-speed wireless internet access. If you - like us - consider the service as essential to a room as running water, anticipate an extra $15/day (AU) for each device.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run and presented hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie19770
Reviews.Content: Very well run and presented hotel. All staff members we dealt with were very happy, friendly people. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and definitely indulgent!”
Reviews.Author: dpsych
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a relaxing break - this is it. Makes for a great getaway and you have the magic of The Rocks literally just outside your window! The spa service is terrific. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 1873KB
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Intercontinental and Hilton in Sydney whilst on business, I'm more than happy to say that the Four Seasons is better than them both. Great location on Circular Quay (close to the train station and ferries for those wanting to travel farther afield), they definitely have very comfortable king-size beds and a great buffet breakfast. Breakfast is fairly expensive at AUD$42 for the full buffet, but this seems to be about the going rate for business hotels in Sydney. The buffet spread is significantly better than the intercontinental with a great choice of hot and cold options. I must also say that it's pretty hard to beat the toiletries at the Four Seasons - L'Occitane is definitely a great choice. I don't think you can beat the staff at the Four Seasons for customer service. Definitely no complaints from me!

Reviews.Title: “I had a overnight stay and wished I could have stayed all week....”
Reviews.Author: JAItaliano
Reviews.Content: I had a great corner view of Sydney Harbor from my room which made my stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Always a favorite in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PJ1975
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost every 5 star hotel in Sydney , and I continue to call this hotel one of my favorite along with Sheraton on Park, Check in always professional, room service and restaurant consistently good. As a business traveller on my own I appreciate a big TV, good bathroom amenities, great view, great food and great location. I am there again tomorrow night and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, comfortable and efficient”
Reviews.Author: RBC13
Reviews.Content: The whole hotel operates as though effortlessly but everything from check-in to executive assistance or the dining areas was done well. The fitness center is nicely appointed and has an open airy feeling - not a dungeon like some. And the location adjacent to the Quay is very appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Million Dollar View for last-minute money”
Reviews.Author: Douchebag00
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to a lastminute.com.au booking and was so glad I unleashed the credit card to make the most of a rare travelling opportunity that I found myself with. I booked a Harbour View Deluxe room for 2 nights and was blown away by my 30th floor window seat overlooking the Harbour Bridge, The Rocks, Circular Quay and the Opera House. The room was excellent, with everything I could have wanted. And the best touch was a very comfortable swivelling lounge chair perched right in front of the big window. The perfect spot to enjoy a glass of Little Creatures and Shiraz! In addition to the fine room, you are of course located very conveniently in centre of the action. A 3 minute easy stroll to Circular Quay for the ferries and train. The Rocks is the same distance. All the touristy stuff is close by if that floats your boat. You have it all at your doorstep. I do not stay in higher end hotels very often but this was certainly a real treat. I would hope that I get to the chance return in the future and live it up again.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: TennysonTrace
Reviews.Content: I guess I was hoping for more... I have just returned from a trip overseas where the accommodation was exceptionally good. Anyway this was just an overnight stay. The positives are - great location, friendly enough staff, a little longer than needed to be at front desk but not excessive, and free valet parking. We were upgraded on arrival to a harbour v iew room - but the rooms are quite small and cramped. I am not sure if it was us but the heating level of the room was very stuffy and we tried to fix it but was unable to get a result and being so tired just fell to sleep. The beds were really soft and my husband ended up having to go a chiropractor the next day. Never really had that type of issue before. The breakfast was ok - nothing special really. I did indulge in a spa/facial at the facility there and that was very good. Lots of attention to detail, very private and a great atmosphere. Would I go back?..... not sure - before i spend that money again i would probably try another hotel in a simialr location - they have quite a bit of competition down that end!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Pakk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed a night at the Four Seasons last week. Firstly, I can understand other reviewers when they are disappointed with the standards of the hotel. This was my first stay at a Four Seasons, and although it was good, I wasn't amazed, which I was hoping for, considering the reputation that the Four Seasons chain generally have. However, I paid $245 a night, and for that price, I found it really good. The room is quite small, but with good amenities. We had a large flat-screen tv with a good selection of channels. The bed was very, very, nice and everything else that you might expect such as a minibar, bath-tub, massage-shower, WIFI (at a ridiculous price), bathrobes (but no slippers) etc. was provided. The city-view we hoped for was mostly over a road and a distant North Sydney unfortunately, and we were on a relatively high floor, the 17th. One of my biggest disappointments was the swimming pool. At first glance, it looks alright, but the pool deck is at a closer look quite worn and old, and I've experienced better pool areas in many hotels that aren't ranked as 5-star. Additionally, there were dead bugs, and hair, floating around in both the pool and the jacuzzi, which of course wasn't very nice. But there aren't just negatives. The service from staff at front desk was very good. We requested a late check-out and got a 2 pm check out straight away when asking, we also got champagne-glasses and a bucket of ice within five minutes of requesting it. The service in the bar was also very good, a small delay for our drinks resulted in a complimentary glass of champagne, and you additionally get complimentary truffle popcorn and toasted nuts with your drinks. Very nice touch. The location of the hotel is also fantastic, and you are meters away from Circular Quay, the Rocks and so on. We also had a quick look at the gym, and it looked good with individual tv-screens, cold towels, and four different complimentary drinks. So all in all, this might partially sound like a very negative review, but in general the Four Seasons Sydney is really good. It's not spectacular however, and for $245 a night, that's fine, but as I mentioned earlier, I can understand the frustration from people paying more than that. I'd say it is a strong four, and with a nicer pool area, and small touches like free WIFI this would be five star.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to return”
Reviews.Author: coralkiwi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney several times now on business, never more than 1 or 2 nights at a time unfortunately, since each time has been a pleasure. Location is terrific, near Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge, and rooms are large and luxurious. Front desk staff in my experience are friendly and pleasant to deal with. My only gripe would be the dinner restaurant, which I have found extremely expensive and with limited options. I prefer to venture out and find somewhere else to eat, which is fine because there are many great restaurants just along the road toward the Rocks. I would probably not fork out to stay here if I was paying for it myself, but if I did choose a 5 star hotel in the central city this is as good an option as any I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel great views”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller121
Reviews.Content: if you get a room on the corner or the side of the hotel, you will have a superb view of the opera house an harbour bridge, its amazing. very convenient location , for bars, restaurants, ferries etc , hotel rooms to a high standard. no complains to speak of, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: woozal27
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Not very personal but efficient and good quality. Very small room - Harbour View room on Wotif. $300 a night. Probably would go somewhere else next time for a bit more personality.

Reviews.Title: “If it wasn't for the concierge and staff, we would be completely underwhelmed and dissatisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Maloneypony
Reviews.Content: Yes, the view and location were nice, but my husband and I have become increasingly underwhelmed with the accommodations of the Four Season chain. There doesn't seem to be much "luxury' anymore except for the price of the rooms. If I hadn't known what the room rates where, I could have sworn we were staying at a Marriott. Definitely not enough 'luxury' value for the money. What was pretty offensive was the charge for WiFi. I mean really? The price of the rooms is up there and then we have to pay for WiFi as well? And if you want to use WiFi in any common area you have to pay again! The bar tender has to go find the manager and give you a piece of paper with a secret, one time usage, password, and charge you. Annoying. They said the charge would be automatically taken off our bill because we paid already in the room, but that's wasn't the case. They will take it off your bill...IF you request that at check out. Double annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away, Delicious & Regenerating”
Reviews.Author: Familytour4
Reviews.Content: Checking in was faultless, the corner Junior Suite was sooo comfortable with views to drool over! The staff were all courteous and professional. Trying a getaway in your own city is difficult, and Four Seasons made it easy to enjoy one's own environment. Cables Restaurant with thier new menu was delicious, our waiter was informative and helped us choose a great array of dishes. Then, the all important bed test, it passed easily and sleep crept up on one! Breakfast was a variety suitable for all tastes from pure health to glutonous. Afterwards, time to be a tourist, and where better than Sydney. The Four Seasons is perfectlty placed in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bed!”
Reviews.Author: Tracypeach
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the very centrally located Four Seasons! It was our first stay in a Four Seasons and we're so glad we did! The highlights of our stay were 1. our room being ready at 8:30 am when we arrived and 2. the BED! We had a peek-a-boo view of the bridge and were on a quiet corner. Our view was GREAT!. The bed was a pillow-top, king and we melted into it the first day, which was perfect since we had been up for about 50 hours before "passing out" around 7:00 pm. The wake-up calls were on point and the service excellent. Bathroom: great shower (water pressure and temp); could have used more light; we're Americans so the toliet flusher and plugs were different for us but we worked with it just fine. The front desk even provided us a "transfomer" box to use during our stay. We had a laptop with a 3rd (ground) pin on the plug. When I couldn't figure out the adaptors, they sent someone from housekeeping to help me and delivered the transformer that worked perfectly. Conceige was great, very personable and they used iPads to show us different things we asked about. They booked my Bridge Climb for me and provided us clear and easy directions to get to everything we needed to access.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant accommodations with friendly staff and fantastic service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelinkelly
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. Our room was nice size, clean and comfortable. The exercise facilities were outstanding compared to other places we've stayed. I did not use the swimming pool here but it seemed to be located in an awkward area of the hotel with a busy street along side of it

Reviews.Title: “Very plush, very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: paulhb
Reviews.Content: Nothing lacking here. Rooms are very comfortable - great facilities, great service. Food and drink are very expensive, but I guess that's a function of where you are. Close walk to Circular Quay and The Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but there are many to choose from....”
Reviews.Author: smjpfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. Rooms were not very large and unfortunately ended up with a view of the freeway. However, it was very well appointed and clean. The hotel was good overall, but there are many great options in Sydney. It is not on a par with the other Four Season hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Hotelman1976
Reviews.Content: Great location, great views (pay extra), wonderful bed....but a little expensive due to GBP exchange rate versus AUD. Our 2nd visit.

Reviews.Title: “The top hotel in a world class city.”
Reviews.Author: danielyyz
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Sydney sets the standard for style, class, and elegance in Sydney. I stayed there on two separate stays during my Australian trip and both stays were perfection. If possible, arrange to have access to the Executive Club high atop the hotel with stunning views, an absolutely outstanding staff, and excellent food and beverage plus internet access. It is well worth the reasonable cost involved. In the hotel, The Bar (lobby bar) is a hot spot and not to be missed is Kable's, the star quality in-house restaurant. One of the best meals of my travel career was in Kable's. I have stayed at many Four Seasons and other five star hotels and this clearly is one of my top favorites. Daniel

Reviews.Title: “Great view & Location”
Reviews.Author: KevinLisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the start of our Australian adventure. This hotel is perfectly located near the Rocks, Opera House and Botanical Gardens- everything is in walking distance. The rooms were clean, the view was excellent, the staff was very friendly and the breakfast buffet was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Check out other hotels before you go”
Reviews.Author: BHeldman
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Four Seasons lays claim to one of the finest locations on the bay. The hotel is only minutes from the Circular Quay with its access to the ferries to outlying spots such as the (wonderful) Taronga zoo, as well as just a few minutes of a walk to the beautiful, picturesque Royal Botanic Gardens, and another quick step to shopping along the section of town called The Rocks. Staying at the Four Seasons Sydney, you are just a hop, skip and a jump from the Opera House as well. All of these things you definitely should go see when you're in Sydney. But you should stay elsewhere. I'd recommend Googling hotels near the Four Seasons and checking their rates against this hotel. I think you'll find that you can stay more cheaply, as elegantly, and be just as close to the amenities as this hotel is. Here's the problem: If you think Sydney is expensive (it is - current exchange rates are $0.75 American to $1 Aussie) you're going to REALLY think the Four Seasons at Sydney is pricey. And, there's very little bang for the buck. Let me see if I can tell you about some of my gripes: * The maid never could get it right in our room. We'd put our stuff out in the order we wanted, she'd take and stack it all up on the shelves, rearranging everything. * I was locked out of my room one time because the maid was in there servicing it. * The bathroom scale had a dead battery. I ordered a new one, it had a low battery. * We needed to make a phone call back to our credit card merchant because we accidentally locked the card trying to purchase a ferry ticket. A 1-800 number would have cost--now get this: $9.00 for the first minute, $4.00 for every minute thereafter! We emailed the card merchant instead and the problem was rectified within 24 hours. * Average room service meal was $35, average drink at the bar $17. (For comparison: A pint of beer at Jackson's on George across the street is $9.00). * Internet WiFi service: $25.00/24 hours. Really? C'mon. There are ways to make money, but shellacking folks on WiFi is truly a ridiculous way to do it. (Jackson's across the street has free WiFi, BTW). There shouldn't be anyone charging for WiFi these days. That's a royal rip-off. * The bedspread was a coverlet that was really hot. There was no alternative: Either you slept hot or threw the coverlet off and froze. While the bed was comfortable, there were few sleeping options. * The spa was outrageously priced! A couple's half-day stay was $900. The cheapest spa treatment I saw was $300. Just absolutely ridiculously priced. * The fitness center was just OK. It had an elliptical and a couple of treadmills. There were a few weight machines. Nothing fancy: You could find the same thing at any adjacent hotel. * The pool was outdoors and would be really cold when we were there (May in Australia is late fall, early winter). OK, it's really great that smiling courteous Aussies hold the door open for you, but t the end of it, it's just not worth the kind of money the hotel charges for absolutely everything. And, our hotel suite, with corporate rates was $300/night. You can do better by at least $100/night (and get free WiFi) as long as you're willing to walk an extra block or two to get to the Quay. Sydney Central Business District (CBD) is laid out very well, with easy walking, plenty of restaurants, ATMs, and other amenities all throughout. You could stay up in Hyde Park, a distance of a few blocks, much cheaper, and be equally as happy with your proximity to the Quay. For all of the hype about serious customer service, the hotel just doesn't get my vote for hitting it out of the park. The only thing serious about the Four Seasons Sydney was its serious prices.

Reviews.Title: “The most unimpressive Four Seasons I've visited”
Reviews.Author: Nicholsfamilytravel
Reviews.Content: I come to Sydney, travel globally and stay at Four Seasons regularly. I figured I would try this property this time (I usually stay at Park Hyatt or Shangri-La), and I'm motivated to write a review about it given the experience. The checkin process was stressful - unpleasant young woman who was the most unaccommodating and anti-service I've encountered at a hotel. Surprising for Four Seasons! Got to my room, which at $400 or more a night, is around 400 square feet - too small to even set up my baggage rack for my suit case. The bathrooms are nicer in Marriott Courtyard...seriously. Slow elevators, 70s infrastructure -- needs a serious overhaul. Breakfast was included and was good, with very good waitress service. $50 for Internet access for 2 days is just icing on the cake of what has been an unpleasant experience. Really unfortunate as I was looking forward to making this my regular hotel like it is in Palo Alto, New York, San Jose and other places. It will not be the case here.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: EndlessParties
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here after going out for my birthday. The location was superb, the service was excellent (we got upgraded to a massive room, might have been a small suite!). The bed was huge and soft, there was a bath and large shower, all in lovely condition, and the l'occitane toiletries made us feel pretty spoilt too! I would really recommend this hotel - it's a little pricey but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Almost makes 5*”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 6:30 AM after 22 hours from NY. The front staff was exemplary and i must bring Rebecca to the attention of the hotel as she went above and beyond for us. Our room was an upgrade with a view of the harbor but it was still on the small side. The next day she put us in a larger room with even a better view! The staff at this hotel, Sarah at Breakfast, Rebecca at the front desk and the amazing Oscar the Concierge, just to name a few...are what makes this hotel reach almost the quality of a 5 star hotel. If the romms received just a tweak to certain details, and we did stay in two types of rooms, this would be 5* luxe without doubt. Don't get me wrong, the rooms are lovely and clean and full of amenities, but...the bathrooms could be bigger and there is a bit of wear and tear on the walls and corners of the small room. They could use a bit of polish. The bedrooms are lovely. The bed is possibly one of the most comfortable I've ever experienced at a chain hotel and of course you have your flat-screen TV and contemporary upscale hotel furniture. Nothing breathtaking about the rooms..but still, very attractive contemporary style decor. The Gym is tops as is the staff. I was happy to see a 'real gym'with a large assortment of cardio and lifting options. The Beeakfast is in the 'top three of the best'... we've ever had at a Hotel...along with the staff. Request a larger room from the start and you probably won't even notice the little details that I noticed as a frequent traveller. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “I was left extremely disappointed, shocked and furious”
Reviews.Author: Kab00m
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular visitor at the Four Seasons, and I've been a guest at the hotel few times before, but I was amazed, shocked in utter belief the 3rd time. For me, it was simply unimaginable. I always thought the four seasons was the finest hotel in Sydney. Not just from the leisure aspect but also from how it's run, the business side of it It's not like you just walked in the hotel and you're looking to book a room from the get-go. In that case, I could care less if the rates were up due to the hotel being full. But it's a lot different when you tried to book for a room, and you're being informed that the room will be booked and has been booked on two occasions (for a standard room, $295 for one night). And when I double checked again for the second time, it was reduced to $225 for one night, while the room was booked as it was confirmed on the phone. One standard room with harbour view for $225 for one night. And we took it to granted like you would expect. On the same day of the supposedly, booking confirmation on the phone, my girlfriend and I went to the hotel expecting the room to be reserved. To our amazement, not only did we find out the room wasn't booked. but the rate had gone up. Had the room been booked in advance like it was suppose to, we would have paid $295 instead of $325 (when the rate went up on that day). If the room wasn't booked like it's shown on the computer, then there's no proof that we booked. But, there's no denying the truth, we were told it was booked. So, decision was made, pay the extra cash and deal with it later, and that's what we did. No need to be confrontational around people. Play it smart. The real issue isn't really about the extra $30 dollars, it's about respect. Clearly, in the hands of other people's Incompetence, it makes our life frustratingly more difficult. This is something that shouldn't occur at a 5 star hotel like the four seasons. I felt insulted , perhaps even cheated. Was it a case of a poorly managed fiasco or was it more sinister, perhaps a delibarate tactic, a trap; Claiming, 'there must have been a mistake, we had no idea what happened'. so they charge us more, 'oh the rates have gone up today'. If this major problem like any other major problem, isn't acknowledged accordingly, then how can it be fixed or improve. I just don't want anybody else to go through what I went through.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the magic you expect from a Four Season Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Hotelfan2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Four Seasons Hotel all around the world because it always is the best. This is the first time I have been disapointed. When you arrrive at a Four Seasons you expect the best there is. You expect the little extra and the world famous friendly and warm service.Â  We arrived after a very long journey and though our driver was very nice the welcome at the hotel was not.Â  The receptionist was cold and at best 'corporate polite' and no refreshments were offered to us.Â  We just got the key and no one escorted us to our room. No effort was made to make us feel welcome. I could go on but my point is... This is not a Hilton, Sheraton or Mariott. This is the Four Seasons. Everybody can build grand lobbies and have designer furniture. But not everyone manage you to feel as welcome and special as The Four Seasons usually do. That's the magic. The personal touch and genuin wish to make your stay the best experience possible. This is why I love your hotels. And that's why I get so disappointed when that does not happen. I hope I will never experience it again. You have some of the best hotels in the world and the one in Sydney should also be one of them...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING- will deffinately return.”
Reviews.Author: nancycandy08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights when travelling to Sydney to do the brige climb. From the moment my taxi dropped me off all the service was amazing! i can not compliment the staff enough-they were incredibly helpful, with alot of them remember who i was by the end of my first day. The room was amazing, had a fantastic view of the harbour. The bed was the BEST bed i have ever slept on. I didn't venture to the local cafes for dinner instead having room service the 2 nights and i was not dissapointed! Great local, great service, great room-could not ask for more! will be returning as soon as i can

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: VlacieNebbermorth
Reviews.Content: faultless location but hotel starting to look a little tired and rooms are a bit on the small side, but apart from that, everything you would expect of the chain and not really any complaints from us. as others have said, there are other hotels hereabouts and if/when we return i think we might try another, but would happily come back here if there wasn't anything else on offer.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: pamshusband_11
Reviews.Content: Mind you, we're very loyal four seasons customers having stayed at over 30 different locations throughout the world. The Sydney hotel ranks in the bottom 3. Everyone can agree that the location is great but the same can be said for a number of other hotels. On the whole, the personnel are pleasant and friendly and the linens are typical. Thats the good news. The problems with this hotel primarily concern the physical facilities, especially the rooms, and on the whole, poor management--the hotel is making too much money selling an inferior product to make changes. As to the rooms, we had the premier room--the one in the picture with the beautiful view. I t was good size but the furniture was a "mish-mash" of styles that must have been taken from other rooms over the years. The furniture was old. The hvac didn't work well and they couldn't make it work to my satisfaction. The bathroom was small. poorly lit and the shower cubicle was so small that there was no place to put my razor. And this id the better room. We were also shown an executive suite which, frankly, was an embarrassment. Considering that the normal rooms are 1/2 the size of ours, I don't know how anyone could be satisfied if the stay is more than a day. why spend this kind of money for an inferior product. Tried to eat in the bar on 2 nights and it was a fiasco. We waited 15 minutes for them to split a hamburger and then left in frustration. The breakfast is uninspiring to say the least. Much of the problems with the physical facility is that this was a Regent hoterl and not built to Four Seasons standards. Now here is what really gripes me. On checkout, I not only filled out the customer satisfaction form and e-mailed my comments. There was no reply just like their is never a management response to any of the critical reviews on this site. I attribute this to poor management. We were planning to return to this hotel and the end of our trip but stopped in to look at the Observatory Hotel and we changed our plans. It was far superior, larger more beautiful rooms and $200 cheaper. The entire attitude of the staff was wonderful. In conclusion, if you've had great stays at other Four Seasons, you will be very disappointed staying here--we were.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney for young families”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Family
