Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 and a half year old girl. Upon check-in, our daughter was presented with a soft toy kangaroo. Throughout our stay, the staff always showed a lot of interest in our little one, which we greatly appreciated. Our room was stocked with toddler amenities, and the restaurant (Kable's) had children's menu and colouring in books. Four Seasons is the most child-friendly hotel we have ever been to and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: spain0809
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our visit, stayed 3 nights which entitled us to free breakfasts. Breakfast buffet was not exceptional and the queue for seating was long at times. Dining in room overlooking the Harbour/Opera House was really special, enhanced by their excellent in-room dining service. Service in the bar area was patchy as was the door concierge service on our arrival from the airport. The accomodation was first class and the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: 3RedDoxies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Sydney for our 40th birthdays and stayed at the Four Seasons. It's a very nice hotel, with great views of the Opera House. It's also very close to the trains and ferries, and the area called the Rocks. Location can't be beat. Bed was comfortable and room was nicely decorated, if a little small. Not quite as small as a European hotel room, but smaller than an American one. Closet space was minimal. Loved the L'Occitane bath products! :) Wifi is NOT included and if I recall correctly was $25 or $30/day - which is overpriced and felt like a rip-off. We did not have breakfast as it's not included and is quite expensive. For our birthdays I pre-ordered a piece of cake to be delivered to the room. I thought for the $30 I paid it might be a nice size (at least enough for 2!) and it was a small single-serving piece. Fortunately they removed this charge at check-out, perhaps because I mentioned our 40th birthdays. But if you do want cake - there are several cafes with great desserts for a lot less money just a short walk away. Do yourself a favor and don't pre-order any amenities like that. We were on a higher floor (I think the 15th?) and could still hear traffic from the street, so it's not very noise-proof. Hair dryer did not work upon arrival and had to exchange it for one that did, and reading light above bed kept shutting off - problem was never resolved even after calls to maintenance. Concierge was helpful with maps, restaurant recommendations, and umbrellas. This hotel seemed mainly like it attracts a business travel crowd, and seemed to cater more to that than vacationers. Overall price of this hotel is inexpensive for a Four Seasons, but it's not up to the level of other Four Seasons. You'll get a nice hotel, but I don't feel you get the luxury you might expect from this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room Service”
Reviews.Author: Ninerd
Reviews.Content: Added Sydney on the back end of a business trip to New Zealand and took my sweetheart along. Great Location by The Rocks and walking distance to Opera House and Harbour as well as ferries. Booked a Harbor View room with direct on view of the Opera House. We paid more than the cost of an Opera View room but the view of the Sydney Bridge and Opera House was completely worth it. Turn down service was excellent every night. The front desk and bell staff were very welcoming. Not so good: Room service overcooked our steak, which we prefer medium rare. It was clearly medium well so we sent it back. Twice. There was little apology and it was not taken off the bill. We filled up on the excellent soup and bread and were too sleepy by the time the steak arrived marginally medium rare to eat it. Overall it took us nearly 2 hours to get our dinner. I stay everywhere in the world as a frequent business traveller and a lesser hotel would have followed up with the guest on this. How does the Four Seasons not cook a steak properly? It rained one night and we went to the valets to request to borrow an umbrella and were treated very dismissively since they were in conversation with each other. Not quite Four Seasons standards. TIP: We used the computers in the business center every day for 15 minutes for free. Overall, the minor annoyances aside, it's a good hotel in an unbeatable location and we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: GAURAV1663
Reviews.Content: Just 100 meter walk from opera house and 5 mins from harbour bridge. This hotel has all comfort facilities which are necessary from Spa to Gym and end the day with a drink in the bar,. Very friendly and co operative staff . Concierge washelpful to get info on transportation and near by hot spot locations. The best pubs IVY and Establishment are just 5-7 mins walk from the hotel for a relaxing weekend night.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: pixie85
Reviews.Content: My twin sister and I have just come off a cruise and wanted to unwind in a good hotel in Sydney. We chose the Four Seasons (because it had a good rate for the quality of the hotel) and were not disappointed. The moment we stepped inside we felt very welcomed. Everything about it was very classy and so clean. The staff were exceptionally helpful. The food tasted 'clean' and fresh. A hotel fit for royals. And I do not praise easily.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons should be ashamed of putting their name to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: theinspectorcalls
Reviews.Content: I felt completely ripped off staying here. If you are used to the Four Seasons style of hotel, donâ€™t expect it here. My advice is stay somewhere else - it really is a dump by Four Seasons normal standards. It just feels old and depressing and the views of the harbor donâ€™t make up for it. Food at concierge level is pretty good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view but.....”
Reviews.Author: mastcfw
Reviews.Content: This is located right in the heart of everything and close to Harbour towne but the rooms are tight and there was dust in some areas and the staff is very slow to respond. The elevator are also very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and breath taking views of the harbour and opera”
Reviews.Author: aih0043
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon in Australia..the hotel is very conveniently poised for tourists and right between the hustke and bustle. We arrived from gold coast at around 3 and our room was not ready to check in!!! I was so so surprised..not only us other guests were also waiting to check in till around 4 pm as well..however, the receptionist offered us some drinks and we waited at the bar. After going in to the room i forgot all of that..the view form the room was breath taking..it was almost as if we did not needed to even go out to see opera and the harbour bridge..it was just there out of our window. Room service is excellent and the housekeeping is also very prompt which is expected of four seasons. Breakfast was very ordinary compared to other five stars..and the choices were very minimal..i would not pay for bed and breakfast if i again stay at this hotel.. But other than that everythng else was very good..the concierge especially went out of their way to make sure we were having a good time in sydney. Would come back again but the management need to improve their breakfast selection

Reviews.Title: “Falls very short of being first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonlazenby
Reviews.Content: Staff were more engaged between themselves then with customers. Room was small but clean, OK for an overnight stay but not for an extended period. I was surprised there was no ability to charge iPhone, with no usb options in the room, hotel's solution was to leave the phone with concierge. Morning breakfast lacked any sophistication - chaotic and very ordinary. Not enough equipment and too many guests kept waiting... my recommendation would be to find a cafe outside of the hotel. I wont be staying again here... trading on a reputation that falls very short...

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: sarahfox
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Sydney Four Seasons traveling as a family with my 8 year old. While I've been to other Four Season's that perhaps are more visually dynamic this hotel most certainly has the Four Seasons Service Standard. After an overnight flight we secured their transportation to seemlesly take us to the hotel. Upon arrival we were met curb site by their front desk who immediately engaged my daughter giving her a plush kangeroo as a welcome gift. While we were too early for traditional check-in time our room was made available to us. From the curb we were escorted directly to our room for a quick check-in - a nice arrival experience. First evening my daughter was surprised once again with a Milk and Cookie plate. Unexpected and very fun. Room service kept us well stocked with towels, and amenities. Concierge were very helpful providing tour information. The location is perfect - litterally across the street from Circular Quay and a block away from the Rocks you have everything at your feet. We found the entire Hotel staff to be prompt, friendly and service oriented. Yes you pay Four Seasons prices but for discerning travelers it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk need get act right.”
Reviews.Author: Humphriesout
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a five nightstay on Feb 18th. Fantastic location. We had flown in from Hong Kong, tired, weary but hey. we were in Sydney. There was a big hold up at check in desk. When we got to it we presented our voucher from the tour company. It clearly stated room only. The girl insisted that breakfast was included. No its no I said, it says there room only. No the girl said. Four nights or more, breakfast is included. \bonus we thought. Read on. The room was out of this world. In our window picture we had the harbour bridge, the opera house and the Queen Elizabeth was berthed right in the middle of our view. The beds were comfortable, the hotel spotless. Breakfast was fine. As we checked out, we are given a bill for breakfast of $438. No you have it wrong, breakfast was included. No its not came the reply. I explained the events of when we checked in and gave the name of the sirl who checked us in. She went to speak to the general manager. The girl said that the girl who checked us in was not at work today but the general manager had said that we should only pay 50% because of the misunderstanding. I asked the girl to go and tell the manager that 50% of nothing is still nothing and that I wasnt going to pay. SHe ripped the bill up and said ok, fine. Please be aware of this issue when you check into this hotel. Apart from that, fantastic. Take a second mortgage out though to eat well and of good class in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: South_AfricanDurban
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, near the ferry terminal and darling harbour is a 15 minute walk, the staff and service are excellent. Really enjoyed my stay there ....

Reviews.Title: “somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lornat22
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney with my daughter to celebrate my 60th birthday. The reservation was made 4 months prior to our stay and we booked a city view room expecting to see tall buildings and city lights, what we got was a 10th floor view of a convenience store in a back street and a close-up of the Cahill Expressway. I asked to be upgraded but was told that the only room available was going to cost an additional $200 per night. The noise from the trains was very annoying as were the reversing beeps of the trucks in the street below which began each day at about 5am. The restaurant meal was very good, but the room service breakfast was overpriced. The best thing about the hotel was the location, being very handy to ferries, the Opera House, the Rocks area and the Bridge, but I would look more closely at other hotels in the area if making a return trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: talitu
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - highly recommend a harbor side room. The view of the Opera House and the bridge was fantastic!! Short walk to the harbor and The Rocks area. Top notch food and service. Rooms were a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: IrisDenmark
Reviews.Content: Except for the less than friendly concierge (one of them, the other was fine) and having to pay 25 AUD per day for internet (which we did not do), this hotel was great. The location was excellent - walk out to the left and in 2 minutes you are on The Rocks, walk straight across the street and you are on the Circular Quay and in 5 minutes at the Opera House. To the right and you are walking through the Central Business District and in 15 minutes you are in Darling Harbour. The view from our room was gorgeous (although do not be duped as we were into "upgrading" to a room with opera and bridge view (seriously, the opera is enough). The gym was excellent and the pool (cleverly situated so that you can feel the vibrancy of the city, but the city can't see you) was as well (great after a hot day walking around Sydney).

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little tired”
Reviews.Author: ribm7727
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for the city. You get awesome views of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House, however if you're on a lower level you also get the noise of the very busy train line near by. The rooms are not quite plush any more, the surfaces are getting scratched, this is definitely out of order for a 5 star hotel. Part of being a 5 star hotel is not just luxury, it's also world class service. In the case of the four seasons Sydney, they are very lacking. Before I arrived a liaised with the concierge to get a bunch of flowers put in the room prior to my arrival for my wife's birthday. This they did, but did not put them in water, so when we got to our room they were dead and looked worse that a bunch you'd buy from a servo. They did fix it, albeit 24 hrs later and this put a real taint on them. Thank goodness they didn't have the audacity to charge me for them! This hotel is slipping down the tripadvisor rankings, it was #4 when I booked last year. If you're going to be spending $300 a night, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view but not much more”
Reviews.Author: mrbompa
Reviews.Content: I have to say the view from my room was one of the best that I have had at any hotel in Sydney before and the location is amazing. The hotel though leaves much to be desired. Personally if I were Four Seasons I would drop this property or have the owners of the hotel dump a ton into renovations. The hotel is dated and sort of run down. The chairs in the restaurant are lumpy or feel like they are falling apar. The rooms have that feeling like the house keeping has banged in to the walls to many times with vacume trying to clean the room quickly. The staff though was wonderful, friendly and helpful. If you were to stay at this hotel under a name other than the Four Seasons name you would most likely be OK with it but the name should elevate this hotel to another level.

Reviews.Title: “The location covers up many sins - not really 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Arctophile28
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL & LOCATION The design seeks to maximise the number of rooms that have a view of the Harbour/Opera House area but the building is ugly and drab looking on the outside. The views from the front rooms are wonderful and to be honest the only reason we stayed for the duration of our visit to Sydney. The location was great - in addition to the superb views it is amongst the historical Rocks area with several restaurants nearby (not just those around Cicular Quay which are more expensive). THE ROOM The rooms are small but then it is a city hotel squeezed into a cramped space. Our room was quite high up but we still heard lots of noise from the street, the trains and the freeway. The sound proofing is poor. The furniture was out of date and well used but functional. Inadequate drawer/hanging space for 2 people who were staying 8 nights. The bathroom was small and much too basic for what was meant to be a 5 star hotel. Small touches were absent - e.g. there was only one box of tissues in the whole place. The bed was large and comfortable. The worst feature was the a/c. We had engineers in the room frequently because it was so cold. (Despite what they say - Sydney is NOT blessed with great weather and it was grey and showery most of the time we were there). In the end we almost always had it switched off which meant the room was airless but at least not freezing. FACILITIES The pool is very small and basic. The loungers are not great and there was no service unless you phoned for it. It was not possible to sit there for long because it is located directly alongside the freeway and hence there is constant loud traffic and the associated smells. Men can reach the pool directly from their changing room but women can't - they need to go through the gym or up or down in the public lift and walk through the hotel. We didn't use the Executive Lounge as the cost was exorbitant and from what we saw and heard the 'extras' provided were not worth it. We did use the Business Centre (in the same place) which is free and the staff were always very helpful though it closes much too early (8PM). EATING The breakfast was acceptable but not 5-star range or quality. Over priced for what you got. Dinner - mixed experience. The 'small plates' evening was excellent. Good food, great service, lovely wine and excellent value. However on the evening we had the normal menu it was a complete let down. The waitress spent almost all of her time chatting at one table ignoring all others. My request to have the caesar salad without croutons resulted in a salad being delivered without croutons or chicken or bacon - in fact just leaves and some dressing! The wait for another attempt at doing this resulted in my partner and I eating our meals separately (there was no offer to re-do or save his hot meal) and this ruined what was meant to be a romantic meal. Also - our glasses of wine were noticeably considerably smaller than the next table who had asked for the same thing ( NO - they did not ask for large glasses). SERVICE Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful though the door staff seemed to select favourites to open the doors for! There was a long delay in our luggage coming up to our room - we would have preferred to just take it up ourselves than kick our heels for 30-40 mins. This is not a 5-star hotel but provided you accept that and the niggles you would have a good stay. All in all, provided the exchange rates improve, because the location and views are so good, (and because we've now learnt some lessons), we would stay here again if we go back to Sydney though we hope that the niggles get sorted (especially since several people have mentioned the same things).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with convenient location, but had expected more..”
Reviews.Author: XploreBuddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights with two rooms during Sydney Mardi Gras 2011. Early c/i (early arrival from overseas) was available for free which was nice. Hotel room (standard room I guess) was comfortable, not very big. Big con was the high temperature in the room when we arrived and a/c system seemed not powerful enough to cool down room, even after maintenance department had checked it. Throughout our stay the temperature in our room was an issue and with no window to open we sometimes felt like there was just no fresh air coming into the room. Our friends in the neighbouring room had the same experience. Would not expect this when staying at a FS hotel. Bathroom very clean (as opposed to the below comment by another traveller I found the room to be spotless clean). No free wifi zone anywhere in hotel (no wifi at all), in-room internet expensive. Housekeeping could have been better: ignoring our DND sign twice, forgetting to restock bathroom amenities twice (eg tissues). Bed a little to soft to my liking. Nice bathroom amenities by l'Occitane en Provence 3 huiles line. Pool nice and sunny. The big pro is the location of the hotel next to Circular Quay. Overall a nice stay and would recommend it to anyone, but must say that for this money I had expected a more exciting stay in terms of unexpected luxuries, touches aso.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: KariH03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2011 and would highly recommended this hotel. The rooms had excellent views, the beds were so wonderful to sleep in and the location is perfect. Everything was within walking distance, great central location.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: antarcticanG
Reviews.Content: location, style and service. all are the best you can dream of. will come again if ever again in the beautifully city.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect from a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: bryan_m11
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel downtown Sydney. The hotel is right near everything, walking distance to all the sights and is near the super cool Rocks area. There are markets there on the weekend. I didn't get to the pool so I can't comment on that. Some of the lower floors don't have such a nice view but others in our group had some really great views.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Huskyrides
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is in an excellent location at the end of Oxford Street, across the street from Circular Quay. To the right of CQ is the Opera House (5mins walk from the hotel) and the Harbor Bridge (3mins) walk. I personally didn't worry about paying the extra for a harbor view room (we faced into Oxford St) as you come down to the lobby and can see the Bridge and Opera House. Room was quite small, but very clean and well decorated. Service was fine. Not brilliant, but not terrible either.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a wonderful hotel! Location, room, service - all good!”
Reviews.Author: BlueGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for 5 days for a wedding and stayed in a City View Premier Room - it was quite a large room and beautifully furnished and equipped and very quiet. The room had a king bed and there was plenty of room for the rollaway bed for our son. There was a separate 2 seater lounge and coffee table, as well as a desk, a swivel office chair and another chair at the desk as well. We loved the room and had no complaints whatsoever - it was serviced twice a day and at the end of the first day, we arrived back at the room to find a lovely cold glass of milk (in a bowl of ice), a sipper straw, biscuit and some treats for our son. Was a lovely surprise and very special for him. The location was excellent, just a short stroll from Circular Quay. It probably would take 10-15 mins to walk into the heart of the city but it would also be very easy to catch a train into Central Station if you didn't want to walk - the trains were frequent. It was just a short walk to cafes, a Starbucks, McDonalds and small grocery stores (and just a bit further to a Woolworths). We found that the service at the hotel was excellent and would definitely stay here again. I would recommend that you ring a travel agent to get a quote as I found that we got a much better deal going through our travel agent than I could otherwise have got over the internet. The price we got was comparable to the price I had received from 4-star hotels in the area - we had friends staying at various locations around the city and I think that we had the best hotel and didn't pay much more (if any) for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but just a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Ad_Guy_Ed
Reviews.Content: For a recent one-week ad shoot in Sydney, I stayed at this location. Overall, the hotel is quite nice and the staff is extremely helpful. I was greeted by name and shown straight to my room the minute I arrived (no having to check-in). I have heard that the average rooms here are quite small, I had a corner room and it was actually very large - with a separate dressing area and closet. The bed was fantastic and the TV was absolutely huge (~50 inches). My only issue was that the hotel furnishing were actually a little tired. There were some pretty big scratches on the end tables and things just looked a little worn. Bottom line though, the service at this hotel was fantastic, and if you could snag it at a great rate, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: bajanative
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Season's hotel in Sydney by Circular Quay. It was a beautiful property- comfortable beds, flat screen television, marvelous views of the city, spacious bathroom with L Occitane bath products. The staff was a little bit cold, but helpful- they provided me with maps of the city and suggested restaurants and pubs to visit. It was pricy, but then again Sydney is a very expensive city- I would say that it is 35% more expensive than New York CIty. The hotel had a small but adequate gym and a small outside pool & jacuzzi. There weren't too many people while we were there, but it lounging space might be problematic during high season. I ate breakfast at their restaurant and the egg whites with asparagus was delicious. They provided adaptors for the electrical outlet and you could request converters. While I waited for my room the front desk gave me access to WIFI in the lobby area. Once checked in I had to pay $29 per day for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyinnz
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Four Seasons Sydney. Our first was 5 years ago and was better then our second. The hotel rooms have gotten worn and tired looking. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. Both rooms were on the smaller side. Our bathtub was well worn and stained. We asked housekeeping if they could try to clean what looked like dirt from the tub and we were told that it was just because the tub was old. There was nothing they could do. That didn't seem like four seasons service. Staying at this hotel felt far from staying at a traditional four seasons hotel. At best the hotel room, service, and food were average. Such a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Simply out of this world - one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: RachelSouthwood
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel? It really is gob-smackingly brilliant in every way. Our room was on the 22nd floor, an interconnecting Premier Opera-View Room, so that our kids had a comfortable, spacious twin room next to our, also with *that* view... We had a direct view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. It must be one of the best views in the world, and is visible from wherever you are within the room. The room also had four comfortable seating areas (including a fun rotating circular round chair overlooking the harbour), a huge bathroom with separate bath and shower, a massive bed that was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and acres and acres of space. It was HEAVEN! The check-in process is a little laborious and the pool is quite small (but the kids loved it), but everything else is spot on, especially the location. We have friends in Manly so the proximity to the circular quay was a real bonus, and when we drove, the valet parking made all the difference. We had Executive Club membership, which was really worth doing. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Some aspects just not up to 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: Springstreet77
Reviews.Content: Check in was excellent. Although it was only 10am, I was sent off to the bar for a complimentary tea or coffee whilst my room was checked by a supervisor and I was in the room by 10.45am which was appreciated. Unfortunately I sat in the bar for the entire time and my tea did not arrive by the time I left. It took a long time for someone to take my order in the first place but at least 25 mins went by and no tea arrived! I was happy when shown my room - quite small but clean and the bed was very comfortable. I liked the toiletries etc. Unfortunately my luggage took an hour to arrive in my room. The look and feel of the hotel is quite dated but in most respects, but looks nice and has a glamourous touch. Common restrooms were pretty basic - not what I expected from a 5 star hotel. We chose to eat breakfast at the Park Hyatt after inspecting the buffet. Just not to the standard I expect of international 5 star buffets... Park Hyatt was delightful BTW. The next morning we inspected the room service menu but decided to go across to Starbucks instead as it was very expensive and the choices limited. Coffee was $9. We tried to have a pre dinner drink in the bar on Saturday night but waited 10 minutes for our orders to be taken and another 10 mins after that the waiter informed us that my cocktail could not be made so we left. I had informed the waitress upon ordering that we did not have much time. It was disappointing that the service was so poor as we have just had a trip to Bali and had a wonderful experience at Four Seasons hotels. We had 2 room service snacks and they were fine. The location is fantastic! Check out was fine, although there was a long queue. Would I stay again? Only if I could get a good price as I did this time. If I had paid normal prices I would've been quite annoyed I think.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrekker
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights over the holidays at this lovely hotel. Location is perfect, just across from Circular Quay and next the The Rocks. Staff mostly top-notch, great fitness center, helpful concierge, and best bar we found in Sydney for excellent cocktails at fair prices (ie everything is expensive everywhere). Keep in mind that this is an older hotel that has been updated with stylish decor, but the lobby retains the 80's gold gilt and glass trim. But overlook that and realize the hotel is a great base and good value for exploring Sydney. For those who complain about small room size, simply book a Premier Room. These rooms occupy the corner of each floor and are literally twice the size of the standard rooms. Our room was wonderful in terms of comfy bed and deluxe linens, huge closet, big flat screen TV, and newly upholstered furnishings. And if you are lucky (we were), you might have a room facing the Opera House and awake each morning to a spectacular view of the Sydney Harbour. Yes, you will see cruise groups coming and going from the hotel, irritating fellow tourists complaining about irrevelant inconveniences, and you may encounter an occasional less-than-Four-Seasons-quality staffer, but overall the experience is great. And the buffet breakfast each morning (pricey but good value) is amazing, be sure to order whatever else you might want that you don't see on the line. And be sure to have dinner on the terrace at the nearby Cafe Sydney atop the Custom House, surely it will be the hightlight of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: 84Cedarhouse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for a special anniversary just overnight. I had all positives until check out. Check-in was very polite and friendly, even though they were very busy they had numerous staff working at the check-in. The porters were very good and polite and nothing was a bother to get for us as required. We had a Harbour View room, which was very clean, neat and what you would expect of a 5 star hotel in Sydney. The beds are comfy (soft) and large King Size, its a shame that there were holes visable in the fitted bed sheet, I would expect from a hotel of this rating that this would have been checked and noticed when making the bed. I have eaten many times at Kables restaurant and it has always been exceptional in service and food. But I did not eat here while staying this time. We did have a drink at the Bar late in the evening, and the service was exceptional and very polite. The atmosphere is very warm and appealing. The only negatives I would say was the holes in the bed linen and on checking out, the attendant was not very happy, and it showed on her face whilst dealing with us. She was very robotic, did what she had to do and that was that, did not say on departure, we hope you enjoyed your stay. She must have been having a bad day. I would recommend and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: TheGriswalls
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions. The first was to attend a business function with work colleagues and our partners. My husband and I and another couple we were travelling with arrived early and the staff were very apologetic that our room was not made up yet, despite us arriving 3 hours prior to check in. We told them this was no problem and we didn't expect it to be. We just wished to leave our luggage, and vehicle and we would go out for lunch. The receptionist advised she would ring when our room was ready. We wandered about Sydney, had a leisurely lunch, during which we received a call from the hotel to advise that our rooms were ready. On our return to the hotel the receptionist advised us that she had upgrade both of our rooms. On arrival at our rooms we found that we had been put in a corner suite (which is huge) with views of the opera house. The rooms were absolutely awesome. The room was so large that we had impromptu drinks and nibblies with eight work colleagues that afternoon in our room prior to attending our work function. Nothing was a problem for the staff. Service was exceptional and anything we required was provided immediately such as ice, ice buckets, extra champagne flutes, serving platters etc. On arriving back at the hotel that evening we all met for cocktails in the bar area of the hotel. The service was brilliant and they kept that bar open as there were so many people still there, we left at 3.30 am and they were just closing up then. On arrival back at our room we found that the cleaning staff had been into our room and cleared up from our earlier "gathering". I did notice the next morning that a cheese knife and board I had brought with me was missing, which could have been an honest mistake - taken with all of the other items (ice buckets and serving trays) which belonged to the hotel. On ringing reception, they contacted housekeeping, who returned it to me with an apology. On my next visit the to hotel, which was not a business trip, I received an upgrade and a tray of handmade chocolate and letter from the manager, apologising for the incident which occurred during my previous stay. I could not believe this response from the manager, as it was only a minor incident which had not re-entered my mind. I have never received such exceptional service elsewhere and would stay there again without a moment's hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: trevorboil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 4 nights. great hotel. breakfast had a good variety. loved the location of the hotel. The young Australian man in the spa who helped me work the cross trainer was fantastic and very helpful much appreciated. rooms were very large and the layout was nice. staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful. would defiantly be back when returning to sydney

Reviews.Title: “great location, great beds but rooms too small!”
Reviews.Author: rachybp Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights, in 2 rooms. one room was upgraded to opera house view which was great. the kids were given soft koala bears as a gift and milk and cookies brought to the room which was great. the decor is lovely and rooms very comfy but they are just too small especially when you've been travelling around oz for 3 weeks with 2 kids and you have way too many bags and cases! the location of the hotel is fab if you want to spend time at the harbour which we did. we had room service one night which was fun and not too expensive but ate out the rest of the time. my husband and kids used the pool which is supposed to be the biggest of any of the cities outdoor hotel pools ( i'd hate to see the smallest)! they did say it was good though. the beds are definatley the comfiest we slept in in all australia! all in all i liked this hotel, it's busy and fun, lots of activity in the lobby. my only negative is that the rooms really could do with being a bit bigger for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marcussss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about service, from check in to check out. You can feel you are special. If you are looking a fancy modern looking room only, please go to Intercon or Hilton. You can see the hotel is just 5 star but people are like zombie working there. This hotel is all about people service. I had stay in a lot five star hotel during business around the world. So far the best attention to details and you can feel why this old building rate so highly in Sydney. A few things remind me, I always have my make up sign early in morning, then i receive a message on my 3rd night stay if i would love the room to be done everyday by 9am. Please ring houseekping and they will coordinate for the rest of the stay. Staff greet you in morning by using your surname when you walk out from your room. It look like its a part of the training that they need to remember guest name on their floor. There is only 2 green tea and i always used them all, the follow day they give extra every single day without asking. Can feel the people who really care their guest need in everywhere. The only downside to me is the room a bit too small, other than this. All are perfect. High suggest to those who always on business trip, this hotel will give you some home feeling. Not just 4 beautiful walls with furnitures.

Reviews.Title: “Too Hot. Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Ssom8888
Reviews.Content: When you walk into a Four Seasons Hotel lobby on a hot muggy day your first impression should be of being refreshed not wow I think it's hotter inside than out. Also the buttons in the lifts dont work. The were also hot. The rooms outdated. The service would be bad in a 3 star hotel never mind the "Four Seasons". Avoid. Stay at the Westin or the newly renovated Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Japonicastar
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location next to The Rocks. We requested Harbour View Rooms and received them, great views of the harbour itself and of course, Sydney Opera House. The hotel itself is clean with friendly staff and nice rooms. We did not eat in the hotel as the food was very expensive but there are plenty of other places to eat, and you can get on a ferry and go to Darling Harbour for a change of scene. The hotel provides the lovely L'occitane products which is a huge bonus for me, along with the usual hairdryer and safe. I liked this hotel but was disappointed in the pool. It is located to the back of the hotel next to a highway and there is constant noise which isnâ€™t the most peaceful or relaxing. All in all a good base, in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday Hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: OzBJM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. I really enjoyed the hotel, it was great, the staff, the breafast, the huge bed. I am normally in Sydney for business and stay very close to town hall station, and that was the one thing i did notice, that it was a bit longer walk to darling harbour or the CBD. however, it was right across the road from the Opera house and harbour bridge - so great for people who are new to Sydney. only other thing i could fault, is the elevators are a bit slow :( but again - not a huge issue.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LuxurynCulture
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with friends and a few family members over a recent long holiday weekend. We have visited several times before but this time we noticed that the city had really 'grown'. Very impressed with Sydney, food, shopping and the Opera House all providing a wonderful experience. The food court in David Jones, the Westfield shopping centre, the MLC Centre in particular Il Bisonte leather shop, all brilliant. But what stood out was our meal in Sailor's Thai Restaurant at the Rocks, George Street. The setting, service, and every dish were all outstanding. Also that old favourite, the Golden Century in Chinatown, super-fresh seafood which you select from the tanks, and reasonable prices. Against this, was the Four Seasons Hotel. It fell short of our expectations of the usual standards of a Four Seasons - no slippers in the bedrooms, dim lighting, poorly informed junior concierges, really slow check-in. Plus points were excellent temperature control in the rooms, and its spa. The Head Concierge was knowledgeable, pleasant and efficient. The bed was great, as was the view (of the Opera house) from the room. The hotel levies a surcharge if you pay the bill by credit card (and who doesn't?). Watch out for unscrupulous taxi-drivers, check the approxmate price of a trip before you leave the hotel. We encountered South Asian immigrants who did not know where they are going, were surly, could very well have taken us 'round the block. So keep your map handy and have the exact address ready, and insist on your change even if they pretend to take ages to find it in their wallets.

Reviews.Title: “Room design looks dated”
Reviews.Author: ElevenBus
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very large and the layout was nice. The furnishings were a bit outdated looking, too much black and kind of ugly carpeting. And for this price you still don't get complementary internet? Didn't feel like it was up to Four Seasons standards. Location is great though, although from the outside it didn't look that fancy either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic locatio and exactly what you'd expect from a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: KateLouiseMac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney with my husband and in-laws in December 2010 and would recommend it to other travellers. We were inatially looking for a cheaper option in the city but the Four Seasons worked out cheaper that the nearby Holiday Inn. The hotel is located right on the harbour with The Rocks just outside the door, a variety of shops, bars, clubs, resturants, and the Opera House a short walk away. The staff are fiendly and professional and every dealing with them was meet with a smile. We stayed in a standard room, which was large, clean and had a view accoss the water to North Sydney. Internet cost was not included in this room rate, there is an addational charge.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pta54
Reviews.Content: This is our special occasion hotel for when we stay in the city. We had a city view room for the first time but the hotel was fully booked and were happy even though it was a little pokey. The location is excellent ....the Opera House and the Rocks are within walking distance as are many restaurants and bars.The staff are the excellent and even ask how you enjoyed the show or restaurant you had told them you were going to the day before. They seem to care!!! Have even recommended this hotel to our friend's kids who are staying there for their Wedding night.

Reviews.Title: “Old and outdated, but still okay”
Reviews.Author: HensWkdAway
Reviews.Content: We went for a friends away wkd, 4 girls. We were unable to get a room for all of us or an interconnecting room. The bathroom was pretty nice considering the age of the hotel, and came with nice Loccitane toiletries considering it was a standard room. The room was a bit old and outdated but not uncomfortable. the pool is outdoors, we couldn't swim though because there were no spots left on the deck. The breakfast didn't look very appetizing when we checked it out, so we went down and got our own. Overall, service was pretty good. More aimed towards older people.

Reviews.Title: “Weigh it all up and this is the best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AlistairLondon
Reviews.Content: One wonders how the star system works, in 2 weeks I stayed in 3 different 5 star hotels in Sydney, Melbourne and Noosa, Four Seasons in Sydney is in a completely different league to the others. I arrived 8am from London knowing my check in time was 3pm, the room wasn't ready so I got some breakfast then went down to the pool, at 11am two members of staff came to the pool with my key and showed me up to the room. I was upgraded from deluxe city view to deluxe harbour view, the luggage was already up there, huge room, incredible view, plasma tv, dvd player, dressing room area, sofa, desk, big bath and seperate shower, enormous bed which you simply sink into, all in all incredibly comfortable. My room was on 33rd floor and the only problem was some drilling going on in the penthouse at about 10am one morning, I spoke to the assistant manager who said it was scheduled for a few hours during the day, it wasn't part of the hotel but he said he'd ask them to stop until noon, which happened very quickly, he offered to change my room which I didn't want to do, then sent up some chocolates and a bottle of wine with an apology. The location is great, it has an outside pool, service is fantastic, room as good as I've stayed in, I've stayed at The Hyatt which is also fantastic but it's a lot more expensive so for me The Four Seasons is the best hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMontreal
Reviews.Content: Top Hote in Sydney... steps from Harbour Bridge, Opera House and The Rocks great Restaurants and bars. Hotel Staff were more than hospitable!!! Soo kind and professional!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: whist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights after spending 19 days touring New Zeland. Everything about the hotel was fantastic, the location, the service, the food. I dont normally eat hotel food but I ate her for 2 nights. I was lucky to get an upgrade so had a fabulous view of both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. I as even lucky on one of the nights to witness a fireworks display. I would not stay anywhere else in Sydney next time I visit which I really hope is soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location, awesome view, 5 stars all the way”
Reviews.Author: toulousifer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Opera-house view room in early February. Despite an unexpected $50 up charge for a room on the 15th floor that had a better view (the original 9th floor view probably would have been adequate, but if you're paying four seasons prices, $50 is mostly irrelevant). The view from our room was spectacular...from the bed and couch you could see the opera house clearly, and from the bed you could also see the bridge. The staff was very good and polite and knowledgable. The prices are crazy, but that's to be expected there. The little extras add up fast: $30+ per day for wireless (though speedy) internet, and crazy crazy room service prices. We won't ever forget our $78 eggs (four of them), not because of how good they were (they were just fine), but because they cost us $78! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great room, pool and location”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1964
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 3 different 5 star Sydney hotels within 2 weeks and this was easily the best. The room was large and very well appointed, the staff were really helpful, and the pool area very good. The only downside is the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect”
Reviews.Author: ZecaoDistritoFederal
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The room we stayed in was large and very comfortable. The hotel had a very good structure and the staff were very kind. We felt at home in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotels with a view to match”
Reviews.Author: Yarra93
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in a Premier harbor view room. We were given a very warm welcome and the lady checking us in asked us what we were going to do in Sydney, she also checked us out and asked us if we enjoyed our activities. The first time that you walk in the blinds are closed and when you open them the views that greet you must surely be the best in Sydney. We could see the Opera house from our beds, which were extremely comfy; I slept straight through the night. The room had a very large desk with a high back chair it was the work area I have used in any hotel. The bath room had a large bath and a shower with a massage setting. The neutral palette of the room is very relaxing, and the highlight of the room was the great chaise looking out of the corner window. The service at the hotel was first class, with the exception of one of the men at the concierge desk who was sarcastic and uninterested in helping us. The room service was good, but the a la carte breakfast in Kables was much better, we had a good table right by the balcony. The only part of the hotel that could do with an update is the elevators and hallways. The lobby is very glamorous, and we always had the doors opened for us. Every aspect of the hotel was of a very high standard, and I look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Four Seasons - Great location”
Reviews.Author: cajseattle
Reviews.Content: Great location and great Four Seasons service as you would expect. The room looked over the Harbor at the Opera House. You are 3 minute walk to the Harbor Ferries and The Rocks (great bars and resturants. So you cannot ask for more. The decor is a little tired in style but not bad shape. If you can get the room at a good price I recommend iut.

Reviews.Title: “honey moon”
Reviews.Author: Joanna078_11
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 wonderful days in Hotel. The room was perfect with a huge bed and great view of the Opera House and bridge. The environment of the hotel was quiet and peacefull.The staff were friendly and ready to serve us any time. The breakfast was unbelievable variety. The hotel was in the best spot in Sydney because we could go by foot or by bus or by ferry boat anywhere after all it was near us. The hotel was that we wanted for our honeymoon ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Zouppy
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Four Seasons. You can not beat the location, and we had a wonderful view overlooking the opera house, and the harbour bridge. Staff could not be more helpful. We will stay there again on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but not the service”
Reviews.Author: ALKDVS
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a wonderful location, convenient to most Sydney sights and transportation. The Premier Room (which we booked through whatahotel.com) was spacious and large, though the bathroom was a bit small. The other rooms in the hotel are reputedly small, and they certainly looked that way as we passed by them. The hotel did not upgrade us, as it was supposed to do for those who use Four Seasons Preferred Partner agents. It also did not quite get the service right--both check in and checkout were slow (there were several errors on the bill). The restaurant service was erratic, though the food was quite good, if not quite excellent all of the time. (This was true at breakfast and at dinner.) The spa was fine, though probably not among the best. The doormen were often chatting amongst themselves or just plain absent. Prices are generally high, which one expects at Four Seasons, but the service was a consistent disappointment. To add insult to injury, the hotel charges a 1.5% service charge if you pay with a credit card. Since no one had told us this when we booked, and since the person who checked us in wrote directly over the minuscule sentence on the form where it states this, we got the fee waived. But it felt tacky and wrong--hotels of this sort rely upon credit. If it intends to do this, it should just increase its rates and drop the fee--rather than burying this information. Other Four Seasons properties get service much more than this property, though it wasn't terrible. It just did not meet expectations for a five star hotel. That said, none of this is new to those who read earlier posts. So maybe we just hoped for an improvement that didn't materialize. Still, this is a fine hotel in an enviable location.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travel82Uk
Reviews.Content: Really struggle to understand why this hotel is rated so highly on Tripadvisor. Didn't feel like a five star hotel or a Four Seasons at all. Our main problem was the rooms. We paid extra for an Opera view room, and were placed on around the 7th floor, as you looked out the window, the Opera House was in the distance but you looked directly onto the freeway ramp, and underneath that the train line. As the train approaches the hotel the tracks bends and most of the trains let out an extremely loud fog horn type sound. This horn noise comes straight into the room making it impossible to sleep. After complaining we were moved to the 20th ish floor, which was much better. You could still make out the train's fog horn but it was distant and wasn't loud enough to stop us sleeping. Essentially the soundproofing of the external windows is very poor. Most of the rooms are also extremely narrow and small for the grade of hotel. The pool is badly sited next the loud train line, and freeway ramp, and it didn't have changing rooms directly next to the swimming pool which meant you had to walk along one of the lobby upper corridors to get to from the changing rooms so we didn't bother using the pool. The whole place felt dated, and the staff weren't very friendly. The location of the hotel is superb but we should have stayed in the Westin for the same money and walked that extra 5minute walk to the Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dated and not what you expect from a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Pat71
Reviews.Content: Great location but there are much a better hotels to stay at in Sydney. The rooms are only ok. The bar is poorly sited and with no atmosphere and the lobby is a 70's flash back. I would stay at the observatory, the Westin or the intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “surprize credit card charge”
Reviews.Author: bobwats
Reviews.Content: on check out we had to pay 1.5% on top of bill because we used a charge card. Hotel said it was new gov policy but we were not charged that at Lizard resort.

Reviews.Title: “a place to remember,shall return.”
Reviews.Author: stanley031
Reviews.Content: if not sure about about anything about the hotel you are going ,example restaurants bars ect ,other special features check reviews about hotel .don't hessitate to call the hotel .early check in 12-noon onwards and ask for a higher floor better views ,every time i asked i got those things .call maybe 1 week before check in request high floor ,they will put on with your reservations .call aprox 9am on the day you are checking in iff you want early check in ,in most cases you can get it ,also if you want late check out ask when you check in ,some times they will let you check out between 12 to 2pm .our view was of opra house and harbour bridge,king size beds fantasic to sleep on ,staff can not be better ,i highly recomend this hotel ,minutes walk the rocks circular quay .5 minutes to opra house.they also done little special things ,example i told them it was my wifes birthday during our stay ,when we come back from dinner ,in our room was a cute little cake and bottle of champaine ,they also called our room twice ,and asked is every thing ok ,the staff were outstanding .last of all ,do this at least twice ayear .its great for your marriage ,and to spoil your selfs ocassionaly ,you worked hard .YOU DERSERVE IT .ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: colin057
Reviews.Content: The second time I've stayed at The Four Seasons and it really is a great hotel. The location couldn't be any better....close to The Rocks area; Sydney harbour bridge; Circular Quay ( for the ferries) and Sydney Opera house. The staff are friendly and very efficient. I would certainly stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but you gotta get the good rooms to get a great experience”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night here as part of a dad & mum getaway from our family visit to Sydney with the kids.had a premiere harborview room on the 33rd floor with a corner room with a killer view. room was decorated very nicely and the bathroom also very nice. gym is in the top tier. spa was also OK and my masseuse Chanita was excellent. location is perfect. breakfast buffet and a la carte items were fine and dinner in the cafe was excellent. service was attentive. you can use internet in the lounge for free. not worth it to get lounge access; not a lot of food, it closes at 8pm and the best views are not there. My main beef here is that the elevators stop on many floors by the time you get to the top floors; they should have express elevators, at least at peak hours, to those paying the premium rates to stay at the top levels and they shouldn't be crowding the elevators with people on low floors getting club level access on the 32nd floor. I also found I could hear doors closing elsewhere on my floor while I was sleeping which shouldn't be the case in a good hotel. Otherwise, it was a great four seasons experience. Park Hyatt was asking twice the price for rooms that night; I actually find this location to be more convenient and the view from my room was probably better since the park hyatt is a low-rise building. But we had high tea there and that was a very nice activity and you get your opera view doing that too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: wilderness_explorers
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and stayed over the New Year period for 6 nights in a Opera Premier room that also had a great view of the bridge I was a little worried having read some previous reviewers but as supporters of Four Seasons around the World we really neednt have worried - our room was VERY spacious, views fantastic, service excellent and the Hotel and Sydney lived up to everything we needed We must have been one of the few families not there for the cricket but the location for getting a family to and from the midnight fireworks was excellent (we recommend Lawn with a View) and with an impending bridge walk after New Year the bridge could be studied before and after Four Seasons is not cheap but it really is quality and the Sydney establishment didnt dissapoint. - the pool area and outside eating area need to be larger but we loved our stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for an average 5* hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bradford8487
Reviews.Content: It's situated in circular quay, which couldn't be better. It had a nice outdoor pool and the staff were all very good. It just wasn't quite as good as I thought it should be: I had one issue which it took 3 attempts to get them to do anything, the breakfast was extortionate as they wanted to charge $42 Aus for the Buffett and there wasn't even any complimentary water or coffee in your room. The location saved it though, and there isn't a lot wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Love_Australia
Reviews.Content: It was the first time in Sydney for my husband so I decided to splash out on a full harbour view room and boy was it worth it! It was expensive but the view was fantastic both day and night. The hotel is also ideally located for all the major sights. We were delayed arriving due to the bad weather in Europe but that wasn't an issue for the hotel, check in and departure was straightforward and quick, staff very friendly and helpful. The room wasn't huge but the bed and pillows were fantastic making going to bed a real luxury! We didn't have any meals here so I can't comment on the restaurant, the pool was lovely with towels provided. If you can spare the money I would recommend a full harbour view on a high floor, we were on the 31st. It was certainly a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: monacobar
Reviews.Content: Location - Great location. Probably the best in Sydney. Close to everything, shopping, ferries, trains, and attractions. View - Booked a Opera House view. We we on the 27th floor. Great view but had to stand write next to the window to see the view. Could not be seen from anywhere else in the room. I suggest going up to the next catergory which I beleive is the Harbour View room Service - All staff were very friendly and helpful once we could reach them. Our bags took almost an hour to get to our room after checkin, and after many calls to have them brought up. Check in and Check out was quick and no fuss. Bar service was good also. We found we had to wait a while when dialing room service, conceirge etc. Sometimes we were put on hold for 10 minutes. Food - only had the buffet breakfast which was ok. Not great but not bad either Rooms - very very small. I was expecting this but they were just a really awkward design and the bathroom was not user friendly. The makeup mirror was for people over 6 foot tall and the toilet area was so small. Overall the hotel was ok but for the price I would probably try somewhere else. The rooms were so small and unpractical that it made all time spent in the rooms uncomfortable. If you are going to stay here make sure you get the suite which are the corner rooms with bigger bathrooms. But saying that we had a great time in Sydney which was probably due to the great location of the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “we would recommend this hotel to anyone, it was superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucylouCoDurham Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels throughout the world this is undoubtedly the best. The service and cleanliness was second to none, the positon of the hotel and the staff were excellent. We will definately return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone who is fortunate to visit sydney. Derek and Sue

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: rachelbarletta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely lovely. The lobby is open and spacious and the door service is great. The staff smile and are helpful. The process of checking in and out was very easy; it only took a few moments. Free upgrade was given upon check-in. Staff went out of their way to make sure our bags were kept safe while we waited for our room to be ready!! The room was an opera view room; absolutely amazing view. Spacious spacious spacious, very clean, lovely furnishings, modern and tidy. The bathroom is large and very functional. Bath is great, double basins handy too. Loccotaine products were a bonus! Plus hairdryer included. Large room with very comfortable bedding. Windows give great natural light and provide amazing views over circular quay and surroundings. Bridge could also be seen partially. Just great!! Best location. mintue walk to cicular quay ferries and cities shopping. Next to great restaurants and pubs in rocks. Pool area is functional and great for cooling off on hot day!! Lacks shade but some have umbreallas. Service by pool is great..cocktails and small snacks and meals! Spa great for late afternoon or early evening break! THIS HOTEL COMES HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, especially to those with no children. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “5* as it should be - plus perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous review I guess they do have two kinds of rooms: renovated and unrenovated. The outside of the hotels isnâ€™t very appealing, such is the Lobby. Itâ€™s all a bit 80s and need update. But since we took the Club Room we hadnâ€™t much to do at the lobby, straight went on to the 32nd floor where the welcome is very friendly and effective. We got a Opera view room (as we booked and paid) at the 31st floor which wasnâ€™t quite big, but modern and with a great view over parts of the harbor and Opera. There wasnâ€™t anything to complain about the room. The blinds were good, the sleep quality superb, bathroom with separate glass-showerâ€¦ Best about the whole thing was the Club itself. Very friendly staff, great harbor views and very nice food of good selection. Unlike other Clubs they even had an Egg-Chef in the morning. The Concierge at the Club helped us with sightseeing options, tour maps etc. No waiting, no hassle, exactly as you expect of a 5* hotel. Iâ€™ve stayed at the WESTIN (which has no Club, even for SPG Platinum members) and the FOUR SEASONS. I would always come back to the FOUR SEASONS â€“ because of the Club.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hotel for Weary Travellers”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Sydney at 8am, after a long flight from the US. I wanted our first few days in Australia to be comfortable, so booked the Four Seasons. The hotel did not disappoint! Although we arrived well before the posted check-in time, the hotel was able to find a room that would be available in 30 minutes. To ease our wait, they directed us to their restaurant for complimentary coffee (much appreciated). Although they took our cell and said they would call us when the room was ready, the check-in host took the extra step of going to the restaurant to find us when the room was ready, and gave us the keys himself. This level of service, characteristic of the Four Seasons, was evident in other small details such as the valets opening the hotel doors for guests, employees smiling & asking us if we needed anything, etc. The hotel's location (Circular Quay) is excellent for seeing historic sights as well as catching local ferries. We would stay at the hotel again and recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons in Name Only”
Reviews.Author: kartwoman
Reviews.Content: Note to Toronto: Iâ€™ve actually been to this hotel before â€” it was suburban Minnesota for prom in 1983 when the brass and glass effect seemed so right. Itâ€™s interesting because I remember reading an article about how the Four Seasons ardently protects and oversees its brand, which summons so many thoughts beyond just baseline disappointment in this property. Bottom line: this is not a Four Seasons in the sense weâ€™ve come to know the brandâ€™s service, rooms, aesthetic, amenities, condition of facilities, and nickel-and-diming-free environment. It is an old Regent in need of an overhaul. Thatâ€™s fine, but at least in places like Singapore, the distinction is made plain and cost reflects it. You can stay at the old Regent, â€œa Four Seasons Hotel,â€� or you can get what you pay for at the true Four Seasons across the street. Iâ€™ve traveled 12 countries and enjoyed dozens of hotels this year â€” FS Sydney was the poorest value. Could be wrong, but it seemed to be more of a package tourist spot a la Marriott. The chief positive, and itâ€™s admittedly a big one, is its fine location. But, really, there are other hotels with stellar locations â€” Park Hyatt would be an obvious choice for this type of stay. As a gentlemen we met in the elevator said as we collectively laughed at the scrolling electronic ad pushing the hotelâ€™s Executive Club for a mere few more bucks(!): if he werenâ€™t writing his stay off for business heâ€™d have been actively complaining about the same things that annoyed us. I so wish I could have expensed this one. I donâ€™t mean to be Andrew-Harper picky here, but the somewhat appalling, cumulative reality about the nickel and diming and subpar service aspects and facilities canâ€™t be glossed over. I just donâ€™t recall these things at other FS properties. To wit: had to pay for water in rooms; none in fitness center or pool except containers that werenâ€™t always replenished (or they lacked glasses so useless); they charged $10 for a printout of an international newspaper (even the most remote hotels of lesser name will toss that in gratis); $30 daily internet charge for inconvenient and sloooowwww connection; use of the 32nd-floor â€œBusiness Centerâ€� was inconvenient and ultimately worthless even for printing boarding passes because the 3 computers were in constant use (hostess wouldnâ€™t even let us in - told us weâ€™d just have to keep checking back and said she couldnâ€™t do printing for us; the poor, unseasoned service at the (extremely lame) spa and concierge desk (late 40s couple asking for a charming wine bar option and weâ€™re told to walk to the loud party bar beneath the opera house instead of the two wine bars we found 1 and 3 blocks away the next day?); pool and spa closed by 8:00; pool and other public areas are outdated and depressing. Even the elevators were slow and often packed with tourists and luggage cart-pushing bellmen (no service elevator?). It often took us two to three tries to get an elevator with room for two of us. Finally, the rooms: we had a suite and it was dark with odd layout and dinged and scuffed wood; peeling wallpaper in bathroom. The bathroom layout also odd w/ unfortunate 1980s brown marble; products tossed on the counter like an afterthought. We saw the regular rooms and they are tiny boxes even by New York standards - opera view helps but still. Noise-sensitive guests beware: the rooms are not well sound-proofed. We heard guests in rooms and constant street and highway noise (highway right outside our window). Sydney, is not exactly a great hotel city, but Four Seasons needs to seriously step up or sever this weak link. It definitely reflects poorly on the brand and I will be quite mindful and selective the next time I consider booking a non-resort FS; its credibility has been undermined with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, just one or two small touches to improve upon”
Reviews.Author: pudsontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights towards the end of our tour of Oz. We had booked a twin/double room and I had emailed the hotel several times to specifically request a double but they did not respond. So when we checked in, of course they only had a twin and the hotel was full. Typical! But no matter, we stayed one night in our twin room (with opera house view) and were then upgraded free of charge to a suite for the remaining 4 nights - complete with a superb view of the SOH and the bridge - WOW! Must have been the best room in Sydney! It was very spacious and a veeerrry comfortable bed! Oh yes - and because it was my birthday I got a cake and card from the hotel. To transfer from the airport we got the train direct to Circular Quay station and it was a 3-4 min walk to the hotel. Easy and no need for a taxi. The hotel is superbly located right next to The Rocks, Circular Quay, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, and the ferries from the Quay will take you anywhere in the harbour. One or two small gripes.....We thought the guys on the door were always looking for limo's occupants to open the hotel door for, us mortals on foot normally had to open it ourselves. Shame but its those small touches that make the difference isn't it. Also, the pool guy wasn't always on duty and when he was, he could have been more attentive. My wife had a massage which she described as 'average' and she is an expert! Also the wi fi wasn't free, something we found frustrating. (NOTE - the best free wi fi we found was on the upper deck of the Manly ferry!). They should have replied to my emails as well. But when we return to Sydney ( and we will and you will too!) we will want to stay in the same hotel in the same room. There really isn't a better view or location in the city for us.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, however I expected a little more!”
Reviews.Author: jimbob317
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location extremley close to the Rcoks, Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge. The location I cannot fault. Service in general at the hotel was excellent the only complaint I would have is that breakfast can be a little slow....if you opt for the buffet. There are three choices for breakfast, all held in the same room. Continental which was included in our room rate at $36, a sunrise special buffet at $42 and a specific menu with individually priced. I got the impression that the hotel wanted to push this and gave those customers who ordered from this better service. My main annoyance was that having told the waitress that we were on the continental buffet and asking what this included we were told everything, and therefore for the three mornings we stayed we had everything. When checking out however it turned out that we had been having the sunrise breakfast and that this was not inlcuded in our room rate and therefore the hotel made attempts to charge my partner and I for the $42 per breakfast each. We managed to argue with the hotelk about this and were not charged in the end. I however think that a hotel of this standard should not be employing tricks such as this. Service in the bar at night was also rather slow. We opted for a harbour view room. Admittedly you could see the opera house and Circular quay however the view wasn't great and if I was to go again I would not opt for this and get a cheaper room. The rooms themselves were well equipped, had nice furnishings and quality toiletries. They were cleaned to an exceptional standard twice a day. The rooms however are rather small for two travellers with large cases, and for my taste the bed was far too soft. Overall I would stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: quorny
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the UK for a 3 night stay at the Four Seasons around 0830 and only had to wait about an hour to check into our room.The view was amazing of the harbour and bridge. The room itself (2716) was i thought tired and have to agree with another reviewer Billymax that the entire hotel is in need of a total refurbishment.The pool area is very small and disappointing.The location on the other hand cannot be beaten with the most comfortable bed ive ever slept in.Breakfast was the usual buffet but again disappointing and very expensive 77AUD (Â£48).the staff though were very helpful throughout the entire hotel. Travel adaptors were available in the room. Overall i think we would stay again at the Four Seasons but only because of the location. the rooms were clean but tired and the hotel itself needs a total refurbishment our stay was very pleasant though.

Reviews.Title: “When is a FS not an FS ?”
Reviews.Author: billymax
Reviews.Content: On the plus side : 1) The position - for the tourist - it's simply the very best in Sydney. 2) The view both day and night - from the full length window in our room on the 29th floor with a full harbour view was just incredible. 3) The bed and linens - fantastic, the usual FS standard. 4) Housekeeping - friendly and efficient. 5) Checkin/out - friendly and efficient. 6) Concierge - friendly and helpful. On the negative side - we thought that the hotel was in desperate need of a total refurbishment to bring it up to a standard that most regular FS guests would expect. The room furnishings were old and worn and several of the glass covered surfaces had dust beneath. Lifts poor and gym pool area uninviting as was the lounge lobby and bar. We didn't breakfast or dine at the hotel because it didn't look terribly inspiring. Not a good advert for FS. Unfortunately this hotel just doesn't have that FS quality and level of luxury that we've grown to expect and thought we'd experience yet again. I must say that if this was the only FS we'd stayed at we'd probably not want to stay at another. We were told that the hotel operates at a 98% occupancy level and so the lack of investment is strange. Having stayed at various FS hotels in various parts of the world we were really disappointed with the FS Sydney. Having said all of this - its not a terrible hotel - its far better than average but it just isn't in our opinion a FS hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons is the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: rob_en_route
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a view of the harbour, but it was still awesome. Don't believe any negative reviews, the Four Seasons is the Four Seasons. This was the last stop on our honeymoon, and we were greeted with champagne. We had an excellent stay, and the location (quite literally steps from The Rocks, the Opera House, and Circular Quay) is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: AKBZ188
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent three nights at the Four Seasons for our 10th wedding anniversary and are so happy that we chose this hotel. We found the staff all extremely friendly and helpful. The room wasn't large but big enough for our requirements. The bed was sooooo comfortable and we both enjoyed good sleeps. Close to everything and lovely to spend time in the Rocks area. Would definitely recommend the Four Seasons Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I Love The Four Seasons, Sydney as Much As I Love Oz!”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm a bit late in writing this review, but thought it was well-deserved. Most everyone who is flying in (like me) has been flying for 15+ hours. A lot of the international flights arrive early in the morning (I got to the hotel at 9AM) and was not looking forward to reception informing me that my room would not be ready for another 5 hours. Instead, I was warmly welcomed and upgraded (complimentary) to 1 of the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in (and I've been to MANY 5-star hotels) all the while paying a rock-bottom rate. Hmmm, maybe karma? Located on George Street on the historic Rocks, you are in walking distance to pretty much everything you should/need to see on your first trip to Sydney (it won't be your last). The concierge was very helpful and genuinely seemed more interested in satisfying my interests rather than any arrangements the hotel might have with other establishments. The Four Seasons, Sydney aptly compliments this wonderful city, and you have everything at your fingertips. I hope you enjoy Sydney as much as I did/do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Shaun14
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the staff were very friendly and had our room ready with in half an hour off us arriving, and we arrived at 8am in the morining, the room was clean and tidy , but a bit dusty in draws and tv unit. the room was fairly small and was a bit awkward for storing 2 large suitcases.
