The main problem with this hotel was the price of everything, i know its sydney but 12 quid for 24 hours interent is a rip off when most hotels are offering this free now a days, 8 quid for a litre bottle of wine, i know the pound is that good these days but sorry ths was riduculous, we had 2 classes of wine one evening in bar and that cost us 22 pounds, the bath room facilities were very good and the TV package you get if you stay on the 27th floor is brilliant, its properly better thaan my sky box at home massive selection of channels with lots of sport and the unit even allows you to record so managed to record a football game at 3 in the morning and watched it the next evening,and has HD as well. also the the Tv was massive as well., not so sure if all rooms are like this though. the pool area is very nice and the bar excellent, but it was raining most days we were there so didnt use it that much.Laundry Service was good but absolutely stupid prices again. overall a great hotel that is let down on value for money, great for a stay but dont buy anything there.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Met - Simply Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Great_Expectations84
Reviews.Content: Based on our flight arrival, we got to the hotel at 9:00am. We were advised to go for breakfast and offered the use of spa showers which we declined. Our room was ready by 10:30am which is acceptable. Opera view room is very small, but just what we are used to in Vancouver. Chocolate and vanilla colour scheme indicated decor has been done within the last 10 years. View was absolutely "peek a boo"; as we expected because the previous reviews confirm this. As this is the second cheapest room type I would suggest paying the difference to upgrade from the City View. That's probably a view of the hotel next door. Service was nice with only one issue. For some bizarre reason our used utensils were left in the room over two evening turn downs and one morning housekeeping service. We found this to be extremely unusual as the room was serviced properly and so regularly. Yet dirty knives and forks were missed three times before we had to get rid of them ourselves. The best thing about this property is the location where the Rocks meets Circular Quay. This area is prefect for tourists; rich in history and very walkable. After staying in his neighbourhood I would never consider an area such as Darling Harbour. We did not eat in the hotel's restaurants as the rates seems too inflated; even for Sydney. Good value options close by are Jackson's on George which is right across the street and the take away joint called Seafood on the Quay (or similar name) for fish and chips. We had breakfast at the Bakers Oven on George Street and enjoyed their exterior rear courtyard setting. A few tips... Don't make local calls; we were charged $40 for two phones lasting no longer than a total of five minutes. Also please do not use the internet in protest - they charge $30 daily and this should be included in the nightly rate. Doesn't have to be free; just included. We went pre booked the 2 hour Rocks Pub Crawl tour which was fabulous and highly recommended. We are not big drinkers but it was still allot of fun that evening. We also took the hop on hop off bus tour which we also recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing about this hotel is the location...”
Reviews.Author: cpietz2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 5 nights at the Four Seasons in Sydney for the first leg of our honeymoon. The location is perfect, right at Circular Quay, easy access to everything. Now come the negatives: our toilet didn't flush, and was never fixed despite calling the front desk several times to complain, the shower leaks everywhere, we were charged for everytime we called the concierge to ask them for anything (dinner reservations etc), wi-fi internet doesn't work if your outside your actual room within the hotel, and the staff in general didn't know what was going on/were very unhelpful. This hotel is not worth the money and is nowhere near up to the standards of other Four Seasons around the world. I think the Intercontinental would be a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “"A hotel is a hotel before you actually stay in it and realise its probably bit more”
Reviews.Author: RohitKatyal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many 5 star hotels owing to my multiple business trips. As a business travellor one would want the hotel to be near to a business district and also conveniently connected to the city in case one gets time to see the city. Four Seasons is a nice hotel with a spacious room (good value for money spend) and very conveniently located in heart of Sydney business district. The room has all the modern amenities a well travelled executive will like to have to relax after a hard days work at office. Its very near (10 minutes walk) to the famous Opera house and the Sydney bridge/pier and is connected with train stations nearby. The street (George street) is full of restaurants and pubs but for a family its bit far away from the famous Bondi beach. I liked the area as a business travellor and would recommend others.

Reviews.Title: “Gobsmacking View.”
Reviews.Author: JandIB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in September 2010. After a long flight from Hong Kong, we had a warm and efficient welcome at the impressive reception desk. A few minutes later and we were in the lift to floor 31, Room 3111. What an amazing view. I was completely gobsmacked and totoally overwhelmed by our first look at both Sydney Bridge and the Opera House. Even at night the view was totally awesome. The hotel is in a great location on Circular Quay. We used the gym and swimming pool -both really good. We didn't eat at the hotel - so much choice immediately outside the door on the Quay or around the corner at The Rocks. We booked through Direct Rooms and got a great deal. The room itself was enormous, with an impressive king size bed, a massive flat screen TV, a great table which we sat at to do our bogs - and a great picture window. It also had a mini bar - with five star prices! Highly recommended - we'll definitely book the same room when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star, great central Sydney location”
Reviews.Author: LittlePrincessNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons on a conference and was very impressed with the service and the room. Staff were friendly, polite and quick to respond to requests. The rooms were spacious, clean and well appointed. The beds are amazing, best nights sleep I'd had in ages (and I travel a lot).

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the Rocks and the ferries”
Reviews.Author: RoverB
Reviews.Content: Lovely large hotel with great views over the harbour. Rooms are well appointed but not very large. The optional upgrade to include breakfast and other upgrades was too expensive and the bar prices also fall into this category. The cost of internet access is prohibitive is you are only a casual user i.e. AUD.30 for 24 hours. Otherwise our stay was very enjoyable and reasonably priced for the facilities we got.

Reviews.Title: “I Expected so much more”
Reviews.Author: nomadicexpat
Reviews.Content: The hotel isnt really a four seasons. it is no where near the 5 star standard of the broader chain. this was built as a different hotel, and makes its living servicing cruise ship passengers and tourists. i have stayed here before out of necessity, but this trip is the last straw. I had a huge roach in my bathroom and told the desk as i was leaving for dinner. When i got back there was no note, nor message, from outward appearance they had only moved the garbage pail over the drain it scurried down. when i called down and asked i was told "dont worry, we put some chemicals down the drain". i stressed i didnt feel comfortable staying in a room where bug chemicals were recently deployed, i was told "dont worry, it should be fine, if you get nauseous call down and maybe we can do something for you". i'd expect a better response from a 3 star airport hotel, let alone the 4 seasons. i mentioned it to the assistant manager the next day, because i hadnt slept at all that night, and was told theyd look into it but there was zero follow up (not even a note in my file at check out for them to apologize) Sydney hotels arent the best, but having stayed at most of them in the CBD i view the 4 seasons as my absolute last choice -- it just isnt worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great wedding night package!”
Reviews.Author: jirrupin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our wedding night as part of the Four Seasons unique 'Wedding night package', and were extremely impressed with this hotel. Upon arrival at about midnight, check-in was quick and seamless. When we got upstairs, there was a fabulous spread of sparkling wine (McWilliams), cheese and crackers, and sweet and savoury canapes. It made arriving to the room truly special. In addition, our Harbour View room had a spectacular view of the Opera House and Bridge. Room quality was excellent and looked like it had been recently refurbed. Our package also included in-room breakfast, and we ordered a wonderful and delicious array of breakfast foods. The man who brought it to the room arranged the table and chairs next to the window so we ate with a fantastic view of the harbour! Check-out the next day was great as well, and we left feeling the whole stay was nothing short of perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to get to,from cruise ship dock, we walked only 5 mins. Reception was welcoming and staff very helpful pleasant and efficient. The reception area was very big and spacious with plenty of seats. The room was very clean and had 1 large bed and TV. The bathroom was very clean with toiletries. We had Opera House view which was pleasant. I would stay here again as very near Quay, The Rocks and Opera House. No Free WIFI in bedrooms. Can use internet in business centre at a charge.

Reviews.Title: “40,000 miles for 2 nights was a good deal”
Reviews.Author: snf8track
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to Sydney for a cruise I read some reviews on here that were not favorable. Construction noise is something that make a hotel stay miserable. I arrived around 9am to the hotel and had to wait for my room. The trainee at the front desk was very nice, seeing that I was very tired and traveled for 24 hrs to get there. She allowed me to go up to the spa and use the shower to freshen up while waiting. I went back down to the lobby waiting patiently. I was just so tired and was falling asleep in the lobby. I think that did the trick, I had a room around 10:45am. I was put on the 20th floor facing the Darling Habour side. I heard no noise at all, but when I went to the elevator I heard tons of noise. The hotel is very nice and an excellent staff but I would have never paid the price they wanted per night. I used airline miles and for 40,000 miles I think I got a fantastic deal. I picked the hotel for location. I was leaving on a cruise at Ciruclar Quay so all I had to do was walk 5 minutes to get on my ship. I would never pay to stay again but if the mileage was right I would do that again.

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever received!”
Reviews.Author: RhiannandKennedy
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, i arrived at Four Seasons Hotel. My expectations were met when i saw my room. I stayed in a corner suite and the room was beautiful, clearly recently renovated, as the room was without wear and with modern furnishings. I was having a little bit of trouble with connecting to the internet, so i went to the business centre on the 32nd floor, where i was greeted by a lovely girl named Rebecca. She was able to help me and i found her to be of great assistance throughout my five day stay. She went out of her way in offering further assistance, even though i was not a guest in the executive club (where the business centre is), offering information about things to do and see whilst in Sydney, as i told her it was my first time to this beautiful city. Rebecca made dinner reservations for me at a few places, and her recommendations were great. I did not use the concierge at all, as Rebecca was always able to help me. The service in this Hotel is amazing, and a true testiment to the Four Seasons philosophy. A must stay property!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a prime location, awesome views across the harbour”
Reviews.Author: madforcruising
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed at the Four Seaons Sydney for 4 nights. I opted for a Premier harbour view room and got assigned a room on the 21st. floor, Overlooking the Opera house, Circular Quay and the harbour bridge. These corner rooms are huge and have king size beds, a good size seating area, with a comfy chair at the window for panoramic viewing and a desk as working area. ThereÂ´s a nice sized walk-in closet with a huge safe. The bathroom features a bathtub, double sink, toilett and again huge shower. There would be a lot to say about the Hotel, but the most important that sticks to my mind is that awesome view. Actually while typing this IÂ´m at the Hotel again, killing a few hours until my flight leaves and having booked a day room.

Reviews.Title: “The view of the harbour is absolutly Breathtaking.”
Reviews.Author: debbieandriske
Reviews.Content: The stay was absolutely amazing, the service, the room, and of course the view , was as i say breathtaking , especially the night views, and so close to everything, id recommend this place to any one who wanted a liesurely few days to relax and enjoy the special harbour views of our wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Strian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 5 nights of our holiday in Australia. This is a modern hotel and what you would expect from the Four Seasons brand - good quality surroundings, good rooms and good service. What makes it stand out is the location - right on the harbour and within walking distance of some of the highlights that Sydney has to offer.The historic and quaint Rocks area is right on the doorstep,quite literally. Circular Quay, the hub of all the harbour ferries, is within 50m - taking a ferry to manly or Watsons Bay is a must. The Opera House is just across the harbour and there are a range of good resaurants in the vicinity. Take an early morning walk through the Botanic Gardens to McQuarrie Point for a great view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the early morning light - you will not forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - $30 for internet is make it my last stay at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: dbs33
Reviews.Content: Overpriced - $30 for internet is make it my last stay at Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in Sydney for location and service and the views”
Reviews.Author: amandajolly
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 0800 in morning after a very long flight - nothing was to much trouble - within forty five mins of us arriving the room was ready - we did get the wrong room first when we check in - we had paid for opera view and when we got to the first room it didnt have that view - however I went down to reception and a lady called Marie sorted for me - she was so good and the room she then gave me was amazing. The hotel location is just wonderful right in circular quay by the ferries with the opera house right in front. The restuarants and shops are two minutes walk away if that. The pool was great 0 just what you need after sight seeing - what was amazing was the staff by the pool as soon as you sat down brought iced lemon water, sun cream and magazine and towel in a basket for you - they even moved sunbed when the sun moved - wonderful service - the decking area by the pool was great to eat as well. The breakfast was the best you can imagine with a great selection of everything and even when the hotel was full the service and attention to detail was wonderful. To sum up this is well woth everything you pay and when you wake up to view off the opera house you never want to go to sleep - the views are the best ever. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: iubettyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and absolutely loved the location. We had a harbor view room which was a FANTASTIC view! Rooms are pretty small but well decorated and very clean. The concierge made multiple restaurant suggestions and reservations for us which was extremely helpful and really enhanced our time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but issue with TVs”
Reviews.Author: KitchieKai
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff was friendly and courteous. The Concierge was simply amazing - got me into Tetsuya the same day and did a lot of other work for me. Keep in mind that when you book an Opera View Room, it will only be a partial view, not full, which is a bummer as other hotels have the full view. There was an issue with the TV in my room - gave a fuzzy picture. I asked fot it to be fixed and it wasn't done. Only disappointing aspect.

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: CanberraFamilygirl
Reviews.Content: last year we stayed at the Four Seasons in Sultanahmet, Istanbul and we were just blown away by both the very special building and the service. Normally we stay at the Sheraton on the Park which we love, but given our experience in Turkey we decided to give the Sydney Four Seasons a go. I really can't fault anything - we booked a basic Harbour View room and had a stunning view of the bridge and opera house. We had added in an excutive club package, so perhaps as a result ended up on the 28th floor which was great. As soon as my husband saw the view he set up his tripod and camera and spent much time taking photos at different times of the day. Room was small but more than adequate, bed and pillows excellent. The Club was good - quite empty, which made a change from the Sheraton where it is a fight to the death to get a place to sit. Also you could help yourself to drinks which made it much easier than waiting for your initial drink. Breakfast was excellent with a chef on duty to make omelettes. Service was friendly and prompt. One thing we liked was the noon checkout - much friendlier as we don't like rushing to leave. However we were expecting a bit more after the Four Seasons in Sultanahmet e.g. there when we came back to the room we found book marks in all the books - a very thoughful extra. The doorman there knew exactly who we were and was very eager to offer assistance. In Sydney it was raining one night - we left the hotel, paused for a minute to consider the rain and then sent my husband back to get an umbrella. He had to convince the doorman that he was a guest and get one. I feel that we should have been asked if we needed an umbrella as we left or there should have been enough guest recognition that when we asked for one we received it without hesitation. We plan to stay at more Four Saesons hotels overseas, until I find out whether the one in Turkey was unusual or representative. I think we will probably stay at this hotel again, although I am not quite sure whether the 12 o'clock checkout and quieter club is enough to warrant the premium over the Sheraton. It was really just a standard Sydney 5* - nothing wrong but no wow factor either. (Of course we are probably quite blase about the harbour and opera house, so maybe for overseas visitors that would add something a bit special).

Reviews.Title: “good location,large room,beautiful lobby,pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: achif
Reviews.Content: like all 4 seasons hotel in general,you cannot be disappointed .we had a nice stay,rooms was large, quiet,comfortable,and a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “The Views Can't Get Any Better!”
Reviews.Author: alegria310
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 2 wedding anniversary at the Four Seasons Sydney. Oh wow, the location can't get any better! It is right next to the Circular Quay with unobstructed views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The Rocks neighborhood is within 5 minutes walk so there are lots of restaurant and shopping options. The Royal Botanical Gardens are about 10 minutes walk away for some quiet time in the city. Sydney is expensive, and so is the Four Seasons! We had originally booked a city view room, but since it was our anniversary, we chose to upgrade to the harbour view room. We were blown away when we walked into our room and looked out the window. The night view is just fantastic if you take a look at the pictures I included in this review. We went up to the Sydney Sky Tower and we both agree that the view from our room topped it by far. We couldn't even see the Opera House from the Sky Tower because of all the buildings in the way. So if you are going to stay at this hotel, you might as well upgrade to see the harbour, or else you can save money and stay in any other hotel in Sydney for a lot less money. The hotel sent us a nice reserved bottle of Champagne for our anniversary and wrote personalized notes to us. Definitely a nice touch! The one piece of warning I have for travelers using the concierge desk is to avoid Huey like the plague. The other people at the concierge were very knowledgeable and helpful. The two times I talked to Huey, I felt like he had no clue what he was talking about. For example, I told him I wanted romantic harbour view dinner for our anniversary. He said that Darling Harbour was too commercialized and so he sent us to Wallomooloo area. We ended up at this pier with no sight of the harbour and instead had views of docked boats. On top of that, the restaurant he recommended had horrible service. The other time I talked to him, I asked him for the exact location of the Japanese garden within the Royal Botanical Gardens. He promptly responded by saying there's no Japanese garden there. When I walked through the garden, I ended up seeing it and I felt like he should not be a representative of the Four Seasons. High speed internet is VERY expensive here. I suggest you find a internet cafe nearby and not spend the outrageous fees at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “STOP! JACKHAMMER IN USE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: viptraveler99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this property before, and am a frequent four seasons guest. I was stunned today to be checked in and to hear a JACKHAMMER on concrete above me. After complaining about the noise, and the lack of disclosure at time of reservation OR check in, I was moved six floors down. Still can hear the noise. DO NOT STAY HERE AFTER OCTOBER 20TH UNLESS THE HOTEL GUARANTEES YOUR QUIET ENJOYMENT OF THE PROPERTY!!! The views are great, the location is great, the place is a bit tired and not up to the Four Seasons standards. The GM recently retired and the owners need to bring this up to Four Seasons standards, but without suckering guests to take their money in the meantime.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, and great service”
Reviews.Author: JTG98
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay highlighted by the way the staff spoilt our two year old with a kangaroo and koala. Room had a good view and was neat, spacious and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--could be improved”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great views and great service.. However could be better: (1) Swivel chairs in room are not comfortable for reading or watching TV (2) credit surcharge for Visa/MC are a ripoff. Australia has the lowest credit fees of any EngLish speaking country (3) Internet charge of $30! Is highest I have paid. Why not have an email offering with a faster sped at a higher price? In London at the best hotels email is at no cost

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: blazeburns
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in Sydney and stayed at the Four Seasons near the Harbour. The hotel was first rate all the way, with a very attentive staff, and the location was absolutely unbeatable. The hotel is located right at The Rocks and Sydney Harbour/Opera House, two of the best places in Sydney to hang out. The Botanical Gardens are a short walk away, or a great place for a run. The rooms were very tastefully furnished, clean and modern. The staff was great. I was on business in Canberra and my wife flew in to join me when I was done. She arrived in Sydney a half a day before me, so I called the hotel and asked for them to arrange for flowers in the room, a spa appointment, and early check-in if at all possible. They took care of all of it without a hitch. When we'd come in from our morning run, the doorman always greeted us with a cold bottle of water as we walked back into the hotel. It's the little things like that that really make a difference. I can't remember the price we paid, but it was actually pretty reasonable. Maybe it was low season (coming out of winter but still pleasant when we were there), but I was surprised at the rate. I think it was better than the Marriott which is right nearby and that surprised me a bit. I've stayed at the Marriott, the Hilton and Four Seasons, each more than once. All three are nice. I like the Hilton - it has a great gym with a lap pool inside and the rooms are very chic - but the location is not as good. It's still only a 15-20 min walk to the Harbour, but why not be right there? The Marriott was nice and the location is just about the same as the Four Seasons, but I think the Four Seasons was nicer all around. The Four Seasons had a great gym, an attractive outdoor pool, great rooms, great staff, and a fantastic location. I think it gets my vote, assuming rates are all in the same general range for the three.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury location and rooms - food average”
Reviews.Author: ericagee1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on top of the Rocks area so perfect for all the tourist stuff around there. We couldn't afford an ocean view but as we walked out each day and saw it, didn't matter that much. We did have a wonderful room which was huge with beautiful bedding and towels - great TV and ipod docking station. Excellent service from everyone - friendly and helpful, including all the housekeeping staff which was noticeable. The only thing we weren't impressed with was the restaurant food at dinner. Undercooked beans in a soup - not what you'd expect from this class of hotel and to make it worse the manager dealt with us poorly when we complained. However, this wouldn't put me off going back. Nice lounge and bar area but live music was withdrawn during our stay and this would stop me staying there again, if it's not reinstated.

Reviews.Title: “Best room in town.”
Reviews.Author: Fairlawn38
Reviews.Content: Lovely room and service. Superb all round. Views of Harbopur bridge and Opera house from my chaise longue! Couldn.d fault a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: exoticquetz
Reviews.Content: My beautiful wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons for our 3rd anniversary for 6 nights. Just the hotel itself was an amazing experience! Neither of us had ever stayed in a 5 star hotel before (we always opt for the 4-4.5 stars, and 3.5 stars if we're absolutely desparate!), and for our first 5 star experience, it was just wonderful! I cannot praise this place enough! The bed was just the most brilliant, soft, wonderfully cloud-like thing we've ever laid on... Big screen LCD TV. Reception probably wasn't too flash, but bring a DVD and it's brilliant! And the tub - brilliant! I could keep repeating the words "incredible, amazing, wonderful, brilliant", as it's now permanently entrenched in our memories as the best hotel we've ever stayed in... The location alone makes it work paying for... Everything that makes The Rocks is right outside your door. We had a Premier Harbour View Room... For a studio room, it was very large... They even left a bottle of champagne on ice for us for our anniversary! If you can afford it, or if you can find a reasonable deal/promotion, stay here. You will not regret...

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: zkad
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located next to Circular Quay and The Rocks, the Four Seasons is just an amazing hotel. We stayed at the Opera View room and the views from our room were definitely a highlight of our trip. The hotel and its services are a bit pricey, but worth every cent. The mini bar should be called mini super market! Huge selection of wines, drinks and chocolates are offered in the room. The bed is ultra comfortable, and service / cleaning was perfect. On the negative side, like in all hotels WiFi was not free, but particularly expensive in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect; location, service, facilities.”
Reviews.Author: kiwi089
Reviews.Content: The best service I have ever encountered at a hotel. Fantastic location. Excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: JericoTraveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this hotel for several reasons. First, the location right near Circular Quay and the Rocks is great. It is easy to walk places or to catch a bus or ferry. Second, the hotel has a great fitness center with lots of weight and cardio equipment. It is more than adequate for the business traveler who wants to stay in shape. Finally, the concierges were helpful and knowledgeable. They went out of their ways to help guests and plan memorable excursions. One word of warning-- I reserved an "opera house view" room and would not recommend spending additional money on this type of room because the opera house was visibly only if you stood at the far right hand corner of the room and peered out. Otherwise the room has a view of the office building across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...not impress service”
Reviews.Author: Belle40
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 days holiday with my 2 and 4 months old son. The view from our room in fantastic. I really like the location as it is very convenience. However the guest service there was not impress at all. The staff doesn't look happy to help us anything. They don't look welcoming which is different from other staff. Staff at concierge are very very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location fabulous but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tez78
Reviews.Content: I regret staying here except for the location which could not be beat. it was so central to everything and it saved our holiday in Sydney. Unfortunately we had a bad experience at check in and it spoilt our time at this hotel. Check in took forever and without any apology which is not acceptable when paying this sort of money. I have been to 2 star property's and received friendlier and more professioanl service. The room was fine but again not up to expectations for this type of hotel. All up we were not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week while on business in Sydney. The room had a spectacular view of the Opera and the Sydney Bridge but everything else went downhill from there. To mention a few: 1. Waited for close to 3 hours to get a room after a 20 hour flight from Toronto while watching other guest registering and walking away from the reception with room keys 2. Ripped the lining of my suit jacket on a wire portruding from the seat cushion of the chair at breakfast (!!!!), the rip was stitched up with apologies a day later, sorry, but apologies are hardly sufficient under the circumstances 3. One morning waited over 10 min for the elevator to come up to the 24th floor where my room was located 4. One would expect bottled water to come with turn down service, never happened here 5. On going tug of war with cleaning staff who every day insisted on setting the AC 3 degrees below where I set it up 6. Had dinner one evening at the Cafe (Kables restaurant was closed), considering prices the food can be at best described as mediocre

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting bathtub and obnoxious and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Four Seasons in August, 2010. I arrived at the hotel and their computer system was down and could not check me in. They said they would write down my name and by the time I came back later in the day, my room would be ready. So, 8 hours later, I return and they can't even find my reservation. After waiting 30-45 minutes, they asked me if I had any confirmation that I had a reservation. Luckily, I had a printout of the confirmation with me and they finally gave me a room. The staff that was helping me was so obnoxious and unfriendly. After a long day, I get to my room and all I want to do is take a hot shower. The floor of the bathtub is covered in brown stains (see pictures). I have never seen a bathtub in this condition in even a 3 star hotel, let alone a 4-5 star one. The location is great, but there are other hotels in the area that can accommodate. A truly disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: ElMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I have stayed at the Four Seasons on a number of occasions as we are frequent visitors to Sydney. We have tried other hotels in between (Westin, Sheraton) but always come back to the Four Seasons. The location is hard to beat. The Premier Harbour View rooms are the best - spacious, comfortable and have amazing views. The beds are heavenly. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Mycafebar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the suite on a higher floor, it is a corner room which has fantastic view of both the Opera House, The Rock and the Sydney bridge. The services are very good , good recommendation for dinner. The material and furniture in the room are good quality. The bed is so comfortable, a plus. Great location and very convenient. However the hotel is very dated and really need a lift up. The food from room services is not up to Four Seasons standard. So we didn't try any of their restaurants at all.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Moosie57
Reviews.Content: Perfectly placed for Opera House/ Bridge? shops/ restaurants and ferry terminal. Hotel staff were superb and very helpful and friendly. They recommended tours for us and all were the best to be had and in small groups, which we prefer.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Esther_and_Ben
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around the corner from Circular Quay station so the location for transport and Sydney's sights is excellent. We were greeted by very friendly staff who got us checked in within the hour even though we arrived 7 hours before check in. We had a harbour view room on the 14th floor. The room was stunning with every convenience you could want. The view of the Opera House and Bridge was spectacular so you feel like you're experiencing Sydney if you don't even leave your room. Do be aware though, you can only really see the Opera House from the bed, you have to go up to your window to see the whole view. Also we booked in advance and got a good deal on the rooms but when we tried to book another night for the following week the cost was nearly as much for 1 night as we had paid for 3!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: AnnieR3
Reviews.Content: supplies were world class buffet breakfast had very wide selection nice business district very near my training venue my room had a great view of the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera house walking distance to all the tourist spots, shops and bus, train, boat terminals (Wow) doorman, room service people and all staff were efficient and caring stayed there on a winter and needed more body lotion, they gave generously 3 days after checking out I noticed I am missing a small part of my charger (half in dark square) and I was able to get it back... Amazing the cleaner noticed it was not just trash!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DivineMissMaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, specifically, because we had purchased a platinum show plus package through the Sydney Opera House and the Four Seasons is one of their partner hotels (the package voucher "paid" for one night out of two at the hotel). The location couldn't be better, just steps from the Circular Quay and The Rocks, and about a 10 minute walk to the Opera House. We had a low floor "city view" room with no view (probably because we paid with the voucher) and the room itself was rather smallish (and there wasn't enough room to put have both suitcases out of the way) although neat and tidy with everything working properly. The beds were quite comfortable. The L'Occitane toiletries (shampoo, lotion, soap) were first class and very nice. The front desk accommodated our mid-day arrival by trying to check us early into our room, but we had to go away and come back and still it wasn't ready until we planted ourselves in the lobby to wait. On the negative side, the business center hours were too restricted and the buffet breakfast (at $42) was outrageously priced for what they serve (ordinary fare -- there are plenty of other places to eat within a short walking distance). As far as Four Seasons hotels goes, this one rates about middling to average but the location is prime.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above & Beyond - everytime!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiSunSeeker
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay here for business - and the service is so consistently good, I felt moved to write a review. On my first stay I asked housekeeping if they had any hair straighteners (no problem - bought GHDs to my room). Left my phone charger behind - no problem, they have one for my phone. In short everyone I've encountered in the hotel is really nice and accomodating. The bed is lovely. The room service meal was tasty. The steam room was nice. There's a convenience store right across the street. There's a starbucks handy, and its an easy walk to circular quay and the rocks for dining. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Australia”
Reviews.Author: sjbsteven
Reviews.Content: Before I even walked in the door the service was fantastic. The check in was instant and I was upgraded. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Staff take the time to talk to you and nothing is too much trouble at this hotel. I was ill on arrival and the hotel staff were very concerned and looked after me. Staff helped me to a doctor and room service made sure that I was ok. I was always addressed by my name and staff did more than what was expected. My room had very nice views of the Habour Bridge and Opera House. The room was big, bathroom great and the best bed I have ever slept in. Because I was ill I had room service for meals. The menu is comprehensive and food great. I have stayed at a lot of hotels in Australia and overseas and none have been better than Four Seasons Hotel Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: usmc63m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons twice during our visit to Australia. Once at the beginning of the trip for 3 nights and at the end of the trip for 1 night. The room for the first nights was very nice with good views and such. The room for our second stay was awful. I can't remember staying in a smaller room. There was not even room to lay open two suit cases. I would never stay there again on the chance that i'd get a room that small. Additionally, for the money one pays to stay at a Four Season, you would think they would give you wi-fi for an hour a day or something. Their charge of $30 still irks me. It would be like charging for a drink flying first class.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, quality hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: InternationalLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days whilst in Sydney and we loved this hotel! A very comfortable stay with a good swimming pool and hotel facilities. Fantastic location - within walking distance to most harbour attractions. Service was very professional, we would stay here again for sure as the rooms were excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Elegance”
Reviews.Author: kevin33330
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is the best I have ever encountered. This hotel is right in front of the port and also in front of the central stops for all trains and buses. Definitely worth the money. I spent 8 days there and I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough but rooms too small!”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a couple of occasions for business, more for convenience as its right next to where I was working. The hotel is lovely, the rooms are a bit small though. Also - the housekeeping probably tidy the room up too much for my liking (my trousers were hung up in the wardrobe one night and my book made it to the underneath of my bedside table). I only complain about this as its one sure way for me to forget and leave things at the hotel - plus I don't feel overly comfortable with people touching my stuff!! The first week I was here, I asked if they had chocolate to go with the port I was drinking at the bar - the barman said there wasn't - but what a great idea that was - and sure enough the next time I stayed, I could order chocolate with my port. Sure it wasn't free like the peanuts, but it felt good to hear someone had taken a suggestion on board!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ive stayed at in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CheekyChops_xoxo
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have stayed at in Sydney. As a Sydney sider that might sound strange, but for work and various events, I stay at hotels in the city. My partner suprised me on Valentines Day 2010, he suprised me and took me to the Four Seasons, and also took me out to dinner in The Rocks. He booked us an Opera View room, which was beautiful! Im used to Sydney hotel rooms being quite small and cramped, but this one wasnt, it was quite spacious, clean, modern and nicely renovated. The view of the Opera House and Cicular Quay was fantastic. Even had a bottle of Chandon on ice for us in the room. The staff were so attentive and so helpful. The most polite and professional concierge staff I have ever experienced. From the valet, to reception, to the bell hop who delivered our luggage to the room, everyone was just on their game and so professional. Thankyou to the staff! The rooms were wonderful, and the bed so comfy. Ive not had such a great night's sleep in quite a while lol. The bathroom is stocked with L'Occitane products, very nice. I would definately stay here again, and happily recommend this hotel to tourists and guests of my home town Sydney. Im certain you wont be disappointed. Honestly did not have a single complaint or annoyance!

Reviews.Title: “Definitive venue hotel, classy service”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time this was the Regent Hotel positioned in the corner of Circular Quay - built with vainglorious pebblecreted outside reminiscent of the architectural vandalism of the era. Hence it is not a beautiful building but the rooms are a good size and well appointed and lit. Features fantastic service - the room service staff know your name as do the breakfast area staff. You can get some great deals on the rooms but be warned that services are expensive - room service, food ($42 breakfast buffet) and internet cost ($29.95 per 24 hours). Despite that, I went to breakfast everyday and paid instead of going across the street where I would pay $10. The first day I was jet-lagged but hungry. I was waited on by Intkawain (?) who was excellent. I asked for the International Herald Tribune - actually not printed in Australia - she told me she would try to find me a copy. After breakfast I went out for a walk and returned to my room to find her off-sider Siva waiting with a printed copy of the IHT. Next morning Siva is my waiter at breakfast and knows how I take my coffee and that I had the prunes the day before and they don't have them today but there are figs instead. The buffet selection was great. Other small touches - Doorman runs after me with an umbrella as I head to Belmondo, because rain is forecast for later. It rained. Left cufflinks at home, did not want to spend $60, gift shop on the 3rd floor had some for $32 - lady said I could look around and she would equal or better any price. She go some designer Ugg boots for one guy with big feet - seemed pretty happy. Bottom line, the hotel is full currently for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mossupp
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons arguably has the best location to easily access The Rocks and Circular Quay. The service is great, rooms are clean and an extremely comfortable bed - perfect for a long post flight sleep! Only negative is that the room service was expensive, but this is the Four Seasons! The Park Hyatt boasts a better harbour view, and is probably better for honeymooners, but for everyone else, save a few Aussie Dollars and book Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Vanessa
Reviews.Content: The four seasons was excellent, the location was perfect and the view from our room amazing with a view of the Opera House. The service was, as expected, excellent. We upgraded to the executive club which was a wonderful added bonus. The room was very comfortable with all that one would expect from a 5 star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money & poor management”
Reviews.Author: sydneyescape
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on our wedding night and it was the worst place i have ever stayed at. The view and room in general was very nice HOWEVER the shower was not working and was leaking water out of the drain, it wasnt just a small leak, it flooded the bathroom where i had my clothing placed and hair straightener. as a result my hair straigtner was damaged and i had no clean clothes to wear because they were soaking wet. When we phoned reception, management was notified and they stated it could not be fixed at that present time and they could not give us another room or at least a small reinburseement for the $410 we paid per night. i was absolutely disgusted. dont waste her money at this hotel there are plenty of better places in the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “So good, it looks like all those Sheraton reward points will be wasted”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRaptor
Reviews.Content: The world's most beautiful harbour and the opera house view are complemented by the quality of the fittings, furnishings, products, service and food at this hotel. We love a good king bed and this one is liking sleeping on air that also caresses you. We love room service and this food and the way it is served by the hotel staff is the best we've had in a decade in Sydney - and it's comfort food too! Plus they still have a turn-down service that isn't "on request"; complimentary shoe shine; and someone irons the newspaper and puts it into a bag to hang on your door! It's not perfect though - in three ways. First, as ever in hotels, housekeeping isn't entirely consistent and horror of horrors the top sheet on our first day had a tear in it! Second, the commitment to sustainability is very low key. The card that says " put this on your bed if you don't want the linen changed" is so discreet it took me 3 days to stumble upon it. And third, it's a tad noisy: the double glazing didn't do it's job very well; and the room/suite doors are particularly noisy, and the housekeeping staff using them bang them about unfortunately. However, we've been staying at Sheraton on the Park for more than a decade but the Four Seasons edges to first choice based on this visit. Sorry, starwood friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: markw_bd
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. You are a few minutes form the iconic Opera House and Harbour Bridge, and just around the corner from the Rocks. Can't really say much more than I'd be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The room renovations are sensational”
Reviews.Author: iaspinall
Reviews.Content: Canâ€™t rave enough about the Opera View room I had last night. Service on check-in / check-out was friendly and efficient. The room itself was huge, with a bed that makes you question if you really want to get up. LCD was bigger than the one I have at home and the dÃ©cor of the room was very contemporary â€“ actually makes you feel like you are in an exclusive boutique hotel and not the large hotel that it is...shame I was only staying for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: HubbysNumpty
Reviews.Content: Given that we turned up with scruffy backpacks earlier than the check-in time we were warmly welcomed by the doorman and reception. They stored our bags and got us our room early which had a great view of the Opera House. The room was great with the most enormous bed which I genuinely mourned leaving behind when we checked out!!! It was mega soft and comfy so be warned if you prefer a hard mattress and pillows. The room was cleaned daily to a very high standard, lovely posh smellies replenished. Had tea/coffee facilities, a safe as well as a mini bar and room service but we didn't use these. Also had a TV and ethernet internet connection, a tad pricey but ok. It was value for money as we got 3 nights for 4! Everyone was nice and friendly as you would expect and it was a fabulous place to posh it up for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a million dollar view”
Reviews.Author: Vinzeph
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at a Four Seasons Hotel (aside from Las Vegas and Jakarta) and it never fails to amaze me. Service was impeccable, location was perfect and the best part is that my room has a wonderful view of the Sydney Opera House. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - amazing service”
Reviews.Author: peard
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is exceptional. It may not be as modern as some of the other hotels in the city but it more than makes up for this with the service and personnel! Every staff member we encountered was great. From the concierge and porter to the desk staff we were very impressed. We had a city view king room which was the base room. We got a very good rate directly from the hotel website and this was for a saturday night. We were on the 12th floor with a view over the city. This room was very roomy in comparison to other sydney hotels we have stayed at. The bed was very very comfortable with a flat panel tv with plenty of channels to choose from. What I also liked was the fact that it had ipod connectivity to the sound system. The bathroom was beautiful with a separate shower and bath with excellent water pressure. Another great experience was that after we checked in at 3pm, we used towels and the facilities and unpacked our bags, when we came back from dinner we had new towels in the bathroom and our laundry was all folded for us with our bags on a fold out luggage rack - definitely not expected given we were only staying one night and already had 3 towels in the room! The location is another very impressive thing about this hotel. It is right on the corner of Circular Quay and The Rocks on George St. It is also a short (5 min) walk up George St to Pitt St Mall for more shopping. Excellent hotel - will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: CKF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney in The Rocks section for four nights in July 2010. We could not have been happier with the decision. The staff, especially Amanda, was especially helpful and always courteous. As our flight from the US arrived early in the morning and our room was not ready, Amanda arranged for us to freshen up in their spa before we ventured out to explore the city. After 24 hours of flying, we truly appreciated this. When we did get our room, we had the most phenomenal view of the opera house! The concierge was always available and polite. The hotel is perfectly situated for walking around The Rocks, which has delightful shops and many restaurants. Easy walk to The Bridge Climb, Circular Quay and the ferries, the Opera House, and the beautiful Botanical Gardens. It is a bit farther to Darling Harbor. We were sad to leave and would stay again in a heartbeat. Only downside was internet use was a steep $30 per day, so we did not use it. If you see a good rate, do not hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Name it self descibes the hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikey0417
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Sydney Australia, NSW. This Four Seasons Hotel Sydney is the best area to stay, and clean, very professional staffs. Good location, walking distance to Circular Quay, Oprah House, and right in a downtown district, and as well as walking distance to and from the train station. Room is quite large, very nice ammenities. If you are a U.S. citizen visiting Sydney, can be quite expensive. So, when you book this hotel, price is fare, but try to book with breakfast included in your stay. Also, best recommendations from the Kingsford Sydney airport to this hotel is to take a train out of the airport, get off at a circular quay station, and litterally 2 minute walk to the property.... Pleanty of night life around, restaurants. It is always Location, Location, Location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic. Excellent Service and staff with a positive attitude”
Reviews.Author: ErikRiyadh
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed 11-18 May for a leisure break and catch up with Friends. The staff are friendly, courteous, use your name at all guest contact areas. The buffet breakfast was wonderful with new variaties offered each day. Housekeeping very thorough and helpful. Pillows are a bit soft for my liking, but that's me. Location great. We visited the nearby Rocks area, took a ferry on Sydney harbour. All just minutes away. We will be back for sure! Erik based in Riyadh

Reviews.Title: “Still at the Top of its Game !!!”
Reviews.Author: Novemberbravo1974
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasonâ€™s Sydney as it hits middle age, is still at the top of its game. Originally built as the Regent Sydney in early 1980s this Hotel has been a rock in a market that has evolved and changed with the on going growth of Hotels in Sydney. So how does she rate??? The room wasnâ€™t the biggest hotel room Iâ€™ve been in but was very well appointed in general, The bed was ultra comfortable ( Little surprise Four Seasons sell these beds on the open market ) the facilities in the room very good, but the as well appointed as the bathroom was it was somewhat small regardless of all those lovely soaps and shampoos. A good TV and Sound System reasonable Internet if required and a good view rounded out the room. The Four Seasonâ€™s is located at Circular Quay offering easy access to everywhere in the CBD and moments walk to the Rocks area, Opera House and Sydney Ferries as locations go its pretty much perfect for Sydney ( Little wonder in later years the Shangrila and Quay Hotels opened in neighbouring blocks ) The location is hard to be critical of. Parking is strictly a valet proposition unless you want to use the nearby parking garages ( expect up to $50 per day ) Bus Stops and Trains are in a moments walk. Service is fast and efficient, The welcomes warm and the atmosphere classy. Bags arrive promptly which is always a good thing. The lobby has a very busy vibe to it and is very lively, The hotel features a wide range of distractions, The shops are nothing amazing or special particularly, There is a nice pool, apparently a highly rated spa according to all reports and 3 Restaurants in total. Sampling the lobby bar I can report it does A mean cocktail an ideal way to finish off any day with a nice Jazz trio that cool not loud and really gives the place a nice ambience. At $50 for 2 Cocktails its not the cheapest bar in town but hey you have splurge sometime. The in house restaurants includes Kabels which still enjoys a fine reputation a legacy of its even grander days but does not have the aura of exclusivity it used to once enjoy more due to Sydneyâ€™s very fickle dining culture than any failing on the restaurants behalf. The Lobby restaurant always had a reputation for solid food likewise. It can be argued the place lacks depth in choice and does not have the top class buffet the Sheraton on the Park has traded with for a decade or more now. There are no shortage of dining options in nearby areas which include many of Sydneyâ€™s best dining options. The Four Seasons is not A cheap hotel. Regular rates can be pricey and in a cut throat market like Sydney can be viewed as over the top, however savy shoppers can regularly score a bargain, if you put in the research in order to savour what is one of Sydneyâ€™s better hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Very nice, close to transport, attractions and much more...”
Reviews.Author: Mi33-Review
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Saturday the 3rd July, for one night - as I had a party to attend in The Rocks Looking at the hotel from the front, may not be much but what counts is what you see when you enter the hotel. Doors are opened for you on entrance to the lobby, Check-in was a breeze, lovely staff greeted you and where very helpful. Stayed in 1107, booked a city view room, was a lovely room. Huge King size bed, lovely bathroom with a shower, bath was seperate, all of the modern features. Rooms where really thought out well and were decorated really well. I'd recommend this Hotel to anyone Was a really good stay, I know if I ever have anything on and I need to stay over for the night I'll be booking here for sure. I pre-booked it through www.wotif.com my room was $200 As I didn't have a credit card, i was able to leave a cash bond of $200 So worked out really well for me

Reviews.Title: “Four reasons for the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Petessnaps
Reviews.Content: Courteous and attentive staff Fabulous food with entertainment every night Great location for access to main attractions and shopping Superbviews over the harbour to the bridge and opera house

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View!”
Reviews.Author: Cornish
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the hotel at short notice a couple of days before arrival and had no problems getting a Harbour View room with breakfast included. Arrived at the hotel very early morning after a long flight from the UK and asked if there was any possibility of me checking in. The receptionist was very helpful and arranged for me to be phoned as soon as the room was ready. In the mean time my luggage was stored and I was able to use the spa for a refreshing shower etc. I was notified within a couple of hours that the room was available and returned to the hotel to find my luggage already placed in the room. The room had wonderful views across Circular Quay to the Opera House and Bridge however was a little on the small size but not a problem for the one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Room small but comfortable, Bathroom tired”
Reviews.Author: NZTeamJJ
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in title, the location is fantastic, walk to the Opera House, the Rocks, DFS is right next door. Room is very comfortable and looks good but rather small. We went for the Opera view, true enough you see it very clearly from the window! but that only amused me for the first 10 minutes :) Bathroom is tired, clearly in need of refurblishment, not at the point of eeky yet so that was a relief. Breakfast overpriced at AUD$42 so unless it comes with the package, or if you received 'free' hotel credit to spend, walk to a nearby cafe at Circular Quay :) Huey at the Concierge was FABULOUS. Helped get us dinner reservations at Quay and Prime. Both of which were delicious :) Wouldn't say Quay is value for money but it does have a fab view of the Opera House and it is on the Top 50 restaurants in the world list so worth a try being a couple of minutes walk from Four Seasons :) Was great for our short weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Four Seasons Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaLeow
Reviews.Content: I would like to compliment Four Seasons on the exemplary service we received during our recent stay in Sydney. It was an excellent location in the heart of city center. As this is our first time in Sydney, your staff upgraded us to the 16th Floor Harbour View Room where we get to see the illumination of the sails at the Opera House. The attention to details was impeccable. Service of this caliber is rare these days and I wanted to be sure that you knew how impressed we were. Please extend my compliments to your staff. You have truly made our holiday truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Husband on Business Trip - Wife on Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Amanda650
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Sydney NSW. He was there for work, I tagged along. 1st off we are from San Francisco, and have done a bit of traveling. We have never been to Sydney and LOVED it. What an amazingly beautiful city. My husbands company made reservations for us at the "Grace Hotel" downtown. BLAH! It was a clean hotel but for a working traveler, not for someone coming into town from over seas. They were oversold and booked us in a room that had a view of a wall, and 2 double beds. We immediately jumped on expedia.com to find a new hotel. The Four Seasons had a room open. THANK GOODNESS. It was fabulous. The hotel is very well located, on the edge of the business district between "The Rocks" and "Circular Quey." My hubby was working all day - but the hotel was the perfect location for me to embark on day trips from. I could walk everywhere I needed. Walked to the ferry terminal, Opera House, The Rocks, down town Queen Victoria Building etc. I booked a hot stone massage at the spa...it was "so so." The Fitness Center was nice, the room was beautiful...view of the Opera House and harbor, the staff was great. We did not eat at the hotel. We tried Peter Doyle's at the Quay and Mad Cow. For the money they were awful. Peter Doyles had a great view, Mad Cow is a fun scene. The food was yucky at both. I took day trips on teh Bondi Explorer and Sydney Explorer. They were great options for me as I was traveling solo during the day. I took a solo trip to Manly via the ferry...that was easy and fun as well. Stay at the Four Seasons. Its great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Plush”
Reviews.Author: mansapatel
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would expect at the 4 seasons, beautiful bar on the top floor, fantastic location right in the heart of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location and the views”
Reviews.Author: cal_traveler2
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Four Seasons, and wish it could have been more. The service at the hotel started the minute we entered - with the doorman taking our luggage before we even checked in and arranging for it to be sent up to the room. The desk clerk called after we made it to the room to make sure the room was to our liking. The concierge was very helpful, giving recommendations for restaurants and arranging airport transportation. The room was everything you expect from a luxury hotel - fine linens, quality soaps, nice decor. The room was a bit small, but adequate. Given the size of the room, the TV was actually too large to view comfortably - a case of trying to provide more, but actually achieving less (also, why is it hotels cannot adjust TVs to the proper aspect ratio?) But we spent very little time looking at the tv - the view from the window was incredible - worth the price alone. The location was also unbeatable - just steps from the Circular Quay, the Rocks and the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: TheMulls
Reviews.Content: Checked out lots of reviews before the long weekend trip away and where to stay. Decided on the Four Seasons in the end. Was concerned about some comments that rooms were small Ours was a tad small, but at the same time very comfortable. My husband and I had a great stay there, easy walking distance to Opera House, Harbour Bridge, the Rocks and ferries to everywhere! Requested a room with a view of Opera House and we were lucky to get one that had the perfect view. I realise that some rooms would not get such a view but I guess that is the same for all hotels anyway. Staff were very polite, courteous and certainly gave us the 5-star treatment. Could not fault this hotel at all and would absolutely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Incedible Hotel with the most fantastic view in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JimSulks
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a four night stay overlooking the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Plush hotel with all of the amentities and a location that can not be beaten in Sydney. Walk to restaurants, shopping, transportation and the famous harbor area within minutes of the hotel entrance. Easy walk to Darling Harbour and other Sydney attractions. Beds are the most comfortable my wife and I have ever experienced and the views amazing. Train and bus facilities within a block of the hotel. Staff at the hotel were the best.

Reviews.Title: “5* hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: goldcardsoul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in the middle of May. On first impressions the hotel looked very grand and a nice hotel. Our first impressions of reception weren't so great. we arrived at 6pm (enough time for the hotel to organize our room i would imagine) and were we were greeted politely etc. but we were told that our room wasnt ready? like they wasnt expecting us. The person attending to us was messing around on the computer saying she needed to find us a room. She went off to speak to a manager who had a discussion in front of us about where to put us!! then we were told that we had a room and we were given the key and that someone would be to our room shortly to remove something from the room as it was someone else's room!!! - when i questioned this the lady was a little short with me and didnt understand why i would be questioning this. She told me that a member of staff would just be collecting something and would be gone. I dont think we needed to be told any of this and this should have been sorted out whilst she was serving us. Anyway the room itself was a full harbour view room, it was a beautiful room and was worth paying the extra for the view. The room had all the extras and nice touches that you would expect from a four seasons/5 * hotel. The bathroom was large and L'occtaine bath products to use. The bed was so comfortable we didnt actually want to leave. The hotel is in a fantastic location and you can see the majority of the major tourist spots on foot. There is circular quay station less 5 mins walk away and there is a number of restaurants and bars and pubs right next to the hotel. The concierge James was fantastic and very very helpful, everything you wanted to know he had an answer for and more times than not produced a leaflet to help you with. He even got us all the train times to the blue mountains and the best places to see and do whilst there. We didnt get time to use the fitness centre of the swimming pool but both looked really nice and i can imagine the pool is wonderful in the summer as it is an open air pool. Overall this hotel is a fantastic hotel and i would definitely stay there again but would hopefully receive better service at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: bedheadwlg
Reviews.Content: By Far the most comfortable bed I have slept in....and I have stayed in almost every 5 star Sydney hotel. The hotel feels like a palace and you leave feeling like a princess!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Staff = Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Travels2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for three nights to celebrate a special family birthday. We needed to take a suite (Harbour View) to sleep the four of us, and deceided to take the the Excutive Club option as well. The views from our suite 3308 were just fantastic, and gave us amazing views of Circular Quay, the Opera House, the bridge and in fact the whole of Sydney Harbour looking east. The suite was comfortable, but I must say I think the fold out sofa bed may have seen better days, as it was a bit lumpy, and the kids did complain about the comfort of it. The main bed however was fantastic. The only minor complaint was that the TV reception was not as clear as it have been. The Executive Club was really well worth the extra money, and the staff working in there were attentive, helpful and provided just a consistantly high level of real customer service that helped make our stay a great experience. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lozz13
Reviews.Content: Four seasons was the perfect choice for my short trip to Sydney. Located in easy walking distance of the Harbour bridge, Opera house, train station and restaurants. What more could you ask for? Customer service was exceptional and the rooms spotless. The only downside I could point out is that we paid extra for an 'opera view room' to which I found we could only see the opera house from our room if we squished into one corner against one side of the wall joined to the window. That I was quite unimpressed with as I don't believe that is worth paying extra for. Apart from that though, all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent service, Excellent Position”
Reviews.Author: Pjtj
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with excellent staff and a location to match. We stayed eight nights and found the staff to be extremely helpful and polite, and in most cases calling you by name. On arrival we found that we had not brought the correct key to unlock our suitcases, but a visit to the concierge had the problem under control. In less than ten minutes a staff member arrived, and when we told him it was okay to break the lock, produced a pair of boltcutters which promptly fixed the problem. The concierge also checked us in online for our flight home. Each day we had the buffet breakfast in Kables Restaurant and found the staff to be very friendly. We requested a high floor for our Harbour View Room and were thrilled with our 26th floor room, the views were spectacular. We will definitely stay here again, and would highly recommend the Hotel to anyone contemplating a trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE- DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl2010
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a Four Seasons Hotel you expect a certain level of service. At the very least, you expect people to at least be polite. However, I was appalled at the service that I received from this hotel's employees. I booked a reservations online and when I went to check in the price on the paperwork was TWO TIMES the amount of my original reservation. When I pointed this out to the hotel employee and SHOWED HIM THE PAPERWORK WITH THE CORRECT PRICE he told me that I must have changed the reservation and would have to pay the full amount. He was rude and unfriendly throughout the entire encounter. He finally got his manager who was even ruder and more condescending. They made us wait in the hotel lobby for AN HOUR AND A HALF while they got things "straightened out". They accused us of changing out reservation NO LESS THAN FOUR TIMES. If I had changed my reservation, why would I be wasting my time complaining?! Things happen- mistakes are made- everyone is human. But the disrespectful tone and language they used throughout the entire encounter was something that no one should have to experience. Plus the rooms are tiny and outdated. I have never been at a worse value for the money than this hotel. If I could give this hotel no stars I would.

Reviews.Title: “Best luxury location in city”
Reviews.Author: DonDiego4
Reviews.Content: Just steps from Circular Quay and ferries to all harbor locations, this is the best located lux hotel in NSW. Of course, it comes with Four Seasons best in class service. The rooms had all the needed luxuries and many have spectacular views of the harbor and city and opera house. Only minor flaw was the rooms are not large and the pocket doors to bathroom annoying.

Reviews.Title: “There is a lot to be said for old fashioned service...”
Reviews.Author: 40ishcouple
Reviews.Content: We often opt to stay in the lastest boutique designer establishments and have had a lot of great experiences over the years. But I have to say when you stay somewhere like the Four Seasons you realise that you've probably been tolerating pretty average service a lot of the time. The location is almost unbeatable with so many attractions on the doorstep and an easy walk to so many great restaurants,bars and shops. The views are fabulous - we stayed in a Harbour view room and although the bed faces away from the window the view is still quite stunning, especially given the price. We paid $295 via the Qantas website and would have to say that is tremendous value compared to other hotels of this calibre. The decor is still a little '80's and reminiscent of when it was the great Regent Hotel - THE place to be once upon a time. In saying that the bed was incredibly comfortable and one of the best we can recall. But without a doubt the best thing about the FS is the service. From the career Bell Captain and Concierge who called us by name to the cleaner we interrupted making up our room, the service was of the very highest standard at all times. As they say, there is a LOT to be said for good old fashioned service.....

Reviews.Title: “Flawless,Fabulous,Friendly Four Seasons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsisC
Reviews.Content: Flawless experience from the moment we checked in, we will definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fabulous well located hotel in Sydney,the overall rating should be #1 hotel in Sydney not #8 We loved it so much our friends booked a room too!!! This hotel has amazing service,the food is fabulous and after a beautiful dinner with friends,we returned to the hotel lounge bar to relax while sipping on the most delicious hot chocolate ever !!! Thank you to the friendly and ever so accommodating reservations staff who honored our request to have a room on one of the top floors. If you are deciding where stay in Sydney, The Four Seasons is a must :)

Reviews.Title: “Cocktails and grandeur”
Reviews.Author: FoodieinOz
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at the Four Seasons for a special weekend away with friends. As a fairly novice 5* hotel person I was very impressed with the professionalism and service in the hotel. My favourite aspect of the stay was the lively and amusing bar! I popped down for a little drink whilst waiting for my friends to get ready and was entertained by the lovely bar staff and gorgeously alcoholic cocktails! The room was great, I don't really understand the qualms about the Harbour View room, you can definitely see the Opera house from the window. There were no complaints there! The only fault in the stay was the wrong bed being booked for us. I booked through needitnow.com and specified a twin room. Unfortuntely when we arrived we were told that you cannot guarantee what room you are going to get if you use one of those websites and that we were in a king as there were no other rooms available in the entire hotel! I'm not sure how true either of those statements were and luckily I didn't really mind sharing with my friend. However, if I had then we would have had to change hotels! Aside from the mix up it was a great experience and I highly recommend lounging at the bar for some five star service and drinks

Reviews.Title: “Flawless touches from one of the all-time greats”
Reviews.Author: Tori171
Reviews.Content: Get the harbour view or the opera view room at The Four Seasons. That's what the experience is all about. Then enjoy the beautiful decor, so tastefully renovated with elegant finishes. Flawless turndown service and fabulous room service with delicious food. L'occitane toiletries in the bathroom. Soft beds with cool, soft sheets. Four seasons is what a 5* hotel should be. This is one of my very favourite hotels in Sydney that never disappoints. Top choice for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons is in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KYGlobehopper
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney on business the week of April 19th and stayed at the Four Seasons. It is a fantastic hotel. The harbor view room was very nice and the view was incredible -- opera house, Circular Quay, the bridge and the harbor were all in view. There is a weekend shopping market a few blocks away down George Street, with a European feel. I even made a video and uploaded it to youtube at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d8pItajPITA It shows an old man dancing in the shopping distract at the Saturday market. Its a great area to stay in and the Four Seasons is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: ffroggy24
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed at Four Seasons on a 3 night business trip. The room overlooked the harbour and had an amazing view of the opera house and the bridge. Absolute luxury and attention to detail. Location couldn't be better. Central to lots of great restaurants..too many to choose! Short taxi ride to the casino. Great service throughout the hotel, from the bell boy to the front reception, was very much appreciated. The L'Occitane bath products were an added bonus. Would definately recommend this hotel and will definately be staying here again! Never was a big fan of Sydney until this trip!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: Troi_10
Reviews.Content: With this being my first stay at the Four Seasons I was still quite impressed with the hotel after reading some negative reviews. One thing I did notice on check in was although the staff were very friendly and professional there seemed to be a lack of information given about the hotel and felt I was left to discover everything for myself. Stayed in a Premier City view room and was exactly like the pictures states which was great!! Fantastic bed and linen as you would expect in a 5 star hotel.Ordered room service a few times and was never disappointed! Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Once Great - Now Tired”
Reviews.Author: AussieStrategist
Reviews.Content: Our double room was too small for two people with luggage (just arrived from overseas). After setting up two suitcases on stands there was no room for two people to sit and watch TV in comfort. Good amenities but Sydney has much better to offer. Not up to Four Seasons standards.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Well situated.d”
Reviews.Author: neilbaird2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights whilst on honeymoon from the UK. We were staying with family on the Sunshine coast and used this as a short break whilst in Australia. We were impressed from the start. Very polite door and reception staff. We were unaware that our travel agent had informed the hotel of our recent marriage but were congratulated at the desk when signing in and after a brief walk to see the nearby opera house, found a lovely bottle of champagne on ice with glasses on our return, compliments of the management. A lovely touch. We were particularly impressed with the fact that despite the "poshness" of the hotel, no-one looked down their noses at a couple of scruffs like us in our shorts and flip-flops on the way out to the beach for the day. Having had deals like this before, We have often found ourselves obviously out of our league but not so with the Four Seasons. Food and drinks reasonably priced in the hotel itself (even room service which was available through the night).
