And situated directly across the road is the James on George pub which was excellent and friendly and also very reasonably priced with entertainment most nights. The hotel has excellent views of the Opera house and Harbour bridge depending where you are in the hotel and the very best rooms have views of both. Superb outdoor pool and spa which is available to all guests and also massage facilities etc. All in all a very lovely hotel right by the railway station and ferry services within easy walking distance of downtown Sydney or Darling Harbour with all its delights. Definitely worth a look. We both loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great spot”
Reviews.Author: OzfamilyAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in 2 rooms (king harbour view and city view suite) which easily accomodated 6 of us. This was one of the few hotels that was happy to put 2 rollouts in a twin room suite for our 4 teenage girls. We were also helpfully located on the same floor. The reservations staff I spoke to on the phone were very helpful (nice to talk to someone who actually understands the hotel rather than other chains call centres!) The location at Circular Quay is great and the harbour view was lovely. I liked the decor which was fairly dark but warm rather than sterile uber modern. The lobby bar was nice with comfy chairs and good selections of snacks. Rooms had good facilities and nice L'occitane toiletries. The tuning of the flat screen tvs could be vastly improved and although there was a nice selections of teas and coffees a biscuit to go with them would be nice. Well fitted out gym and nice outside pool. The access to the pool and the spa was a little open to the lobby and the restaurants so you tend to feel a bit exposed in swimming gear. Staff generally pretty good. Occasionally got lost in a service black hole in the bar and had a odd situation where a kids burger was different 2 nights in a row and the waiter didnt offer to make it the same. (would have cost the chef a piece of cheese and lettuce to make a kid happier!) Nice breakfast with plenty of options. Can get very busy but they usually opened up extra areas to accomodate everyone and we only had a 5 minute wait for them to find a table for 6. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to par.”
Reviews.Author: Pugadonis
Reviews.Content: The good.... Excellent staff - efficient, friendly and courteous. Central location - easy access to Sydneys CBD. Food - Very high quality; both room service and dining. The bad..... Thirty something year old building that been cosmetically tarted up. Worn out bed in our suite was quite uncomfortable (in a $750 p/night suite!) Old bathrooms have been fitted with new taps in an effort to make NEW. $12 for a glass of orange juice is a bit steep. Limited Foxtel. Swimming pool area is very old and sad. Parking at $45 p/night is extra. Verdict. The bad outweighs the good. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small regular rooms”
Reviews.Author: KellyGayle
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice and I love the bar and the location (it is a very "businessy" hotel). One time when we went it had a promotion for a free upgrade to a corner room that was amazing (the regular room i had before you could barely fit in your luggage and 2 people in...). You can walk to anywhere at this hotel and i liked the bar (although the hyatt is just a stroll away and has the most amazing views of the opera house).

Reviews.Title: “Comfort for a price”
Reviews.Author: sammiejoe78
Reviews.Content: Only booked the room for one night and it was very nice. Comfy beds, new tv (although not digital so quality was poor), flash bathroom...everything that you would expect. Room is on the small side, but not enough that you are cramped. Although, reading an earlier comment about the key cards, when first going to our room, we didn't count properly and tried to enter the wrong room and the key didn't work for it. So they don't work for everyone's room! Overall, not a bad place, but probably not worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “Agree with the last two reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Kit138
Reviews.Content: I share the views of the last two reviewers. I was quite disappointed with the view . . .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but too pricey”
Reviews.Author: dcribb
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Four Seasons which is very well located in the The Rocks area of Sydney. We were very impressed by the Front Office Manager of the Executive Club, Jane. We had booked an executive suite with harbour view at EUR 410 (approx US$ 550). Suite is a misleading name for this large room. The view was great, though. The lobby bar was less than we would have expected from a hotel of this price class, which meant that we had to go out for a drink and bite to eat, although we had just arrived from a 24 hour flight from Europe. On our return leg through Sydney we stayed at the Hilton, which was much better value, I have written a review about this as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but public areas and restaurant lacking in spirit”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus3325
Reviews.Content: This does not seem like a Four Seasons once you enter the hotel, although the rooms are quite nice. The description of the "opera house view" room by the hotel is not really accurate, as previously mentioned. The only view you'll have is if you walk to the far wall by the desk and turn your neck to the left, then you'll see the opera house. If you want actual "sweeping views", or views from the bed, then you'll have to book one of the larger rooms with a harbour view. I would advise that you phone the hotel itself for more information about the views. The public areas look quite dated and are very busy all day and night. It appears that it's not been updated since the eighties? The breakfast restaurant was totally packed all mornings we were there, although service was very good and the food was good. With all the hustle and bustle and lack of the usual chandeliers, flowers, nice rugs, etc., it did seem a bit more like a business hotel than a FS, but some may like that. The room decor is on the modern side, in browns and grays, and it does work well. Some of the staff were a tad off, lacking the usual polish seen in this brand, whilst others were spot on. We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental (next door) one night and found the views and service to be better but not the room decor itself.

Reviews.Title: “GM Trip, Four Seasons Hotel, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: reerob926
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the most opulent hotels I've stayed in. When you enter, it's breathtaking. Danish modern decor with dark woods and warm neutral colors, you enter the lobby and are compelled to gaze at artful ceiling. The central lobby is encircled by ascending spiral banisters winding toward the upper floors. Piano bar, ambient lighting and unbelievably attentive service make this place shine. The rooms are small, but beautifully appointed with marble bathrooms and contemporary furnishings (dark mahogony, heavy brocades). The beds were incredibly comfortable with at least 600 thread count sheets. Our room had a view of the Sydney Harbor Bridge. We were so impressed with the decor in this hotel, that we remodeled our kitchen after it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but deceiving advertising about the room views!”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker2503
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney for 4 nights at the end of March. We booked a Premier Opera View Room, with a special 4 nights for the price of 3 promotion direct through the hotel. Our room was on the executive club foor (level 32). The free night made this category room more valuable. The rate did not include breakfast but the Hotel were happy to provide buffet breakfast for an extra $50 total per night. So we had the breakfast on the first morning but then indulged in the many cafes near by in the Rocks district. If you want a luxurious experience in a large room with a bathroom big enough to be a small apartment, then this place is for you. The L'Occitane beauty products are a plus, as are the lovely dressing gowns and slippers provided. The Hotel also provides rooms with a daily newspaper upon request. The only 2 negatives about the Hotel room are: (1) the bed - if you like a firm matress, you won't like the bed. The mattress is extremely soft and has a top cushioned layer that can't be removed. My husband slept like a baby but I tossed and turned the first night and had to sleep on the couch on the second night. It was a real struggle for the Hotel to find us a firmer matress- they only had one which was being used on our first and second nights. Luckily it became available on our third night. Slept really well after that. (2). If you book a Premier Opera View room for the view, you may be dissapointed. The picture on the website suggests that you can see the Opera House from the bed. This is quite decieving. On one website the room was described as having "sweeping views of the Opera House". The onyl thing sweeping about the view is that you need to sweep from one side of the room to the other in order to see the Opera House. Because of the Hotel's architectural design, you can only see the Opera House if you stand right in the corner next to the office desk or sit at the desk. This is due to one of the Hotel's exterior wall blocking the view. There is only one Premier Opera View room on each floor of the Hotel, each being in the same location on the floor as our room so this problem would exist in any Premier Opera View Room. Otherwise, our stay was delightful and the location of this Hotel is ideal. The staff are extremely professional and attentive and the service is great. Would recommend this Hotel to anyone coming to Sydney for a short stay - pretty expensive for a long holiday. The gym is the biggest I have ever seen at a Hotel and the pool areea is lovely - they even hand out free strawberry smoothies to guests in the pool area. The Eastern Distributor (freeway) and train tracks run right along the Pool but we didn's find that this detracted from our experience at all. Overall a lovely hotel & we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: STomSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Four Seasons enroute to Cairns, wish we could have stayed longer as Sydney is one of our favorite cities. We got a great rate online which included breakfast, upon arrival we were upgraded to a club level suite. Great surprise!! We had a separate living room/office area and a nice bedroom with a king bed. The bathroom was large with a separate tub and shower, and great L'Occitane toiletries. The shower had some of the best water pressure we have experienced, wonderful to bask in after a long long flight from the US (30+ hours, but that was our fault). Our rate included breakfast and the breakfast buffet was very nice. Good selection and the food was fresh and plentiful. Locationwise the Four Seasons is great, walking distance to most CBD attractions and very central. I would highly recommend the Four Seasons hotel in Sydney. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Location from Heaven”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: Having been about 15,000 miles short of the next elite status on United Airlines, I took a miles grab trip from Los Angeles to Sydney between Christmas and New Years. Knowing nothing about the city, I relied on my travel agent who had some promotional discounts at the Four Seasons. Darn. I arrived early in the morning and took the subway from the airport, which dropped me a short 5 minute walk from the hotel. The night manager checked me in, and offered what she described as a "nice city view" room. I shot her my puppy dog eyes and asked for an opera house view, and she gave me a voucher for a free breakfast and told me to return in 2 hours. I did, and I, to this day, am still overwhelmed. The view from the room was dead on in front of the opera house, with a side view of the Harbor Bridge. It was spectacular. There are a dozen or so iconic views in the world, and this is one of them. To return from a day out and enjoy a night time view of the opera house and the Harbor Bridge is something that I will never forget. The rooms are not large or plush, but the room was clean and comfortable. This is a city hotel, not a resort. The buffet breakfast, included in my rate, was well above average, and the servers were on the ball with numerous different newspapers and plenty of advice. The service was good from beginning to end, from the waiters to the front desk to the bartenders. I had a great time, and would return in an instant. To the lady night manager who gave me the upgrade, thank you!!! I

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for seeing Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugalug
Reviews.Content: We have just had a fantastic week end in Sydney staying at the Four Seasons. There are so many beautiful areas of Sydney but this is a great position to stay in as a "tourist". The view of the harbour, bridge and Opera House is beautiful and it is a very easy walk to the steps of the Opera House. You are only steps away from the ferry terminal which can take you to all the other Sydney highlights. The rooms have recently been renovated - (the beds so comfortable) and the service was excellent. This would be an ideal hotel choice for an overseas visitor looking for the perfect Sydney position.

Reviews.Title: “A top quality hotel on every level but be warned, the basic rooms are on the small side”
Reviews.Author: hamishthedog
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference but the location, on the edge of circular quay and the rocks is fantastic. I was up early every morning to go walking and make the most of the location. Hotel is top class throughout. It has quality facilities, from the foyer to the unusually good gym. Breakfast area is a very attractive atrium. Food was pretty solid, although I have seen better ranges of hot food. They were happy to make coffees to order at no extra cost, which was a plus. On the other hand, you're not short of good outside options in this location. Service is extremely attentive, which some will love and others will tolerate (I fall in the latter category). My room was beautifully fitted with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Great bathroom including quality L'Occitane soaps etc.. However, the basic room size is pretty compact in my view (small would be a more honest assessment) and I overlooked a pretty non-descript view. Probably worth shelling out the extra for a larger room and harbour view if you're staying for a special occasion. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone happy to spend a bit for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Seasons WIth A Few Sharp Edges”
Reviews.Author: ChuckC
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, sleek property, well located and proudly displaying the Four Seasons name. The front door staff are well groomed, polite and friendly. The concierge staff are helpful. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. Formerly managed as a Regent hotel the FS Sydney recently underwent a renovation and was re-flagged as a Four Seasons. Now, of course, everyone expects a Four Seasons experience. There are clearly a few sharp edges, however, that need to be smoothed, such as: * Adding a surcharge to your bill if you use a credit card -- no, I'm not kidding -- with no advance notice, an anti-customer behavior * Charging AU42 per person for a typical buffet breakfast -- yes, 42 (and the eggs were cold) and having no alternative dining at reasonable prices; anti-customer behavior * Placing noisy kids in rooms near guests preferring a quiet, Four Seasons experience; tone deaf behavior * Holding a huge, noisy cocktail reception for a convention group in the main lobby; anti-brand behavior * Charging AU25 per day for use of the hotel's Internet (does everything in this hotel cost twice what it does elsewhere?); anti-customer behavior By pushing discounted room rates all over the Internet the Four Seasons Sydney likely has improved its bottom line. But at what cost? If you are a typical FS guest, expecting the quiet, pro-guest experience be forewarned. This is not a full Four Seasons experience, at least not yet. When you relay a problem and all that the front desk staff can do is blush and apologize, you know the hotel's sharp edges will be there for awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LizQ
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night before flying back to UK. Booked through Travel Republic and got a really good rate including breakfast. Service was excellent as was the room - cityview but we actually had a view of opera house more than city. Breakfast choice was great. Would definitely stay here again if we could get it at a reasonable rate

Reviews.Title: “First impressions good, but a disappointing finish”
Reviews.Author: AnnFelicity
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable city centre hotel with rooms of the standard one would expect. We checked in early and were impressed that our luggage had already been put in our rooms when we returned. After that there were some niggling disappointments. A lack of biscuits on the tea tray seemed mean - even modest hotels provide these. Next morning the advertised free muffins in the lobby were unavailable and no-one seemed to care. When we checked out we found that 1.5% was added to the bill when paid by credit card. I have never experienced this before and I must say it sends the guest away feeling disgruntled.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Melbourneguy
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Sydney is looking fresh and stylish after a refurbishment of their rooms. Our room overlooked the Opera House which was especially nice. The decor is crisp and minimalistic but not clinical. I liked the use of darker woods with the contrast of white duvet covers and turquoise cushions. Toiletries are L'Occitanne which is a nice touch, Im not sure if the public areas have had an update, I would assume not as the furnishings look tired. As for location, you are down on the waterfront which is great for sightseeing but shopping is a schlepp and negotiating Sydney's buses is a nightmare. I selected this property because they offered a great rate for a 5 star hotel. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mitchie737
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days pre cruise and found this a typical passing through hotel everything average including breakfast and rooms the swimming pool area was very basic but in fairness sydney has sooooo much to offer who would want to sit by a boring pool the best thing about this hotel is the location it is close to the beautiful Sydney Harbour and many restaurants and a nice shopping Mall called The Gallaries where you can buy tax free goods, passport needed . Mitchie 737

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaceYork
Reviews.Content: You can't fault the location of this hotel for a visit to Sydney. The Four Seasons offers excellent services and facilites with amazing views. Unfortunately breakfast wasn't included but there were plently of local cafes to choose from. Everything is within walking distance. The airport is also very accessible as the train station is two minutes walk away with direct frequent trains to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming for a Four Seasons establishment”
Reviews.Author: lilingenue
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Four Seasons hotels in the world, this is a decidedly underwhelming hotel in terms of decor and space, especially if you decide NOT to book one of their pricier harbour view rooms or suites. Still, it is a very good hotel with the Four Seasons service that they're well-known for, and it has an excellent location which makes it easy to explore The Rocks area of Sydney, along with its historical sites/pubs. It's also a stone's throw from the ferries, so it's very convenient indeed. I was definitely disappointed though in the lack of the little touches that usually make Four Seasons hotel stays memorable. Although they had their prerequisite L'Occitane shower gel/lotion/soap, there were no bedroom slippers, toothbrush or shaving kits available...I had to call housekeeping to ask for those. Call me a lazy traveler, but if I know I'm staying at a nice hotel, I generally skip bringing the basics to lighten my travel bags! The room was also VERY small, and you had to play music through the TV, which made for rather poor sound quality. Also if you're expecting a lot from the pool area...don't. A highway runs right over it, and it is VERY small. Still, at least there's a pool...those don't seem to be Sydney area hotel standard!

Reviews.Title: “All in all the BEST hotel stay we have had thus far ..”
Reviews.Author: taylormtran
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel for a surprise 3 night 10th Wedding Anniversary stay for my wife and I after extensively researching all the hotels around Harbour area. I am glad to say that the Hotel definately met up to my expectations and made our anniversary a memorable and special event. The room was elegant and romantic with a picture perfect view of the bridge and opera house that look every bit as amazing as the promotional pictures. A boquet of our wedding flowers was presented in the room as I had requested and a little later a complimentry bottle of champange was delivered. I booked the executive club level so we definately enjoyed the elegance and quiet during our breakfast (with eggs made specifically for us every morning) as well as a great open bar and canapes in the afternoon. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout but in particular the club staff were amazing. The bar staff presented us with a lovely Anniversary plate with chocolates and even the lobby pianist somehow knew and played our wedding song ! We found all the hotel's amenities to be great .. we used the gym, swimming pool and day spa and the location of the hotel was second to none. A final note .. were totally dissapointed by a dinner cruise we attended one night but this was totally forgotten when we had room service setup and amazing dinner by our window so we could enjoy a romantic seafood dinner against the harbor lights backdrop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Cath0508
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Four Season's for 4 nights. Check-in was brilliant, so fast and curtious the bags where whizzed up to the room for us. On waking the next morning in our room on the 26th floor we had a lovely view of the Opera House. The room was large, and had the MOST comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The En-suite had both bath and shower and the wardrobes where large. I cannot possibly describe how the little touches such as adapter plugs make this hotel very special. Breakfast is out of this world and there is something for everyone even fresh honey straight from the hive! The Four Season's is in the perfect position for sightseeing as it is right by the Central Ferry terminal and you can also walk in a few minutes to the Opera House, Bridge and Rocks area. Room service breakfast is a treat, definetly make sure you try it at least once in your stay. On departure we where offered, Coffee, Newspapers and also bottles of water for the taxi ride. Would I stay there again? Oh Yes I would go again tomorrow if I could!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: melbournetraveller24
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in an excellent location, perfect for exploring Sydney by foot. We very much appreciated our early check in, and found all staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. The concierge in particular was very helpful with planning our day. It was a pleasure to experience such good customer service! We loved the wonderful view from our opera view room on the 24th floor, and also thoroughly enjoyed th pool and spa. The room was very spacious and comfortable, with good quality bed linen and toiletries, and many thoughtful details. The complimentary Birthday cake was a lovely surprise! An excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “A superb Hotel in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: the_cadmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 2 nights in Sydney, prior to a 7 day tour of Australia and what a starting point it was, the Hotel service, Food and rooms were all superb, with the room service just exceptional. However the main reason for staying at the Four Seasons, would surely be an simply outstanding location, near to the lively and enjoyable area of 'The Rocks' and the 'Circular Quay' and the 'Opera House' which are all just a few minutes very pleasant walk away. Finally we upgraded to a Harbour view room, with views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge, which at about Aus$60 a night extra was a little high, but when you see the view it's well worth it, if theres a better view from any Hotel in the World, i'd like to see it !!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Marcothepolopony
Reviews.Content: I booked an Opera House view room via Needitnow. I was delighted with my room. The Reception service, check-in and check-out was flawless. I will be returning to the Four Seasons when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous. 5-star without doubt.”
Reviews.Author: PistolPete2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. You can see all the obvious benefits from the website, eg location, facilities etc. So I won't repeat. But I would like to mention a couple of things which are the reasons I would go back. 1) The staff. Tina, the concierge, helped me organise dinner and drinks for some friends at a local venue. We hadn't been able to book previously but Tina got us in because she knew the manager. Crucially for me, I was able to give the details to Tina, then go and do some sightseeing, and Tina would have updates waiting for me when I returned. Therefore she totally owned the issue so I didn't need to worry about it. Great service. Also, Jane in the Executive Club lounge was very friendly, courteous and helpful. I had a problem getting my phone to use an Aussie sim card, and Jane helped me by letting me try the card in her phone, and also called the phone company for me when I found the website unclear. Brilliant service again. Other staff I met, particularly at breakfast, were also great. 2) The breakfast was superb - a great selection of fresh food. Everything you could imagine. And the breakfast restaurant is on a mezzanine level overlooking the lobby which is great for people watching and creates a lovely vibrant atmosphere. There is a great pianist playing too. It's a great place to stay, particularly for exploring the Rocks area, ie the Opera House, Botanical Gardens, Sydney Harbour Bridge, and getting ferries from Circular Quay. You can also walk into the city centre in about 15 mins. I stayed here for the first two nights of my trip to get my bearings and get some sleep after a long flight. Wish I could have stayed longer too!

Reviews.Title: “The Partial View”
Reviews.Author: Dicey09
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay if you're a local and/or traveler. Having stayed here on several occasions we were surprised to find that our Opera View Premier Room looked onto office blocks. The view of the Opera House was there . . from one of the windows if you stood to the side and looked out. It does mean that one needs to ask the right questions when booking. I was surprised by the Four Seasons lack of transparency in this regard as we have enjoyed many memorable stays on previous occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Four Sesons in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: JGSwick
Reviews.Content: Great Harbour loacation. Good view rooms are available, but many can be sent to the side, with limited view of the beautiful Harbour. Functions as a city, overnight hotel not a Four Seasons Resort. High quality location, but with a very busy crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: moomoocow04
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservations through Amex (Platinum card)on line with the promise of an upgraded room, breakfast and other amenities. Upon arrival I was told the booking did not count as an Amex booking (Amex logo all over the form) and I would receive nothing extra. Both Amex and the Four Seasons are quilty of a "Bait and Switch" scam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best location for seeing the city of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: esd3104
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons, Sydney for 4 days between Christmas and New Year's. The location couldn't be better for walking around the city, and catching the ferries, and the service was excellent. The rooms aren't huge, but still a nice size and are clean and up to date with a beautiful bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “The start of the Four Seasons Obsession”
Reviews.Author: Perfect_Island
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Sydney for our anniversary. Service: As soon as our taxi arrived, the doors were opened, our luggage was whisked away and we were walking through the grand foyer. Ther service was exceptional. We got a card and champagne for our anniversary! Room: The room was nice, it was a city view, but it was modern with great tv, bathroom etc. I loved the L'Occitane products... Cleanliness: Exceptional as you would except. I left my facewash in the shower and thought that it had been thrown out. I was a little dissapointed till I discovered that it had been put on top my make up bag! Food: The cafe foccacias were tasty and of great quality. The bar though expensive was good. I was a little surprised to see such a busy bar (on a Saturday night). It's where I discovered Orange Pekoe tea... Location: For a tourist was great. I had booked into some great restaurants and it was close to most of them. Near the rocks, the harbour and the bridge. Perfect walking distance to everything. It's my first Four Seasons stay and I hope it won't be the last!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: freyaNsw
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 premier city and opera view rooms over nye and we found everything great even though the hotel was full it did not feel busy The only problem was putting us on a low level even though booking in february Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great service best location”
Reviews.Author: dlvanr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for two nights to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday. He was climbing the bridge and we wanted to stay within walking distance. The location was fantastic and the service was 5 star all the way. We arrived at 10.30am after a very early flight and our room was available for us straight away which was just excellent. Everyone was so friendly and helpful which made our weekend in Sydney very memorable. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent functional hotel in downtown Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: MagicalMysteryTours
Reviews.Content: In our experience service in Australia is typically of a poor standard. Not the case here. Having stayed here on 6 occasions over the past 12 mths we have not been dissapointed once. Good value with nice views and very good service. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, could do better”
Reviews.Author: WonderingSnob
Reviews.Content: We liked: 1) The restaurant 2) The gym (one of the best hotel gyms I have seen) 3) The spa 4) The staff Did not like 1) Internet not included (a hassle, prefer hotels that include internet in their rate) 2) Front desk is understaffed (long check-out / check-in), check-out took us >20 minutes and on the two occasions we called reception we were put on hold

Reviews.Title: “Less impressive than other Four Seasons hotels”
Reviews.Author: luckyexpat
Reviews.Content: LOCATION was perfect for us - ideal for wandering the Rocks and finding shops and restaurants, seeing the Harbor, and catching buses or ferries. We had adjoining "Opera View" rooms not terribly high up, and while it it true that you can only see the harbor and Opera from certain corners of the room, that was expected (it is not the highest view / room category), and we were excited and happy with the views we had. The rooms themselves were quite small and ordinary, but the bathrooms were large and well-appointed. SERVICE was somewhat disappointing. We arrived early in the morning, after very long flights with two children, and while willing to hang out by the pool (though we had to change in a small, un-airconditioned bathroom) for several hours, we were frustrated that even by 2 pm, when it was raining on the pool deck, and despite repeat responses from the front desk that they were expediting our room, we still had no place to relax. VERY unlike receptions at every other Four Seasons hotels we have stayed in - essentially very impersonal and unconcerned. Although reception told us we could "absolutely" begin charging food and beverages (our package included a F & B credit we wanted to use) to our room, the pool staff regretted that they couldn ' t find us in their system and we had to dig out a credit card The POOL, while perfectly clean and adequate, was not huge and quite ordinary, and right by an expressway (rather a surprise when billed as "the nicest outdoor hotel pool in Sydney"). Again, nowhere near comparable to any other Four Seasons facility we have encountered. POSITIVES: The SPA was far nicer - the staff warm, helpful, and very competent, and welcomed the whole family in to the showers when the rain forced us off the pool deckand we had no where to go (the lobby seats seemed full, presumably of other poor souls waiting for rooms to be ready). I enjoyed a relaxing massage and the steam rooms, and the lime water was the kind of thoughtful touch that DID seem up to standards. The FOOD was also worthy of the Four Seasons name (and price). The "continental" buffet breakfast was extensive and fabulous - including smoked salmon, cheeses, all kinds of breads and fruits and juices. Room Service options were also very tasty and beautifully presented (although - service again - the kitchen first sent up the wrong dish for one of us. They quickly fixed their mistake when alerted).

Reviews.Title: “lovely as always”
Reviews.Author: BOBOKolding
Reviews.Content: we have just stayed for 5 nights at the four seasons in Sydney. We travel quite a bit and usually try to stay with the four seasons whenever we can. And yet again the lovely chain did not let us down. Although the hotel might seem a little old and not updated in terms of the hotels decoration, the service and the staff is so excellent in every way, that it truely always is a great pleasure for all members of my family to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Living it up”
Reviews.Author: kellie_bell
Reviews.Content: This hotel's service was so incredible that it made us feel like celebrities!!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Service, Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: sidzy
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, there is no doubt about it. Infact that is what made me choose the Four Seasons above the others. The rooms were quite small, which was disappointing to see upon arrival because they looked bigger in photographs. The service was pathetic. They made me wait for a couple of hours to check in, despite the check in time being 15:00hrs. This was absolutely crazy cause me and my wife were exhausted when we reached the hotel. I finally got my room at about 17:00hrs and with a few things missing in the room. The concierge too were not very helpful. I needed to get a package dropped off to a friend living barely a 500m walk from the hotel that was arriving the day of my departure from Sydney and they were not willing to do it. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Sydney. Plenty of other nice hotels in the area around it, go for them! Also, another great area to stay would be the Darling Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms OK, service good, location fab”
Reviews.Author: woolloomooloo
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable. The spa was great and able to accommodate all our special requests, even at short notice. The rooms were OK but then we did get a pretty good rate, so shouldn't really have been expecting a Harbor or Opera View. Nancy at Check-In was super friendly, helpful and veeeery patient with us. Luke at the Concierge Desk saved us a couple of hours by helping us with our rental car return. The TV/cable service was being upgraded during our stay, so we had some trouble with our in-room movies, but we weren't charged, so no real harm done. Cocktails were ridiculously expensive. Good compromise between business and leisure hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, service and rooms; dated facilities”
Reviews.Author: Genob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. We found the staff friendly and helpful and the room was spacious and very nice. Both were up to typical Four Seasons standards. As some of the other reviews here noted, the common areas do seem a little dated (reminded me a bit of the Four Seasons in Vancouver or DC) and the fitness facilities are in need of expansion and updating. Those aspects were not what I'd typically expect at a Four Seasons. The location is perfect. I would stay here again when I return to Sydney (and get my fitness fix with a run across the Harbor Bridge or around the botanical gardens.) We did not try the restaurants at the hotel. Internet charges of nearly $30 a day seemed outrageous too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Location”
Reviews.Author: LaDolceVitaNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to Circular Quay so very convenient to the ferries, opera house and Harbour Bridge. The rooms and hallways are nicely renovated, the rooms are very spacious and new. However the exterior of the building and the lobby are very 1970's, and could use a little face lift. I would also say the breakfast buffet leaves much to be desired for $45/per person, there should be an omelet person, berries, waffles etc., we have stayed at many Four Seasons and the breakfasts are always wonderful, this one was quite poor especially for the price. The pool in person is much less impressive than it looks in the pictures on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Solid property but the service isn't perfect”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property with a good location in the center of the business district. The rooms were quite large and the views of the Opera House (from a Harbor View room) were quite nice. The main lobby is a little dated but still attractive. Housekeeping, bell staff, concierge and front desk staff were all what I would expect at a Four Seasons; however, the service in the main restaurant was quite poor. Wait staff at dinner were rude and were visibly annoyed that I wasn't having a large dinner. Service at both breakfast and dinner was minimal / unattentive. With respect to breakfast, this is one of those places that is clearly used to having most guests select the buffet. As a result, they aren't used to paying attention to a la carte guests. It took forever to get a menu and my order took a very long time to arrive. Coffee was also re-filled infrequently. If I were to stay here again, I'd request that they leave a pot on the table. I would not choose this property vs. other hotels that I have visited in Sydney. With the AUD as strong as it is, it is fairly poor value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “3-4 Stars at best”
Reviews.Author: travellotus
Reviews.Content: The regular rooms are small. Opera view rooms only have a view of the Opera house if you are perched along the window, pressed against a wall. There are only plain views of the Opera house (so the hotel staff tells me) if you are in a Harbor View room. For those of you that stay regularly at Four Seasons; service is not what you can expect at a typical Four Seasons. It's on par with a Hilton at best (I originally would have said Hyatt, except the Grand Hyatt in Melbourne was aces above this hotel.) Kables restaurant has wonderful service and food at night. The food and service during breakfast is mediocre. Reception is exceptionally inefficient, we waited 45 minutes for them to resolve a problem with our room. 45 minutes and 5 telephone calls. After that, they attempted to check someone else into my room, while I was taking a shower. Good thing their deadbolts work. When I asked to speak to a manager, she dodged my request in every possible way. The bellhop dropped my bags in my room and ran out without offering to put it on a luggage rack for me or explaining anything in the room to me. When we arrived at the pool, there were only four other guests. After 45 minutes, the waiter still did not approach us. I opened my own door (both car and front hotel lobby doors) almost every time. The doormen and bellhops were very busy joking with each other. Housekeeping did not seem to vacuum at all. Also, when I first arrived in the room, the garbage can was still full. The good things: The concierge is excellent, as always. Tina is especially helpful and resourceful. The location is absolutely prime. The business center had good service. After receiving my guest comment card, the general manager sent me a letter apologizing for the service I received and credited me a bit of money back to my credit card. This is the only reason I did not give this hotel 3 stars. My honest suggestion is that unless the rate is under $180, spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Sydney Stay”
Reviews.Author: rag714
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for our Sydney stay. The Four Seasons location couldn't be better as it is in The Rocks and close to Circular Quay and most of the city center attractions. In addition there is the famous Four Season service which never disappoints. Our room was a Premier Opera View room on a 27th floor corner and, although it was nice having a view of both the Opera House and the city skyline, we would have had a better view of the Opera House itself in a regular Opera View room. We also could have had a view of both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge if we had booked a regular Harbour View Room. However, we took advantage of a special that offered three nights for the price of two nights that was available for Premier View rooms only. The room itself was quite large and well-appointed. We did not eat in the hotel so can't comment on the restaurant. We enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, theres nothing else to say........”
Reviews.Author: Mrsthomo
Reviews.Content: For our last night in Sydney we decided to stay in The Four Seasons, we couldn't have made a better choice. We were surprised with an upgrade to a gorgeous room on the 33rd floor with stunning views over the harbour and then further surprised with a bottle of bubbly and a card from the manager congratulating us on our marriage. We had cocktails in the bar before dinner (fab selection) and then had a sumptuous meal in the plush yet understated Kables (have the Chateaubriand it's great), we were impressed with the selection of wine by the glass which enabled us to sample a number of different wines with our meal. Staff in the restaurant were very friendly and attentive without being over the top. After dinner we headed back to the bar to listen to the live jazz and sample a cocktail before retiring to our awesome room.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible location with incredible service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingThru56
Reviews.Content: Whilst this Four Seasons is much larger (much!) than the equivalent Four Seasons in the USA and Asia Pacific, it doesn't lose any of its intimacy or exclusivity. The views are truly incredible - we had a hotel overlooking the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. The rooms themselves are very classical but still have modern touches and flourishes. We didn't dine in the hotel for any meals other than breakfast and whilst nice, it was really like many hotel breakfasts. I recommend getting out and exploring the city and maybe finishing off with a night cap in the lobby bar. Great stay with amazing service you expect from Four Seasons. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a perfect Sydney location with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Courchevel
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in a perfect Sydney location with 5 star service. I cannot emphasis enough the excellence of the service I received while at the Sydney Four Seasons - my room was attended to promptly during my five day stay (at least twice a day) and each request I made of the front desk, housekeeping and room service were immidiately addressed. The Concierge Desk was beyond outstanding as I interacted with them on a daily basis from restaurant suggestions, directions, the best place to purchase hand rolled cuban cigars, tourist attractions, they even four friends and myself access to a private nightclub on a Saturday evening at the last minute (Luke and Jorge are outstanding at their jobs and excute everything in a professional manner, well done gentlemen). The Four Seasons location is excellent for accessing all the city has to offer while not directly "on top" of all the hectic touristy locations. The only hotel that I consider in the same category in Sydney with the Four Season is the Park Hyatt which is somewhat inconveniently located in my opinion. While in Sydney I stopped into the Westin at Martin Place (which appears to be a newer property) - the room size was OK, but the Westin lobby lacks the intimate feeling of the Four Seasons and instead feels more like a mall than an upscale hotel and is annoyingly loud. As a comparison, by the 2nd day of my stay at the Four Seasons the lobby staff was addressing me by name. The view from my room was outstanding (Harbor View Room on a high floor) - generally speaking the room furnishings were adequate and what I would expect from the Four Seasons, although I have stayed in other Four Season properties with more updated rooms. Overall room comments as follows - rooms are a tad small, bathrooms are a tad small as well, nothing that impacts the overal stay, but worth mentioning. Beds/linens were outstanding, and overall appearance of the rooms are excellent. Would be nice to have remote controlled curtains and an updated sound system, listening to my iPod through the TV (flat screen) speakers (all required connections provided in the room) leaves a little bit to be desired. Overall - outstanding hotel with top rate professional staff in the best Sydney location. The Four Seasons is the best Sydney offers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: SEPIKMERI
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of my sister and one of her neighbours, both who had stayed there for business. This hotel ticks every criteria, it is fantastic! I booked a room with a harbour view, this alone was fantastic, looking out at the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. I slept with the curtains open all night. I arrived late around 8pm as I had been with friends in the Blue Mountains, so ordered room service. This was outstanding and the food was delicious. In general, I found the staff only too helpful, they really made you feel special. The hotel is in a great location, close to the Rocks, Circular Quay and the Opera House. It is a short walk up George street to the main shopping area and department stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, facilities and especially the staff”
Reviews.Author: jeyno
Reviews.Content: A refreshingly pleasant place to stay when on business. The staff are what makes the difference in this hotel - they are clearly focused on what residents might need during their stay and ready to make sure guests interests are attended to before they cover rest of their duties. It makes a big difference... thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, efficient service - strange room shapes”
Reviews.Author: belladonna01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and it is in a great location, the service is efficient rather than friendly and it is very reliable. One thing that is quite odd about hte property is the angular shape of the rooms . Overall quite ok, however...................

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage888
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for exploring Sydney! We walked to so many places and the ferries our just down the street. With views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, I can't imagine a prettier view. Hotel staff is so attentive but at the same time genuinely friendly--and the Four Seasons breakfast buffet is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “IMPECCABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: PeterStreetwise2
Reviews.Content: The FOUR SEASONS in Sydney is an impeccable place. I have stayed there twice and would do so again. It is about as central as you will find, opposite the Opera House. You do indeed get a buzz as you enter the Lobby. The architecture and design is as tasteful as to be found in any top hotel. The Reception Desk was so, so efficient, with very mature, well-trained, friendly personnel, you are in your room before you know it. The sound-proofed room was more or less spacious and the bed a 'dream'. Of course, the bathroom was superb, with towels galore. The service in the rooms was top-notch. The pool and spa first-class! Alas, now for the down-side: breakfast was pricey, the 'wi-fi' connection in the room was mega-exorbitant, with no free option in the lobby and the laundry charges were astronomic. If on corporate expenses, this is in order but half the guests pay their own way, I would guess. Apart from that, the hotel is one of the best in the city and when you go elsewhere in Oz you immediately see the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Luey9189
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in the hotel. The service is fantastic from checking in to any housekeeping requests. The rooms are new and bathrooms are gorgeous. First class experience and highly recommend! The location is also great as only a short walk to the opera house and shopping district. Also close to the ferry and train station if public transport needed.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kitten_777
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon. Overall we were disappointed with FS Sydney.Our room was small and decor was quite dull- pretty boring business style. Food was ok, breakfast buffet was pretty good, cocktails were lousy and dinner was average - my seafood bouillabaisse was overcooked and the "broth" was a thick gunky texture. Nothing about the place gave the impression of 5* apart from the bed which was really comfortable. The FS sydney is fine for business travel but is certainly not a romantic get away. We were really sorry that we didn't know about Establishment which is a really funky hotel just up from the FS - we had sushi in the bar one night and the whole place seemed really cool, great design and buzzing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Glitz instead of quality”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: The Four Season aspires to be five-star, and therefore must be rated against that standard. I was there for six days (leading a conference) and got to know it well. The good: It's extraordinary clean and unbelievably shiny. The staff kowtows constantly, and smiles and says "good day" at every opportunity. It opens every possible door for the guests. The OK: The exercise area, although small, contains a good selection of equipment. The pool is satisfactory given that it's located in the middle of an urban area. The showers are good, except that sometimes the water pressure and temperature suddenly changes when taking a shower. The bad: The rooms are very small. The windows are angled so that 30% of the view is blocked by the wall of the adjacent room. The lower rooms look directly into the nearby neighboring buildings and nothing else. The mattresses are way too soft. The service, while extended with cheer and smiles, is terrible. For example, our original access to the room was delayed for "10-20 minutes" while it was inspected. After an hour, we gave up. We were then told we'd be telephoned on our cell phone when it was ready. Never happened. We were also told our luggage would be waiting in the room. Also never happened. We asked directions to a certain store. We were quickly and cheerfully given the directions, but they were incorrect. The meeting room (Ballroom 1) was a disaster. External sounds of equipment being moved, constant sound of some sort of loud beeping, and occasional very loud music intruded to the point that the speakers could barely be heard. This continued over all three days of the conference. The internet was pricey (as usual with such hotels) but was slowed down to the point that internet surfing and email reading were the only feasible activities (which I never previously have experienced). Forget therefore trying to view a U-Tube video, for example. The breakfasts (c. $US 35) were poor. The scrambled eggs were a strange combination of undercooked and overcooked. The omelets were dry. The selection of pastries was limited (and a basket of three cost c. $US 15). The tone signaling an elevator had arrived seem to emanate from the center of the bank rather than one of the five elevators themselves, with the result that one had to search to find which elevator had arrived. Since the signaling lights are blocked by ornamental lamps, it was necessary to scramble feverishly to reach the car before the door closed, and, if it was an end car, more likely than not one would miss it. (This happened to everybody at the conference.) In short, if you like superficialities, this is your place. You'll get smiles, greetings, and will view acres of clean shiny surfaces. If, rather, you value service, views, creature comforts, and overall quality, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Luxury 5* Experience in every sense!Hands down THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: panagiotis123
Reviews.Content: Whatever i write about my experience with Four Seasons isnt going to be enough to depict how good this hotel is! Apart from the fact that the hotel is on the BEST, and i mean THE BEST location in Sydney, and the hotel is absolutely beautiful, what makes this hotel my No1 city hotel in the world is the AMAZING staff!!From concierge to reception and the best room service i've ever encountered. due to the nature of my job i have stayed in loads of luxury hotels around the world but i have to say that the quality of service i got in the Four Seasons is definitely unmatchable!!Four Seasons should be proud of their staff!! They made our staying so much more enjoyable! We had a Full Harbour view room and the views are just breathtaking! Highly recommend it! Have no doubts that Four Seasons is the best out there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: seeking_9
Reviews.Content: Perfect service. Amazing location. In the heart of the rocks - we walked to the opera house, bridge climb and rocks markets. Sydney cafe is great for dinner and walking distance too! Staff are genuinely friendly, helpful and informative. The bed is fantastic - tempting to stay in bed all day instead of exploring Sydney... Breakfast is ok, order eggs if you get the buffet. If you are tourist you should stay here!

Reviews.Title: “FAULTLESS!”
Reviews.Author: foresthouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons from 1st-6th October, in a full harbour view room. We had spent over three weeks in the "outback" - the Red Centre and the Kimberley - and when we arrived in reception we were dusty, sweaty, tires, and generally not looking at our best! Everyone else around us were either in suits (men) or evening dresses (ladies we assume!) however the man at reception treated us as if we were very special, and had also been tipped off by our tour operator that we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. He arranged for a fabulous room, and even sent us up a bottle of champagne. Without exception every member of staff were polite, helpful and friendly, and seemed genuinely pleased to talk to us, and answer any questions we had. As the weather in Sydney was quite poor while we were there (not the hotel's fault) we paid $135 for 24 hours membership of their Executive Club, located on the 32nd floor. It seems a lot of money, but it included acces to the club from 6.20am until 8pm, unlimited drinks from the bar (alcoholic, soft and tea/coffee), canapes from 5-8pm (bothe hot and cold snacks, replenished throughout that time) and a full hot breakfast, which alone would have cost over $40 each. Would definitely recommend upgrading if you can afford it, even for one day. Overall, despite the fantastic views available in and around Sydney, our overriding memory of the city will be the first class stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: islanderbob
Reviews.Content: just came back from 3 weeks in australia,four seasons was our first stay in australia,got a room from expedia for us$150/nite harbour view ,arrived at the 4 seasons from the u.s.a @9am and check -in was at 2pm,we upgrade our room to harbour/opera view for us$100 more and was able to check-in right away. the room(suite!!)w/living room/office,sofa,etc) was incredible,corner unit facing the opera, wow!!!great sunset. modern and comfortable. now this hotel is next to everything 5min walk to opera,2min to ferry boat to everywhere,nice restaurant ,coffee shop, shopping and "the rocks". citysightseeing sydney/bondi tours bus(us$30/day) is next to entrance of hotel,this is a great way to visit sydney and bondi beach in 1day. the staff at the 4 seasons were all 5 stars . enjoy your trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: dbdgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Sydney, 3 different stays over the course of 2 weeks as made Sydney our point city to get to various places around the country. The hotel could not have been more accommodating - storing luggage, upgrading rooms, discount good towards the spa or restaurant due to our extended stay. The concierge there, James, was fabulous. Helped us out on several occasions and most importantly, caught and handled an airline issue. We had reservations at another chain hotel so we could get "points" but am so glad we changed hotels at the last moment. Nice rooms, comfortable beds, great views, fantastic location, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Classic”
Reviews.Author: danny8688
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with prime location. Walk to the Opera House (10 minutes) Circular Quay (1 minute), The Rocks (3 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury accommodation”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a premier city view room with my friend. It was an upgrade from the city view room. Very smooth check-in and staff very pleasant. It was a massive room with room to swing a cat. Very nice bed. Loved the large widescreen LCD tv and Bose system. Nice living area with a huge walk in robe. Bathroom was really nice as well. Location is quite good in the Rocks area. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: I know five star when I see it. And this is definitely is a five star hotel, with all the proper bells and whistles. I had never stayed at a Four Seasons before, but I am very glad I did it here. They were kind enough to upgrade me to a Harbour View room, and that just blows you away. You have no idea how beautiful that view is, day and night, until you've actually seen it. The attention to detail is amazing, and it's the details that make it a genuine five star hotel. A small note, hand signed, to remind me of my pre-booked spa treatment. The wonderful l'Occitane toiletries and the attentive housekeeping that gets you ice and folds your clothes. Spa is wonderful, definitely the best in Sydney (as voted by CondÃ© Nast Traveller's Magazine), had two treatments there, and although the facilities (including the pool) seem somewhat lackluster, the treatment and massages reveal that we're in the hands of experts here. Wonderful, and well worth the money. My only nag would be the breakfast buffet. At 39 AU$ it's quite expensive and really not special at all, even boring (apart from the freshly squeezed orange juice, and quality coffee). So not worth my money. But apart from that, it's one of the best hotels I ever stayed in - and check out my profile to see the other gems in this world I've had the pleasure to call home for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: moomoo3001
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend planned our weekend getaway here for my birthday, it was a fantastic surprise. it was so fabulous, we were on the 25th florr with city views. nothing was too much trouble for the staff. we would definintely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Air_Palma
Reviews.Content: Everything was simply perfect, the staffs, the room, the location, the room (with a 52' flat screen), the mini-bar was unbelivable and not too over-priced. If I have to go again for leisure, I will defintely choose that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pretty average”
Reviews.Author: ytang714
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for few nights when we went to sydney. Location - it's good if you want to be near the rocks, but very far from china town or other pubs if you are into night life. View - we paid extra for the opera house/harbour bridge view room but it was partially blocked by nearby buildings. We could hardly see the bridge... Room - it was very tiny, no slippers. Overall it was worse than the Four Seasons I'd stayed in shanghai few years ago. Overall i wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, not up to standard in comparison with other Four Seasons around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Simply one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: eat_drinkMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Four Seasons for 3 nights for a romantic get away. The trip started out quite badly as our Limo driver failed to pick us up from the airport and we were still charged as apparently we weren't there (beware Omni Car Limo Hire). Upon our eventual arrival via taxi we weren't in a very good frame of mind, thankfully this was all about to change rapidly as the friendly and efficient staff gave us a warm and seemingly genuine greeting and had our bags whisked away to our room. My wife was ecstatic when we walked through the door to our room and saw the tasteful and modern furniture. I expect that the hotel has been recently renovated as everything appeared to be very new right up to the Samsung 46" LCD tv. Very unusual to see a brand name tv in a hotel, in fact most rooms I've stayed in have brands that I've never even heard of before or since. It was this sort of attention to detail that really made Four Seasons stand out from other hotels fro me, even the bedside clock was a Bose wave system and until you've heard the sound quality of one of those you wouldn't think it possible for such a small unit to produce such rich sound. The bathroom in the Premier rooms was quite large and finished very lavishly in all its marble glory with a modern oversized bath tub and spacious shower. We didn't dine at the restaurant as we already had bookings at some of Sydneys best which are all just a short stroll from the hotel including 'Quay' which has just been awarded the Gourmet Traveller 'Australias Best Restaurant 2009' for the second year running and of course Neil Perry's famous 'Rockpool' restaurant is only about half a block away. If you're looking for a great way to see the harbour we also booked on to 'Captain Cook Cruises' 'Gold Deck Dinner' which includes a 3-4 hour harbour cruise aboard a luxury vessel and a seven course degustation dinner with matching wines. The bar is open for standard drinks as well so it works out to be a fantastic cost effective evening and a very romantic evening as well. Look around on the web for deals as you can often find tickets cheaper than on the Captain Cook Crusies website. We booked through Viator and saved about 25%. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Four Seasons and would definately stay again although after walking around Circular Quay for a few days I would also be very keen to try the Park Hyat as it would have to be in the best location of all the Circular Quay hotels, might have to save a bit longer though as it's even more expensive than the others.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Besitos22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights! If you want an impressive stay in Sydney then consider the Four Seasons, overlooking the harbour in the historic Rocks district. It's just a short walk from the city's shopping and business centres, our room had the most dramatic harbour front view of the famous Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. It was perfect for part of our vacation tour of Australia. The staff was both very professional and friendly, making our stay very comfortable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, plenty of room. Itâ€™s just a 5 min. walk to the Circular Quay transp. Hub (trains, ferries, buses), 10 min. to the heart of the Rocks District for history. For location in Sydney, you canâ€™t really do better than this hotel. We are thrifty travelers, but decided to go all out while in Sydney.. and it was ALL worth it!! I hope to stay here again if I ever decide to pay Sydney another visit (which most likely will :).

Reviews.Title: “Only for the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Vamprila
Reviews.Content: Had the Opera View room for 2 nights, paying around $20 more to upgrade from the city view rooms. However, I would say it is rather disappointing. Half the window was blocked by the wall protruding on the left, towards the harbour. You could only see the Opera House when you sit at the writing desk by the window. As we were on the 9th floor, we are directly opposite offices. Having spent days in the suburbs in Blue Mountain, Jervis Bay etc, it's hard not to notice the sound of the city. With traffic right at your doorstep, the sirens, and vrooming of cars, is less than desirable. But I have to say, I loved the king-sized bed which is soft and cushy. The huge Samsung TV. The Loccitane bath goodies. Lots of Sports channels, CNN, BBC.. i guess it's more a hotel for business MALE travellers. The location is great if you want to spend your time at The Rocks. It's within 10 min stroll to the Circular Quay Station and Ferry Terminal. However, if you want to shop along George/ Pitt Street/ Chinatown, it is quite a walk across the business district before you reach the retail area. But the weekend market at The Rocks is amazing, and that's just 5 minutes away. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location & Loved the Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: Mei_C
Reviews.Content: The last hotel we stayed.. See my other reviews on Crowne Plaza Darling Harbour (disappointing) and The Westin Sydney (really good stay) which were all part of the same trip. We arrived about 1pm. Check-in took slightly longer because we were prepared to wait for an additional 15min for a room on the 30th floor with Opera House view. Worth the wait. We also paid to upgrade to Club Floor access. Standard rate of AUD135 per room/night was reduced to AUD85 because of a short winter promotion. And we also got another AUD100 in credit which we used to offset the upgrade. So all the promotions made this a very reasonable stay. The bed was very very soft but comfortable enough. The only problem was waking up at 1:30 in the morning because the pillows gave me a neckache. Concierge promptly sent foam pillows but I still had problems sleeping. All I could think of was Westin Sydneyâ€™s pillows and bed. But the next morning, I called housekeeping and they promptly sent another pair of pillows, this time they were made of latex. THAT made all the difference. Finally, I could look forward to a proper nightâ€™s sleep! The room is much smaller than the Westinâ€™s but it was also more cozy. Loved the interiors design and we had a lovely view of the Opera House. The FS provides travel adapters etc but not much toiletries. No toothbrush, toothpaste, bedroom slippers etc. I guess you could call housekeeping for them but we brought our own. The toilet was half the size of Westinâ€™s but good enough. The shower was great. Separate bathtub. I was only worried that the hairdryer would fall off the shelf and into the toilet bowl. The hairdryer wasnâ€™t that heavy and pretty powerful. The housekeeper was happy to change the bathrobe each day, unlike Westinâ€™s. The concierge was very precise. I asked how much it cost for a taxi ride to Westfield Bondi Junction and they said AUD20-21. I actually paid AUD20.30. So I decided to take the bus the next day and bring my hubby there. The Club Lounge was terrific. The staff and their high level of service must be commended. The cocktail hour 5pm-8pm daily had very limited but very good quality food. The drinks, including liquor, were all self serve so you mix and match as you wished. The soup of the day, kept warm in a thermos flask, was smooth and rich. The mini cheesecakes and tarts were delicious. 6:30am to 10:30am each day, the limited breakfast was great. The sugar powdered pancakes were soft in the middle and thick and crispy at the edges. Eggs were cooked to order and there were bacon, sausages, baked beans, cheeses, smoked salmon etc. I had pink guava juice every day. Location of hotel: Superb. The Rocks and Rocks Market is only 5min walk away and you must eat at Wolfieâ€™s at the Village near the Rocks. Really good steaks and sauces. We walked 5min to the bus information counter in front of McDonaldâ€™s opposite Circular Quay. This newsstand-like counter gave us helpful info and we walked across the road to Stand E where we boarded the express bus 333 to Westfield Bondi Junction (you must go there, probably biggest mall in Sydney) and also to Bondi Beach. The limited stops made the trip faster and costs about AUD3.20 one-way. I had considered staying at the Shangri-la instead of FS but each day, looking down from the 32nd floor window of the Club Lounge made me thankful that I need not walk up all those steps to get to the Shang. Yup, weâ€™re really glad we chose the FS instead. We both really enjoyed the Club Lounge and its really good breakfast and also the convenient location to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JanetCoulbeck
Reviews.Content: Great location and views of Sydney opera house and harbour, rooms small and bathrooms tiny. Step out and you are in the heart of the city, lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a trip”
Reviews.Author: WillMyWifeGetSick
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room with Opera House view. Excellent food especially the evening meals (relatively new chef who has been getting positive reviews in Sydney papers); great buffet breakfast. The service at the hotel was excellent. The location was outstanding for touring (near Circular Quay). Great concierge service. Would definitely go back when in Sydney the next time.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home - Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Montza
Reviews.Content: At the time of writing this review, I stay at this hotel 3-4 days a week, and almost every visit my service expectations are exceeded. Every staff member is simply committed to great service, it's actually quite embarrassing, as a regular guest, just how good they are. Since the refurbishment completed (late 2008) the old beauty is back to perfection. 42" LCD TVs, outstanding king size beds, l'occitane amenities, uber-fast internet and depending on your room - Some of the best views on offer of both the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The gym is great with 4 or 5 quality treadmills, ample bikes, rowers, weight machines and a stack of free weights. The pool is handy in summer, whilst heated, it can be a bit chilly on the deck in winter. The day spa is recognised in Sydney as one of the best. The only weakness I would call out is the lack of a quality bar and narrow restaurant choice. But to be perfectly honest, hotel bars are generally full of the boring types and being located at Circular Quay near The Rocks, there is no shortage of local watering holes and dining preferences. For business: Great location right on George Street, well appointed to get work done when you need to in your room with fast web, good quality desk and chair. For pleasure: Perfect location for Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Also located directly opposite Circular Quay ferry station, where you can take a ferry to Manly and other tourist destinations. The Four Seasons Sydney is simply an exceptional hotel. As with all of my reviews, please contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: maciejbosak
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Four Seasons hotel in 2006. It was at the end of a long concert tour. The Four Seasons is. obviously a great place to stay; however, the room rates are high. The hotel is located in the city center within a walking distance from the Sydney Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and staff. Room needed a little refurb”
Reviews.Author: OP2002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked an Opera View junior suite for four nights directly through the Four Seasons site, it seems these are now classified as Premier rooms. Looking at their site it seemed the best bet at the standard rooms were a tiny 280 square feet. Location: The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic, just across from Circular Quay a two minute walk into the Rocks and about five round to the Sydney Opera House. Ambience: Not quite the usual Four Seasons, nice entrance and friendly welcome. The public areas of the hotel did feel a bit ordinary, luxury hotels often stand out not only from their public and private areas but this just didnâ€™t have the wow factor. Room: Plenty spacious with nice view of the Opera House (as we had a very high floor) from the window in the living area. Good storage space for cases with desk and large bathroom too. My only disappointment with it was the fact the large bathroom had no windows which with a view of the Sydney skyline would have been fantastic, one way glass of course! Also our room had old style Nokia CRT televisions, even mid range hotels have flat screen HDTVs now so this was a bit of a surprise. It seems more recent reviews note that rooms have these. The room did feel a bit tired, the desks had been bumped a few times too many and the carpet looked a little worn in places. Otherwise, very comfortable bed as usual with Lâ€™Occitane toiletries (love them!) Facilities: To be honest we really didnâ€™t take advantage of much of the hotel facilities favouring restaurants in the city.We did see the pool round the back of the hotel which while quite nice did have the hum of the Cahill Expressway running just above it! Service: Usual Four Seasons excellence! We used the concierge to score an excellent table at Aqua down beside the Opera House (a really fantastic meal) which we were unable otherwise to get. Staff were very friendly and gracious as has become expected at stays at Four Seasons everywhere. Even the young kid hailing the cab outside was great! Also had a few items dry cleaned and was very impressed with the speed there too. Other nice little things like the fact a pair of rather tatty shoes I left on the floor in the room were polished and left beside the bed. Summary: The only disappointment was the dÃ©cor and furnishings of the room. Flat screen HDTVs should be standard at any high end hotel and the room was in need of a refresh. Other than that we canâ€™t complain, the location is absolutely fantastic. We didnâ€™t fork over the extra cash for a harbor view room, might do that next time, I bet the view from the high floors is spectacular. Definitely consider getting anything above the standard rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Five Star”
Reviews.Author: WanttobeNomad
Reviews.Content: We had an interconnecting room for $440 a night parking was $40 a day breakfast at Executive Club and drinks snacks in afternoon $120 approx per day. Breakfast was amazing anything you could possibly want and more all were extremely fresh and Shane the chef on call to make eggs any way you like. Jane the host upstairs knows you name before you even meet her. How is that? Our rooms overlooked the Opera House - Beautiful - Beds were huge - and two large lcd tvs with fabulous furnishings. The kids couldn't believe this place and neither could I. A great place to stay, near the Rocks, Circular Quay and all Ferries Trains, good location on George Street.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MrDBP
Reviews.Content: Situated close to the Harbour bridge and Opera House this hotel is a genuine 5 star with prices to match. Rooms are in the traditional dark wood style, smallish but very comfortable, The bathrooms are lovely and they've thought of all the little things. Service can't be faulted. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here”
Reviews.Author: BeachLoverTorquay
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons was fabulous. Great staff, comfortable rooms, amazing location. Loved the Sydney get away staying in this amazing hotel, everything was lovely. Great bed and pillow, clean bathroon and Locatane products were beautiful. Stayed for three nights, but would like to move in.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view, wonderful staff, perfect location, great price for the Four Seasons!!”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelgirlSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a wonderful five day stay at the Four Seasons. It was my first visit to Sydney, and the staff made me feel right at home. Arlando was so friendly in showing my room amenities and providing sightseeing suggestions. Check in was prompt and friendly. The views of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge were amazing. The hotel's location was perfect, as it's steps from the Circular Quay. The staff was warm, and not stuffy. On one occassion, I felt a bit out of place sporting my jeans and Ugg boots while riding in the elevator with several staff looking polished and professional in their suits and ties. One staff member suddenly exclaimed, "Oh, how I wish I were wearing my Ugg boots!" The staff is good natured, and they were always available to assist with any needs. I will definitely return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and a memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: pnreddy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel when we went to Sydney, Australia. It is located in Circular Quay and is just a short walk to the shopping centers and restaurants. There are also museums, art galleries and beaches nearby. The location is perfect because it is very easy to visit the other tourist spots of Sydney. It is within walking distance to the buses, trains and ferries. It is a good place to stay in for business travelers because itâ€™s near the business centers. And it is about 20 minutes away from the airport. Our room was a bit small but comfortable and clean. We were on a higher floor and we had an incredible view of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from our window. The bathroom was also small but clean. Aside from shampoo and soap, this hotel did not have any other toiletries in the bathroom, which was quite strange for a well-known hotel. The buffet breakfast was good but there was not much food on the table. We had to order from the kitchen. Service was great. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
