They were courteous and efficient. Other amenities like the spa and swimming pool were good. The Four Seasons Hotel is a bit expensive but we had a nice experience and a pleasant stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly chic”
Reviews.Author: wockinwod
Reviews.Content: I have always shied away from the Four Seasons brand as to me it had an impression of looking like "Laura Ashley had thrown up in the room". What I mean by this is lots of florals and very traditional. If that is your sort of hotel then this brand will suit you down to the ground. The website showed that the hotel had undergone significant refurbishment so I thought I would give it a try. I have to say that the rooms (mine was an Opera House view) was very understated with a very modern feel to them. They are certainly not large rooms but a comfortable size none the less with nice brown, caramel and white tones. The bathroom is a good size with a separate bath and shower. The L'Occitane amenities are always welcomed. The room was booked through American Express Platinum Travel and as it is part of their Fine Hotels programme there are extra inclusions (breakfast for two, US$85 to spend etc). This certainly made it very appealing. Check-in was very friendly, infact the welcome at the door was great. Even better was being provided with a A$100 credit to use as I was staying for two nights. Dinner was had at the casual restaurant and the food was just fine and very well priced for a five star property. The maitre d' was also exceptionally friendly and his service was impeccable. I also recommend the cosy bar on the ground floor, again, great service from the bar staff. One surprising highlight was the fitness centre. Most hotel gyms have one or two tradmills, a bike and a machine which defies scientific explanation. This gym was well equipped with a number of cardio machines, free weights and weight machines all coupled with a view over George Street. The one area that disappointed was breakfast. The service from the staff was fine but not exceptional and inconsistent. Further the breakfast offerings were very standard. I found the eggs to be dry and a little tasteless. The juice on offer was very tart. I would have also expected to see an "Egg Chef". Really, if this is all I have to complain about then I am being too picky. This is a great spot to stay and so well located in Sydney near the beautiful Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: need4more
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night to celebrate an anniversary, taking advantage of a promotional rate. Had a city view room on 29th floor, while not the more popular (and no doubt more expensive) view of the Opera House and Harbour, the city view still took in The Rocks, Harbour Bridge, Walsh Bay and harbour west of the bridge - you weren't stuck looking straight in to another building or directly into other hotel rooms.. The room had a very comfortable bed, reasonable space for two, 42inch LCD, DVD player and the usual amenities you might expect. Liked the shower's separate temperature control, so you could vary the water pressure and temperature independently. Went to the inhouse restaurant - Kables - which had strong reviews on www.eatability.com.au. Food was very good, wine expensive, staff were attentive once you were seated, bookings recommended over Fri/Sat/Sun, we saw people turned away - it's not a value proposition but worth it if you want something special. There are no booths or secluded tables, you don't feel isolated from other diners. Staff on reception desk and room service were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient, couldn't have asked for more. Parking cost ~$45 per 24hr period - might be on par for city rates during the week, but seems poor value if you can't expense it back to an employer. Being based in Sydney the location wasn't terrible important, but if you were a tourist in this city then this hotel is conveniently located to transport hubs and touristy things. In summary, I'd go back for sure if I got a promotional rate. If i was traveling for business or money was no object I'd go back as well. The staff were great and the room was entirely sufficient for a one night stay. A Harbour/Opera House view would add more appeal again.

Reviews.Title: “a top class experience from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: modjis
Reviews.Content: i've come away from 7 nights at the four seasons over the past two weeks, and i'm struggling to find even the smallest fault with this hotel. believe me, iâ€™m a picky customer when it comes to hotels. i spend about half my year in them all around the world so you come to appreciate the good, the not so good and the downright ugly. from my experiences, the (revamped) four seasons in sydney is a world-class establishment. i previously stayed here exactly one year ago for a similar length of time, (8 nights) and although the experience then was enjoyable too, it was hard to avoid noticing how dated the rooms looked. the service was impeccable but the hotel (as has been mentioned before) was in dire need of a makeover. upon returning this year, the guest rooms have been totally remodeled. i stay in a large corner room on a high floor, with an opera house view. the rooms as always are spacious and superbly laid out but styling now reflects a much more contemporary approach - gone are the tired pastel and floral shades and in comes sexy muted browns, creams and charcoal with splashes of subtle colour here and there. the lighting is also much improved, with ten separate lighting aspects in the bedroom alone, allowing for a variety of subtle lighting possibilities. the overall ambience is now leagues ahead of last year. obviously, the fittings are relatively new so they haven't had much wear, but the feel of the deep carpets, the trademark high beds, the thick full length curtains and the endless scatter cushions is now one of real quality and luxury. the bathrooms havenâ€™t been altered, but they didnâ€™t need it. they remain superb: l shaped marble caverns with a separate bathing room with walk in shower and six foot bath. and the lâ€™occitane toiletries are absolutely first rate. the experience was good before i even arrived. the superb front office manager karen koelewyn took care of my specific needs for a pretty in depth itinerary, and her attitude was simply 'nothing was too much trouble'. in fact from the bellhops to the guys who serve the room service, to the spa lady everyone's attitude was absolutely top class. its great to go away from a hotel feeling so enthused about the experience, as it really does reflect on how you view that hotel in terms of future bookings. no hotel can run without problems and there were niggles and kinks here and there. a persistent knocking sound from the pipes in my room, and occasionally rather inconsiderate housekeeping staff slamming other guest room doors outside early in the morning, despite clearly having a dnd sign on the door. early on a room service order was messed up as well, but the important thing is how the hotel reacts to these inevitable issues and the reaction was always prompt, polite and fixed the problem immediately. professional and considerate touches abounded; i sent a large load of laundry down on a standard 24-hour service one day at around 10am. to my surprise, it was returned 9 hours later, when i double checked i was paying for only the standard service, the lady confirmed it and said they always try to get it done as quickly as they can. classy. location wise, if youâ€™re a traveller to sydney you cant really beat it. bang on the harbour overlooking the rocks with unsurpassed views of the harbour bridge and the opera house, both within walking distance. the hotel is also at the end of george street with shops and restaurants all close by. i'm surprised at some of the reviews about the staff being surly; nothing could be further from the truth in my experience. the only downside about the new style four seasons was having to move to other cities several times during my stay; even moving to the park hyatt in melbourne one day felt like a step down. in summary, wouldnâ€™t look at another hotel in sydney...

Reviews.Title: “The best season”
Reviews.Author: GLobetrotterMumbai
Reviews.Content: We went to sydney during New year's time. Sydney is pretty during Dec and this hotel was an icing on the cake! Right next to darling harbour, it is close to all the happening things in sydney. Our room was well equipped with a great view of the harbour.the staff was very hospitable and service very good. There is also some fancy shpopping n the hotel premises.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but great location and top service”
Reviews.Author: p750777
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in a full harbour view room on the 15th floor. This has a great view of the bridge and opera house from the window and was a definite highlight. The room is on the small side but is well laid out with a large flatscreen TV and good desk/storage. The location of the hotel is iseal for circular key and very central to get anywhere in the city. The service we received at the hotel as at other Four Seasons I have stayed at was excellent from all staff through checkin, baggage concierge etc.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: RobertLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 4 nights concluding our trip from west to the east coast Australia before returning to the UK. To stay at this hotel is a pleasure. We booked an Opera House view from our room which was spectacular. The '14' series on each floor are really good, eg 1014, 1114, 1214, etc with great views. Ask for high floors for the best views. The gym is very well equiped and a must. And so is the Spa. $80 got me a well needed back, shoulder and neck massage. The hotel is within a short stroll to the harbour, the Bridge and everything you will need. No need for cabs. Get a cab, however, to Darling Harbour. Lunch and a few beers or dinner, it's great. Tip..Walk through the gardens the other end of the Opera House to get the best pictures of the Bridge and Opera House in one camera shot. Or take the tourist train by the gates of the park. This is a top end hotel that will not disappoint you from the moment you arrive to the sad time you leave. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice details”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelover33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Opera View room earlier this month for 3 nights. The good: Excellent location--you are basically at the corner of the Circular Quay and the Rocks, two great areas to walk around and enjoy lovely architecture and views. The Circular Quay is great for taking ferry trips (we went to the Zoo and Manly Beach). The hotel is literally a 3 minute walk from the train station so the airport ride is a breeze. You are also a very short cab ride (or a moderately long walk) to Chinatown or Darling Harbor. The room was clean, the safe in the closet was large, and there were 2 luggage racks in the closet. My boyfriend absolutely loved the bed, and we appreciated the down comforter. The shower had a separate on/off handle from the temperature gauge, so it was nice not to freeze in the shower waiting for it to get warm, or scald myself when the temperature rose. Lovely L'Occitane bath products too! The concierge helped us book tickets for a play at the opera house for the same night as well as get us reservations to Quay restaurant (HIGHLY recommended--get the snow egg for dessert, it was seriously the best dessert I have ever had and I'm a huge sweets person) on the day we arrived. The concierge did lead me astray, however, when I inquired about seeing a koala--I was told I would be able to lightly pet a koala at the Taronga Zoo, however, when we got there, I learned that they apparently have a strict no-touching-koalas policy. That was the one disappointment I had with the concierge. The bad: The room was quite small. Definitely better suited for one person than two, but we didn't mind much as we were out doing activities during the day. Also the "opera view" was really only an opera view when you stood in the very corner of the room, however, I know other rooms were considered "Opera View" and did have very lovely views of the Opera House from more vantage points in the room, so I suppose we were just unlucky. The bottom line: A very good value and a great location, I know I would definitely return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt78Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week. Up to that point I was in the opinion that one can only get exceptional hotels with good service in Asia. The Four Seasons Hotel Sydney proved me to be wrong. Everything was perfect even the restaurant recommendation from â€œAlexanderâ€�. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: HSB82
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is an absolutely fantastic hotel, easily the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It might seem a little bit pricey but is well worth every penny! The room was lovely - we were upgraded to a full harbour view room as it was our honeymoon. The staff were all really friendly and we were given complimentary champagne. Every member of staff including reception, the gym and spa staff and the room service staff just could not do enough for you. The facilities including the gym, swimming pool and steam room were really impressive. An absolutely amazing hotel that I would definltely recommend to anyone who wanted to treat themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great views”
Reviews.Author: MrsWaterhouse
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons has amazingly good service - from the check in people to the restaurant staff. The club lounge is great. The only negative is the traffic noise from the freeway near the pool but pop in some headphones.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: philandalex
Reviews.Content: Could not fault one aspect of our one night stay here! From the friendly door staff, efficient concierge and magnificent harbour views, the stay our stay was truly memorable. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Daisy1009
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for two nights as part of a Princess Cruise Land Tour. Hotel is adjacent to all of the activity. Next to Circular Quay (Key) with restaurants, Opera House, famous bridge, etc. Business area right out door of hotel. It was a perfect location to explore area. Typical high quality hotel. When you go out exploring ask doorman for cold bottle of water (they have them with doorman) and ask for a handy 4 seasons shopping bag. Room was great and so was bed. I even wrote down the type of mattress they used for future reference. View was of bridge-but for little more money I am sure you could view of Opera House. I would say they have one of the best hotel locations in Sydney. Pool was very small and really not too attractive-but the location of hotel made up for it.. Exercise room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good but not impressed by checkin process/staff”
Reviews.Author: mkhamilton02
Reviews.Content: My boy friend and I were traveling Australia but he was arriving Sydney later than I was. His flight arrived 4 hours after mine. He booked the hotel and made sure to give them my name, however when I tried to check in I was hassled because I was not my boy friend (his name was on the reservation). The reason we booked this way was because he was working for a company that received a special rate (still $300+ USD/night). I've stayed at many Four Seasons resorts before, and have never had an issue like this. I was not let into my room for over an hour as I was passed around from hotel manager to different front desk associates the entire time questioning our booking process, etc.. They claimed because the reservation wasn't in my name, I wasn't allowed to check in. I had just come from the Four Seasons in Buenos Aires a few weeks earlier and had no problem checking in ahead of my boy friend. I also had no problem putting down my credit card at checkin, as I did in Buenos Aires. However, although I even offered to put down my credit card for the room at the Four Seasons in Sydney, I was still hassled. After at least an hour they FINALLY allowed me to check into my room, and pay for it myself. Not sure why it took an hour of convincing. Since my boy friend was in the air when all this was occurring, I was unable to call him to have him clarify the situation. This was the worst experience I've had with any resort ESPECIALLY the Four Seasons - and such a shame because I LOVED Four Seasons service and this situation really put a bad taste in my mouth!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, service and accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience from the moment we arrived. Exceptional service and accomodations with a glorious view of the opera house. Stayed in a suite which connected to a twin bedded room for the kids, providing lots of space to roam. We could walk to most everything from the ideal location and public transportation was close, too. The pool and workout facility is first class, too. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons? - not.”
Reviews.Author: DebOz
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Four Season hotels and resorts from Cairo to the Maldives, we were very disappointed with the Sydney property which is more a shabby 4 star than a Four Seasons. The rooms are tiny, if you fling an arm from one twin bed, you will easily concuss the occupant on the other bed. The bathroom fits only one at a time. And for $600 a night in a harbour view (through thick grime) window. The room was basic, no extra blankets in the wardrobe to change the down bed covers to something light as the air conditioning wouldn't drop below 20c and this in Sydney's hottest month. No complimentary water, telephone books, no toothbrushes, nail files and shavers. The bathroom was so cramped, the hairdryer had to stay out on a shelf above the toilet. Classy. No drawers or cupboards to put toilet bags in and when you are travelling with a 22 year old, they need cosmetic space! I had to get up on the first morning to quieten the housekeeping staff who where opening room doors, shouting "housekeeping" then letting the door slam shut. I pointed out there were 4 "do not disturb" signs on the rooms in the immediate vicinity which would indicate people sleeping - or trying to. I mentioned this to the front desk but the whole scene was repeated again the next morning. Breakfast was in a tired cafe with even tireder staff. I had to ask 3 times for an order to be taken and at no time was water put on any table and again had to be requested. The only indication that this was a Four Seasons in a previous lifetime was the Concierge service and the doormen who were helpful and professional. So overpriced, tired, and tiny. You can do better for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the 4 seasons for location & quality”
Reviews.Author: CarryonTravelling
Reviews.Content: As we're a couple in our early 30s who like small boutique hotels we thought long and hard about booking the 4 Seasons in Sydney - however we weren't disappointed. Yes it's a large hotel, however the service was fabulous, our room great, we opted for an Opera House view and we had our room upgraded twice! The views, room quality and location can't be beaten and the hotel bar was full of life and atmosphere in the evenings. The bed was super comfy and the rooms very quiet. We wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a keeper!”
Reviews.Author: southernbelljrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel service was outstanding! I was delayed two days due to snow in Washington and because of the time difference missed the time to change my reservation. They changed the reservation for the day I was to arrive and did not charge me at all! After I arrived, they upgraded my room! We had an incredible veiw of the harbour out one window and the city veiw out of the other. I have never stayed in a place that I was so pleased with! The bed was very comfortable also. The valet service was outstanding! I will definately be staying at the four season on my next adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA,GREECE
Reviews.Content: We did stay here for 7 nights on the new years eve period (30/12-06/01) So as you realize the price was extremely high (you donâ€™t want to know) We didnâ€™t mind about that as we will like to see the fireworks from our room . We did book two Junior Suite with Full Harbor View the room was spacious and beautiful the bathroom was perfect the views spectacular the best we could have .I was really happy with my choice The breakfast was so and so we did try it once but nothing remarkable. The room service was expensive but we did expect that. The views of the fireworks the best . The massage in the spa really good and the pool great (heated) the internet worked well 209 dollars per week . The only bad thing that I can thing about is one : the most of the people that work here (only the people that open the door were ok) are friendly but snob â€¦ We were there paying a serious amount of money and they were looking at us as if we were aliens (at least) every time that we were meeting someone in the elevator they were looking as like we had a disease or something ? we went to the bar one night to have a drink we wait were they advise as and there were some people after us (as snob as the waitress) so they did give a table to them and we were standing there waiting at least 10 minutes . We had a great stay and if the people there were not like that it was going to be perfect â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jlajc
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is in a fantastic location, close to the ferries, The Rocks, the buses, the Harbor Bridge, and the Opera House. After the long day of travel to get to Sydney, we loved having everything close at hand once we got there. The room itself was fine. It was clean; the bathroom was fairly sizeable; and the bed was very comfortable. We used the gym a few times as well, and it was pretty decent for a hotel gym. The service, and the concierge especially, were outstanding. Our only one minor complaint was we didn't feel the "love" that you often get when staying at a Four Seasons. Maybe it was that the hotel seemed to be geared more towards the business traveler rather than tourists. But as whole, the experience was a very good one.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: paulineNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Sydney's staff are very professional and friendly. My mum was ill on our arrival after a long flight from Dubai. The door staff helped her into the hotel,and found her a seat while I checked in. As our room was not ready we had some lunch. We had to wait about an hour. Our room had fantastic views. But all we wanted to do was go to bed. It was so quiet we slept until the next day. Breakfast was brilliant lots of variety. We enjoyed our visit so much. We stayed a week later before a flight to Fiji. I have read the reviews. And if people find fault with the Four Seasons. They have obviously not travelled as much as me.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Seasons Experience”
Reviews.Author: Peace&Harmony
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with our stay at the four seasons since it was not the standard that I expected it to be although considering the price that we paid for the room via hotel club, I should not have been surprised. The receptionists and all of the staff were very helpful and friendly on the plus side. Also our breakfasts were good. On the downside, our room was very small, the choice of movies was poor, the swimming pool area was very dated and not positioned in a good place right under the flyover. One of our evening meals (taken in the room) was dried out and not of a great standard and the vegetarian options in the restaurant were not brilliant. Despite many reviewers saying how comfortable the beds are, my partner and I prefer our beds a little harder and we had trouble sleeping for the first two nights as we were "lost" in both the beds and the pillows. A bed board which was added did not help although we were grateful for the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LizzyS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons in Sydney whilst getting married. Would recommend this hotel particularly for a special ocassion. We upgraded for $30 per night to a deluxe room which was worth it. We had already booked a full harbour view room and it was well worth the money. The staff were exceptional and even offered to open up the whole business centre floor at 3am for my partner to go on the internet! If you can afford it stay there and even if you can't book the lowest rated room and upgrade on your arrival. We booked direct with the hotel which I think is better as most search engines don't include breakfast (which was also fab,) and we got a $150 voucher for the spa included. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worthy of the Four Seasons brand”
Reviews.Author: ajmith
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Four Seasons for six nights. Best bits were view of opera house and bridge, and the super-comfortable beds. Bar prices were I thought very reasonable. Buffet breakfast was extremely poor for a supposed five star hotel. The views are what makes this hotel worth staying in. It is an average four star hotel, but certainly is head and shoulders below that which you normally associate with the Four Seasons brand.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly bed, best views, close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: lovetojourney
Reviews.Content: Had a two day break in beautiful Sydney. Were lucky to be upgarded (no extra charge b/c of previous business trip visits) to a large, newly refurbished room on the 27th floor. Had 2 windows at either end of the angular room - one overlooking office buildings, & the other with a partial Harbour Bridge view. The bathroom was big, with a separate shower/bath/toilet area and a double sink area. Timeless, fully tiled marble in terracotta colours and quality toiletries. Apart from the view, the main highlight of out stay was the heavenly bed. So high from the ground we had to step up to reach it! Luxurious pillow-top mattress, yet firm & supportive. The quilts and huge pillows were SOOO comfortable. It really seemed we were sleeping in the clouds! First night we were sent some fruit & a juice as a welcome gift - a nice touch. We ate the buffet breakfast on both mornings - fresh and delicious and reasonable value for a 5* hotel. All in all a great stay at an excellent hotel in a brilliant position. Just walk out the door & in 3 minutes you are at the Harbour enjoying the famous sights. The Rocks area is also on your doorstep. So much to see & do. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tricker74
Reviews.Content: We paid a small upgrade fee to stay in a newly refurbished City View room, which was small but really nicely decorated. Great free Occitane products in the bathroom, lovely high quality sheets and EXTREMELY comfortable bed. What made the stay for me was the wonderful spa treatment I had. It was really superb and very reasonably priced. Also there's a fantastic outdoor pool and bar area on 3rd floor, and a very well equipped gym. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the room service was very good value and well above average.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, poor service, noisy refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: outdoorsfans
Reviews.Content: Myself and my new husband stayed at this hotel recently as part of our honeymoon. We stayed at a total of 8 properties during our 3 week trip to Australia and this is the only one that will be getting a negative review. Firstly the plus points- fantastic location which could not be better, and stunning views of the bridge and Opera house. The concierge were very helpful and friendly, the guy who brought our bags up was lovely, and they were also able to recommend some good restaurants. For me- thats it. The room itself was very tired, the furniture was a bit 80's and although everything was very clean, it just did not have the high quality finish and look I was expecting for a hotel chain with this reputation. It just was not in my opinion of 4* quality. Another thing which I really found irritating was the lack of mirror over the dressing/writing table. The only mirror for applying my make up was in the bathroom, and it may just be me but I like to sit down in front of the mirror and take my time getting ready! I guess if we had not paid so much for the room I would not have had such an issue but I just felt it was not good value for money. I also think it did not help that we had stayed in a Shangri La hotel in Hong Kong and not only were the rooms stunning but they absolutely gave us the special treatment. The other major gripe I have with this hotel is that there were definately some form of room refurbishments going on while we were there on the floor above ours. On the first day we arrived we were very tired from our flights and attemtped to have a pre dinner nap at around 4.30pm, however there was very loud banging and drilling from above. I called reception and explained and they told me there was work going on but it would be finished by 5pm. I asked if this was going to continue throughout our stay and was told it was but that it would only be between the hours of 9am and 5pm. I was not really happy with this as we were not warned of any refurbishment when we booked, but I decided to let it lay as figured I was probablly just grumpy from the long flight and lack of sleep! The next morning I had to ring reception again when the work had clearly started at 8am, I was prettty much fobbed off and told as far as they were concerned it was not supposed to start until 9am. Nobody came back to me and I relaised at that stage nobody was interested. The next morning as we were leaving there was drilling from above which started at 7.30am. Its not even so much the noise that upset me but the the complete lack of service that went with it or follow up of my complaint. The hotel does need some updating so I can understand why it is going on but I feel you should be made aware when booking if you are going to be disturbed by noise during your stay. Another thing which I found a little annoying was that twice they came around to do the turn down service at around 6.30pm whilst we were getting ready to go out for the evening. Surely most people at this time in the evening are having showers etc.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: LSCats
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my 4 day stay at Four Seasons Sydney. I thought that my Opera View room was adequately sized and nicely appointed. It was very quiet. I could never even hear the A/C. Although my room was not ready when I arrived at 9:00 a.m., I was allowed full use of the spa, fitness room and pool. I worked out in the fitness room, had a dip in the pool and jacuzzi, showered and changed for the day. My room was available at about 11 a.m. The only negatives about my room were that only instant coffee was provided to use with the French Press coffee maker and the make-up mirror was mounted (obviously by a 6 foot plus person) way too high for use by the average woman. The location could not be beat. Even if I stayed in another hotel I would definitely choose the Circular Quay/Rocks area again. I could walk to the Opera House, Ferry terminal, botanic gardens, modern art museum, Sydney Bridge, weekend market and all the shops and restaurants in the Rocks area. The concierge desk was very helpful in recommending tours and restaurants. The restaurants in the hotel were very expensive but there are numerous options outside of the hotel and the concierge was good about recommending inexpensive cafes for breakfast (not just pointing to the hotel dining room as would occur in some other hotels). There is no extra charge for use of the well equipped spa fitness room, sauna and steam rooms. Coffee, tea, juice and fruit are complimentary in the spa all day. The price for my room was actually less than a comparable room at the nearby Marriott and I was able to get a weekend discount for Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights, which was not offered by other hotels. I would definitely return to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The Finale After 5 Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Merchant
Reviews.Content: After writing 5 reviews of this hotel and having first stayed here in 1985 it is finally over. Each visit in the last few years has shown a more tired, less professional, shabbier and incredibly a more pretentious hotel. As the hotel has declined the staff has become more haughty. Particularly the front desk which has a collection of snooty youngsters with a total lack of a service mind set. An early arrival is always fraught with problems (one has little choice about when to arrive due to airline schedules). To be lectured on the "official check in time" is not much appreciated after a long and sleepless journey. Paying top dollar for a corner full harbor and opera house view room (which we always book) the one we were finally given (1709) after 2 hours of "housekeeping" and being totally ignored for over 3 hours was hardly the spectacular view of previous rooms we have enjoyed. If you looked to the left from the small window you saw the bridge, if you looked to the right the opera house! For that and a old Nokia TV (yes Nokia) and shabby sofa with stains you pay $600 per night. Still charging for internet for premium rooms this once great hotel which stood above all others in Sydney has finally hit the bottom and after 23 years of patronage this is one customer who will never return. Kables is not worth eating in any more.Even the shabby room could have been tolerated with a more cordial and helpful reception. We stay at Four Seasons Hotels throughout the world and this one has now become an embarassment to the brand. The front desk would be a scandal at Courtyard by Marriott. Each review we have written has shown a rapid deterioration of service and ammenities. The bathrooms and marble showers are still wonderful and the beds are comfortable but those things can be found at many other hotels in Sydney. Goodbye, Four Seasons Sydney- you are not what you used to be and we are now researching a new hotel for the next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Tired - Needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: ilana613
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel after a 10 hour flight we found that they did not have intercommunicating rooms as we had specifically requested. They tried to make out it was our fault, but when we told them that we were on a round the world trip and every other hotel had got it right, they changed their attitude and managed to find us two intercomunicating rooms but as one was a suite there would be an extra charge, which they reduced because of the mix up. Apart from that the service in the hotel was faultless, and apart from the rooms being old fashioned, we were very happy. If I was to go back again and the hotel had not been renovated I would opt to stay at the Observatory instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4manns
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Four Seasons was excellent. The location was perfect for walking about Sydney or hopping on a ferry to various sights. We began our vacation here and stayed in the Opera House/harbor view room, which was gorgeous at night. We ended our vacation back in Sydney and returned to the Four Seasons- we could have chosen other hotels but returned because we liked it so much. On the second stay, we booked a city view room, which was fine. Both rooms were large and clean with very comfortable beds.The staff is very professional as well as friendly. There are endless fantastic restaurants in the area to choose from as well as great shopping. We most definitely enjoyed including the Four Seasons in Sydney as part of our Australia vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and pretty ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick,easy and efficient but thats about where it stops. Don't be fooled by the Four Seasons name. This is a long way off its 5 star competitors in Sydney and I've stayed at quite a few. The rooms are very small and need serious updating. The TV is old with bad reception. The bathroom is even smaller. The room we stayed in had airconditioning problems. On my 4th call to management I demanded a room change. I received one. My recent review of the Shangri La encompassess everything that this hotel is not - quality. Pretentious exteriors does NOT make a 5 star hotel. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - What a view”
Reviews.Author: d_nathan_99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 nights from 31st May and had the most amazing time. We booked a transfer from Sydney airport through the hotel and the transfer was so smooth. The check-in procedure is fantastic. We booked an Opera House room and it was stunning. The rooms are smaller than i thought but offered all 5 star products and services. Location is stunning and we managed to use trains, ferrys and taxis one minute from the hotel. I would stay here again and advise anyone to give the Four Seasons a try. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friday the 13th”
Reviews.Content: For a special occasion we stayed in a suite with a great view of Sydney harbour, bridge and opera house. The room was very spacious with one of the most comfortable beds upon which I have had the pleasure of sleeping. The suite was very subdued and understated in nature and consequently didn't have that true luxury feel I associate with Four Seasons properties. The Executive Club was an oasis of calm and quiet in the hotel with particularly nice staff and adequate facilities. Shame they didn't have the Veuve on tap like their Hong Kong counterpart. The location of this hotel is ideal for getting around Sydney's waterfront, the Rocks and George St and has easy access to the Harbour bridge and the northern suburbs. The outdoor pool and jacuzzi would be fantastic during the warmer weather and I enjoyed a steam and sauna to ease a few aching muscles. This hotel is really very good with committed, friendly staff but would benefit from an injection of cash and enthusiasm to spruce up some of its more dated and worn elements and could really improve its art work and floral displays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCRGator
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, we stayed at some very exceptional properties before we arrived at the Four Seasons in Sydney but I still expected more from The Four Seasons. First off, the rooms are eceptionally small - we're talking NY sized rooms or even smaller. The views were great though- we could see the Opera House and the bridge from our window. The bathrooms are pretty cramped as well and the shower had mold all along the bottom. The location of the hotel is great though - walking distance to major attractions. I was a little put off by a charge of $14 for 7.5 minutes of internet access in their business center - you're already paying a lot to stay there and for them to just charge egregiously for something as cheap as internet access is just inconsiderate to me. Breakfast was good and the selection was varied. One other major problem we had was we used the in-room safe to store valuables (mainly cash and camera) and were in a hurry to make our appointment at the bridge climb. I went to get our camera out and the safe malfunctioned so I called security to override the safe....it turned out that even the override wouldn't work. So we waited and waited and ended up finally just leaving for our big adventure without our camera (I was not happy about this).....the safe was finally opened when we got back but it took them quite some time (well over an hour). This was frustrating and concerning - what is there had been medication in the safe - it could have been trouble. Overall, the location was great but for the price and cramped space, I would try another hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Deborah
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in Sydney - and I am a local. Every few months I give my mother a treat at this hotel - and it is a treat for me. It is also my favourite place for a drink after work - great bar. More of that later. First stayng in the hotel - great beds, great bathrooms (with walk in separate showers). My mother (elderly and given to complaints) loves it. Room service is good - I note some people say expensive. It is room service. If you are lucky enough to get Tim to deliver it to your room, he will make your stay. He is the best advertisement for Four Seasons. His professionalism, friendliness and commitment to customer service is among the best I have encountered. Reception are unfailingly nice and helpful. Now the bar. Friendly bar people, behidn the bar or those who come to your table. It is a sophisticated spot for those who like to have a drink in civilised (ie. quiet and comfortable) surroundings. The quietness is complemented, ironically, by the music (Tuesday-Saturdays) - usually a pianist, but always appropriate and never intrusive. The only minor complaint is that the bar menu isn't that extensive - I would like to see something healthier, and lighter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ALEXANDER _123
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in April. Had a room on the 29th floor with a partial view of the harbour. Room great, bathroom large,clean, great shower with L'occitane products (replaced when used), thick robes, loads of towels. The most comfortable bed I have slept in.Food in the bar very good, if a little pricey, but a good selection of wines by the glass. Had room service for an early breakfast one day which, for the price, was very good and served lavishly, nice linens and the table set up in front of the window etc.It was continental and we had only asked for a few danish and coffee, but also got cereals and croissants and butter and jam and so on. Any niggles? Well 2 incidents. That morning while we were eating breakfast in our room an air stewardess (with luggage) walked into our room. She had a key card which opened our door. So after a few 'Is this your room?' Oops sorry etc.. my husband said he would sort it out with the front desk. Meanwhile, I sat gazing over Sydney harbour in my robe finishing my coffee. Suddenly there was a loud whirring noise and I was face to face with 2 men standing a few feet away cleaning my window. Then the one guy gave me a thumbs up sign and winched his way down the building. It was all over in a few minutes.I was left contemplating the possible scenarios that they could have witnessed. You don't expect this on the 29th floor at 7.30 in the morning. We mentioned this (and the stewardess thing) to the Reception and received a plate of hand made chocolates delivered to the room and a hand written apology from the Manager. It did not affect my stay nor my opinion of the hotel overall. Would definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: bizotraveller
Reviews.Content: I got room 815 which although is on the lower levels, still has great views of the Opera house and the harbour. I'm thinking the higher rooms would be brilliant. Oh well maybe next time. But the room I got was excellent. Oversized and a very very sweet bed which i slept in like a baby. Room service was a little bit slow, but then again I wasn't timing them too much. The sashimi was a little bit pricey as well. I could have walked to a sushi shop and got a lot more for the same price. I've stayed in most hotels in Sydney and the four seasons ranks up there amongst the best.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Gallavanting Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights prior to embarking on a cruise to Los Angeles. The hotel was part of a Princess pre cruise package but we upgraded to a Harbour View Room. We were on floor 11 and the view was amazing. The hotel was smart and efficient as you would expect. We did not eat in the hotel as we wanted to see and experience as much of Sydney as we could in the short time we were there. The hotel is ideally situated right by Circular Quay for ferrys, Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk, The Rocks, Bus Terminal, Opera House and lots of restaurants and pubs. Our cruise ship also docked within walking distance of the hotel and was in fact parked almost under our window.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired rooms & bad room layout”
Reviews.Author: CLKPerth
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Four Seasons in Singapore and having the most wonderful time we had no hesitation in staying at the Four Seasons Sydney. Bad mistake. Firstly, once the booking was made we were trying to organise airport transfers thru concierge. The guy we were dealing with just could not comprehend that there were 3 of us. He continually confirmed everything for 2 pax. We had booked a full harbour, opera house and circular quay junior suite for an average of $800 per night. Upon arrival at the room whilst the view was fantastic the bathroom took up the corner where most of the views would have been. The bathroom was tiny and you couldnt have more than 1 person in there at a time. The wardrobe was on the other side of the room so you had to walk out of the bathroom and thru the room to reach the walk in closet. Crazy room layout. More on the room layout - the old old TV faced the bed and completely away from the lounge area. The desk chair blocked the entrance to the bathroom. Anyway, we went out for dinner expecting our sons rollaway bed to appear after dinner. What did appear was that the lounge was rolled out to reveal a sofa bed. Really? For an 18 yr old boy at $800 per night. The mattress was approx 2 inches thick. My husband went down to front desk to request a proper rollaway bed. He was told that for the room we booked the sofa bed was what was offered. FOR $800 per night in a junior suite!! Yeh NO! After some discussion a rollaway bed was bought up and I have attached photos of the quality. This was basically the standard of this hotel overall. Very very tired. Some positives - the location of the hotel is great, the food is good and once we got there concierge was very helpful. In addition, there was no pool attendant, the fridge and phone broke down in our room and I was locked in a treatment room at the spa after a door handle came off. Would I recommend the hotel - NO!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Seasons as part of our work convention. We stayed for seven nights in a full harbour view room. From the moment you arrive at the hotel it is a five star welcome. Excellent reception staff and check in procedure. Room was a little small (have to expect this is a city hotel) but very comfortable and everything is supplied. We had breakfast in our room the first morning which was the best breakfast ever! We also attended events in the meeting rooms and the ballroom all of which were excellent - food and drinks very good. No complaints with this hotel at all - excellent location in the city and shops/internet/laundry access just outside the hotel. Very close to the Rocks area, Opera House, Botanic Gardens and many good bars!! You will NEVER want to leave. Staying at this hotel is an absolute luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, a four seasons”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: For business, stayed only one night. Clearly a more dated hotel than Hilton, Westin. But well maintained, still very four seasons. Good service. Location is pretty much by the harbour, walkable to Circular Quay. Probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant room with average service.”
Reviews.Author: THE INSPECTOR
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Four Seasons 1 hour ahead of the check-in time of 3.pm on the slim chance that a room would be available. "Please come back in an hour",we did and the room still was not ready?The piano was playing and the doors were being opened but the basic service was not available. We finally obtained our room after another 15 minutes with our bags to follow. After waiting 1.5 hours we still had not received our bags. Called reception "your bags are top priority Sir", 20 minutes later they arrived? After these experiences we did not try the meals etc.but opted to eat out. We tried "The Waterfront" (excellent service & food) and "The Italian Village"(excellent service & food), both are located a short walk (150 metres) from the Four Seasons just past the Overseas Shipping Terminal. The Opera House View room was excellent with 2 windows, 1 with Opera House & 1 with city views. Plenty of room with king size bed,lounge, table, fridge,robes T.V cabinet etc. The bathroom was huge ( 'L shaped ) with a separate vanity area,huge bath, fantastic shower, fluffy towels,robe & slippers . The room was meant to be non-smoking but had ashtrays? Overall the location and facility is excellent just the service is uncoordinated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel, poor food”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: Firstly, its in an awesome location - if you want to be by Circular Quay, Rocks, Opera House, etc this hotel is great for that. but.......... .........the hotel is not up to Four Seasons standard. If you are expecting immpecable service, 5 star attention and the finest food then you'll be dissapointed. I'd say it was 4 star at best, and in some areas (food) its 3 star. The hotel is perfectly comfortable and clean if a little dated but is not as luxurious as a Four Seasons usually is. The outdoor hotel pool and spa are also good, but again dated and the pool service is OK but yet again not up to the Four Seasons brand. The ajoining Spa and treatments are very good, especially by Sydney standards. My one area of criticism is the food. The restaurants have terrible service (especially at Breakfast) and the quality of food is exceptionally poor for a 5 star hotel. Its no coincidence the restaurants are rarely busy. I'm amazed the managment hasn't spotted this and attempted to improve the food and service. I've stayed in most Sydney hotels in my 7 years of business and holiday travel and all in all this is a perfectly good hotel, in a great location, with OK service However, it isn't worthy of the Four Seasons brand and is letting them down. If you do stay here make sure you get good rates and don't be persuaded into paying top prices in return for the usual Four Seasons quality, as you won't find that quality at this Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loretta360
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good service and comfortable room. Sydney is a pricey city so expect things to be pricey here. Dry cleaning for 1 shirt is $13 aussie dollars. Breakfast buffet was $ 29 aussie dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, incredible beds and world class service.”
Reviews.Author: VirtuosoDownunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in December, 2007. We booked Opera House View Junior Suites. The view was stunning, we had to pinch ourselves! I would agree with other comments that the outside of the hotel is fairly uninspiring and dated, and I am sure that the hotel is aware of this. Where they come into their own is the service and overall experience which is in keeping with Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts. The bed was the most fabulos I have ever slept in, and indeed we are looking to buy one this year! Would go back tomorrow. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Tired City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidWynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel post cruise 9th Jan 2008 for two nights. The day before arrival I reconfirmed a large vehicle by email for 13 suitcases for the two large families and received the hotel emailed confirmation. At the port having not been met and waiting for forty minutes the families walked the two hundred metres to the hotel leaving me with the suitcases. i was left for two and a half hours standing in the blazing sun because the hotel had not arranged the vehicle. I arrived sun burned and more than a little annoyed, I had phoned at least six times and was always put on hold and got no where, and this was on a Spanish mobile phone calling Australia. By way of my family going to and from the port to the hotel we eventually got transport. This hotel is used by the cruise ship companies and therefore it was literally a chaos at the hotel with the huge amount of arrivals and departures on that morning, something to bear in mind if booking this hotel. On arrival I was told that their would be no charge for the vehicle and they arranged a free airport drop off two days later. I know mistakes can happen but when you receive written confirmation of your instructions and are paying 630 dollars a night you really do expect it to be right....and it wasnt. The hotel room was a junior suite full harbour view on the ninth floor. The view was excellent of the Opera House and bay. The room was really very average, dull and a little tired, it had nothing positive to comment upon other than the view. The lobby and bar area are also very normal with little to comment on. I took my son to the swimming pool which has to be the ugliest I have ever visited, it is continually in shadow and has no natural ambience being in a concrete surrounded area next to a railway line. The water was very cold bearing in mind we were in peak summer. In brief the hotel is very well positioned for visiting the rocks area and the Opera House and the views from the full harbour view rooms are very nice but that apart the Four Seasons Sydney is a well worn ugly city hotel with little charm. This hotel is well below par from its sister hotels from the same chain. Sydney is a beautiful city and everywhere is within a short walking distance. Other hotels may not overlook the Opera House but if visiting Sydney I strongly suggest that you do not repeat my mistake by placing to much emphasis on the view. I would not stay at this hotel on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, but this is not Four Seasons quality”
Reviews.Author: anthonyuk
Reviews.Content: Let's be absolutely clear about this. This place is not the standard of your usual Four Seasons. It is really a four star hotel parading as a five star due to the stunning views you can get from your room (and you certainly pay for that view!). We had a full harbour view room and the views of the New Year fireworks was absolutely superb. The room itself had a very comfortable bed and a nice bathroom. However, it just didn't have the finish you'd expect of a five star hotel. It even had the old fashioned large box television rather than a more modern LCD. This may seem a small point, but you really don't see this kind of thing at five star hotels anymore. The bar in the lobby was very nice though and the staff helpful. We even had room service one night and were surprised with just how good the food was. For the view, it was amazing, but overall this is really not Four Seasons quality.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, international 5*”
Reviews.Author: EmPalmer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for a night in December 2007. As you would expect of the group, the hotel is an international standard 5* hotel with great facilities and rooms, and high service levels. Nothing was too much trouble. The most wonderful thing for me was the location â€“ five minutes walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks area. I got a fantastic deal through Expedia and would definitely recommend this location for both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Two Seasons at Best”
Reviews.Author: gogobag
Reviews.Content: Like many others here, we made the mistake of assuming, "well, it's a Four Seasons, it can't be that bad." We were wrong. It's bad. At least for the price you're paying and the expectations of what the Four Seasons brand connotes, it's bad. Our room had a terrific view and location, other than that, it was charmless, dated and basically unclean (see the photos). The staff makes an effort to distract you from the fact that your room looks more like an airport Marriott than a luxury hotel property. But it couldn't make up for all that was lacking. The TV is old and has a very limited selection. The carpet and couch were stained. The shower control was broken. The gym was small, too hot and poorly equipped. The pool is a cement enclosure alongside a highway. A concierge made us a reservation at the wrong location, leaving us to convince the maitre d' that we really did call for a reservation. To the hotel's credit, they did give us a discount after we'd complained enough. My advice? Choose a smaller boutique hotel or go to the much more charming Park Hyatt (no, I'm not a shill for them.) Don't repeat our mistake until this place gets the major overhaul it needs.

Reviews.Title: “Is it a real Four Seasons?”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful service and a great location. The rooms however are on the small side and do not come with the quality one would normally expect from the Four Seasons. while clean and nice the decoration does not set the hotel apart from its middle range competitors

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: RK1London
Reviews.Content: When you book to stay in a four seasons you expect a minimum level of luxury and comfort in your stay. We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and i can safely say that the place lets the four seasons brand down and has made us question whether we will ever choose this brand again. It screams 1970's! This hotel was part of our honeymoon and if you are looking for somewhere special. This is most definately not the place for you, The only thing that i would say are true 5* are the breakfasts and the porters. Everything else is certainly not. The room was tiny we paid for a full harbour view which we got but the room smelt musty and the bathroom was tiny and not that great. The pool area was horendus. Really realaxing with a motorway equivilent that you can see whilst you are sun bathing and generally a shabby area.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: ucha
Reviews.Content: When you choose a Four Seasons you basically think (if nothing else) that you can't go wrong, that you aren't risking much because it's a Four Seasons! One of our honeymoon stops was Sydney so we booked the Four Seasons. After a long haul flight from Tokyo via Singapore we were pretty anxious to get some rest. Upon arrival it didn't look like a lobby fit for a hotel of that category. We were also not impressed with the old and ill-maintained elevators. But the real shock came from the room. It was so small that our 3 pieces of luggage barely fit anywhere. The room had no decorative objects except for a plastic alarm clock from the 80's... The window was tiny so the "harbour view" was almost non-existent. The bathroom was proportional to the room. We were so appaled with the room that we immediately went to the business center to use the internet and look for another hotel and left. We didn't try any of the restaurants but we did have a look at the spa and its menu which was very limited. The outdoor pool consists of a small tank at the back of the hotel. Definitely not going back to that hotel and have learnt the lesson about making general assumptions about hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Not Four Seasons Caliber”
Reviews.Author: blsandler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adequate, but certainly not of typical Four Seasons caliber. The rooms are tiny, the bathrooms are even smaller, the look of the hotel is dated, and many rooms smell of smoke (even on non-smoking floors). My husband and I switched rooms three times and concluded that all the rooms in the hotel smell like smoke and are small. One more word on the smell: we had them send an air purifier to our room on two separate occasions and it made no difference either time. Of course, however, because it is a Four Seasons, certain elements of the hotel were great. The room views were awesome (we overlooked the harbor and saw both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from our window) and breakfast buffet is delicious. The bar downstairs is very happening (great live jazz), and they serve delicious munchies with all drinks. Location was great (right in the center of everything) and the gym was large and had nice equipment. If in Syndey again, I would not stay at this hotel. It truly isn't of the FS standard and I believe that another hotel could easily outshine this dated Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Feel--Great Service”
Reviews.Author: RockDoc50
Reviews.Content: I recently had a three-night stay by myself at the Four Seasons Hotel in Sydney. I was there strictly for a holiday and to sight-see. I booked a small suite on the Executive Club Floor, and that's exactly what I got. As others have noted, the hotel has seen better days. It has a very "tired" feel to it--the furnishings are aging and the facility itself desperately needs an upgrade. I spent a lot of money on my room--overall I think the value received was reasonable but not great. My room, located on a high floor, did have a nice view of the Harbor, including the Opera House and the Bridge, but neither window was posiitoned to see the entire Harbor, either while seated at the desk in the small sitting room, or from the bed in the bedroom That was a MAJOR disappointment, since I booked the room based on the view. The only way to get a nice view was to stand by either window. That being said, I did enjoy my stay. The Club had continuous servings of food throughout the day, including a fabulous breakfast (they had a chef prepare eggs to order) and nice evening heavy hors d'oervres, and after dinner drinks with a nice selection of premium spirits. The Club Concierge has to be rated as one of the finest I have ever experienced. She made every effort to make recommendations about restaurants and places of interest. Since I only had 3 days to explore, I tried to make use of every minute--and her help was invaluable. Little touches really helped, like arranging to have breakfast delivered gratis to my room early on the day of my departure. A major disappointment, though, was her inability to push a reservation at my first-choice restaurant--I understand that it is difficult to reserve at the last minute, but at least she tried. The room itself was laid out fine except for the positioning of the windows. There was a nice working desk, a small sitting area with television (neither television in the sitting area or bedroom were a flat screen---they should definitely upgrade), and a small wet bar. The bathroom was very small, though with a separate walk-in shower---I wish it were designed to have its own window looking out on the Harbor. The bedroom was small with a comfortable king bed. I did spend an hour at the outside small pool. The pool area was cozy and well laid-out, and the service was very attentive. Location was great--walking distance to Circle Quay and the Opera House. Service is what sets this hotel apart from others. Simply put, there are few hotel properties that provide the type of service that Four Seasons consistently does, and that was not an exception in Sydney. So despite the fact that the hotel needs some plastic surgery, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Oshanda
Reviews.Content: I expected more for what I paid. My wife and I spent the weekend at the Four Seasons and I was disappointed with the size of the room that we got for the amount that we paid - it was small and pokey. The whole look and feel of the hotel was old and tired. The room did have a very good view over the harbour bridge and the opera house but we paid an excessive premium for it. There is better value and more comfortable rooms to be had at other hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Four Seasons Gloabaly”
Reviews.Author: rkhny2004
Reviews.Content: After staying at many of the properties in this chain I was incrediblly dissapointed at my experience here. Like one of the May reviews I found the hotel understaffed, not well informed of their own city and at best "tired". I had booked a car to pick me up on arrival, it did not show up despite several e mails with the concierge, who seemed completely unable to book a car service. At check in they lost my luggage and despite an early check in my room was not ready until 2 pm. When I was sent to the assigned room, it was the wrong room and belonged to someone else with my same last name and was a smoking room. After going back to the front desk and wasting even more time, I was finally assigned the proper room..now 3:00 pm. The concierge who screwed up the car service made reservations at a "hip, australian restaurant with great wine list" per my request. Unfortunately, it was an Asian restaurant full of screaming children, bad food and loud music, excactly what I had not requested. The room I was given was on the executive floor with a club. However, they failed tto tell me that just because i was on that floor did not mean I could use the club. I showed for breakfast and was literally run out as "I did not belong". I spend about 40 room nights at 4 Seasons annaually and have never seen such a poorly managed hotel. Do not stay here if you are a Four Seasons veteran or you will be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Tricolours
Reviews.Content: I have no doubt that 15 years ago this was the most grand hotel in Sydney. It isn't now however, but they are still charging like it is. My experience wasn't bad, in fact the staff where wonderful, the room was pleasant and the facilities where Ok, its just that when I pay just shy of $AUD400 a night I expect more. I have previously reviewed the Sheraton on the Park in Sydney and would like to add it beats the four seasons in every category quite convincingly and especially as much more often you can score a deal on one of the booking sites with it than you can at the Four Seasons. My major negative with the whole place was it is just a bit dated and they will really need to spend big dollars soon to maintain a five star rating which I personally feel rating groups give out way to freely. Another thing that caused me irritation was I was running late for a meeting and had to quickly iron a shirt. Unfortunately the room had no iron so I had to call housekeeping and 30 mins later I had my iron and I was now really late for my meeting. Why the hell wouldn't a major hotel just put an iron in the room?? Other than that the other facilities such as the pool area were OK without making you feel you where at a five star establishment. Overall in no way would I rate it bad however compared to some of its peers I just felt it didn't quite measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Old Favourite”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend in late September. We have stayed here from time to time over the past 20 years and come back to it because of the excellent location. It used to the The Regent and really very little has changed in terms of overall impressions. It has been updated and retains a great sense of luxury and quality although in a rather conservative "marble and beige" way. The rooms are well appointed, of average size and suplied with lovely Occitane toiletries. Many rooms have fantastic views and even the city views can be very good. It is the location which makes it though - alongside Circular Quay allowing easy access to the ferries, downtown shops and the Rocks. We booked on the internet and got a good last minute rate.

Reviews.Title: “Samll rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: Emmanuelle70
Reviews.Content: Smallish rooms, but comfortable, and fantastic location. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “TOp view and place”
Reviews.Author: BoogyOz
Reviews.Content: Thew view from the room was great, the checkin process was good although there was a bit of a wait. The food in the hotel was good, i did expect better but i can not complain. The rooms were well finished and the beds very confy. Overal experience was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: williams44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and then 1 more night later in our trip in July. Our first two nights cost AUD$350/night including the buffet breakfast (weekend special), and our third night was AUD$350 with no breakfast. We thought it was a great deal, especially the weekend special. There's a reason that the Four Seasons has a great reputation - great service. We had reserved city view room for all three nights, but we were upgraded to an opera view room for the first two nights and then a junior suite on our third night. Almost in every Four Seasons we've stayed at, we've been upgraded. It's really smart of them to do that - it doesn't cost them any more and it goes a long way in terms of good will. The hotel itself is not what I normally think of when I think of a Four Seasons hotel. It's more like what I call a "conference hotel." Maybe it was something else before. It's a high-rise building, with a more business-like feelng. It has a great location by the Rocks. Very convenient to everything. The front desk person was very friendly, courteous and efficient. We were able to check in even though it was before 9 am. That was great, especially after getting off a long international flight! In terms of the rooms themselves, we can't complain. We had a great view of the Opera House from the 32nd floor on our first two nights (we asked for a room on a high floor) and then also on the 12th floor on our third night. The rooms were comfortable, as expected. The junior suite was huge. The buffet breakfast, as you would expect, was very good. The service at the concierge was a bit uneven. We had an encounter with one woman who didn't really know what she was talking about. We had better luck getting information from the tourist information booth across the street from the hotel. We would recommend this hotel highly. We had read some mixed reviews on these boards, but we really couldn't find any faults. We love the Four Seasons chain!

Reviews.Title: “360 View of the City!”
Reviews.Author: Traceymari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the 360 suite--and sweet it was! What a view! We could see the ENTIRE harbour, the bridge, the opera house, and Manley Island. What a city! This was the best city visit we've ever taken and the hotel is located right on Circular Quay--right in the heart of downtown happenings. The suite is on the executive level, so bfast, lunch, and cocktails & snacks were included in the room stay. Bathroom was spectacular--marble everywhere and wonderful L'occietain soaps & lotions! Spa was fabulous. Gym is terrific--great view of the street below while doing cardio. Food & presentation @ the hotel was exceptional. Everything was delicious and so fresh! Wonderful breakfast muscli! They even gave me the recipe! We arrived very early in the morning and the bfast buffet was just fantastic after spending 15hrs in a plane. Hotel is located right next to the Rocks, and there are many excellent restaurants and pubs in the Quay, just a quick walk away. Far away the best hotel in Sydney. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at....”
Reviews.Author: FSTouroftheWorld
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel in Sydney. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Rooms are tiny and look nothing like the photos on the website. My husband and I tried to have a romantic weekend together there and booked a suite. The suite had horribly old carpet, and a horribly old smell to go with it, and the view was of a brick wall. So we moved - to a higher floor - and it was a shoebox. The pool area was very average. They staff were rude. We checked out after one night and went home. We've stayed at the Westin in Sydney many times before that and many times since and that is by far and away a superior hotel. We have stayed at the FS Los Angeles (South Doheny Drive), FS Maldives at Kuda Huraa, FS Bahamas, FS Jackson Hole, FS Arizona and FS Whistler, and I was shocked at truly how appalling this hotel really was. It is the old Regent Hotel (which it was prior to FS purchasing the property) and it has not been updated since the 80's. I can understand a hotel not being updated, however, this needs to be reflected accurately in photos and the price needs to reflect this also.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Suites if you want extra space-well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: YoMan
Reviews.Content: We spent five wonderful nights in Sydney in August. We frequently stay in Four Seasons Properties because we like the consistant quality. After reading reviews, we booked the FS Sydney. Because we had our son with us we elected to book a junior suite. We heard the regular rooms were not as large as a typical FS room. The suite ended up costing the price of a regular room in other Four Seasons. So I thought the price was fair. Got upgraded to a full harbour view and Opera House view. The room was typical FS quality, plenty spacious. All staff was great. I would highly recommend the FS Sydney. On our return trip to Sydney we spent two nights at the Park Hyatt. Also a wonderful property, but the room was not as large as the junior suite at the FS. The retail price at the Hyatt was more, but I used points so cannot complain. Per other reviews the FS is in a great location, short walk to the rocks and very close to Circular Quay for all types of transportation (bus, train, ferry)

Reviews.Title: “Wow- Four Seasons made our stay so special”
Reviews.Author: LynneandSteve
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney on 15th August to celebrate my husband's birthday the next day. I had arranged for a car to collect us from the hotel and the driver was waiting in arrivals with his Mercedes outside. As we pulled onto the hotel drive we were greeted by Melissa (an assistant manager) who welcomed us both and wished my husband a happy birthday for the next day. Melissa took us straight up to the room and the minimal check in was done there. We had been upgraded to a harbour view suite and the view was stunning, to the left was the harbour bridge and to the right the Opera house. We had only been in the room a short while when room service delivered a birthday cake and a birthday card signed by the hotel manager. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is in a great location just by Circular Quay and a very short walk to the Rocks. There is a pool but we did not use it as the weather was just a little to cold in August. When we got home we found that a small error had been made on our bill. I contacted Four Seasons who passed the request on to the hotel who sorted it in a couple of days and sent me an e-mail to confirm this. I then received an e-mail from the hotel manager apologising for this oversight. It seems that Four Seasons are repared to go that extra mile to ensure that their guests are totally satisfied. We cannot praise this hotel too highly for their staff, attention to detail and location. We had excellent value for our stay and should we be in Sydney again (which we hope to be) we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not as good as hoped”
Reviews.Author: OzOlive
Reviews.Content: I had nowhere else to go from my office's preferred supplier list so had to move hotels into the Four Seasons. Service at front desk was good and very friendly. Nice lobby and public areas (piped muzak can get a bit irritating though). Room was the tiniest I have ever been in but not unpleasant. Furniture OK. There was no view (to be expected as I was on a corporate rate). Bed comfy and super clean linens, surfaces, bathroom etc - no dust or dirt anywhere. Breakfast buffet looked fine from what I saw - I had porridge and it was fine. Data connections bit archaic - fee payable for internet access (take your wireless card! - although if you do, bear in mind this may be a bit flaky if you are in a room on a high floor - the wireless is a bit unpredictable in the city on high rise floors) Excellent shower and great toiletries in the rooms - L'Occitane. Turn down service ok. No iron or ironing board in room which I found a bit surprising. On the whole - nothing offputting but just average stay - to be fair my room was very good value for short notice in Sydney and in such a central location at AUD210 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons- Fabby!”
Reviews.Author: lesleyc
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the Four Seasons quite some months before going- got 4 nights for the price of 3 which according to the receptionist was excellent value. Had a fabulous time there- lovely room with plently of space- all the staff were very helpful, polite and friendly. Ate at the cafe restaurant on the 2nd floor once- food good and prices fine. Also had room service- quick and again, reasonable. Spa was excellennt- good treatments and pleasant staff. Fitness area also good- made use of the outdoor spa every night- was dark but heated so that was fine. Had a great stay- recommend it to all- great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: firtreecott
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel as a base for our holiday in Australia so stayed there three seprate times over a three week spell. The rooms are small, so book a suite if you like a bit of space. The website photos do tell the truth - there is just the one armchair in a standard room. The views are good, but stay high up to reduce the traffic noise. Breakfast is good and breakfast staff are brilliant, but plan your trips to the toaster. The bar is still a bit smokey and receptionists can be a bit offhand. However, we were very comfortable here; the bellhops were marvellous, housekeeping were prompt and efficient, the bar staff were great and the location is excellent for access to Circular Quay and the Rocks (and also for buses to Newtown for economy dining). We had just stayed at the Shangri-La in Singapore, so it was a bit of a come-down to stay here. I might consider staying elsewhere next time, just to get a bit more space for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the four seasons!”
Reviews.Author: Hyde01
Reviews.Content: We went to Australia for our 5th anniversary and our first stop was Sydney. The four seasons hotel was amazing, if I were going back I would definitely stay there again. First of all the location in unbeatable. It is within walking distance of some of the major attractions and the Rocks District is very pretty. You will also find many travel points nearby from a taxi stand right outside to the boat cruises, subway station and buses within a minute walk. We were upgraded to a harbour view room. Had we known how gorgeous the view would be of the harbour and the opera house we likely would have chosen the upgraded room to start with. However, I have read many reviews where others have stated they were given the same upgrade so it was nice not to have to pay the additional money for it. The room was not huge but was extremely comfortable. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have probably ever had, it far out beats the Heavenly Bed at the Westin hotels.
