Everything in the room was done to a high standard from the large selection of tea, to the turndown service to the excellent L'Occitane toilettries. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. We did not get a chance to use the pool as we were out seeing the sites most days and the day we thought about swimming the lounge chairs were all taken. We only had one meal at the hotel which was breakfast upon our arrival. The food was great but it was pricier than what we were looking for and in that district there is an abundance of restaurants and bars to choose from. Overall the location and view are unbeatable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Australia, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MauidAmy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on our recs from here and other recs were dead on. Perfect location and good views (if you book that type room). I booked our room (#2114-make sure to ask for a higher room) through asiarooms dot com and was hesitant at first, but everything was there and correct. The rooms were small, but nice views. Comfy beds and pillows and great and yummy room service. We needed room service after our 15 hour flights and walking around untl bedtime (to fight jet lag). We were near the ferry, public transportation, etc. My complaints were the spa at the pool was cold and not full. We looked forward to this to help relax at night after walking around all day. Also the prices at the bar were pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: teddyrex
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Hotel - Sydney AU My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney for two weeks in April prior to sailing on SAPPHIRE PRINCESS to Los Angeles. The hotel is wonderful and we had a marvellous time. We had a full harbor view junior suite (rooms ending in 15 have the most spectacular views of the harbor - Opera House, Bridge and Circular Quay) and it was large and elegantly furnished! (Note: regular rooms appear to be beautiful but on the small side). We paid the extra fee for membership in the Executive Club which was pricey but worth it with wonderful breakfasts, cocktail hours and desserts daily plus a fabulous concierge, Jane, just for Exec Club members. She was very helpful in all ways and invaluable in finding my wife a doctor when necessary. The regular hotel concierge, Jorge, was also great - booking restaurants, etc. The Hotel's restaurant, Kable's was excellent - great food and service (not fancy or fussy!) and we enjoyed eating several dinners there (much better food than we had at some of the "top" and most expensive restaurants in the Rocks/ Circular Quay area). We did not use the Spa but the outdoor pool was lovely and the poolside lunches were great. In summary, this was a lengthy stay at any hotel and we will remember it as one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at anywhere! Wish Australia was not so far away so we could return often to the Four Seasons Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: SydneysidersSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Deluxe Opera House / Harbour view Junior Suite. The room was very large, opulent and very smart. The staff were incredible and amazingly attentive. Received complimentary champagne and strawberries for our honeymoon night. The view was amazing. An absolutely lovely, charming hotel with very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but loosing its shine”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: I generally clock up around 60 hotel nights a year in Sydney and have also provided reviews of the Westin and Shangri La, so now its Four Seasons turn. The FS brand usually markets itself on absolute quality, immaculate service and unforgettable experiences. FS Sydney however excels in some aspects but is definitely hamstrung by the quality of its rooms. Rooms - the rooms are the weakest link to the hotel. They are definitely on the small side, okay they're TINY. The bathroom is also small and is only sectioned off by a sliding door. Not much privacy if you're rooming with someone else. The views are good, but much better from the Shangri La. Decor wise, its definitely time for a re-furb. With the like of Hilton, Westin and Sheraton being newer hotels (or recently re-furbed), FS will continue to struggle. The hotel is due for an 'interior refurb' in 2007 but whether this means new rooms I'm not too sure. Cost of in room use of broadband is definitely on the high side. Service - this is the one area that FS excels at, however after staying at this property over 4 years the level of attentiveness is beginning to loose its shine. Services provided by porters and doormen can be hit and miss. Reception is very good, always welcoming and very efficient. Room service is generally very good. Housekeeping is excellent. Food - I've only ever ordered room service and its been good. Prices however are definitely on the high side, but expected. Not a huge fan of the restaurant ambiance so I've never eaten there. Being so close to the Rocks, much better to talk a walk and eat there instead. Spa/Health Club. Health Club facilities are good, spa treatments are done in very relaxing surroundings but once again, prices reflect accordingly. Overall, staying at the FS, the service shines through and makes my stays there generally very pleasant and memorable. Travelling alone, I don't mind the small rooms but I can see how it can be a problem when 2 or more are travelling. Is the FS Sydney same as other FS's around the world, probably not. Can you get a room with a better view, definitely yes, but does any other hotel offer the same level of service, probably not. This hotel still remains one of my favourite hotels in Sydney. If there were the option to give 4.5 stars I would, but this case its only a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service and great views.”
Reviews.Author: ocalllo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had both lived and travelled in Australia as backpackers and wanted our return to Sydney on our honeymoon to be special. Our travel agent got us a great deal in the Four Seasons and we could not refuse. (altho we later discovered that there had been a mix up and the booking agent got the price wrong and it should have been dbl what we paid put they picked up the excess!) We arrived into Sydney and got the express train down to Circular Quay and strolled over to the hotel (probably the only ones ever to do so). We were very early to arrive but there was not a mention of this and we were checked in immediately. We were told we had a city view room, we enquired about upgrading as given the location you just had to have a room overlooking the harbour. We were told it would be $25 to upgrade (not made clear if this was p/n or pppn we were too embarrassed to ask) but decided to go for it. We got the full talk about the hotel and all the facilities from the check in staff and really felt like vip's. The room was beautiful and definitely luxury but very very small, but when you opened the window to take in the view it didn't matter about the size of the room. With the Opera House on one side and the Bridge on the other we were taken away by the beauty, having spent many a day at the harbour dreaming as a backpacker we never thought we would be returning in style! The service was exceptional everywhere especially at the pool. The pool boy was extremely attentive and altho i agree with another reviewer they could do with more chairs you never felt awkward as you waited for one to arrive. We loved Sydney before we arrived at the Four Seasons and now like it even more. ps the upgrade was per room per night - bargin

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: aus99
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. Room was clean and well set out - had all facilities you would expect. Windows must have been double glazed as very quiet and could not hear the George Street traffic. Two minutes walk to Circular Quay so easy access to trains and ferries and a pleasant place for a stroll. Staff were friendly and efficient. Have stayed in a fair number of Sydney CBD hotels on business and reckon this is one of the better ones - will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Seasons this is not....”
Reviews.Author: JBeers
Reviews.Content: Just left the Four Seasons Sydney and am still at a loss as to how this hotel could possibly be a Four Seasons! We were booked to stay over a week and when we saw the room (rather, the tiny dark hole with a view of the expressway) we immediately decided to check out the next morning. We arrived quite late the night before and when we pulled up, there was not one person at the valet or at the door to greet us. I realize it was nearing midnight but come on, it's a Four Seasons, where's the service? We waited in our rental car for a few moments, thinking SOMEONE was bound to emerge and help us with our luggage and valet the car. No one came. I actually had to walk into the lobby and wave and say "hello?" to get the attention of the receptionists at the front desk. Finally, someone came out to help with the luggage cart. As I said before, we were shocked upon entering the room, which was smaller than the smallest hotel room in NYC. There was about 2 feet between the foot of the bed and the TV cabinet so my fiance and I keep bumping into each other. We didn't even unpack our suitcases and could barely manuver about the room. We asked to be upgraded that evening to a larger room but were told that the hotel was booked at 110% capacity. When we mentioned that we had made our booking months in advance, it made no difference. Overall, the lobby was nice and the hotel was clean. However, if you are expecting the service and room standard of a typical Four Seasons hotel, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudiaspiandorim
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 6-year-old daughter and I stayed at the Four Seasons Sydney from Dec 25th 2006 to Jan 05th 2007. We booked a Jr. Suite with city views. We found the hotel to be an excellent place to stay in Sydney, with a great location and flawless service. The room was fantastic, the staff always willing to help, the food we ordered from room service was nice and the outdoor pool very inviting on those hot summer days. Of course the hotel's decor is a bit dated, it is not a new hotel, but all the public areas were always clean, and the staff members ready to help. The only thing I think needs improvement is because the pool area is quite small ,there are not enough chairs , so quite often guests had nowhere to sit, which is something unnaceptable for a five-stars hotel. Other than that, we loved the Four Seasons and will definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace”
Reviews.Author: LyndhurstPrahran
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when it was the Regent on several occasions, and universally enjoyed the experience. I gather that FS are planning on upgrading the property ( I stayed with my wife in June 2006) but at last years visit, the place was dreadful. The room was expensive even by Sydney standards, and the room itself was old, badly in need of updating and impersonal. The hotel was filled with conference attendees. They held meetings all over the place in common areas, the staff did nothing to stop this. This alone made the stay dreadful The restaurant service was shocking, understaffed, meals left on tables well after guests had gone Not up to four seasons standards. Great position, but there are so many great hotels in Sydney that I will not stay here again until it is taken to with a broom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: highloyo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel by the Circular Quay. Things I liked about the hotel are convenience to Opera House and ferries and the service. I didn't like the size of the rooms. Unless you book a Jr suite or suite (which are both very expensive), the rooms are tiny. Our teeenager traveled with us and since there aren't rooms with 2 beds, we ended up with a king and a roll-away. This took up quite a bit of walking area within the room. We had a highly discounted room so it really had no view except for the street below. The service though is unmatched, especially the housekeeping staff and the bathroom amenities. The food in the restaurants and coffee shop are expensive but its the 4 Seasons and quite frankly, food seemed expensive throughout Auastralia. Interent service was a daily $20 Au. a bit steep. I think more and more hotels should start providing free internet service since wireless connections are so cheap these days. It must be a real moneymaker for hotels though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Tripper35
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Seasons Sydney over New Year. The hotel is desperately in need of a refurb; at the moment it might be a great place to host an Austin Powers party, but without any such fancy dress on hand to create the right vibe, it just looks passÃ©. We stayed in a junior suite with a full harbour view, which was an amazing place for viewing the fireworks and very spacious, so we were able to have a few friends round to share the experience. But the decor was tired and dated, as was the bathroom. Yes, it's a city hotel, so no doubt many visitors are there on business and you donâ€™t expect it to be the same as one of the resort hotels. Nevertheless, there are also many tourists, many of whom, like us, have no doubt booked on the strength of other Four Seasons properties and their experiences there. This was, unfortunately, sadly lacking and not comparable in any way. Even the service was simply not up to scratch, there were so many mistakes made - a room service order took 1Â½ hours to arrive, despite the fact they said it was on its way when we called to check after 50 minutes (clearly they were lying); when it arrived, the main courses were lukewarm (despite having been in a hot box - but by then we were so starving, we just ate it); the ice cream on the side of our dessert order was completely melted; we had the wrong pudding delivered with another room service order; and, our laundry and another room's was mixed up - and it took over a day to sort this out and get it back. When my boyfriend telephoned to complain at about 6pm one evening, we were informed that the hotel manager had already left for the night. We left a message with the person we spoke to for him to call us. When we left, four days later, the manager had still not returned our call. It started to make sense why the service is so bad - with a manager with that attitude, itâ€™s really not surprising and the rest of the staff don't stand a chance. As my boyfriend said, "I've stayed in 15 other Four Seasons around the world and this one is definitely at the very bottom of that list." It might have great views, but we won't be going back. Next time, weâ€™ll stay at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not on par with Four Seasons' other properties”
Reviews.Author: bikinigirl
Reviews.Content: This is just NOT a good property. They need to overhaul the entire staff! I would never stay there! You can find outstanding service and better accommodations elsewhere in Sydney--try the Establishment hotel...now that's a hotel that meets its star-rating! Of course, if you like bland, boring, slow service, rude staff...the Four Seasons is for you. I think "mediocre" is an appropriate characterization!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: roselilycat
Reviews.Content: My (adult) daughter and I booked an Opera view room at the Four seasons on 26 January for a special treat to celebrate Australia Day. We arrived early (11.30) in the hope of leaving our bags until check in at 3pm only to be advised that our room was ready and we had been upgraded to a full harbour view room on the 28th floor! We spent quite a bit of time just sitting at the window watching everything happening on the harbour and in the streets far below us. Sydney harbour is magic at night! Even though I have lived in Sydney all my life the magnificent view from our room still took my breath away. The room we had was spotless as was the bathroom. We couldnâ€™t find fault with anything. Everyone at the hotel, from having the door opened for us going into and out of the hotel even before we reached it, to the reception desk, to housekeeping, to the staff at breakfast it was wonderful. The professionalism and friendliness was first class and the hotel is to be congratulated on their staff. We will certainly be back for our next special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: moking
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights of my honeymoon at this hotel. My first impression was this is an average hotel and not up to a four seasons standard. The rooms were too small and very bland. The pool and gym were good. The best part of this hotel is the location, and i guess that is what I paid for. There are so many other great hotels in the same vicinity that are much cheaper that I would stay in the next time i went.

Reviews.Title: “Just the tonic after long flight to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: OFile
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights mid-December. Was upgraded from Opera View room to Full Harbour View room. I think it was the 23rd floor. Brilliant views. Good front desk service. Fabulous bed - really comfy. Good gym and pool area. Really worth trying to get breakfast included in the rate - it is typically Four Seasons i.e. superlative. And as if that isn't enough the location is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaytrippersNYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to splurge on our first hotel stay after the long trip from NY. Absolutely worth it. The hotel is beautiful with great ammenities (the spa was a great way to unwind after the flight and a whole day of touring) and the location (right on the water next to the circular quays) made getting in and around Sydney (including the beaches) a breeze. We got upgraded to an operahouse view, which was nice and our the room rate included a great breakfast buffet, which kept us full for most of the day. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Clancysclan
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Sydney is a fabulous Hotel. My wife and I spent Christmas and a few days before and had a wonderful experience. The staff is very attentive and extremely professional. The location is ideal to see the city. Part of our package included the breakfast buffet and you did not want for anything. If you want to be pampered, stay at the Four Seasons, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: nycbc98
Reviews.Content: My mother and I (her adult daughter) recently spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons. Before arriving, we had some qualms about staying in such a large, commercial hotel because we were concerned that it wouldn't be as personable as smaller hotels or that it wouldn't provide a "local" experience. We were, however, more than pleasantly surprised upon our arrival. The staff were very friendly and low key, while also incredibly efficient. We had many requests during our 4-night stay, and each request was met quickly and with a smile. It was particularly helpful that our room was ready more than 3 hours before the scheduled check-in, and we were upgraded to a full harbour-view room. The views of the opera house, harbour and harbour bridge couldn't be beat. The restaurant at the hotel was excellent with a very knowledgeable staff (as was room service). The pool area and spa were also wonderful treats at the end of a long day. The location was ideal, within a 5-minute walk of the rocks, the ferries and shopping (and a 10-minute walk of the opera house). It was an ideal "home" during our trip to Sydney. In sum, the hotel was truly focused on hospitality--I'm not sure I've ever stayed somewhere that was run so well at every level (check-in, housekeeping, room service, the spa, the restaurant, arranging reservations and activities in Sydney, etc.). The only downside (if I must give one) is that the rooms are a bit smaller than the other hotels in which I've stayed in Sydney (the Park Hyatt and the Sir Stamford). But the large picture window overlooking the harbour and the excellent service more than made up for the room size (as a side note, I would recommend booking the full harbour view instead of the city view in the event upgrades aren't available). When we go back to Syndey, this will be our preferred accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “agree with previous reviewer, not your average 4 seasons hotel”
Reviews.Author: huxtable
Reviews.Content: this is the third four seasons hotel we have had the pleasure of staying in, and whilst not terrible, it had the least WOW factor, compared to the hotels in Bangkok and Singapore. We stayed in the deluxe, king, city view room The lobby, is the least impressive Four Seasons lobby, it does look aged and definately the WOW factor is not there I would say that the location is very good The room we had was small to say the least. The bathrooms were puny The rooms did have a damp smell to them and lacked that freshness feeling Break fast is not worth the 40 $ bill you pay, as the choice is limited Service was good, but your expect that with this chain, as that is their main sell We would not stay here again, for the reasons mentioned above and also there are better value choices elsewhere without the Four Seaons name premium attached

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_Boston
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Four Seasons (when the price is right) ... but this location really didn't live up to the standards of the hotel's reputation. The room smelled somewhat damp & moldy. The room was very small and overall unimpressive. This is the only Four Seasons (so far) that has not lived up to the name ... it feels like a 're-labeled hotel' ... The only good things about the hotel were location and room views. The view came at a price though. This leaves the only benefit to its location. So ... if you can find a location close to the attractions you are interested in ... save the money ... Be sure to try to see a show at the Opera House ... it is a good experience ... and one of the few things to do in Sydney ... besides visiting the Rocks area ... and of course seeing Aboriginal Buskers and the Bridge Climb ... As an insider tip ... walk all the way across the bridge and then underneath for great photo ops of the city ... we were the only people (tourists) over there ... it was a great peaceful escape ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AD72
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, excellent staff, modern clean rooms and an outdoor pool. Staff were all friendly and helpful, on reception, serving breakfast and concierge. No, it isn't cheap but worth it I think.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for the view”
Reviews.Author: rambling_man_fla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are staying at this hotel for four night. We travel a ton and have stayed at various level of hotels from 4 star to Exclusive. I dont care how this hotel is rated by various magazines. I would never stay here. It is dirty and the service is lacking. The views are great if you can see thru the windows. You may think you can relax, however the hotel is on a major highway. The pool is a truck length away from the highway. The photos on the Four Seasons web site do not match what you get. I would save the money and stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Just horrendous - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: California_Family_3
Reviews.Content: My family and I normally stay in upscale hotels when we travel, but we have pretty reasonable expectations. In other words, one wrong thing here and there will not bother us. That being said, this is THE worst hotel I have ever stayed at ...by far! I don't even know where to begin...employees were extremely rude and disrespectful during our check-in. We had arranged for early check-in over the phone, yet they claimed no such arrangement was made and refused to give us a room. We had a really tired little one with us, which made all this even worse. Anyhow,a few points, to keep it brief: * hotel is pretty run down: public restrooms were missing locks, doors were scraped, soap dispensers broken; rooms are small and completely outdated, air quality not very good * staff is non-responsive and you have to ask multiple times for whatever you need * hotel food is HORRENDOUS. we are by notmeans picky eater but i can honestly say that i have never ever had food this bad...anywhere. i think i would rather walk into KFC and have one of their chicken meals than eat at 4Season's Kable again...and I am a vegiterian! You truly know the food is inedible when even steamed rice tastes bad. Anyhow, this is our first trip to Sydney so I don't know what other hotels in the city are like, but this one should not be given more than 1 star!

Reviews.Title: “Even a Sydney person likes it”
Reviews.Author: grae13
Reviews.Content: Im australian and have lived in sydney my whole life. My family and I used to go and have breakfast and stay there for one night on each of our birthdays. They have a great pool and spar and if your lucky, a good view. But like any hotel in the middle of the city, its very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Bowsy
Reviews.Content: The main factor in picking this hotel was the location and view, both of which did not disappoint! We had originally booked a family suite which had a view overlooking both the harbour bridge and opera house but had to move on our second day due to some flooding in our room from a burst pipe! Normally, this would be a disaster and we were ready to leave the hotel when they offered us an upgrade to the penthouse suite on the floor above us. I have travelled a lot but have never experienced a room quite like this with views that were simply stunning (see photos). If you want a central location fr exploring Syney with a excellent location, this is the hotel! While I realise that this is exceptional, one of the pleasant surprises while staying at the Four Seasons (apart from the room) was the quality of service and friendliness of the staff at all occassions! Having said that, the hotel in terms of 'look & feel' did come across a bit outdated for what you would expect for a Four Seasons Hotel, having been refurbished when the chain took over the original Regency Hotel which was previously there.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Random_person
Reviews.Content: Great location (a stone's throw from circular quay) and fantastic service (I phoned for an ironing board and it arrived within 90 seconds). Only complaint would be the small rooms (relative to other hotels of the same class). Unique for the Sydney CBD, the hotel has an outdoor pool which is hardly used, and a very pleasant place to relax after a pie at Harry's.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - first class hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Haggis_Supper
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife and our 2 young kids - 4 and 6 years) stayed at the Four Seasons en route from Melbourne to Coffs Harbour in September. One night on the way up and one on the way back. Pleased to say that we could not fault the hotel or the service we received. From the moment we arrived the porters helped us unload, insisted my wife calmed down and let them worry about blocking the entrance (!) and to go inside and relax. The receptionist upgraded our interconnecting rooms so we had views of the Opera House and then gave the kids a koala each ! The receptionist, porter and concierge remembered our names the following morning, helped with directions, advice and with our numerous trips to the car park. On the return trip we were welcomed back like long lost sons, upgraded again and helped with the unloading and even tidying of the car. We arrived at 8.30pm but they offered to keep the (fabulous) outdoor pool open for an extra 45 minutes to allow our kids to have a wee swim after a 6 hour drive. Every member of staff, without exception, was polite, professional, courteous and genuinely warm and friendly. I've travelled a lot with my work and I can honestly say that the level of service was unsurpassed. We will return and I can thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: LP20000
Reviews.Content: Great location and service! Our room was ready when we arrived at the hotel at 7:30 am (no extra charge for the early check-in) and we were upgraded to a room with a view of both the bridge and opera house. Room was a bit small but the service was excellent - they took us straight up to our room and checked us in there so we didn't have to deal with reception at all. Location was extremely central. We had no problems getting around on public transit. Highly recommend and will stay there again next time i am in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great harbour views”
Reviews.Author: Cailean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days in march 2006.Luxury hotel with top class service. Our room had a perfect view of Sydney Harbour including the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.Only slight disappointment was that compared to other Four seasons in Las vegas and Singapore the room was on the small side. However everything else was exactly what you would expect of a top hotel. Did not eat there so cannot comment on the food.Four Seasons is our favourite hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: carajackson2005
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Four Seasons, Sydney several times and have always been impressed! Room was a little on the small side but was very clean and very luxurious. Both the room service breakfast and the breakfast in the hotel restraunt were fantastic. All staff delt with were helpful and polite, particular the bar staff and concierge. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: BrianSantaBarbara_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the four seasons in Sydney for 5 nights in early July. I really enjoyed everything about my stay here. The room was great (not large, but not too small - it was comfortable and very well maintained) I upgraded my room to room with a view of the opera house - the views of the circular quay and opera house were amazing. The location of the hotel is really unbeatable. The service that I received from every person at the hotel was very definitely first class. The concierge was extremely helpful with bookings and directions and front desk and restuarant staff were equally welcoming. I ate breakfast at the hotel everyday and the buffet was well done. I guess the only negative comment I could make is the cost of daily internet access is A$20 which seemed like alot to me - otherwise I felt like the hotel was a great value and I would definitely recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arewethereyet!Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, its very central to everything, opera house, circular Quay, Rocks and shopping. The pool is on the roof, of the 3rd floor so if you are scared of heights its not the best place ,the cars above are zooming by, it very small pool. The hotel doorman and conceirge are polite and helpful. The food is expensive. The rooms are very small, and well our glasses and cups for coffee were dirty, that was a major turn off. When told about it, there were not too interested the least. Its very expensive ,and we felt we were not getting our moneys worth, I thought the standards would be alot higher. We would not stay here again for the fact of the dirty dishes, and there no concern attitude, We found this to be a sensitive matter. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: mccPreston
Reviews.Content: Definitely over-rated. The only good thing about it is the location although the small pool area is next to a busy road and railway line which is not conducive to relaxation. The rooms were small and our TV did not work and had to be repaired. There were very limited TV channels. The room we were initially allocated reeked of tobacco smoke and it took a while to get relocated. We repeatedly had to ask for toiletries to be replaced. Over-pretentious and not good value for money. Obviously reliant on its name and location. Would not cfhoose to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual expections of a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: BMK1
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Sydney is a takeover of a prior hotel--I think the Regent. The rooms are small but well appointed. We had a full harbor view room and the view was great. The front desk staff was friendly, but the concierge desk was shortstaffed, misinformed, unintelligent and screwed up reservations that we had made with them in advance. They did fix the mistakes but were very disorganized. The maid service and trundown were intermittent--and when they did come they didnt even leave a card at night with the weather for the next day. I have stayed in many Four Seasons hotels and this site is not up to the others. However, there location is fantastic, and maybe that is enough for them.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller rooms, but great view and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: frangipani7
Reviews.Content: The room was fairly small and plain, lacking the "wow" factor we've experienced at some other Four Seasons properties. (But it was also the least expensive Four Seasons we've stayed at). The view was fantastic --the Opera House, Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge, and Rocks District. Our room package included a buffet breakfast each morning, and it was wonderful. Highly recommended. The gym is small but adequate and was never crowded when we were there. The pool area up on the roof is pretty. The service was excellent -- unfailingly prompt and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: caz1949
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights over the New Year period. Rooms was very nice and clean with soft towels in the bathroom and plenty of toiletries. Did,nt eat in any of the restauants so can't comment on the food. Pool was great, heated. Could of done with more loungers though. Service was excellent throughout the hotel. Location was great very close to the Quay and bridge great for New Year Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: Guruswife
Reviews.Content: Each March my other half and our son have a "boys'" weekend so this year my 11yo daughter and I decided to join in the experience by having a night in the city. Last Sunday afternoon she went into both the Shangri La and the Four Seasons and made enquiries about room rates, welcome packages for children etc. The receptionist at the Shangri La looked over her head and spoke to the back wall and stopped answering her question halfway thru to serve another person...basically he dismissed her....bad choice... The Four Seasons explained what was on offer and gave her a written pamphlet with room rates etc...no prizes for guessing..she chose Four Seasons (and yes the reception area was just as busy!) I made the phone booking from home and was told if we came in a little early our room would be ready..we arrived just before 1pm and it was... 32nd Floor with full harbour view..not an upgrade but certainly a fantastic spot.. The Room.. The Four Seasons is the old Regent and room sizes are still indicative of the 70's build. Small but clean and well furnished. All things required and Occitane products in the bathrooms. Fluffy towels etc as you would expect. The Pool... We hit the pool around 3.30pm and were given lounges (no problem finding one) and served with iced water. Service was similar to asia..prompt but unobtrusive.. Our cocktails (smoothie for her) took around 10 mins and an apology was given for the delay!! (I don't think 10 mins to make a cocktail and smoothy is an excesively long time) The pool was perfect temperature and a few noodles (foam) and kickboard were supplied. The pool area has more lounges and space than the nearby Hyatt the only drawback being the few trucks on the Cahill Expressway Food.. We didn't pre reserve at any restaurants so we ate in house at Kables. Food and service equal to any five star restaurant in Sydney (prices to match but that's no surprise). The only drawback would be the lack of view. There was plenty of space and wonderful attentive service. Breakfast was part of our room rate so we dined after a short walk out to Dawes Point. Plenty of variety and the "baby smoothies drunk thru a chocolate" straw were only surpassed by the best hot chocolate ever (not as good as a brenner tho) as it was frothy and had lots of marshmallows as required. I enjoyed the array of fresh fruit and egg white souffles.. Service.. As good as any we've had anywhere. Not once were we treated as a little odd (mother and daughter sometimes attracts this) and my daughter was always treated as a valued guest (after all she was really the client I was only the cash provider!) No queues for check in, check out, or breakfast. Staff who genuinely seemd happy to be of service. Location.. One of the best spots in Sydney..convenient for all the Quay attractions and esy to get around..not uphill like the Shangri La but being high rise high enough to have a wonderful harbour view..slightly better than Intercontinental as i think more rooms have views of the bridge and Opera House...the price tag of course indicates this Now all i need to do is convince Guru to take me for a "romantic weekend" Sorry no photos..i put the battery on charge and left home without it! Guruswife

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kolya
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the New Years Eve celebration from December 29th to January 2, 2006. This hotel has a great location and harbour views. It also offers the best value for money in terms of New Years Eve accommodation in a Sydney hotel with a view of the fireworks over the harbour bridge and the opera house. The service is decent and staff is pleasant and helpful. The hotel, however, is nothing special, certainly not near the standard of some other Four Seasons Hotels. Rooms are very small and smoking floors absolutely stink with cigarettes. I have never stayed in a luxury hotel where this was so bad. Given the time of the year I was not able to change to a non-smoking floor, but luckily the staff could arrange for the room window to be opened and this was very helpful. One night I found a huge cockroach in the bathroom, which was needless to say not very pleasant. The decor in the rooms also is nothing special and the whole plays looks like it could use a makeover. Given the choice I would try a different hotel in Sydney such as Park Hyatt, Westin or Shangri-la before coming back to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Sydney location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently treated my boyfriend to a weekend break in Sydney. I booked an Opera house view room and when we checked in discovered we had been upgraded to a Junior Suite. The room was fantastic! Amazing harbour views with an incredible outlook over Circular Quay and the pool area. I would recommend requesting a higher level room as George Street can be noisy at nights particularly honking horns! The pool is fantastic particularly the cabana tents, the pool staff were very helpful and friendly as we enjoyed a delightful afternoon by the pool. The front desk staff were equally attentive and ingratiating. The breakfast which was included in our rate was impressive catering for all. The location of the hotel is superb. Minutes to The Rocks and the Opera house and ideal for a short stop over in Sydney. This is definitely one of the best hotels in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Four Seasons name”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_dot
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of the hotel--it's really convenient. Comfortable beds in ridiculously small rooms. Considering this is an older hotel, the decor is acceptable. The concierge staff is the best thing about the hotel. They are consistently helpful and attends to you immediately, well, at least the male ones do. Cab drivers may still refer to this hotel as the Regent or mistake your destination as Four Points hence it's always good to say George St after you've said Four Seasons. A lot of tour groups--especially cruises--stay here and that places a lot of stress on the staff, which is reflected in the degree of cleaniness in my room (well, they could be old stains). Horrible coffee. Breakfast buffet is average. Lunch is good. I am concerned about the competence of the front desk staff though. They are poor in customer relations and executing their job responsibilities. I will spare the details here as they are too long to write. The management keeps promising better service the next time and despite repeated stays, I have to say that there is still much room for improvement. If you don't mind climbing up a small slope, try the Shangri-La. Huge rooms with much better views than the Four Seasons. The staff is also more sincere in assisting customers and are incredibly good in team work and noticing customers' needs. This should probably go to the Shang's review. All in all, this is not your typical Four Seasons where you receive 5-star service and 5-star accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown2
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Four Seasons for four nights leading up to New Years Eve after four nights in the Park Hyatt. The Four Seasons is a big, high rise hotel. Well situated in the center of Circular Quay and walking distance to all of the imporant sites. Room was nice but only about 1/2 the size of the Park Hyatt room, and not as luxuriously appointed. Bathroom amenities were very nice. View of the Opera House was not so great and lack of opening windows made us long for the fresh air of the Park Hyatt. Service was very good overall, including the spa. The gym and pool were very nice. Breakfast in the restaurant was nice- a buffet with menu service- but not as nice as the Park Hyatt. Excellent, well informed conceierge desk staff. Hotel security was efficient and very well prepared for the massive crowds on New Years Eve. Decent mini-mart across from hotel (exit Level 3) with internet computers that are priced more reasonably than the hotel computers in the Executive Club.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took a suite on the 34th floor, the walls were coverd with mildu, the service stunk, the pool was dirty, and they wanted big tips! I shold have stayed in the Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms ... but who cares!”
Reviews.Author: Amazingplanet
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Sydney, and make a point of staying at this hotel whenever in Sydney. It cannot be beaten for overall value. There are some other lovely hotels in Sydney eg. W, Park Hyatt (a personal favourite), but the Four Seasons presents the best value without a doubt. The location is great, if you can get a harbour view room on a relatively high floor, you will not be disappointed. Whilst being very used to the amazing service one experiences throughout hotels in Asia, and always being shocked and disappointed when visiting hotels in places like Australia and the US, I find the Four Seasons service to be great - and I am a fussy camper. Yes the rooms are small, and the desk faces the wall, which is never pleasant if you need to do some work in your room, but try to get out and about and enjoy Sydney for what it is. There might not be many TV channels, as mentioned in someone elses review ... but again ... who cares! You shouldn't be in Sydney to sit in your room and watch TV. The down side would be that the rooms are noisy ie. doors closing in rooms next door etc. Many of the staff are knowledgeable and friendly, but not over the top. The room service is excellent ... but do try to get out and enjoy some of the great restaurants within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay, enjoyable, great location.”
Reviews.Author: sionnach
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late Sep for our honeymoon. We actually stayed there for a two week period as we were staying in Sydney for the entire time. Hotel is in a great location, we got the train from the Airport and when we exited the station there was our hotel which was a delight after our long travel time. Check in was great and we were upgraded to a Harbour view room (after reviewing Trip Advisor before we knew what we stood a good chance to get upgraded from a city room). We got food delivered to the room that night and the waiter setup a table beside the window. It was a prefect view of the harbour and a great introduction to Sydney. The room itself is very small and for a five star hotel they do need to address this. They also should have a complimentary business center so that guests can access email for free. The roomrate should cover this cost. We ended up going to a Kinkos near the QVB to access our email. Also they do hold a lot of conferences, so when one comes back to the hotel it is rather busy. On another night they had a awards cermony for the cricket players going on, they had a ton of security people around that were very ignorant and rude. The hotel should not forget about it's guests during such events. Overall the hotel is very good, if they can address the room sizes then they will be little to compalin about. It's location is amazing and perfect for a stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Well worthy the money”
Reviews.Author: synergest1
Reviews.Content: We had a jr. suite with an adjoining room for the kids. As soon as we were led in into the room I was blown away by the breathtaking view of the opera house and the harbor bridge. The room it self was spacious and very clean, though I would not have felt that if I had gotten anything smaller then a jr. suite. The hotel staff was accommodating and handled requests dealing with small children with ease, and even brought up cookies and milk at bed time. Location was outstanding even though the rocks area was slightly gimmicky and touristy. A far cry from its origins! The concierge staff was great and was always dead on with restaurant recommendations and theater tickets. If you come to this city and want a prime location, killer view with a great staff, stay here. I wouldnâ€™t waste the money if on business, but well worth it for vacation. Attached picture was taken from one our room windows.

Reviews.Title: “A great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: moldavian
Reviews.Content: A few comments that I have not seen mentioned here: - Have room service set up the table in front of the window (if you have an Opera House view) for a fabulous dinner. The room service food was excellent! - My wife was sick for our entire stay (5 nights) so we rarely left the room. The staff was wonderfull. Room service was able to provide homemade soups, teas and meals that you would want at home if you were sick. The staff provided us with help in locating a doctor and clinic and managed to set up all of the appointments for us. - The number of large gatherings (conferences and such) made this hotel seem too business-like. - Immediately across the street from the rear entrance of the hotel is a great mini-market. They have just about anything you want. They are also very friendly. They have several computers available for internet access. Note: This is nowhere near the best Four Seasons that I have stayed at - thus the average rating. Overall, when categorized with all luxury hotels, this hotel is above average.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Saved Our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: tiffani_in_vancouver
Reviews.Content: What can you say about the Four Seasons Hotel chain in general? OUTstanding. I dare anyone to find better customer service than this hotel chain. We arrived in Sydney after a very long flight. Tried checking into another hotel we had previously booked and it was a disaster. I immediately knew to call the Four Seasons and book. They had a room ready for us immediately. They even upgraded our room at NO extra charge and we had the best view. The beds and linens are always the best here and any other Four Seasons I've stayed at. The customer service is the best I've had at any hotel I've ever stayed at. Wherever I go in the world, I KNOW I can count on the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “great place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. The views, gym, food, decor, and service were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best Hotel you could stay in Sydney. Location is the best. The service is very good. The hotel is walking distance to almost every interesting place in Sydney. Unlike the other 5 star hotels. You want to stay in Sydney you Stay in this Hotel. I gave it a four because the rooms are small and not too many interesting T.V chan. like the states.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: onholiday2005
Reviews.Content: We spent a week, and were lucky to have a suite with view on Opera House et Harbour Bridge. The location is great, the view amazing, the service pretty good.. The food was amongst the best we ever had (including top London and Paris restaurants). What else could anyone ask for? It may be difficult to choose between the differents treatments offered by the beauty salon... If you really trying to find a fault: maybe the TV are not as modern as one could hope... The decor is not exactly the one I would have chosen... Seriously, a brilliant place, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sydney for 4 nights at the Four Seasons Hotel and we could not have picked a better hotel. The staff were all wonderful, from the doormen to the front desk, and even the housekeeping. Everything we requested they were quick to provide. The hotel room and food at Kables is a bit pricy, but everything in Sydney is expensive! Nevertheless, it was all worth it! We had the harbour and opera house view which is definitely worth upgrading to. It's located right across from Circular Quay and The Rocks. If you want to take the ferry it's a 5 minute walk if that, and the train is right across as well. The room is very confortable we didn't hear a thing eventhough there is a train station right across from the hotel. The bed was so nice! Down conforter, down pillows, great sheets. And housekeeping comes twice a day to take care of your room! You'll be very pampered at the Four Seasons. I'd love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon to Australia and New Zealand. All I can say is FABULOUS. A perfect location with top notch service.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Seasons Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 199 George Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
